0.text:
[j]
Thus fallen in the ear in battle with the left arrow,
what did the few remaining Kurus do, O Davija

1.text:
And seeing the force rising, King Suyodhana
And what did the Kauravas overcome when the Pandavas had overtaken them

2.text:
This I wish to share, tell me, O Davijottama
For I am not satisfied to hear the great deeds of the ancients

5.text:
He, though consoled by the reasons determined by the scriptures
by the kings, did not find the skin to kill the son of Suta, Samaran

6.text:
He considered heaven to be strong and the earth to be
determined to fight, and went out to battle again

8.text:
Then there was a tumultuous battle between the armies of the Kurus and the Pandavas
O best of Bharatas, like the battle of the gods and demons

11.text:
Then in the afternoon the great chariots surrounded that day
called Hardad and he was killed by Yoga Bhimasena

12.text:
Tasmin hate maheshvase hatashishtas tarayo rathah
sanrabhan nishi rajendra jaghnu panchal sainikan

16.text:
Aho subalvan kalo gatish cha parama tatha
shakratulyabalah sarve yatravadhyanta parthivas

17.text:
Drishtvaiva cha puro rajan janah sarvah sa sanjaya
parrurod bhrishodvigno alas rajanna iti sasvaram

19.text:
He ran and saw the young men there
lost in mind and mad and tormented with grief

21.text: Seeing him sitting innocent all around, surrounded by his daughters-in-law, Gandharva and Vidura, the best of Bharatas

22.text:
And so with others and friends and relatives and well-wishers
the death of Karna, who meditates for the same purpose

23.text:
Rudanna evabravid vakyam rajanam janamejaya
atihrishtamanah suto bashpasandigdhaya gira

26.text:
Parachya hata maharaja dakshinatyasha cha sarvashah
udichya nihatah sarve parachyasha cha naradhipa
rajano rajaputrasha cha sarvato nihata nrip

28.text:
Dhrishtaddyumna killed Rajan Shikhandi Chaparajita
Uttamauja Yudhamanyu and Rajan Parabhadraka

30.text:
All the men were killed and the elephant was knocked down
The charioteer and the tiger and the horse were killed in battle

31.text:
What is the remaining camp of the Tavakas, O lord
the Pandavas and the heroes have reached each other

32.text:
Parayah satri shesham abhavaja jagat kalena mohitam
sapta pandavatas shesha dhritarashtras tatha tarayah

35.text:
The whole world has been killed by time, O best of the Bharatas
Duryodhana has been killed by time, O Bharatha of enmity

38.text:
Gandhari and the best of kings and all the women of Kuru
fell suddenly to the ground and heard their cruel words

39.text:
Then the kingdom fell unconscious on the ground
A great story with others' lamentations was carried like a cloth

42.text:
Vidvan Kashattara Mahaprajna Tavam Gatir Bharatarshabha
Mamanathasya Subhrisham Putraira Heena Sarvashah
Having said this, he fell unconscious again

43.text:
Seeing him so fallen, the relatives who were with him
shitais tu sishichus toyair vivyajur vayajanair api

45.text:
Sanjaya also cried there seeing the king anxious
and all the Satriyas and Gandhari and the illustrious

46.text:
Then after a long time he spoke to Vidura
Dhritarashtra, the tiger-man, being bewildered again and again

47.text:
Let all the women and the illustrious Gandhari go
so may all these friends fill my mind greatly

50.text:
Then Sanjaya, seeing the king there, regaining consciousness,
was poor and crying in great distress

51.text:
Paranjalir and breathing heavily repeatedly
consoled the king with sweet words

52.text:
[Vai]
Visrishtasva atha narishu Dhritarashtra 'Ambika suta
vilalapa maharaja dukkhad dukkhatara gato

53.text:
Sighing like a smoke, shaking his hands again and again
thinking again and again, the Maharaja then spoke

55.text:
Vajrasara mayam surely my heart is strong
which the sword tears my killed sons not into a thousand pieces

60.text:
Ehya Ehya Putra Rajendra Mamanathsya Sampratam
Tavaya Heeno Mahabaho Kaan Nu Yasyamya Aham Gatim

61.text:
Being a mover, O great king, where are you going, hero, leaving me, the friend of the known and
blind and old

64.text:
Who will call me father father when I get up in the morning
Maharajati constantly called Lokanatheti

67.text:
Bhagadatta, Kripa, Shalya, Avantya, Jayadratha,
Bhurisrava, Somadatta, Maharaja, and Bahlika

68.text:
Ashwatthama and Bhojasha and Magadhasha and the mighty
Brihadbalasha and Kashisha and Shakunish and Saubala

69.text:
Malecchas and many thousands of Shakas and the Yavanas with
Sudakshinas and the Kambojas and the Tarigartadhipatis

70.text:
Bhishma, the grandfather, Bharadwaja, and Gautama
Sharutayusha, Acyutayusha, Shatayusha and the mighty

71.text:
Jalasandho 'atharshyasringi rakshasasha chapya alayudha
alambuso mahabahu subahusha cha maharatha

72.text:
These and many other kings, O king,
are ready for me, all leaving their lives in battle, Lord

74.text:
Chedinsha and Nripashardul and Daraupadeyansha in battle
Satyaki and Kuntibhoja and the demon Ghatotkacham

75.text:
One of these, O great king, is capable of restraining
The Pandavas, in battle, ran towards the angry horse
What else with the heroes and the Pandavas who had been destroyed

77.text:
One of your ears will kill the Pandavas with me
Then the brave kings will stand under my rule

80.text:
Standing among them where my sons are being killed
what else can I share in the battle while they are growing up

81.text:
Bhishma and killed where Loknath, the most powerful
Shikhandi, reached Jambukam like a lion

82.text:
Daronsha and the Brahmana where all the weapons
were killed by the Pandavas, what else could they share in the numbers

83.text:
Bhuri shavara hato yatra somadattasha cha samyuge
bahlikasha cha maharaja kim anyad bhaga dheyato

84.text:
Sudakshina was killed where Jalasandhasha and the Kauravas
Sharutayusha and Acyutayusha, what else is their share

85.text:
Brihadbala hato yatra Magadhasha cha mahabalah
Avantyo nihato yatra tarigartasha cha janadhipah
Samshaptakasha cha bahutha ki anyad bhagadheyato

86.text:
Alambusus and Rajan, the demon bow and Alayudha
Arshyasringa were killed, what else is the share

87.text:
Narayana killed where the cowherds were mad about war
and many thousands of Malechhas, what else could they share

88.text:
Shakuni and Saubala where Kaitavya and the mighty
killed Sabalo the hero what else is the share

89.text:
Kings and princes, brave men with spear-arms
killed many where what else is shared

90.text:
The Kshatriyas gathered from various countries where Sanjaya
was killed in battle, all what else did they share

92.text:
A man who is equipped with shares produces surety
A man who is equipped with fame and fortune attains good fortune

93.text:
I am separated from all my fortunes and my sons here, Sanjaya
How can I be old today, under the control of the enemy

95.text:
I have nothing else to do except to go to the forest
Sanjay, the salt party that has reached this state

96.text:
Duryodhana killed where Shalya and killed in battle
Duhshasana Vishasta and Vikarna and the mighty

97.text: How can I hear the words of Bhimasena, who has killed a hundred of my sons in one battle?

98.text:
Asakrida vadatas tasya Duryodhana vadhena cha
Dukkhashokabhisantapto na sharoshya harusha girah

100.text:
After weeping for a long time, Dhritarashtra, the son of Ambika
sighed long and hotly and thought about the others

102.text:
Hearing that Bhishma and Drona were killed and Suta's son had fallen,
what did my men do to the commander of the army, Paraneta

104.text:
Let you see Bhishma killed on the battlefield by Kiriti
Let us all see Darona killed in this way

106.text:
I have already been told by the great Vidura
Duryodhana's fault that the enemy will be destroyed

110.text:
Ko va mukham anikanam asit karne nipatite
Arjunam vasudevam cha ko va paratyudyau rathi

111.text:
Who protected the right wheel of the king of Madras in battle
and the left of the warrior who wanted to fight or behind the hero

112.text:
How is it that the mighty king of Madras, whom you have gathered together,
has been killed by the Pandavas in battle, or is he my son, Sanjaya?

113.text:
Tell me all about the great destruction of the Bharatas
and how my son Duryodhana was killed in battle

114.text:
And as all the Panchalas and their followers were killed
Dhrishtadyumna and Shikhandi and the five sons of Daraupadya

115.text:
And as Pandavas were freed, so were the two Satvas in battle
Kripasha and Kritavarma, the son of Bharadwaja

116.text:
Yad yatha yadrisham chaiva yuddham vrttam cha sampratam
Ahilam sharotum ichchami kushala hoya asi sanjaya

118.text:
When the son of Suta was killed, the great Pandavas
and the armies that had fled, were brought together by Chasakrita

120.text:
It is better to hear the middle of the Indian
forces in the suffering of the armies that are fighting

122.text:
Seeing the serpents killed in battle, Pattinsh and Marish
Ayodhana is very terrible, like Rudra's play

125.text:
Duryodhana, I will tell you this essay, O Kauravas
Listen and do it, O great king, if you like it, O sinless one

127.text:
Putro bharata pita chaiva savasreyo matulas tatha
sambandhibandhavas chaiva yodhya vai kshatrajivina

129.text:
There I will answer you with some good words
When Bhishma and Darona and Karna are killed, O great charioteer

130.text:
And with Jayadratha and your brothers killed, and sinless
Lakshmana and your son, what is left for us to worship

131.text:
Yeshu bhar samasjya rajye matim akurmahi
te santyajya tanur yatah shura brahma vidam gatim

132.text:
We shall be miserable without you here with our virtuous great chariots
by dropping many kings

133.text:
The terrible demon is invincible even to all living beings
The dark-eyed mighty-armed one is invincible even to the gods

134.text:
Indra karmukavajrabham indraketum ivochchritam
vanara ketum asadya sanchachal mahachamuh

135.text:
Our minds are delighted with the roar of the lion and the sound of Bhima's Panchajanya Savannah and
Gandiva's roar

137.text:
A great bow washing in the golden river
visible in all directions as if in lightning clouds

138.text:
And as the cloud rose in the dark wind
Tavaka that strength, O king, Arjuna, the best of the satra-wise
The deep winter burned the chamber like a fire

139.text:
Gahmanam anikani mahendrasadharmaprabham
dhananjayam apashyam chaturdantam iva davipam

140.text:
I saw you shaking the army and crossing the earth
Dhananjaya, like an elephant in a lotus

141.text:
Tharasayantam tatha yodhana dhanura ghoshena pandavam
bhuya enam pashyaam mrigagana iva

143.text:
Today marks seven decades of the present India
Struggle in the most terrible battle of slaughter

144.text:
Your troops, blown away by the wind,
Autumn clouds, grew old all around

145.text:
Tam navam iva paryasta bharantavatam maharnave
tava sena maharaja savyasachi vayakampayata

146.text: Who is your son Suta, who is your companion, Darona, who is I, who is your soul, who is your heartfeltness, and who is your misrule, who is your brother, who is with your brothers?

147.text:
Banagochar saw that Jayadratha had finished
the relatives of his brothers and sisters and his maternal uncles

148.text:
Sarvan Vikramya Mishato Lokansha Chakramya Murdhani
Jayadratha Hato Rajan Kin Nu Shesham Upasmahe

150.text: The lost moon is like the night, the army is like a slain leader, the trees are broken by snakes, the dry river is turbulent

151.text:
In the white woman with the dead eyes, the white horse
will roam as he pleases, the mighty-armed one burning like fire in the room

152.text:
Satyakesha chaiva yo vego bhimasenasya chobhayoh
darayet girin sarvaj shoshayet cha sagara

154.text:
Then in the other face, the force in the ear, O Pandava, was protected
durable and hidden by the killing of Gandhi

155.text:
You have ripped off those things that you have not done to the saints
and you have done them without cause

156.text:
You have gathered all the world with your effort for the sake of yourself
That you doubt, my father, and your soul, O best of the Bharatas

160.text:
He who does not know that he is righteous and despises the righteous
is quickly filled with kingdoms and does not find righteousness

162.text:
Vaichitravirya Vacanat Kripa Shillo Yudhisthira
viniyunjita Rajya Tavam Govinda Vacana Cha

163.text:
Yad baruyad dhi Hrishikesh rajanam aparajitam
Arjunam bhimasena cha sarvam kuryur asanshayam

165.text:
This is the forgiveness I think your Parthians are not fighting
I am not telling you for the sake of compassion or for the sake of protecting your life
I am telling you the right thing, O king, you will die of it

166.text:
Iti vrdho vilapyaitat kripah sharadvato vacah
dirgham ushnam cha nishvasya shushocha cha mumoha cha

167.text:
[He]
Thus addressed by the illustrious King Gautama
sighed long and hot and remained silent, O lord of the worlds

170.text:
Gahmanam anikaani yudhyamaanam maharathaih
pandavaira atitejobhir lokas tavam anudrishtavan

172.text:
Hetukarana sanyuktam hitam vacanam uttama
uchyamanam mahabaho na me vipragrya roccate

174.text:
Thus, having been received by a messenger, Krishna, devoted to the welfare of Arjuna,
having obtained the other, and having opposed the action of Hrishikesha,
how can he accept my words, O Brahman?

175.text:
Vilapa hi yata krishna sabhamadhye sameyushi
na tan marshayate krishno na rajyaharanam tatha

176.text:
Ekpranav ubhau krishnav anyonyam parati sanhatau
Pura yach chrutam evasid adya pashyamitat parabho

177.text:
And hearing that Savasriya was killed, Keshav slept in sorrow
How can he forgive us for his sins for me

180.text:
Ubhau tau baddhanisrinshava ubhau chabaddha kankatau
kritavairava ubhau virau yamava api yamopamau

181.text:
Dhrishtadyumna and Shikhandi, who have made enmity with me,
how can they make an effort against me, O best of the gods?

182.text:
By misrule that black one-clad virgin
was troubled in the assembly in the sight of all the world

184.text:
And when Daraupadi suffered for the destruction of Krishna's intoxication
She performed severe austerities for the fulfillment of her husbands' wealth
She always lay on the floor until the torment of enmity

185.text:
Putting down pride and honor, Vasudeva's brother
always serves Krishna as if he were an observer

186.text:
Iti sarvam samunnaddham na nirvati katha chan
Abhimanyor vinashaena sa sandheya katha maya

187.text:
How can I enjoy this earth, O Sagarambaram
by the grace of the Pandavas, I shall enjoy the kingdom of little

188.text:
The sun is burning above the kings as
How can I follow Yudhisthira afterwards as a servant

189.text:
How can I enjoy myself, give pleasures and give abundantly
and be miserable and live with the miserable

190.text:
I don't envy your words spoken for your affectionate good
but I don't think it's time to make a treaty anyway

191.text:
I don't see Sunita with a good fight
It's time to kill the enemy
It's time to fight him

192.text:
It is my desire that many sacrifices have given me gifts to the brahmins
that the Vedas have been heard by me and have been placed on the heads of my enemies

193.text:
Bhrtyame subhritas tata dinash chabhyudhrito janah
Yatani pararashtrani savarshtram anupalitam

194.text:
Bhuktash cha vividha bhogas tarivargah sevito maya
pitrunam gatam anrnyam kshatradharmasya chobhayoh

195.text:
There is no sure happiness here where is the kingdom where is the fame
Here fame is to be established and that is by war and nothing else

196.text:
The death of even a Kshatriya in the house is condemned
It is a great iniquity to die in the house in a shadow

197.text:
A man who releases his body in the forest or in battle
takes the sword and goes to great glory

199.text:
Tayaktva tu vividhan bhogan paraptanaam maramam gatimam
Apidanim suyudhena gaccheyam sat salokatam

200.text: The brave, the noble, the unrelenting in the battles, the wise, the truthful, the priests of all deeds

201.text:
Shastravabhritham aptanam dharuvam vasas tarivishtape
muda nunam parapasyanti shubhra haya apsarasam ganah

202.text:
Seeing the ancestors worshiped in the assembly of Indra
Apsaras surrounded by the modamanas in the sea dwelling

203.text:
Panthanam amarair yatam shuraish chaivanivartibhih
api taih sangatam margam vayam api aaruhemahi

204.text:
By the old and wise grandfather
Jayadratha, Karna and Dushasana

206.text:
Uttamastravidah shura yathoktakratuyajinah
tayaktwa paranaan yathanyayam Indra sadmasu dhisthitah

207.text:
Tais tava aya rachitah pantha durgama hi punar bhaveta
sampatdbhira mahavegaira ito yadbhisha cha sad gatima

210.text:
And what kind of kingdom will it be for me without my relatives
friends and friends and marrying Pandavas

211.text:
So I will defeat the world by doing this
with a good fight and then I will get heaven and nothing else

212.text:
Thus spoken by Duryodhana, all worshiped his words
and the Kshatriyas addressed the king, saying,

213.text:
Unconcerned about defeat and determined to fight
all were determined to fight

215.text:
In the sky, in the coral, in the holy place beyond, in the auspicious snow,
They drank the red Saraswati and left the water with their daughter-in-law

218.text:
Shalyasha, Chitrasenasha, Shakunisha, the great charioteer
Ashwaththama, Kripasha, Kritavarma and the Satvatas

220.text:
Rane karne hate veere tarasita jitakashibhih
nalabhan sharma te putra himavantam rite girim

221.text:
They accompanied the 'Abruvan there in the presence of the king's army
and worshiped the king in the battle according to the ritual then

222.text:
Making an army the leader of the others, you deserve to fight
by whom we will conquer the hearts in battle

223.text:
Then Duryodhana stood in battle with the best of chariots
the best of all wars, the image of death in battle

224.text:
Savangam parachchannashirasam kambugrivam pariyanvadam
vayakoshapadmabhimukham vayaghrasya merugauravam

225.text:
Sthanor resembles a bull with shoulders and eye movements
with a strong, slim arm with a wide dense taste

226.text:
Similar in speed and strength to the Arunanuja winds
Equal to the light of the sun and equal to the light of the sun

227.text:
Kanti rupamukhaishvaryais taribhish chandramasopamam
kanchanopala sanghataih sadharm shalishtasandhikam

228.text:
Suvruttoru kati jangham supadam savangulinakham
samritva samritvaiva cha gunaan dhatra yatnaad vinirmitam

229.text:
Sarvalakshanasampannam nipunam sharutisagara
jetaram tarasarinam ajeyam shatrubhira balat

230.text:
Dashangam yasha chatushpadam ishwastram ved tattvata
sangamsha cha chaturo vedan samyaga akhyana panchmana

231.text:
Aradhya taryambalam yatnaad varataira ugraira mahatapasah
Ayonijayam utpanno daronenayonijena yah

232.text:
The darkness of unparalleled deeds, unlike in form on earth, the master of all knowledge, the ocean of virtues, the unblemished
tama abhyetyatmajasa tuvyam ashvatthamana abravit

233.text:
Yam Purasah krityasahita yudhi jeshyam Pandava
Guruputro 'daya sarvesham asmakam parama gati
Bhavan tasman niyogata te ko 'satu senapatir mama

234.text:
[Daruni]
Ayam kulena viryena tejasa yashasa sharia
sarvaira gunai samudita shalyo no 'satu chamupatih

242.text:
[Dur]
Senapatyena varaye tavam aham matulatulam
so 'samana pahi yudham sharestha sakanda devan ivahave

243.text:
Abhishichyava Rajendra Devanam Iva Pavakih
Jahi Shatruun Rane Veer Mahendra Danavan Iva

244.text:
[He]
hearing these words of the king, the king of Madras was very angry
Duryodhana then spoke these words to the king

245.text:
Duryodhana, mighty-armed, hear the best of the eloquent
Yav you think these two Krishnas are the best of the charioteers
They are not equal to me in the strength of their arms

246.text:
Udyatam prithivim sarvam sasurasuramanavama
yodhayeyam ranamukhe sankruddh kim u pandavana
vijeshye cha rane parthaan somakansha cha samagatan

249.text:
After he was anointed, the roar of the lion was great
Your troops played musical instruments, O Bharatha

252.text:
Tavam hi shakto rane jetum sasurasuramanavan
martyadharmaan iha tu kim u somak srinjyan

254.text:
[Shalya]
Today I will kill all the Panchalas in battle with the Pandavas
O king, I will go to heaven or I will be killed

255.text:
Today let the worlds see me wandering in fear
Today all the sons of Pandu, Vasudeva and Satyaki

257.text:
See my prowess, my bow and my great strength,
the lightness of my weapons, my arms and my strength in battle

258.text:
Today let the Parthas and Siddhas and their companions see
what strength I have in my arms, what wealth I have in weapons

260.text:
Today I will tear the armies of the Pandavas from all sides
Daron, Bhishma, the most powerful, and Sutaputra in battle
I will wander about in battle fighting for your sake, O Kauravas

261.text:
[He]
Abhishikte tad shalya tava saineshu manada
na karna vayasanam ki chin menire tatra bharata

262.text:
The soldiers there were delighted and flowery
They thought the Parthians had been killed and subdued by the king of Madras

266.text:
Hear this and do as you have done, Madhava, forgive me
You are the leader and the protector, and make what follows

267.text:
Tam abravin maharaja vasudevo janadhipam
artayanim aham jane yathatatvena bharata

268.text:
Viryavansha and Mahateja Mahatma and especially
Kriti and Chitrayodhi are combined with lightness

269.text: I think that the king of Madras is as distinct as Bhishma and Darona in battle with Karna

270.text:
I cannot find a warrior of India
awarrior equal to him, O lord of the people, thinking of his horses while fighting

271.text:
Shikhandyarjuna was so stronger in battle than Bhima and Satvata and Bharata
Dhrishtadyumna

274.text:
In the whole world of the gods, there is no other man like you
He who kills the king of Madras in battle, O Kurunanda
Your strength is shaking every day fighting

275.text:
Tasmaja jahi rane shalyam maghavan iva shambaram
Atipaschad asau viro dhritarashtra satkritah

276.text:
Tavaiva hi jayo nunam hate Madresvare yudhi
tasmin hate hatam sarvam Dhritarashtra balam mahat

277.text:
Etach chrutva maharaja vachanam mama sampratam
paratyudyahi rane partha madrarajam mahabalam
jahi chainam mahabaho vasavo namuchim yatha

278.text:
No mercy is to be shown here, for this is my maternal uncle, and kill the lord of the Madras by rewarding the dharma of Vai
kshatriya

279.text:
Bhishma, crossing the ocean of Drona, Karna, the source of the underworld
Do not sink with your host, Shalya, reach the cow's foot

284.text:
The fever gone, the great archer crossing the river, the great chariot
became the army of the Pandavas very happy at night
and having won the victory at the death of the son of Suta, Marisha

289.text:
Then the forces all the army left in India
armed only saw death and retreat

291.text:
Then all gathered together your soldiers with their son
Kripasha and Kritavarma and Darauni and Shalya and Saubala

292.text:
And the rest of the other earthlings made time then
not not one should fight in any way even the Pandavas

293.text:
Whoever fights alone against the Pandavas or leaves them fighting
he will be covered with five sins and sins
we must fight with those who protect each other

294.text:
Thus having made their appointment, all the great chariots there
pursued the king of Madras and rushed at once to Paran

297.text:
[Dhru]
Tell me the fall of Darona, Bhishma and Radheya, my youngest
and again of Shalya and my son

298.text:
How Shalya was killed in battle by Dharmaraja Sanjaya
Bhima and my mighty-armed son Duryodhana

300.text:
The hope of their sons was strong, O king, when
Bhishma and Darona were killed and Suta's son fell
Shalya would kill all the Parthians in battle, Marisha

302.text:
When Karna was killed, the Parthas roared like lions
Then, O King, great fear seized Dhritarashtra

304.text:
Paratyudyato rane parthana madrarajah paratapavan
vidhunvan karmukam chitram bharaghnam vegavattaram

305.text:
Rathapravaram asthaaya saindhavasvam maharathah
tasya sita maharaja rathasthashobhayad ratham

307.text:
On the journey the king of Madras was bitten by the face of the army
with the Madras, the brave sons of Karna and the invincible

308.text:
On the left, Bhuta and Kritavarma were surrounded by swimmers
Gautama on the right and Shakaisha with the Yavanas

309.text:
Ashwatthama was surrounded by the Kambojas behind him
Duryodhana was protected in the middle of the palace by the leaders of the Kurus

310.text:
Surrounded by a great army of horses and Saubalasha,
the great chariot of Kaitavyasha and all his army followed

311.text:
The Pandavas and the great archers, armed with the army of the Arindamas,
being shipwrecked, O Maharaja, attacked your army

312.text:
Dhrishtadyumna, Shikhandi, Satyakisha and the great charioteer
rushed forward to battle against Shalaya's army

313.text: Then King Yudhisthira, surrounded by his army, attacked Shalya, the best of the Bharatas, to kill the demon

314.text:
Arjuna, the great archer, killed the enemy
Sanshaptaka Ganansha and ran away with speed

316.text:
The two sons of Madri, Shakuni and Uluka, the great charioteers
with their armies and their armies, appeared in battle

317.text:
Thathaivayutasho yodhas tavakas pandavan rane
abhyadravanta sankruddha vividhayudhapanayah

318.text:
[Dhr]
Slain Bhishma, the great archer, Darona, Karna, the great charioteer
Kuru, with the little remaining Pandavas in battle

319.text:
When the Parthians were well-enraged and defeated, Sanjaya
what was the best of my strength and that of others

321.text:
Eleven thousand chariots, O best of the Bharatas
ten thousand and seven hundred teeth

322.text:
In the full hundred thousand two horses, Bharata
Narakotyas and the third Balam, this is yours

323.text:
Six thousand chariots and six thousand elephants
ten thousand horses and a crore of infantry, O India

324.text:
This is the strength of the Pandavas in the last battle
These are the ones who came together to fight, O best of the Bharatas

328.text:
Then the battle that ensued was terrible and terrible
The guards and the others killed each other

331.text:
The sound of the terrible serpents and the doors was great
heard in the sky at the right time by the clouds

332.text:
Nagair abhyahatah ke chit saratha rathino 'patan
vayadravanta rane vira daravyamana madotkataih

333.text:
Horses and chariots of foot and length were trained there
They were sent with arrows to the next world, India

334.text:
Sadinah shikshita rajana parivarya maharathana
vicharanto rane 'bhayaghnana parasashaktyarishtibhis tatha

336.text:
The great charioteers surrounded the serpent and the charioteer
They killed the seventeen weapons and the great noise

338.text:
Nago naga abhidrutya rathi cha rathinam rane
shakto tomaranarachair nijaghnus tatra tatra ha

339.text:
The chariots, elephants and horses crushed the feet
They appeared in the midst of the battle, making great anxiety

340.text:
The horses and the horses ran around, adorned with leather
The swans drank the earth beyond the snow

343.text:
With the sound of musical instruments and the blast of conches
the earth resounded like a thunderbolt in India

347.text:
Shirobhih patitaira bhati rudhirardraira vasundhara
tapaniyanibhaih kale nalinaira iva bharata

348.text:
Udvruttanayanaisa taisa tu gatasatvaih suvikshataih
vayabhrajata maharaja pundarikaira ivavrita

349.text:
Bahubhis chandanadigdhaih sakeyurair mahadhanaih
patitaira bhati rajendra mahi shakradhvajaira iva

351.text:
Kabandha shatasankirnam chatra chamarashobhitam
sena vanam tach chushubhe vanam pushpachitam yatha

352.text:
There the warriors, O great king, roam the horses fearlessly
They appear blood-red limbs like blossoming kimsukas

353.text:
Even the elephants disappeared, tormented by the arrows
They fell here and there like cut clouds in battle

355.text:
Those elephants fell like clouds on the left all around
The mountains looked like thunderbolts at the end of the age

356.text:
There are heaps of horses and horses fallen on the ground
The mountains are visible here and there

357.text:
The river that carries the world to the battlefield
Shonitoda Rathavarta Dhavajavrikshasthi Sharkara

358.text:
Bhujankra Dhanuh Saraota Hastishaila Hayopala
Medo Majja Kardamini Chhatra Hansa Gadodupa

359.text:
Kavachoshnish sanchanna pataka ruchiradruma
chakrachakravali jushta tarivenu dandakavrita

360.text:
The mother of joy to the brave, the fear of the timid
The river Roura flowed, crowded with Kurus and Srinjaya

361.text:
That river carrying to the world of the ancestors is very terrible
Terur vehicle boats you brave iron-armed

362.text:
In the present and in the battle of the unlimited Lord of the worlds
In the destruction of the four horses, in the terrible formerly like the gods and demons

363.text:
Acroshan bandhavan anya tatra tatra parantapa
karoshadbhira bandhavaish chanye bhayarta na nivartire

365.text:
That great army of yours, O lord of the people, being slain,
was bewildered there and there, as if under the influence of women

367.text:
As soon as they heard the great noise, Dhrishtadyumna and Shikhandi
pursued the king of Dharma and rushed towards the king of Madras

372.text:
Stand, stand, was the voice of the great souls of Daravi
The Kshatriyas then wished each other victory in battle
They ran and were not broken, O Pandavas, your soldiers

373.text:
Tayaktva yuddhi pariyan putran bharatrun atha pitamahan
matulan bhagineyansh cha tatha sambandhibandhavan

374.text:
Hayan davipansa tavarayanto yodha jagmuh samantata
Atmatraan kritotsahasa tavaka bharatarshabha

376.text:
This stands King Yudhisthira, the son of Pandu,
shining in a white robe held by an umbrella

377.text:
Atra me parpaya kshipram pasha me sarathe balam
na samartha hi me kshipram pashya me sarathe balam
na samartha hi me Partha sathatum ady puro yudhi

379.text:
Apatantam ca suddenly the great force of the Pandavas
Dadharaiko rane shalyo velevoddhritam arnavam

383.text:
They reached each other and held picture bows
raising like clouds from south to north

384.text:
They both shot each other with arrows
I see no difference there between the Pandavas or anyone else

393.text:
Sakundalam samukutam sunasam savayatekshama
Chitrasenashirah kayad apaharat pandavah
sa papat rathopasthad divakarasamaprabhah

401.text:
Then, fixing his golden-pointed arrow, the Pandavas cut off the stone
bow of Rajendra Satyasena

403.text:
Avidhita tava asambhrantau madriputrah paratapavan
davabhya davabhya maharaja sharabhya ranmurdhani

407.text:
Athanyad dhanura adaya vegaghnam bharasadhanam
sharaih sanchhadayam asa samantata pandunandanam

408.text: But Nakula, the destroyer of enemy heroes, restrained them with his arrows and struck Satyasena and Sushena with two daggers

412.text:
Like Leliha, the lord of the serpent-daughter, who was very poisonous
raised up and threw her into the battle of Satyasena

414.text:
Seeing his brother killed, Sushena was overcome with anger
Abhyavarshacha arrows quickly attacked Pandu Nandan

415.text:
Seeing Nakula without a chariot, Daraupadeya, the mighty
son of Soma, ran to seek his father in battle

416.text:
Then Nakula, the son of Soma, mounted that chariot
The best of Bharatas shone like a lion on the mountain
He took his bow and fought Sushena

418.text:
Sushena then, angry, struck the Pandavas with arrows and sword
and struck his son Soma with twenty arms on his chest

419.text:
Then the angry Maharaja Nakula, the hero of the enemy
shot covered all directions with his arrows and was mighty

420.text:
Then he took the sharp-pointed half-moon of Sutejana
and threw it with speed into the battle of Karna's son

422.text:
He was killed by the great Parapatd Rajan Nakula
The tree on the banks of the river was as great as the speed of the river

423.text:
Karna saw the killing of his son and Nakula's prowess
The army of Tavaki fled in fear, O best of the Bharatas

424.text:
Tam tu senam maharaja madrarajah paratapavan
apalayad rane shurah senapatir arindamah

425.text:
Vibhis stood, O great king, and set up his army
The lion roared loudly, and the bow made a terrible sound

426.text:
The Tavakas in battle, O king, protected by a strong bow,
paratiyudyur aratis te samantad vigatavyathah

428.text:
Satyakira Bhim Senasha and the sons of Madri and the Pandavas
Yudhisthira rewarded Harineshedham Arindamam

430.text:
Thus all the Tavakas easily
surrounded the Madras king and, well enraged, again fought aroccayan

431.text:
Then the battle ensued, increasing the fear of the cowards
and stopping them by killing the guards and others

432.text:
As the battle of the gods and demons was before, Lord of the worlds,
Abhitanam, so, O king, Yama, the development of the nation

435.text:
There was confusion among the Pandavas scattered
and not in many directions or in other directions

436.text:
Filled with sharp arrows fired by the Pandavas
The slain heroes were destroyed and scattered all over
The Kauravas were killed by the great chariots of the sons of Pandu

439.text:
Then there arose a great fear of the Tavakas
and of the Pandavas, O King, and in the great battle

442.text:
Parakshaye darune jate samhare sarvadehinam
ananashastrasamavape vayatisakta rathadvipe

443.text:
In the joy of the warriors, in the fear of the timid
in the sinking warriors, in the killing of each other

444.text:
Paranadane mahaghore vartamane durodare
sangrame ghorarupe tu yama rashtravivardhane

445.text:
Pandavas destroyed your army with sharp arrows
so did your warriors fight the Pandava soldiers

447.text:
Labdhalakshah pare rajan rakshitasha cha mahatmana
Ayodhayansa tava balam mrityum kritva nivartana

448.text: The army of the Kauravas was overwhelmed with deer and fire

450.text:
The king of Madras, however, was enraged and took the best bow
and attacked the Pandavas in battle

452.text:
Then with hundreds of sharp arrows the mighty king of Madras
struck that army in the sight of the king of righteousness

453.text:
Paradurasans then, O king, in various forms,
chachal shaking sound, and the earth with its mountains

454.text:
Sharpened spears with flaming tips falling all around
Meteors fell to the ground and the sky hit the sun

456.text:
Then that battle was very fierce among the Sanghacharis
Then all the armies gathered together, O lord of the people
The Kauravas, O king, attacked the army of the Pandavas

458.text:
Bhimasena and Sharaisha were stoned with golden feathers
Daraupadeyas and all the Pandavas, the sons of Madri

462.text:
Davirdas Turgash Chartah Pattayo Rathinas Tatha
Shalya's Banaira Nayapatan Babhramur Vayandans Tatha

463.text:
Avista iva madresho manyuna paurushena cha
parachhadayad arin sankhye kalasrishta ivantakah
vinardamano madresho meghahrada mahabalah

464.text:
He was killed by Shalya, the army of the Pandavas
Ajatashatru, Kaunteya, attacked Yudhisthira

467.text:
His surgeon shot a terrible arrow like a poisonous sword
He struck the great man with speed and rushed to the village

469.text:
Daraupadeyasha cha shatrughnam shuram artayanim sharaih
abhyavarshan mahabhagam megha iva mahidharam

471.text:
Ulukasha and Pattri and Shakunish and Saubala
Samayamanasha and Shankair Ashvatthama the great charioteer
Your sons and Kartsnya juggled Shalya in battle

472.text:
Kritavarma pierced Bhimasena with his sword and stopped his angry form with a great
arrowhead

473.text:
Kripa angrily attacked Dhrishtadyumna with arrows
Daraupadeyansha and Shakunir attacked Yama and Darauni

474.text:
Duryodhana yudham sharesthava ahave keshavarjunau
samabhyayad ugratejah sharaish chabhyahand bali

475.text:
Thus there were hundreds of dudes around you with
horrible pictures everywhere, Lord of the Worlds

476.text:
Rishya Varna killed the horse Bhoja in the battle of Bhima
He got down from his chariot and Dhatasva Pandu Nandan fought with a club in his hand

477.text:
The king of Madras killed Sahadeva's horse in the other face
Then Sahadeva killed Shalya's son with his sword

478.text:
Gautama again fought Acharya Dhrishtadyumna
Asambhrantam asambhrantam yatnavana yatnavattaram

479.text:
Daraupadeyas and the heroes each with ten arrows
Avidhad the son of the teacher not too angry as if he were not at the time

480.text:
Shalyo 'pi rajana sankruddho nighnana somaka pandavan
punara eva shataira banair yudhisthiram apidayat

481.text:
His Bhima, angry in battle, bit his teeth and roof
The mighty man took up his club to destroy him

482.text:
Yamadandapratikasham kalaratrim ivodyatam
gajavajimanushyaanam paranaanta karanim api

483.text:
Hemapatta parikshiptam ulkam parajvalitam iva
shakyam vayalim ivatyugram vajrakalpam ayo mayim

484.text:
Chandanagurupankakta paramadam ipsitam iva
vasa medo mrigadigdham jihvam vaivasvatim iva

485.text:
Patu ghanta rava shatam vasavim ashanim iva
nirmuktashivishakaram pruktam gajamadair api

486.text:
Tarasani, the delight of all the armies of the enemies,
the famous in the world of men, the tearing of the horns of the mountains

487.text:
Yaya Kaulas bhavane Maheshwara sakham bali
ahvayam asa kaunteyah sankruddham alakadhipam

488.text:
Yaya mayavino driptan subahun dhanadalaye
jaghan guhyakaan karuddho mandararthe mahabalah
nivaryamano bahubhira daraupadya pariyam asthita

489.text:
That thunderbolt, the stream of gems and gems, the eight-headed Vajra-gauravam,
raised up by the mighty-armed Shalya and ran towards him in battle

490.text:
Gadaya yuddhakushalas taya darunanadaya
pothayam asa shalyasya chaturo 'shavan mahajavan

491.text:
Then Shalyo, angry in battle, thrust his sword into his chest
nichkhan Nadan, the hero broke through the shield and fled

492.text:
Vrikodaras tava asmbhratas tama evodhritya tomaram
yantaram madrarajasya nirbibheda tato hridi

495.text:
Then the flowering Parthas worshiped Bhimasena
seeing that he was a terrible and uncomplicated man in the battle of action

497.text:
Tam diptama iva kalagnim pashahastama ivantakam
sashrngam iva kaulasam savajram iva vasavam

498.text:
A haryaksha with a spear, like a drunkard in the forest,
Bhima attacked him with speed, grabbing a great club

502.text:
So also the mace of the king of Madras cannot withstand the speed of the great
no other warrior than Vrikodara in battle

505.text:
The club of the surgeon became frightening with its white burning gold
The club of the surgeon was pierced like flames of fire

511.text:
The club struck the left and right by the king of Madras
Bhimasena, the mighty-armed, did not move as he did

512.text:
Thus Bhima was beaten with the speed of his club again and again
Shalya did not hurt, O king, the mountain carried by his teeth

513.text:
I heard in all directions the sound of the two male lions
the sound of their clubs falling like thunderbolts

517.text:
Athodyamya gade ghore sashrngava iva parvatau
tava ajaghnatur anyonyam yatha bhumichalo 'chalau

519.text:
Both Senator Viras then cried out
They were both very much in shock

520.text:
Then Sagadam mounted the bull of the Madras on his chariot
Apovaha kripa shalyam turnam ayodhanada api

521.text:
Bhimasena, bewildered like a shepherd, rose again in a moment
Bhimasena, holding a club, called out to Madrapam

525.text:
As soon as they fell, your son, O best of the Bharatas,
Parasena Chekitana pierced his heart severely

528.text:
The Pandavas, conquered by many of the Tavakas,
were wandering, O Maharaja, to be examined all around

529.text:
Kripasha and Kritavarma and Saubalasha and the mighty
Ayodhya were rewarded by the king of Madras, Dharmaraja

530.text: Duryodhana, the great king, fought Dhrishtadyumna, the killer of Bharadwaja

533.text:
Then there arose a fierce battle between the mutual killers
with mutual killing and mutual pleasure

534.text:
In that other-turned battle, O king, in the destruction of the heroes
there arose a terrible earthly dust driven by the wind

535.text:
Sharavana named the Pandavas and the praises
we know each other and those who are not afraid to fight

536.text:
That dust was subdued by the blood of the male tiger
and the directions were born pure in that dust subdued

538.text:
Brahmalokapara bhutva pararthayanto jayam yudhi
suyudhena parakranta nara savargama abhipsavah

539.text: Then the warriors of the husband's body, determined to do the work of the husband, fought with their minds attached to the husband's body

541.text:
Kill, kill, capture, destroy, cut off
The same words are heard in your and their strength

542.text:
Then Shalya, the great king, struck Dharmaraja Yudhisthira
with sharp arrows, desiring to kill the great charioteer

543.text:
Tasya Partha maharaja narachan vai maharatham
marmanya uddishya marmajno nichakhan hasanna iva

546.text:
Even the king of Dharma, enraged, struck the illustrious king of Madras
with sharp arrows played by the Kankabarhi

547.text:
The great charioteer struck Chandrasena with seventy arrows and Suta with nine arrows
Darumasena with sixty-four arrows

548.text:
When Chakraraksha was killed, Shalya was killed by the great Pandavas
Then Rajansha Chedin killed the twenty-fifth

549.text:
He struck Satyaki with twenty-five and Bhimasena with five
sons of Madri with a hundred sharp arrows

550.text:
Evam vicaratas tasya sangrame rajasattama
sampreshayac chitan partah sharan aashivishopamana

551.text:
Dhavajagram chasya samare Kuntiputro Yudhisthira
paramukhe vartamansya bhallenapaharad rathat

552.text:
I saw his star cut off by the son of Pandu, the great soul
falling like a mountain peak

553.text:
Seeing the sword fallen and the Pandavas standing still
the king of Madras became enraged and released a rain of arrows

559.text:
[He]
when Dharmaraja was tormented by the king of Madras, Marisha
Satyakira, Bhimasena and the sons of Madri, the Pandavas,
we surrounded them with chariots and tormented Shalya in the battle of the demons

560.text:
Tam eka bahubhira drishva pidyamanam maharathaih
sadhuvado mahan jajne siddhasha chasana paraharshitah
asharyam ity abhashant muniyash chapi sangatah

561.text:
Bhimasena struck Shalya in battle with Shalya Bhuta in valour
with one arrow and again with seven

562.text: Satyakisha also threw down Madresvara with a hundred sons of righteousness and roared like a lion

564.text:
He is a brave man in battle who is tormented by those great chariots
drawing a bow, a terrible speed-killing heavy weapon

565.text:
Satyaki was struck by Shalya with twenty-five spears
Bhimasena was struck by Tarisaptya and Nakula by seven

567.text:
Sahadevas tu samare matulam bhuri varchasam
sajyam anyad dhanuh kritva pancabhih samatadayat
sharaira aashivishakaraira javalaj javalanasannibhai

569.text:
Bhimasena, with seventy-three, Satyakira, with nine arrows,
Dharmaraja, with sixty, gave Shalya to the gone

574.text:
Sach covered with the arrows of the son of Dharma in battle
he then struck Yudhisthira with ten sharp arrows

576.text:
He cut off Satyaki's other bow with a razor blade
and struck Bhimasena's face and tansha with his sword

577.text:
His angry Maharaja Satyaki and Satyavikrama
sent him a spear and a golden staff of great wealth

578.text:
Bhimasena then shot a spear as bright as a serpent
Nakula gave him power in battle, Sahadeva gave him a good club
Dharmaraja wanted to kill Shataghni and Shalya in battle

579.text:
Tan apatat evashu panchanam vai bhujachyutan
Satyakiprahitam shalyo bhallaish chiched tomaram

580.text:
Bhima cut the golden ornament of the arrow for the welfare of others
in two ways, having done his hand in battle

582.text:
And the king cut off the hundred-slayer in the arrow, Bharata
while the sons of Pandu watched the roar of the lion and the roar
they could not bear it, but Shaineya, the enemy, triumphed in battle

587.text:
Then, O king, the mighty-armed Bhimasena, the most powerful
leaving his mind, fought against the king of Madras

590.text: His son Dharma, O king, quickly killed Chakraraksha in the great battle with his sword, O earthly king of Madras

591.text:
Tasminsa tu nihate shure chakrarakshe maharathe
Madrarajo 'tibalavan sainikan astrinocha chraih

593.text:
How can it not be true that Madhava's words are great
For the angry king will not throw away my strength in battle

596.text:
Then I saw the golden feathers that had been thrown by the surgeon into the sky
a shower of arrows like the names of locusts

598.text:
The bow of the king of Madras, with free arrows and golden ornaments,
continued as if the sky, O lord of the people

599.text:
Neither the Pandavas nor us saw anything there
The arrows were blinded by the great for the great fear

603.text:
Dharmaraja Purogasa tu Bhimasenamukha rathaah
na jahuh samare shuram shalyam ahavashobhinam

605.text:
And the other great archers, Dhananjaya, with his medicines,
greatly showered the mighty arm with arrows

608.text:
Taisa tu kshiptah shara rajana kartasvaravibhushitah
Arjunasya rathopastham purayam asura anjasa

610.text:
Kubaram rathachakrani esha yoktrani chabhibho
yugam chaivanukrasham cha sharabhutam abhutam tada

611.text: Never before, O king, nor have we heard of such a thing as the Tavakas of Partha there engaged in

612.text:
That chariot shines everywhere with colorful feathers and sharp arrows
like a plane lit by hundreds of meteors on the ground

613.text:
Then Arjuna, O great king, with his arrows bowed,
rained down that army like a cloud of rain on a mountain

614.text:
They were killed in battle by arrows named Partha
Partha thought it was a ghost and looked at it as such

616.text:
With the wheels falling and the ages on the ground
with the trumpets, the banners and the white chariots

618.text:
Heads falling and wearing earrings
arms and shoulders all around, O King

619.text:
Heaps of umbrellas and crowns with their youngsters
appeared on the chariot tracks of Partha, O Bharatha

620.text:
The incomprehensible earth, the mud of flesh and blood,
became, O best of Bharatas, the play of Rudra, as
the mother of fear, the mother of fear, and the joy of the brave

625.text:
Tayora asin maharaja banavarsham sudarunam
jimutanam yatha vrishtir tapante bharatarshabha

626.text:
They were competing with each other, but with arrows bent at the ends
they struck each other in battle with their horns like bulls

628.text:
Then he struck Arjuna with twelve golden-winged sons
and Vasudeva with ten Daraunis, O Bharatha

629.text:
Then the next day the terrible demon Vayakshipada Gandhiva bow
honoured and for a moment the son of the teacher in the great battle

631.text:
Hatashve tu rathe tishtana daronaputras tava ayo mayam
musalam panduputraya chikhepa parighopamam

635.text:
He was cut off and fell to the ground, O Partha, by the arrows of the great battle
Darayan, the mind of the kings of the earth, by the sound of Bharata

636.text:
Then Pandavas struck Darauni with other arrows
He was overpowered by the strong Partha and very strong
Then Darauni was not confused and stood in all his strength

639.text:
Vikarshana vai dhanushreshtam sarvabhar saham rddhama
javalanashivishanibhaih sharaish chainam avakirat

640.text:
Suratham tu tatha karuddham apatantam maharatham
chukop samare daraunir dandahata ivaragah

641.text:
Tarishikham bharukutim kritva srikkini parilelihan
Udvikshya suratham roshad dhanurjyam avamrjya cha
mumoch sharp arrow Yamadandasamadyutim

642.text:
He pierced his heart and entered the other with great speed
like the thunderbolt of Indra, tearing the ground

643.text:
Then he fell to the ground and was struck by an arrow
like a thunderbolt hitting the peak of a mountain with great treasure

647.text:
There I saw the wonder of seeing their prowess
that one Arjuna fought the heroes at the same time

648.text:
Vimardas, however, was great with Arjuna's enemies
Satakrator as before with a great demon army

649.text:
[He]
Duryodhana, the great king, and Dhrishtadyumna and his followers
fought a great battle, full of arrows

650.text:
Tayor Asana Maharaja arrowheads thousands
clouds at the right time water streams all around

655.text:
Shikhandi, accompanied by Kritavarman and Gautama, the great charioteer
parabhadras, was fighting with archers

656.text:
There was also a great battle in the terrible form of the Lord of the Worlds
They gave up their lives in battle in the gambling of their lives

657.text:
Shalyas tu sharavarshani vimunchana sarvatodisham
Pandavan pidyam asa sasatyaki vrikodaran

658.text:
And so both Yama and Yama, equally mighty in battle,
fought, O king, with their might and strength

659.text:
In the great battle of the Pandavas, who were armed with shalya and arrows,
there were no great charioteers who could find a way out

661.text:
Nakula, the destroyer of the enemy, covered the sword in battle
and struck him with ten times in the interval of Satan

662.text:
Sarvaparashavaira banaih karmar parimarjitaih
savarnapunkhaih shila dhautaih dhanura yantraprachoditaih

663.text:
Shalya was tormented by that great woman
Nakula was tormented by the great woman

664.text:
Then King Yudhisthira, Bhimasena, Satyaki,
Sahadeva and Madreya attacked the king of Madras

665.text:
Tan apatat evashu puryanaan ratah savanaih
dishasha cha paradisha chaiva kampayansha cha medinim
paratijagraha samare senapatir amitrajit

666.text:
Yudhisthira with his sword and Bhimasena with seven
Satyaki with a hundred horses and Sahadeva with his sword

667.text:
Then the bow and arrow of the great Nakula
The lord of Madras then cut it to pieces with the sword of Marisha
Then the bow was torn apart by the arrows of Shalya

670.text:
Bhimasena then attacked the king of Madras with sixty Satyakira nine arrows
and struck him with heron petals

671.text:
Then the king of Madras, angry, struck Satyaki with nine arrows
and again with seven arrows of bowed mountains

674.text:
The two sons of Madri, however, became enraged and struck Bhimasena and Pandava
Yuddhisthira with ten arrows

675.text:
There we saw the wonderful manliness of the king of Madras
that the Parthians with him did not turn in battle

678.text:
That conjunction became tumultuous and wonderful
Satyakesha and the brave king of the Madras
like the ancient kingdom of Shambramara

679.text: Satyaki, seeing the king of Madras in battle, struck him with ten arrows and said,

680.text:
The king of Madras, however, was severely wounded by that great soul
Satyakima was struck back with sharp arrows from Chitrapunkha

682.text:
Then sat the tumultuous bloody waters of Paramardas
The heroes roared like lions fighting

683.text:
Their seated Maharajas threw each other
like lions roaring in battle

684.text:
The earth was covered with a thousand streams of their arrows
and the sky suddenly became arrows then

685.text:
The arrows darkened it in many ways all around
and the clouds appeared like shadows by the arrows released by the great men

690.text:
[He]
Then your army, rewarded by the king of Madras,
again attacked Partha with great speed in battle

693.text: Then Dhananjaya, angry with Kripa and his followers, attacked Kripa with a stream of arrows and also Kritavarma

694.text:
Shakuni stopped the army with Sahadeva
Nakula stood by and looked at the king of Madras

695.text:
Daraupadeya and Narendransha were defeated by Bhuyishta
Daron's son was defeated by Panchalya and Shikhandi

698.text:
There we see the action of Shalya in the greatest battle
when he alone fought all the armies of the Pandavas

700.text:
After tormenting the king with arrows like poisonous snakes
he ran and again showered Bhima with arrows

701.text:
Seeing the lightness of his bottom and the armedness
he did not worship the many others' servants

704.text:
Jayo vastu vadho veti kritabuddhira maharathah
samahuyabravit sarvan bharatruna krishnam cha madhavam

705.text:
Bhishma, Darona, Karna and all the others who were seen by the earth
were defeated for the sake of the Kauravas and died in battle

706.text:
You have done your part as much as you have enthusiasm
There is only one part left, this is my surgical great chariot

708.text:
Chakrarakshava, these brave sons of my Madravati
are invincible even to Vasava in battle, bravely accepted

711.text:
I will fight with my maternal uncle today in the Kshatriya dharma, O earthlings
for victory or otherwise

713.text:
Shaineyo dakshinam chakram Dhrishtadyumna tathottaram
Prishthagopa bhavatu adya mama Partha Dhananjaya

714.text:
Purahsaro mamadyastu bhima shastrabhratam varah
evam abhyadhika shalyad bhavishami mahamridhe

715.text:
Thus said and so did all the king's servants
And the joy of the army was again then, O king

716.text:
The fulfillment of the promise of the Panchalas, the Somakas and the Matsyas in particular
and that of Dharmaraja in battle

721.text:
Shalyas tu samarashlaghi dharmarajam arindamam
vavarsha sharavarshena varshena maghavan iva

723.text:
The rain of arrows was picturesque and small and fine
and no one saw its cavity while walking in battle

724.text:
Tav ubhau vividhair banais tatakshate paraspar
shardulav amish parepshu parakrantav ivahave

725.text:
Bhimasa, however, accompanied by your son Ranashaunda
Panchalya and Satyakisha and the Pandavas, the sons of Madri
returned the heroes headed by Shakuni from all sides

726.text:
Then there was a tumultuous battle again between the conquerors
Tavakata and the others, O king, in your evil counsel

727.text:
Duryodhana, however, with Bhima's arrow,
cut off the golden flag in battle

728.text:
The beautiful lion of Bhimasena fell
with a great beautiful net

730.text:
Sacchinnadhanva tejasvi rathashaktya sutam tava
bibhedorasi vikramya sa rathopastha avishat

733.text:
The great charioteer Darona's son rushed to save him
Kripasha and Kritavarma were looking for their son

735.text:
Yuddhisthira, however, rushed to Madresham in anger
Svayam sanchodayanna asvavan dantavarnan manojvan

739.text:
Sasvasuta dhavajarthanah rathinah patayanah bahun
Akridd eko balvan pavans toyadan iva

740.text:
Sasvarohansha cha turgana pattinsha chaiva sahasrashah
vayapothayat sangrame karuddho rudrah pashuna iva

748.text:
Shalyo or Pandava killed and gave the village to Duryodhana
There was no such certainty among the warriors there, India

750.text:
Then Shalya shot a hundred arrows at Yudhisthira
and his bow was cut off by a sharp arrow

751.text:
He took the bow and struck the sword with hundreds of arrows
and cut the bow with his sword

752.text:
Then he struck his own horse, clever with bowed horns
with medicines, and with cold tips, and both with heel chariots

753.text:
Then with his glowing yellow and sharp sword
he took away the sword of the one who was in the other's face
Then the army of Duryodhana, the enemy, was defeated

756.text:
Vidhivat kalpitam shubram mahambud ninadinam
sajjayantropakaranam davisatam lomaharsanam

759.text:
Strike Satyaki with ten arrows, Bhimasena with ships
Strike Sahadeva with ships and oppress Yudhisthira

761.text:
He cut off his arms and with many weapons he
made the earth crossed by the warriors like a sword

762.text:
Thus the armies of the enemy, thick with death,
parivavrura bhrisham karuddhah pandupanchala somakas

768.text:
Akarnapurnayata samprayuktaih; sharais then sanyati tailadhautaih
Anyonyam aachadayatam maharathau; Madradhipasha chapi Yudhisthirasha cha

778.text:
Then Shalya struck him with nine arrows; Bhima and King Yudhisthira
took down the golden shield; the great man tore his arms

779.text:
Then with another blazing sun; with the sword the king's bow went mad
and with his grace he struck the thread; with six arrows he fell face to face

780.text:
Madradhipasha chapi yudhisthirasya; sharaisha chaturbhira nijghana vahana
vahansha cha hava vayakaron mahatma; yodhakshayam dharmasutasya rajah

783.text:
Tama is the foremost of all bowmen; one grazing in Samara with great speed
Bhima with a hundred arrows; Madriputra Sahadevas as well

784.text:
They looked at Shalya, who was bewitched by those arrows; Bhima cut off his shield with his arrows
He was cut off by Bhimasena; the skin of the Madra king was a thousand stars

785.text:
The great soul took his sword and chariot; he ran after the son of Kunti
Then he cut off the chariots of Nakula; Yudhisthira was attacked by Bhimabala

788.text:
Then they rejoiced at the action of Bhima; those chariots of the Pandavas
made a noise and laughed loudly; and blew their conches like the moon

793.text:
Tcha chapi shalyasya nishmya karma; mahatmano bhagam athavashishtam
samritva manah shalya vadhe yatatma; yathoktam indravarajasya chakre

795.text:
The king observed Naradeva; the purified soul removed the sins
There was nothing like the ashes of the king of Madras; that is wonderful to me, O king

797.text:
She shone with great force; she suddenly fell with a twinkling linga
all the Kurus gathered together watched; as at the end of the age a great volcano

798.text:
Tam kalaratrim iva pashahasta; Yamasya dhatrim iva chograrupam
sabrahma dandapratimam amogha; sasarja yatto yudhi dharmarajah

799.text:
Gandhasraga agryasana panbhojanaira; abhyarchitaam pandusutaih parayatnaat
samvartakagnipratimaam javalanti; krityaam atharvaangiraseema ivogram

800.text:
Ishaan hetoh paratinirmitam tam; tavashta ripunam asudeha bhaksham
bhumyantarikshadi jalashayani; parasahya bhutani nihantum isham

801.text:
Ghanta pataka manivajra bhajam; vaidurya chitram tapaniyadandam
tavastra parayatna niyamena kalptam; brahma davisham antakarim amogham

802.text:
Balaprayatnaad adhirudha vegam; mantras cha ghorair abhimantrayitva
sasarj margena cha tam parana; vadhaya madradhipatera tadanim

803.text:
Hato 'saya asava iti abhigarjamano; Rudra 'natakayant karam yatheshuma
parasarya bahum sudradham supani; karodhena nrityanna iva dharma rajah

805.text:
She tore his marrows white; his chest was huge and so was his shield
entered the cow like a toyam; burning the king's huge fame

807.text:
Spreading his arms he went from the chariot to the cow; Sanchinnavarma was cut off by Kurunandana
Mahendra was like a horse, the great soul; like the peak of a mountain struck by thunderbolt

808.text:
Bahu parasaryabhimukho dharmarajasya madrarat
tato nipatto bhumava indradhvaja ivochchito

810.text:
The lover fell on his chest with his beloved
After enjoying the earth for a long time, the Lord embraced him with all his limbs as if he were asleep

812.text:
Shaktya various hearts, brahmins, known weapons and flags
peacefully, even the king of Madras, Lakshmi, did not let us go

813.text:
Then Yudhisthira took his bow and bow-splitting
Vaydhamad davisata sankhye khaga rad iva pannagana
Dehasun nishitair bhallai ripunam nashayan kshanat

816.text: And he struck the best of men with many arrows, and the madman of war, who wished to avenge the death of his brother

819.text:
He saw the beautiful earrings falling from the head of the chariot
the inhabitants of heaven falling like the destruction of merit

823.text:
Tans tatha bhajyatas tarstan kauravan bharatarshabha
shiner napta kiran banair abhyavartat satyaki

824.text:
Tam ayantam maheshvasam aprasahyam durasadam
hardikyas tavarito rajan paratyagrahnad abhitavat

825.text:
The two great men together were as invincible as Varshney
Hardikya and Satyakisha were as intoxicated as lions

826.text:
They covered each other with arrows of pure brightness
Archirhira iva suryasya divakarasamaprabhau

827.text:
Chapamargabaloddhutan marganaan vrishnisinghayah
akashe samapashyam patangaan iva shighragan

829.text:
Tan nikritam dhanushrestham apasya shinipungavah
nyad adatta vegena vegena ayudham

831.text:
Then he cut off the chariot and the ages with well-controlled spears
and killed his horses quickly and both the heel charioteers

832.text:
When the king of Madras was killed, Rajanvirathe Kritavarmani
Duryodhana's army was all back facing the other side

833.text:
The others did not realize that the army was covered with dust
but the force was defeated and then turned away

836.text:
The Pandavas, seeing the chariots, shot Dhrishtadyumna and his companion
Anarta, the invincible, with sharp arrows

839.text:
Ashwatthama then carried the king's dead horse without a chariot
Samapovaha heartily with his chariot Yudhisthira

840.text:
Then Sharadvata struck Yudhisthira with eight arrows
and he struck the horse with eight sharp arrowheads

841.text:
Evam etan maharaja yuddhashesham avartata
tava durmantrite rajan sahaputrasya bharata

842.text:
In that great archer the boon was fired; in the midst of the battle, the Kuru leader
Parthas, together with him, were overjoyed; they blew their conches, seeing Shalya killed

843.text:
Yuddhisthira and Parashashansura today; in the past, the gods, like Indra, in the killing of Vritra,
crushed with various musical sounds; resounding all over the earth

846.text:
Duryodhana forbade those heroes again and again
to kill Yudhisthira, the Pandavas entered the force

854.text:
The great chariots of the great army of the others
The great winds shake the trees like the flames of the same heat

856.text:
The mighty warriors of the Panchalas, Shikhandi, the great charioteer,
Dhrishtadyumna, Shaineya and Daraupadeya in all respects

857.text:
Evam tan vadinah shuran Daraupadeya maharthaah
Ahyaghnana yuyudhanasha cha Madrarajapadanugana

858.text:
Chakrair vimathitaih ke chit ke chich chinnair maha dhavajaih
paratyadrishyanta samare tavaka nihatah paraih

859.text:
Alokya Pandavas yuddhe yodha rajan samantata
varyamana yayur vegat tava putrena bharata

860.text:
Duryodhana, however, was trying to console those heroes
and no one there ruled him, the great charioteer

861.text:
Then Shakunira, the son of the king of Gandhara, said
Duryodhana, O great king, is able to speak the word

862.text:
What is the strength of the Madras who are watching us?
It is not fitting that this battle stands in yours, India

863.text:
This is the time to fight with the name
Then why do you forgive the others so densely, O king

865.text:
[Shakuni]
Not the heroes who rule their husbands are angry in battle
It is not enough for them to do so and it is not time for them to ignore them

868.text:
[He]
After saying this, the king was surrounded by great force
and he went away with the roar of a lion, shaking the earth

869.text:
Kill, strike, capture, destroy, cut off
It was the tumultuous sound of your army, India

870.text:
The Pandavas, however, seeing the battlefield, with the followers of the Madra king
rushed to the bush, settling in the middle

872.text:
Then the dead friends of our departed, the thirsty
happy, without making a sound, with the others

873.text:
Then the rounds that rose appeared all around
A great cholka fell through the middle of the circle

874.text:
The earth was covered with broken chariots, with Yugaksha killed, with great chariots,
with fallen horses

875.text:
Vatayamanaisa turagaira yugasaktaisa turangamaih
Adrishyanta maharaja yodhas tatra ranajire

876.text:
Some of the chariots with broken wheels swan horses in battle
Some of them took the chariot and wandered in ten directions
There and there are seen the same horses equipped with yokes

877.text:
The charioteers fell and destroyed us, O best of men
they fell from the sky, the perfect ones like the holy names in destruction

878.text: Seeing us slain and the brave followers of the king of Madras, O Partha, the great charioteers

879.text:
The vultures of victory, the destroyers of the enemy, rushed forward with speed
making the sound of arrows and mixed with the sound of conches

883.text:
[He]
fallen in battle, the invincible king of Madras, the great charioteer
Tavakas, your sons, and Parayasho, turned away

884.text:
Vanijo navi bhinnaya yathagadhe 'palave 'ranave
Apare param ichchanto hate shure mahatmani

886.text:
Like bulls with broken horns and like elephants with broken teeth
we returned at noon defeated by the son of righteousness

887.text:
Na sandhatum anikani na cha rajan parakrame
Asid buddhir hate shalye tava yodhasya kasya chit

890.text:
Horses, other elephants, other chariots, other great chariots
ride on swift infantry, fear the enemy's chase

896.text:
Today King Satyadhriti conquered his friend Yudhisthira
Today Duryodhana is devoid of the brightness of the king's glory

898.text:
Today let Kaunteya know that he is capable of all bows
and today the foolish will condemn himself for his sin
today the words of Kaattura are true and good for the warriors

900.text:
Let that king know the greatness of Krishna today
Let him know the terrible sound of Arjuna's bow in battle

902.text:
Hate Duryodhana yuddhe sakranevasura maye
yatkritam bhimasena dukkhasana vadhe tad
nanya kartasti loke tad rite bhima mahabalam

903.text:
Let us know today the prowess of the eldest Pandava
hearing that the king of Madras was killed, even the gods were very unbearable

904.text:
Today he will know that the two mighty sons of Madri
were killed in battle by Saubala and the brave Gandharvas in all respects

905.text:
How can they not be victorious whose warrior Dhananjaya
Satyakira Bhimasena and Dhrishtadyumna are his companions

907.text:
And those whose Lord of the worlds is Lord Krishna and Lord Janardana
how can they not have victory whose religion is the refuge of age

909.text:
Who else is able to conquer in battle except Partha and Yudhisthira
whose master is Hrishikesh, always the treasure of righteousness and fame

913.text:
Na matikramate Partha dhanushpanim avasthitam
Jaghane sarvasainyanam mamasvana paratipadaya

916.text:
And hear the lion's roar often, terrible and terrible
Therefore go slowly, thread, and take care of your hips

922.text:
Then, O king, Bhimasena and Ghrishtadyumna, their attendants,
were sent by the force of four horses, and the judges of various orders

927.text:
Bhima was angry in battle with those who then stood by him
He got down from his chariot and quickly stood on foot

928.text:
Jatarupaparichchannam paragrahya mahatim gadam
Avadhita tavakan yodhana dandapanira ivantakah

929.text:
Rathasvadvipahinas tu tan bhimo gadya bali
ekvinshatisahasran padatin avpothayat

931.text:
The footmen were killed and lay on the ground covered in blood
The earrings were well blossomed as if shattered by the wind

933.text:
The great force of infantry, covered with flags and banners,
was destroyed, and there appeared a terrible and terrible form

934.text:
The great chariots of all the armies, led by Yudhisthira,
ran after your great son Duryodhana

936.text:
That wonderful thing I saw in the manhood of your son
which the Parthians with one could not overcome

938.text:
I do not see that country on earth or in the mountains
where the Pandavas will not kill you, what is the use of your flow

939.text:
They have little strength and are black and severely wounded
If we all stay beyond the sure we will have victory

940.text:
The Pandavas who have gone away from you, who have sinned,
will follow and kill the arrows that are in battle with us

941.text:
Listen, all you Kshatriyas who have gathered together
When the end always kills the brave and the timid
Who is the foolish man who does not fight, O Kshatriya Baruva

942.text:
Shareyo no bhimasena karuddhasya paramukhe sathitam
sukha sangramiko mrityu kshatradharmena yudhyatama
jitveha sukham apnoti hata paretya mahat phalam

943.text:
Na yuddhadharmacha chhareyan vai panthah savargasya kauravah
Achirena jital lokaan hato yuddhe samashnute

946.text:
Dhananjaya rode in a chariot, a mighty
famous bow throwing Gandhi in the worlds of the sea

947.text:
The mighty Shakuni and Satyakisha, the sons of Madri,
fall down with speed, rejoicing because of your strength

948.text:
[He]
When the flood of forces had ceased, Shalva, the commander of the Malechha host,
turned in anger to the great force of the Pandavas

949.text:
Asthaya sumahanagam parabhinnam parvatopamam
driptam airavata parkkhyam amitraganamardanam

950.text:
He who is born of a great noble family; well worshiped by Dhritarashtra and always
well conceived by the experts in the scriptures; always carried in battle, O king

956.text:
And seeing her swiftly defeated; all your chiefs of the warriors in battle
worshiped the king there; and blew their conches like the moon

957.text:
Hearing your roar, then, the Kauravas; released from joy with the sound of conches
The commander of the Pandava army, the Srinjayas; the son of Panchala did not die in anger

959.text:
Seeing the darkness falling suddenly; the lion of the kings of Panchal in battle
we sent him to the island at once; to kill, O king, the son of Darupada

965.text:
He saw the son of the king of Panchal; then tormented by the great serpent, he
ran at him with sudden speed; Bhima, Shikhandi and Shinesh and Napta

967.text: Then the king rained down on Prishtkan; the chariots were killed by the swiftness of the sun as a network of rays; they fled there and then all

969.text:
Panchalarajas tavaritas tu shuro; gadam paragrihyachalashringa kalpam
asambhraam bharata shatrughati; javena viro 'anusasara naga

971.text:
The broken pot suddenly roared; releasing the poison from his mouth
the serpent fell like the earth; the earth trembled and moved like a mountain

974.text:
[He]
but in that killed brave Shalve Samitishobhane
your strength was broken by the speed of the wind like a great tree

976.text:
Sannivruttas tu te shura rishtwa satvatama ahave
Shaulopamam sathitam rajan kiryamanam sharaira yudhi

978.text:
There was a wonderful battle between the Satvatas and the enemies
when one of them stopped the Pandusena from fighting

979.text:
They were in a difficult task for each other's friends
The roar of the lion became a great touch to the heavens of the others' joy

980.text:
Frightened by that sound, the Panchalas, O best of the Bharatas
Shiner Napta, the mighty-armed Satyaki, pursued them

982.text:
Tam ayantam mahabahum paravapantam shitan sharan
javenabhyapatad dhiman hardikyah shinipungavam

985.text:
Narachair vatsadantaish cha vrishnyandhakamaharathau
abhijaghnatur anyonyam parahrishtava iva kunjarau

986.text:
Charantau vividhan margan hardikya shinipungavau
muhura antardhate tau banavarshtya paraspara

987.text:
Chapavegabalodhutan marganaan vrishnisinghyoh
akashe samapashyam patangaan iva shighragan

988.text:
Tam ekam satyakarmanam asadhya hridikatmajah
avidhya nishitaira banaish chaturbhish aturo hayan

991.text:
The best of the bows that were taken down, the Shini chief
Another accustomed speed, the Shine bow with the arrow

993.text:
Unable to bear the cut of the bow by Kritavarman
the angry Atiratha quickly attacked Kritavarman

996.text: Overwhelmed with anger, he raised his spear and threw it with the speed of his arm, killing the Shinipungavam

998.text:
He was killed in battle by Yuyudhana, his horse and charioteer
Kritavarma followed the earth with his weapon

999.text:
At that time Satyaki, the brave Davairatha, was deprived of his chariot
and all the armies were greatly afraid

1001.text:
Noticing the dead horse and the dead charioteer Arindam
Kripa rushed to kill the king Shinipungavam

1002.text:
Tama aropya rathopasthe mishatam sarvadhanvinam
apovaha mahabahus turnam ayodhanad api

1004.text:
The others did not realize that the army was covered with dust
The Tavakas fled, O king, except Duryodhana, the king

1006.text:
Pandunsha and all the angry Dhrishtadyumna and his associate
Shikhandi, Daraupadeya and the hosts of the Panchalas

1007.text:
Kekyan Somakansha Chaiva Panchalansha Chaiva Marisha
Asambhraam Duradharshah Shitair Astrair Avarayat

1008.text:
Atisthad ahave yattah putras tava mahabalah
Yatha yajne mahan agnira matra pootah parakashayana

1009.text:
The others did not turn to him like mortals to death
Then he mounted another chariot and approached Hardikya

1010.text:
[He]
putrasa tu te maharaja rathastho rathinaam varah
durutsaho babhau yudhe yatha Rudra paratapavan

1011.text:
His thousand arrows covered the earth
and the rest of the mountains were covered with streams of arrows

1013.text:
Yam yam hi samare yodham parapashyami visam pate
sa sa banaish chito 'bhuda vai putrena tava bharata

1014.text:
As the army
appeared to be covered by the dust of the army, so were the arrows of the great man

1015.text:
I saw the earth becoming an arrow, O lord of the earth
Duryodhana, the bowman with the sword in his hand

1016.text:
Among those thousands of warriors, Tavakas and others
I think there was one Duryodhana horse, a man

1017.text:
There I saw the wonderful prowess of your son
That the Parthas with one did not pass away, O Bharatha

1018.text:
He struck Yudhisthira with a hundred horses, O best of the Bharatas
and Bhimasena with seven and Sahadeva with seven

1019.text:
Nakula and Dhrishtadyumna with sixty-four and five

Nakulasha then struck the heroic king with nine arrows
the great archer of terrible forms and roared

1022.text:
Satyakisha also struck the king with an arrow bowed
Daraupadeyas with seventy-three arrows and Dharmaraja with seven
Ashitya Bhimasena with seven arrows

1024.text:
All men saw the lightness, beauty and strength of the great man
very much all beings

1026.text:
Their fall was like a terrible tumult
for the turbulent sea is like a night in the afternoon

1029.text:
Tava ubhau karurakarmanaava ubhau bharata duhsahau
ghorarupam ayudhetam kritapratikritaishinau

1031.text:
In this interval the heroic king was defeated
Apovaha rathenajau sahadevah paratapavan

1033.text:
That battle was wonderful and terrible, Marisha
Eekshitripritijananam Siddha Charanasevitam

1035.text:
Thus the valiant Nakula surrounded the son of Saubala in battle

1037.text:
Thathaiva kritavarma tu shaineyam shatrutapana

Duryodhana cut the bow in the battle of Dhrishtadyumna

1039.text: Dhrishtadyumna also took the supreme weapon in battle and fought the king in the presence of all the bowmen

1040.text:
Tyor yuddham mahach chasit sangrame bharatarshabha

1042.text:
There was a battle with them, like the senses of the body
The horrible form was unbearable, unlimited and very

1043.text:
They also tormented him like a child with the demonic senses

1044.text:
Evam chitram abhuda yuddha tasya taih saha bharata

1045.text:
Narash chaiva narai sardham dantino dantibhis tatha

sankulam chabhavad bhuyo ghorarupam visham pate

1046.text:
Idam chitram idam ghoram idam raudram iti parabho

1047.text:
They met and fought each other
They struck and killed each other in the great battle

1050.text:
When the sun was covered with dust and made dull
the earth became covered and you were brave and great charioteers

1053.text:
The sound was tumultuous in the number of arrows falling
like a great bamboo forest burning everywhere

1054.text:
[He]
present and in a terrible and terrible battle
broke the strength there of your son by the Pandavas

1058.text:
They fight by inference and by noun each other
Their victory was great let us fight each other

1059.text:
Then King Yudhisthira, filled with great anger
desiring to conquer Dhritarashtra and his kings in battle

1060.text:
The ships struck Sharadvata with golden feathers and stone-sharpened
four horses, and the welfare of Kritavarman

1061.text:
Ashwatthama tu hardikyam apovaha yashasvinam
Atha sharadvato 'shatabhih paratyavidyad yudhisthiram

1063.text:
They chariots, equipped with chariots of mind and wind,
rushed against the chariot of Kaunteya in battle

1064.text:
They all surrounded Yudhisthira, O great king,
and they turned the invisible Saikasha like clouds to the sun

1066.text: And the fierce battle of the Pandavas and the Kurus, the expansion of the Yama nation

1068.text:
There was a great battle there between your son and the Pandavas
and you have never seen or heard of anything like it

1069.text:
Among the warriors and others who are being
killed in the present and unlimited war all around

1074.text: The meteors fell from heaven to earth, hitting the sun's orb

1075.text:
Visvaga vatah paradurasana nichaih sharkar varshinah
Ashruni mumuchur naga vepathush chasprushad bhrsham

1081.text:
But the king of Gandhara spoke again, and then Bali
turn away, you unrighteous, and fight, what is the matter with you?

1083.text: With his strength he struck the Pandavas from behind with sharp arrows in the present destruction of the people

1085.text:
Then Yudhisthira, seeing the broken army nearby,
stirred up the mighty Sahadeva without hesitation

1086.text:
This strong son has bitten us by squeezing our hips
Look at this wicked Pandava who is destroying the army

1087.text:
Go and kill your Darupadeya and Shakuni Saubala
I will protect the chariots with Panchal, O sinless one

1088.text:
Let all the elephants and horses go with you
and the thirty thousand foot soldiers, kill the bird Saubala

1090.text:
The foot soldiers and the thirty thousand Daraupadeyas all over
the horses in battle ran, but they were mad at the bird for battle

1091.text:
Then Saubala, O king, overtook the Pandavas
and killed the army from behind, Jaya Ghridhra, the fierce one

1092.text:
The horsemen, however, were enraged at the Pandavas' Tarsvinam
Paravishan Saubalanikam and overtook their chariots

1094.text:
Then the raised mace of Parasam Akapurusha served
Paravartat mahad yuddham rajan durmantrite tava

1095.text:
The words of victory ceased and the charioteers became observers
for no distinction was seen again in all or in the others

1096.text:
The Kurus and the Pandavas saw the powers thrown by the brave arms, O best of the Bharatas
Jyotish, as if they were collapsing

1097.text:
Rishtibhira vimalahisha cha tatra tatra visham pate
sampatantibhira akashaam avritam bahv ashobhat

1098.text:
O king, the form of the Parasas fell all around
like the locusts in the sky, then, O best of Bharatas

1101.text:
Then there was a terrible darkness covered with dust by the army
They attacked the sky and therefore the country was covered with dust
The horses, O king, and the human parts were covered with dust

1102.text:
People fell to the ground and others vomited a lot of blood
Their hair was stuck in their hair and they couldn't move

1105.text:
Blood-stained arms cut off heads and hair
We saw the earth covered with hundreds and thousands

1106.text:
It was not possible to go far there on horseback by anyone
on the ground covered with horses killed by horses

1107.text:
Blood-stained armor, armed with weapons,
with various weapons, terrible, killing each other
well close together, the most killed soldiers in battle

1109.text:
Thus the Pandava army was covered with blood
six thousand horses and the best of the chariots

1112.text:
For the bird of prey is in the midst of the defeat
The king of Sauba will not again come to battle

1118.text: The heads cut with swords are like the fall of the locks of the loud voices in the destruction of the world

1120.text:
Striking with sharp weapons their brothers, sons and friends
the warriors fall down equally as birds for meat

1122.text:
Sanghataira asanabhrashtaira ashwarohaira gatasubhi
