1124.text:
Shaktyarishti parasashabdasha cha tumulah samajayat
bhindatam paramarmani rajana durmantrite tava

1126.text:
Drunk with the smell of blood, many others fainted
killed the others and all the others who were found after the others

1128.text:
On a tumultuous day of wolves, vultures and foxes
There was a terrible loss of strength in the sight of your son

1130.text:
Asibhih pattishaih shurais takshamaana punah punah
tavakas chaiva pandavas chaiva nabhyavartanta bharata

1131.text:
Paraharanto yathashakti yavata paranasya dharanam
Yodhas paripatanti sama vamanto rudhiram varanaih

1132.text:
He grabbed his head and looked like a trunk in his hair
raising a sharp sword covered in blood

1134.text:
After the slowdown, at the sound of the great force of the Pandavas
Saubala approached with the few remaining horses

1140.text:
Evam anyonyam ayastha yodha jaghnur mahamridhe
pitruna bharatruna vayasyansha cha putran api tathapare

1141.text:
Evam asid amaryadam yuddham bharatasattam
parasasibanakalile vartamane sudarune

1143.text: He went and hurried to the army and said,

1145.text:
Where this beautiful umbrella shines like the full moon
Where these flat stars stand bitten by the chariots

1146.text:
Where this sound is tumultuous like the thunder of rain
go there quickly, O king, and you will see the Kauravas

1149.text:
Duryodhana, happy-looking, lord of the worlds,
considering himself as if he had done his duty, O king of Abarvin

1151.text:
Hate tasmin rathanike pandavenabhipalite
gajan etan hanishyamah padatinsha chetaransa tatha

1154.text:
Then there was again the roar of the victory, O lord of the worlds
The arrows of Paradurasi and the well-shooting arrows were terrible

1155.text:
Seeing them approaching, he quickly raised his bow
And Dhananjaya, the son of Kunti, the son of Devak, said

1156.text:
Chodayasvan asambhranta paravishaitad balarnavam
Antama adya gamishyami shatrunam sharp arrows

1157.text:
Eighteen days more today of this battle, Janardana
present, the greatest meeting of each other

1158.text:
Being a white woman for infinite ages, the horse of these great souls
kshayam has gone today in battle, see fate as it is

1159.text:
Samudrakalpam tu balam Dhritarashtrasya madhava
asmana asadya sanjatma goshpadopamam acyuta

1160.text:
Hate Bhishme cha sandhyacha chivam sayad iha madhava
na cha tat kritavana moodha Dhritarashtra subalisha

1162.text:
In that fallen Bhishma, the other fell to the ground
I do not know the reason why the battle was fought

1163.text:
I consider the Dhritarashtra's fools to be very foolish
who resumed the battle against the fallen son of Shantano

1164.text:
Anantaram cha nihate darone brahma vidam vare
Radheye cha vikarne cha naivashamyat vaishsam

1165.text:
With little remaining army and the son of Suta fallen
with his son, the tiger of men did not rest like Vaisha

1166.text:
Sharutayushi hate shure jalasandhe cha paurave
Sharutayudhe cha nripatau naivashamyat vaishasam

1167.text:
Bhurisravasi Shalye cha Shalve chaiva Janardana
Avantyeshu cha veereshu naivashamyat vaishasam

1168.text:
Jayadratha and the killed rakshasa and the alayudhe
Bahlike and Somadatta did not recover, Vaishasam

1169.text:
Bhagadatta killed the brave Kamboja and Sudakshina
Duhshasana killed Naivashamyat Vaishasam

1170.text:
Seeing the brave men killed by the kings of Prithana Mandalika
The strong men in battle, Krishna did not rest like Vaisha

1171.text:
Akshauhinipatin drashva bhimasena patitan
mohad va yadi va lobhan naivashamyat vaishsam

1172.text:
Who, born in a royal family, especially the Kauravas, would
make a great enmity with no purpose other than Suyodhana

1173.text:
Knowing more than virtue, strength or valour,
who would fight a fool who knows the good and evil of others

1174.text:
How can he who does not have the mind of the horse listen to the good words spoken by you
with the Pandavas in the afternoon

1175.text:
What is the medicine for him today who has rejected Shantanava, Bhishma, Darona and Vidura
for the sake of peace

1177.text:
Kulantaka rano vayaktam jata esha janardana
tathasya drishyate cheshta nitish chaiva visham pate
naisa dasyati no rajyam iti me matir acyuta

1179.text:
As long as the souls of Dhritarashtra are burning, the honorable of Dhritarashtra

1181.text:
Then all I know today is the purpose of the evil-minded
What was said by that great Vidura

1182.text:
Yo hi sharutva vacah pathyam jamadagnyad yathatatham
avamanyat durbuddhir dharuvam nasha mukhe sathitah

1183.text:
It is said by many Siddhas that as soon as Suyodhana is born
he will go to the evil spirit Kashayam after finding him

1185.text:
So 'day I will kill all the warriors in battle, Madhava
For the killed of the Kshatriyas and for the camp in the empty soon

1186.text:
He will choose to fight with his own equals to kill himself
That ends with enmity by guesswork, Madhava

1188.text:
Stay with Bharati, brave, until I kill him with sharp arrows
Duryodhana, the evil-minded, and his army in battle

1190.text:
[S]
Abhishu hasto dasarhasa tathoktah savyasachina
tad balaugham amitranam abhitah paravishad rane

1191.text:
Sharasanavaram ghoram shaktikantaka samvritam

1192.text:
Hayapattilatakirnam gahamano mahayashah
vayaccarat tatra Govinda rathenaatipatakina

1195.text:
There was a great sound of arrows sitting on the other side,

1196.text:
The arrows in the bodies of the undressed fell to the ground
The arrows sent by Gandhi touched the thunderbolt of Indra

1197.text: The horses and the horses, O lord of the world, fell in battle, the arrows roaring like moths

1198.text:
There was everything covered by the arrows sent by Gandhi
They did not know the direction or the other direction in the battle

1199.text:
Sarvam aasij jagat puranam partha namanktaih sharaih

They were burnt by Partha's fire like elephants
They were killed by the sharp arrows of the Kauravas

1201.text:
Sharchapa dharah parthah parajvajanna iva bharata

1202.text:
As at the end of the forest the forest foot is thrown; The dark movement with the noise burns the chamber
The canopy of many trees and dryness; The very rich flame of the tormentor

1203.text:
Thus he, the glorious of the arrows; the arrows of the high-spirited fire
burned all your son's army; the unbearable thirst of the thirsty

Anekarupakrutibhira hi banaira; maharathanikam anupravishya

1206.text:
[He]
resolved to defeat the brave men who were trying to fight
by Dhananjaya with his Gandhi

1207.text:
The unbearable touch of the thunderbolt of the mighty
is seen to be released like a cloud releasing a stream of arrows

1209.text: Chariots with dead axles, some with metal threads, and others with broken axles and wheels, some with seats, O lord of the worlds

They mounted the other chariots and comforted them for a moment

1216.text:
Paniyam apare pitwa paryasvasya cha vahanam

Comforting others, they put their brothers in camp and

1218.text:
Sajjayitva rathan ke chid yathamukhyam visham pate

1220.text:
Agamya sahasa ke chid rathaih savarnavibhushitaih

1221.text:
Dhrishtadyumna, Panchalya, Shikhandi, the great charioteer
Nakulish, the charioteer of Shatanika, Ayodhya

1223.text:
Then your son Janadhipa
Banasanghana many vai pareshana was India

1226.text:
Then King Duryodhana mounted his horses on his back
and attacked the chariot not far from the enemy

1228.text:
Then, in the broken chariots, thirty thousand great islands
Pandavas surrounded the five charioteers on all sides

1231.text:
They surrounded him with mountain-like elephants
and with their sharp arrows he struck the elephant

1232.text:
There I saw great elephants killed by a single arrow

1235.text:
Bhimasena broke the pots

1240.text:
And seeing the Pandavas surrounded by all the elephants
Dhrishtadyumna, the great king, with all the other gentlemen

1241.text:
Not seeing Duryodhana in the chariot, Arindam

1243.text:
Ahuh kecchid dhate sute parayato yatra saubalah

1244.text:
What do you see Duryodhana doing if he is alive
Fight together all of you what will the king do to you

1246.text:
Let us kill all this force which is equally family
These all kill the elephants and come up equally Pandavas

1248.text:
Kripasha and Kritavarma fled to where Saubala
left the chariot army, the brave and strong bowmen

1249.text:
Then, after they had gone, the Pandavas, led by Dhrishtadyumna,

1252.text:
He fought the fifth battle with the force of the Panchalas by himself
and placed them in the country where Sharadvata was situated

1254.text:
Athapashyam satyakin tama upayaantam maharatham
rathaish chatushataira veero maa chabhyadravad ahave

1255.text:
Dhrishtadyumnada I am freed how chich shant vehicle
fallen Madhavanikam evil deeds like hell
there was a battle terrible moment very terrible

1257.text:
Then, as if in a moment, that Gajanika was killed
by Bhimasena, Naracha and Arjuna

1258.text:
Paratipishtaira mahanagaih samantata parvatopamaih
natiprasiddheva gatih pandavanam ajayata

1260.text:
Ashwatthama, Kripasha and Kritavarma, the Satvata
Apasyanto rathanike Duryodhana Arindam
Rajanam mrigayam aasus tava putram maharatham

1262.text:
[S]
Gajanike hate tasmin Panduputrena Bharata
vadyamane bale chaiva Bhimasena sanyuge

1264.text:
Assembled in battle, O king, the remaining sons of your
invisible son of the Kauravas, Duryodhana, together with your sisters, attacked Bhimasena

1265.text:
Durmarshano maharaja jaitro bhuri balo ravi
itya ete sahita bhuva tatra putra samantata
bhimasena abhidrity rurudhuh savato disham

1266.text:
Then Bhima Maharaja resumed his chariot
and shot sharp arrows at the hearts of your sons

1269.text:
Then with another spear that pierced all the coverings
Sharutantama killed Bhima, your son, the great charioteer

1270.text:
Jayatsena then struck him with an arrow and laughing as if
he had thrown him down from the chariot of the Kauravas, Arindam
fell from his chariot, O king, and died immediately on the ground

1271.text: Sharutarva then struck Bhima in anger with a hundred arrows of vultures and horses

1274.text:
Then with another sharp arrow the enemy struck
Durvimochan and sent him to death

1278.text:
Seeing his brothers killed in many single battles
Sharutarva, overcome with anger, attacked Bhima

1279.text:
Vikshipan sumahach chapam kartasvaravibhushitam
discharge arrows and many poisonous fire patterns

1280.text:
He, however, O king, cut off the bow of the Pandavas in the great battle
And he threw the cut bow with twenty

1282.text:
Mahad asit tyor yuddham chitrarupam bhayakam
yadrisham samare purvam jambh vasvayor abhut

1283.text:
Tayos there with arrows freed from the Yamadanda and auspicious
covered the earth and all the sky and all directions

1286.text: Then Bhima, enraged, took your son's chariot and fourteen horses with arrows to the abode of Yama

1287.text:
Viratham tam samalakshya vishikhaira lomavahibhih
Avakirad ameyatma darshayana panilaghavam

1288.text:
Sharutarva viratho rajanna adade khadga charmani
Athasyaadata khadgam shatachandram cha bhanumat
Kashuraprena shirah kayat patayam asa pandavah

1289.text: The body of the great man, whose upper limbs were cut off, then fell from the chariot, resounding the earth

1293.text:
Then he killed five hundred of all the great chariots
and again seven hundred of the elephant army in battle

1294.text:
Having killed ten thousand of the Patti with his supreme arrows
and eight hundred of the Pandavas, he sits equally

1297.text:
Vidravya tu kurun sarvans tansha cha hatva padanugana
dorbhya shabdam tatash chakre tarasayano mahadvipana

1298.text:
Hatbhuyishta yodha tu tava sena visam pate
kin chich chesha maharaja kripana samapadyat

1299.text:
[He]
Duryodhana, O great king, and Sudarsha, your son,
Hath the rest then standing in the midst of the horses in numbers

1300.text:
Then, seeing Duryodhana standing in the midst of the horse,
the son of Devak said to Dhananjaya, the son of Kunti

1302.text:
Parishrantasha cha Nakula and Sahadevasha cha Bharata
yodhayitva rane papana Dhritarashtra padanugana

1303.text:
These are the young men who have left Suyodhana and crossed the river
Kripasha and Kripavarma and Daraunisha and the great charioteer

1304.text:
He stands Panchalya with the supreme Sharia
Duryodhana having killed Bala and all the other gentlemen

1306.text:
Rearrange all your forces and stand in the middle of the battle
Kill him with sharp arrows and you will be done

1307.text:
Seeing the elephant killed and yours defeated Arindam
as long as these do not flee, kill Suyodhana

1308.text:
Yatu kash chit tu panchalyam kshipram agamyatam iti
parishrant balasa tata naisa muchyeta kilbishi

1309.text:
Having killed all your forces in battle, Dhritarashtra's son
considered the conquered sons of Pandu and assumed the form of a great one

1313.text:
Five hundred horses remained for Shakuni and Saubala
A hundred chariots remained for Dave, Janardana
A hundred teeth, and a total of thirty thousand infantry

1316.text:
Look at Duryodhana standing in the army thus defeated
For today the Maharaja will have his enemy killed

1319.text:
Nikritya vai duracharo yani ratnani saubalah
sabhayam aharad dayute punas tani aharamya aham

1321.text:
It is finished today, Karna, everything will be black
Today Duryodhana will leave the burning body and the dead body

1322.text:
Napayati bhayat krishna sangramad yadi chain mama
nihatam viddhi varshneyya dhritarashtra subalisham

1323.text:
My horse is this unable to bear the horsemen of Arindam
go to the roar of Jayatala until I kill him

1324.text:
Thus spoken by the illustrious Pandavas, Dasarha
Achodayad Dhyana Rajan Duryodhana Balam Parati

1325.text:
Then the great chariots, ready for the crossing,
Bhimasena, Arjuna, Sahadeva and Maris
passed with the roar of a lion to kill Duryodhana

1327.text:
Sudarsana, your son attacked Bhimasena
Susharma and Shakunish fought with Kiriti
Your son Sahadeva attacked Hayaprishtha

1329.text:
Sopavishad beaten by your son in the chariot
blood-soaked all over like a poisonous snake

1330.text:
Then, regaining consciousness, Sahadeva, lord of the worlds,
Shared Duryodhana with sharp arrows

1331.text:
Partha also triumphed in battle and Dhananjaya, the son of Kunti,
cut off the heads of the brave men from the backs of their horses

1332.text:
Then Partha struck Vayadhamad with many arrows
and went on horseback to all the chariots of the swimmers

1335.text:
Shilashitena cha vibho kshurapreena mahayshaah
shirash chichhed parahasansa taptakundalabhusanam

1336.text:
Satyeshum atha chadatta yodhanaam mishatam tatha
As a lion in the forest, O king, is hungry for a deer

1341.text:
That arrow sent by that bowman blazing with anger
reached Susharma and pierced his heart in battle

1342.text:
Sa Gatasura Maharaja fell to the ground
Nandayan Pandavas and all the young men

1343.text:
Slaying Susharma in battle, he brought his sons, the great charioteers,
seven, eight, thirty and thirty arrows to Kashayam

1346.text:
Then, angry with her laughter, he removed his head from his body
with a sharp sword and fell to the ground with his hand

1347.text:
Tasminsa tu nihate veere tatasa tasya padanugah
parivavru rane bhima kiranto vishikhanja shitan

1350.text:
Thathaiva tavaka rajan pandaveya maharathana
sharavarshena mahata samantat paryavaryan

1351.text:
Vayakulam tad abhut sarvam pandavanam parai saha
tavakanam cha samare pandaveyair yuyutsatam

1353.text:
[He]
In that other battle, when Naravaji and Gaja were destroyed,
Shakuni Saubala, O king, attacked Sahadeva

1355.text:
But Shakunis, O great king, struck Bhima with arrows from the sea
and with ninety arrows he shot at Sahadeva

1358.text:
Then, angry in battle, Bhima and Sahadeva, the mighty warriors of Bharata
charatu, killing in numbers

1360.text:
Ashvair viparidhavadbhih sharach channair visham pate
tatra tatra krito margo vikarshadbhir hatan bahun

1361.text:
Along with the slain horses and the horsemen
with their shields cut off and their armor cut off, the earth was covered with flowers like Shabala

1363.text:
Udvruttanayanai rosat sandashtaoshtha putaira mukhaih
sakundalaira mahi channa padmakinjalka sannibhaih

1364.text:
Bhujaish chinair maharaja nagarajakaropamaih

With an arrow adorned with gold; with a well-sharpened divakarabha

He struck that head with a swift arrow; with a golden feather and a stone

Tam chapi sarve paratipoojayanto; hrishta baruvanah sahadevam ajau

Then the angry followers of Maharaja Saubala

Subala's killed son Savajiratha Kunjare
Your strength was cut off like a great forest

Except for the son of Darona, the hero and also Kritavarman

The great wise Krishna Dvaipayana came to him and said

1457.text:
I also saw him crying and fought alone

I told him that I had seen everything in person

Tarayah kil rathah shishtas tavakanam naradhipa

Without such friends, sons and brothers, and

Tell me all this and me freed from the great wind

1470.text:
They all looked at me and quickly stirred the horses

1474.text:
Aho rich man he does not know the living 'unequal king

There the bushes were terrified and the sun was setting

Ajaghnuh karajaish chapi panibhish cha shiransya uta

I am alone and freed but by chance

Duryodhana's secretaries who remained

Dhritarashtra's son, to that wise Bhimasena

[Then]
then, in those chariots that had disappeared, the Pandavas

Indra killed the demons by means of his actions

After entering the reservoir, he wanted his life

For the brave do not flee when they see their enemies, how can you

That thy arise, fight, humble thyself,

Because he relied on Karna and Shakuni and Saubala

Then fight back against the sin well, India

Where is your manhood gone, what is your honor, Suyodhana?

Or you will defeat us and rule this earth

This is your first religion created by the creator, the great soul

Not for the sake of life, not for fear, not for depression, Lord of the worlds

Not yours now I think the work is done by war anytime Chit

[Y]

1629.text:

1630.text:

1631.text:

Jayadratha, the brave Bhagadatta, the two

1663.text:
[Y]
Fortunately you also know the Kshatriya dharma, Suyodhana

Fortunately you are a brave Kauravas, fortunately you know the battle

1665.text:
Come together one by one with the weapons you have agreed to

1667.text:
[Dur]
Eksha ched yodhum akrande varo 'daya mama diyate

One of your brothers who thinks I am

Shaking the waters, he quickly took his mace and the mighty

But seeing him with a club in his hand, he stood like a mountain with horns

1680.text:
Tam uttirnam mahabahum gadahastama arindamam

1702.text:
[S]
Thus Duryodhana, O king, roaring again and again
Vasudeva, enraged at Yudhisthira, said this

1703.text:
If this horse chooses you in battle, Yudhisthira
Arjuna, Nakula, Sahadeva or anything else

1704.text: What is this courage, O king, that you have taken, that you should be the only one to be killed and made king?

1705.text:
Etena hi krita yogya varshanih tarayodsha
Aise purushe rajan bhimsenajighansaya

1709.text:
Bali bhima samarthasha cha kriti raja suyodhana
balavan va kriti veti kriti rajana vishishyate

1712.text:
I do not see him in the world with a club in his hand, the best of men
who fights Duryodhana in numbers and specializes in his deeds

1713.text:
Phalguna or you, Madriputrav, yet or
not capable I think in the battle of the mace-hand

1716.text:
[Bham]
Madhusoodana, do not be depressed, Yadunandana
Today I shall cross the very difficult path of enmity

1717.text:
I will kill Suyodhana in battle no doubt
Victory is sure to be seen by Krishna, the king of righteousness

1718.text:
Adhyardhena puneneyam gada gurutari mama
n tatha Dhritarashtrasya ma karshir madhava vayatham

1719.text:
Samaran api lokans tarin nanashastradharan yudhi
yodhayeyam rane hrishtah kim utadya suyodhanam

1720.text:
[He]
As he was thus conversing, Vasudeva worshiped Vrikodara
with joy and said these words

1722.text:
You have killed all the sons of Ghritarashtra in battle
kings, princes and serpents

1723.text:
The Kalingas, the Magadhas, the Gandharvas of the north, the Kurus, and
they reached you and were killed in the great battle, O Pandu

1725.text:
And your sinful Dhritarashtra will be destroyed in battle by your enemy
You will break his forehead and pass the enemy's promise

1726.text:
Yatnena tu sada Partha yoddhavyo Dhritarashtrajah
kriti cha balavansha chaiva yuddhashaundsha cha nityada

1729.text:
Then Bhimabala Bhima said to Yudhisthira
Standing with the Srinjayas, like the sun, burning

1730.text:
I am eager to fight in battle with this
for this vile man cannot defeat me in battle

1732.text:
Shalyam adyodharishyami tava pandava hrichchhayam
nihatya gadaya papam adya rajan sukhi bhava

1734.text:
And the king Dhritarashtra, hearing that I have killed his son
will kill the evil deed which he has done, and that is the wisdom of the thief

1737.text: Seeing him with his horn like Kailash rising, Bhimasena then said to Duryodhana, O king

1738.text:
The evil deeds which King Dhritarashtra and you have done to us
Samara are the evil deeds which have been committed in Varanasi

1739.text:
Daraupadi ca pariklishta sabhamadhye rajasvala
Dayute yad vijito raja shakuner buddhinischayat

1740.text:
And whatever other sins you have committed against the wicked
and the innocent Parthians, look at the great reward of it

1742.text:
Hato Daronasha cha Karnasha cha hato Shalya paratapavan
Vairasya chadi kartasau shakunir nihato yudhi

1743.text:
Bharatarasa, you have killed the brave sons and fellow soldiers
They have killed the kings and the brave men who have not stopped in battle

1747.text:
[Dur]
Why have you fought so many times with me
Today I will destroy your faith in battle, Vrikodara

1748.text:
Don't you see me, the sinful club, standing in the battle
with a great club in the shape of a snow-peak

1749.text:
Gadinam ko 'daya me papajetum utsahate ripuh
nayatto yudhyamanasya devasva api purandara

1750.text:
Do not roar in vain, O Kaunteya, like the autumn mist of water
Show your strength in battle as long as there is mercy for you

1752.text:
That drunken elephant, the humans, with the sound of the floor,
we again cheered, O king, King Duryodhana

1756.text: Seeing him, the kings worshiped him and said,

1757.text:
Then Rama said, seeing Krishna and the Pandavas
Duryodhana and the Kauravas standing with clubs in their hands

1758.text:
Forty days later today I left Dave and I went to Vai
Pushya and returned to Sharavana
I wanted to see the club fight between the two disciples, Madhava

1760.text:
Krishna and the great archers greeted Halayudha
saswajate paripreetau pariyamanau yashasvinau

1761.text:
The sons of Madri and the five sons of the brave Daraupadi
Abhivadya sathita rajan rauhineyam mahabalam

1762.text:
Bhimasena 'tha balavan putras tava janadhipa
tathaiva chodyat gadau poojayam asatur balam

1764.text:
Then Rama embraced the Pandavas and Srinjaya
and asked them how they were doing and all the Pandavas who were of immeasurable strength
And so they approached him and asked him if he was healthy

1765.text:
After worshiping all the Kshatriyas and the great-minded Hali,
making a well-connected consensus as age

1766.text:
He embraced Janardana and Satyaki with love
smelling Chaitava on the forehead and asked how they were doing

1767.text:
Tau chainam vidhivad rajan poojayam asatur gurum
Brahmanam iva devesham Indropendrau muda yutau

1768.text:
Then the son of Dharma, Rauhineyam, said to Arindam,
Look at this great battle of Bharata, O Rama, O Bharatha

1773.text:
I am not going to help Dhritarashtra, Keshav
nor will I go to the sons of Pandu as I came

1776.text:
[Vai]
Upaplavye nivistesu Pandavashu mahatmasu
Pareshito Dhritarashtrasya samipam Madhusudana
Sham parati mahavaho hitartham sarvadehinaam

1779.text:
Then Krishna returned and dismissed Dhritarashtra
In action, the tiger-man Pandava said this

1784.text:
Ashrayam asa bhojasa tu duryodnanam arindamah
Yuyudhanena sahito vasudevasa tu pandavan

1785.text:
Rauhineya gate shure pushyena madhusudana
pandavayana purskritya yayava abhimukhah kurun

1786.text: As he was on his way, Rama said to his servants,

1787.text:
Gold and silver, cows, clothes, horses,
elephants, chariots, donkeys, camels and vehicles
Bring all the equipment for the sake of the holy place

1788.text:
Go to the Saraswati flowing again, swift-moving
Bring the priests and the hundreds of the gods

1790.text:
Surrounded by priests and friends and other noble brahmins
by chariots and horses and by others, O best of the Bharatas
by cows and camels and many chariots

1791.text:
The chariots of the autumns, the bodies of the arts, the babies of long life
are waiting in the countries like India
The food prepared for the sake of the hungry is all around

1797.text:
The hungry woman's food and delicious food, O best of the Bharatas,
Upajahrur naras there clothes and ornaments

1799.text:
Ever cheerful, delicious food, auspicious
Surrounded by hundreds of people in the marketplace
Verified with various trees and shrubs, adorned with various gems

1809.text:
[J]
Why did Lord Soma become infected with tuberculosis
And how did the moon sink in it in the greatest of holy places

1810.text:
How did the moon jump into it and drink it again
Tell me all this in detail, great sage

1813.text:
Tasa tu sarva vishalaksyo rupanapratima bhuvi
Atyarichyata tasam tu rohini rupasampada

1814.text:
Then the Lord of the Night made love to her
She became his heart today so he ate her always

1815.text:
Pura hi somo rajendra rohinyam avasacha chiram
tato 'saya kupitanya asana nakshatrani mahatmanah

1816.text:
Ta gatva pitaram parahuh parajapatim atantritah
Somo vasati nasmasu rohini bhajate sada

1817.text:
Ta vayam sahitah sarvasa tavatsakashe parajesvara
vatsyamo niytaharasa tapascharanatatparah

1819.text:
Tasha cha sarvabravid daksho gachchadhva somam antikat
samam vatsyati sarvasu chandrama mama shasanat

1822.text:
Hearing that word from them, Daksha said to Somam
Be equal to your wives and I will not curse you, Virochan

1824.text:
And they went and bowed their heads to the father of Parahu, and then
Soma dwells not in us, therefore take refuge in us

1825.text:
Rohinyam eva bhagavan sada vasati chandramah
tasmana nasa tarahi sarva vai yatha na soma avisheta

1826.text:
Then, hearing this, the Lord became angry with Yakshmana, lord of the earth
and with all his anger he entered Chodu's husband

1828.text:
Ishveshtibhira maharaja vividhabhira nishakara
na chamucyat shapad vai kashayam chaivabhyagachchat

1831.text:
Then the gods came together and said to Soma, O king,
Why does not this form of yours shine like this?

1832.text:
Tell us all the reason why you are so afraid
We will hear your words and then we will

1834.text:
The gods heard his words and went to Daksha and said
Parsid Lord Some, stop this curse

1836.text:
Veeruda oshadhayasha chaiva bijani vividhani cha
that we should offer to the Lokguru

1838.text:
May the moon be equal to all his wives always
May the moon dive into the best holy place of Saraswati
He will grow again, O gods, that is my true word

1839.text:
And for a month and a half the decay of the moon will always go
And for a month and a half then the growth will be true, this is my word

1840.text:
Then Somo went to Saraswati under the command of the sages
He went to Parabhasam, the supreme holy place, by Saraswati

1841.text:
Amavasya mahatejasa tatronmajjana mahadyutih
lokaan parabhasayam asa shitanshutvam avapa cha

1842.text:
And all the gods, O king, having attained the light of the other, and being accompanied by Pushkalam
Soma, became the other face of Daksha

1843.text:
Then Parajapati dismissed all the gods
And the Lord turned to Soma and spoke again

1844.text:
Mavamansthah satriyah putra ma cha vipraan kada chan
gachcha yuktasada bhuva kuru vai shasana mama

1845.text:
He was released, O Maharaja, and went to the whole abode
and the people were happy and ate as before

1847.text:
Amavasya maharaja nityasha shashalakshanah
sanatwa haya apyayate shariman parabhase tirtha uttama

1848.text:
Atash chainam parajananti parabhasam iti bhumip
parabhaam hi paramaam lebhe tasminna unmajjya chandramah

1849.text:
Tatas tu chamasodbhedam achyutas tava agamad bali
chamasodbhedam iti evam yam janah kathayantya uta

1850.text:
There he gave gifts and distinguished Halayudha
stayed for one night and bathed according to the custom then

1851.text:
Udapanaam athagacchata tavaravan keshavagrajah
Adyam savastyayanam chaiva tatravapya mahat phalam

1852.text: Because of the closeness of herbs and Lord of the earth, O Janamejaya, the Siddhas, O King, know that even the lost Saraswati

1858.text:
How did the brothers leave him in the well and go home
Tell me this, O Brahman, if you think it is worth hearing

1859.text:
[Vai]
Asana purvayuge rajana muniyo bharatarasa tarayah
ekatasha cha davitasha chaiva taritasha chaadityasannibhaah

1866.text:
Kadachid dhi tato rajan bharatarav ekat davitau
yajnaartham chakratush chitta dhanaartham cha especially

1867.text:
Tayosh chinta samabhavat taritam grihya parantapa
yajyan sarvan upadaya patigrihya pashuns tatha

1868.text:
We shall drink the moon with joy, having attained the great fruit of the sacrifice
Chakrusha chaiva maharaja bharatarasa taraya eva ha

1871.text:
Taritas tesam maharaja purastad yati hrishtavat
Ekatash cha davitash chaiva shrishtah kalayan pashun

1872.text:
They were worried when they saw the great herd of cattle
How can these cows not cross without us

1873.text: They addressed each other and said to each other,

1874.text:
Tarito yajneshu kusalasa tarito vedasu nishtitah
Anyas tarito bahutara gavah samupalapsyate

1878.text:
Then the great sage crossed the well
Then he cried out, and the two sages heard him

1881.text:
Tarit atmanam alakshya kupe virut trinavrite
nimagnam bharatashrestha papakrina narake yatha

1883.text:
He thus contemplated the great ascetic in that well
and saw a tree hanging there by chance

1886.text:
Ajyam cha salilam chakre bhagansha cha taridivaukasam
Somasyabhishavam karva chakara tumula dhavanim

1888.text:
In the present and in the sacrifice, the very great soul who has crossed the
disturbed crossing heaven and all the reasons is not understood

1889.text:
Then Brihaspati heard a tumultuous sound
Hearing it, the priest of the gods said to all the gods

1892.text:
They went there and digged the well where he had crossed
They saw the great man dished out in the sacrificial rituals

1893.text:
Seeing him, the great man, equipped with the supreme Sharia,
Uchusha said,

1894.text: Then the sage said to the gods,

1899.text:
Tatheti choktva vibudha jagmu rajan yathagatam
taritash chapya agamat paritah savama eva nilaya tada

1902.text:
I have cursed the future for this sinful deed
and the young Golangulrshka monkeys under the control of others

1905.text:
And seeing him drinking water and the others again and again
The poor soul went to the river and then attained destruction

1906.text:
[Vai]
Then, O king, Halayudha came to destruction
Shudrabhiran parati daveshad where Saraswati was lost

1907.text:
Because that Saraswati, O best of Bharatas, was destroyed by her enemies,
therefore that sages always call her Parahura, the destroyer of her

1912.text:
There rejoice the gods and the ancestors with the trees
They are always sprinkled with holy flowers and divine again and again

1913.text:
Akridbhumi sa rajansa tasam apsarasam shubha
subhumiketi vikhyaata sarasvatysa tate vare

1915.text:
Seeing the vast shadows of the gods, Gandharvas, Rakshasas
Gandharvas, the son of Rohini came to that holy place

1916.text:
Vishvavasumukhasa tatra gandharvasa tapasanvitah
nrittavaditragitam cha kurvanti sumanoramam

1918.text:
Feed the devotees with desires and satisfied them with great wealth
Then Madhava went away with the brahmins and praised them

1919.text:
Therefore Gandharvatirtha and Mahabahu Arindamah
Garga Sarato Mahatirtham Aajgamaik Kundali

1920.text:
Where Garga, the old austerity-conscious soul,
transgressed the movement of time, knowledge and astronomy

1921.text:
Utpata darunasha chaiva shubhasha chaiva Janamejaya
Saraswati's auspicious holy place was prescribed by the great soul
And by his name that holy place is known as Garga Sarat

1925.text:
There he saw a great conch, as high as the great mountain
like a white mountain, served by hosts of sages,
a mountain born on the banks of the Saraswati, a palm-flagged tree

1927.text:
They all leave the horse food and eat the fruit of that plant
varataish and niyamaish from time to time

1928.text:
Paraptaish cha niyamais tais tair vicharantah prithaka prithaka
Adrishyamana manujair vayacharan purusharbha

1929.text:
Evam khayato narapate loke asmin sa vanaspatih
tatra tirtham saraswatiah pavanam lokavishrutam

1930.text:
And in that part the Yadu tiger gave the names of the illustrious in the holy place
copper vessels and clothes of various kinds

1931.text:
After worshiping the Davijans and worshiped by the rich in austerities
Halayudha did not reach the holy forest of the Davaitas, O King

1933.text:
Thathaiva datva viprebhya parobhogan supushkalan
tatha parayad balo rajana dakshinam saraswatim

1934.text:
And not far away, O mighty-armed one, the most illustrious
righteous Acyuta came to the holy place of Nagadhanva

1935.text:
Where Vasuki, the king of serpents, is enshrined
O great king of great light, surrounded by many serpents
Where there are fourteen thousand sages and Siddhas

1936.text:
Where the gods assemble and anoint Vasuki, the best of serpents
king of all serpents, according to the custom
there is no fear of serpents, there is no equal, O Kauravas

1938.text:
Apluty bahusho harishtas tesu tirtheshu langli
dattva vasu davijatibhyo jagamati tapasvinah

1940.text:
Where the Saraswati again turned to the other side
to observe the great souls of the sages Naimisheya

1949.text:
Agnihotrais tatas tesam huymanaira mahatmanaam
Ashobhata saricchrestha deepyamanaih samantata

1950.text:
Valkhilya Maharaja Ashmakuttash and Tapasah
Dantolukhalinash and others samprakhalas and others

1952.text:
The sages sat there near the Saraswati
adorning the best of rivers like the Ganges

1955.text:
Then the dark crowd of sages, desperate and worried,
we showed them, O king, Saraswati in their sense

1958.text:
Amogha went and gave them again the gift of I
Then the great river Rajan made a wonderful sight

1962.text:
Then, O king, Parayad Bala, worshiped by the gods
Saraswati, the best of holy places, with a host of various brahmins

1963.text:
Badarengud Kashmarya Palakshasvattha Vibhitakaih
Panasaish Cha Palashaish Cha Kariraih Peelubhis Tatha

1964.text:
Saraswati tiruhair bandhanaih sayandanais tatha
parushaka vanaish chaiva bilvair amratakais tatha

1965.text:
Atimukta kashandaish cha parijataish cha shobhitam
kadali vanbhuyishtam ishtam kantam manoram

1966.text:
Vayvambuphalaparnadair dantolukhalikair api
tathashma kuttair vaneyir munibhir bahubhir vrutam

1967.text:
Savadhyayaghoshasanghushtam mrigayuthashatakulam
ahinsraira dharmaparamaira nrityaira atyantasevitam

1968.text:
Halayudha came to the seven Saraswati holy places
where the great sage Mankanaka performed austerities for the Siddhas

1969.text:
[j]
Why did the seven Sarasvatas and Kasha the sage Mankanaka
How did Siddhasha and the Lord become his law

1971.text:
[Vai]
Rajan sapta sarasvatyo yabhira vayaptam idam jagat
ahut balavadbhira hi tatra tatra sarasvati

1972.text:
Suprabha kanchanakshi cha vishala manasahrada
saraswati oghavati suvenura vimalodaka

1973.text:
The great present of the grandfather
spreads on the earth in the sacrificial field among the twelve species

1974.text:
Punyahaghoshaira vimalaira vedanam nindais tatha
devasu chaiva vayagresu tasmin yajnavidhau tada

1975.text:
There also, O great king, initiated by the other grandfather
you sacrificed there by the sacrifice with the prosperity of all desires

1976.text:
Manasa chintita haya artha dharmaarthakusalais tad
upatishtanti rajendra davijatinsa tatra tatra ha

1977.text:
The Gandharvas sang and there the Apsaras danced
We played the divine instruments with ease

1979.text:
In the present and sacrifice at Pushkar, the grandfather
said not the sages, O king, this sacrifice is not greatly fruitful
There is no better river to be seen, since Saraswati is here

1980.text:
Tach chrutwa bhagavan parita sasmaratha saraswati
pitamahena yajata ahuta pushkares vai
suprabha nama rajendra nama tatra saraswati

1981.text:
Seeing her, the sages were pleased and thought much to make Saraswati honor her
grandfather

1983.text:
In Naimishe the sages, O king, meet and assemble
there are pictures of stories, horses, seats, Vedas, Lord of the people

1984.text:
There the sages sat on horses and learned various lessons
They met and the sages remembered Saraswati

1987.text:
Gayasya yajmanasya gayeshva evam mahakratum
Ahuta saritaam sharestha gaya yajne saraswati

1989.text: Auddalkes and the sacrifice of the sacrifice there in the circle of sages who were safe from all sides including India

1990.text:
In the northern part of Kosala, in the holy Rajan Mahatma,
Auddalaka, the sacrificer, formerly worshiped Saraswati

1991.text:
The best river came to that country for the sake of the sages
worshipped by the sages covered with bark and deerskin
and sold as hardening the mind, for she was taken away by their minds

1992.text:
Suvenura Rishabhadvipe punye rajarshisevite
Kurosha cha yajmanasya kurukshetra mahatmana
Ajagama mahabhaga saricchrestha saraswati

1993.text:
Oghavatya api Rajendra Vasishta mahatmana
samahuta kurukshetra divyatoya saraswati

1994.text:
Dakshena yajata chapi ganga davare saraswati
vimaloda bhagavati brahmana yajata punah
samahuta yayau tatra punye haimavate girau

1995.text:
They were united and then they came together in that holy place
The seven Saraswati holy places were then known on earth

1996.text:
These are the seven Saraswatis named
The seven Saraswatis are also holy and sacred

1997.text:
Listen to the young brahmachari of Mankanaka
Apgama avagadhasya rajan parkriditam mahata

1998.text:
Seeing by chance there Satriyam in the waters of India
Sanayanti Ruchirapangim Digvasasam Aninditam
Saraswati Maharaja Chaskanda Viryam Ambasi

2002.text:
Pura Mankanaka Siddha Kushagreneti Nah Sharutama
Kashata Kil Kare Rajans Tasya Shakaraso 'Saravat
Sa Vi Shakarasam Drishtva Harshavistha Paranrittavan

2004.text:
Brahma and other demigods, O king, and the sages and the rich in austerities
vijnapto vai mahadeva rishera arthe naradhipa
nayam nryed yatha deva tatha tavam kartum arhasi

2008.text:
Tam parahasyabravid devo munim ragena mohitam
Aham na vismaya vipra gacchamiti parapasya mama

2011.text:
[Rasi]
I think there is no other god greater than Rudra
You are the movement of the world of gods and demons, you are the spear-bearer

2012.text:
The sages here say that this universe was created by you
Your own everything enters again at the end of the age

2017.text:
The seven Sarasvatas and in this man who worships Me
Nothing will be rare for him here and there
They will go to the Sarasvata world without doubt

2018.text:
Etan Mankanakasyapi charitam bhuri tejasah
sa hi putrah sajanyayam utpanno matarishvana

2019.text:
[Vai]
Ushitva tatra Ramasa tu sampujyashramavasinah
tatha mankanke pariti shubam chakre halayudha

2020.text:
Datva danam davijatibhyo rajanim tama uposhya cha
poojito munisanghaish cha paratara utthaya langli

2021.text:
Anujnapya munin sarvana saprishtva toyam cha bharata
parayayau tavarito rajans tirthahetor mahabalah

2023.text:
Mahata Shirasa Rajan Garastajangho Mahodarah
Rakshasasya Maharaja Rama Kashiptasya Vai Pura

2024.text:
There before, the great soul performed austerities in poetry
where his policy was all transcended by the great soul
there he thought of the conflict between the demons and the demons

2026.text:
[j]
Kapalamochana brahmana katham yatra mahamunih
mukta katham chasya shiro lagnam kena ca hetu

2028.text:
The head of the evil demon was cut off at Janasthana
by the cold-edged sword and then fell into the great forest

2032.text:
He went to the rivers and all the sea and the great ascetic
Then he told them all about the names of the sages who had become spiritual souls

2033.text:
He was immersed in all the holy places and did not attain salvation
but he heard the great words of the sages

2034.text:
Saraswatyas tirthavaram khayatam aushansam tada
sarvapapaprashamanam siddhakshetraam anuttamam

2041.text:
Then Haldhar, accompanied by the noble Brahmins,
went to the place where King Rushangus had left his body

2042.text:
Rushangura brahmano vrddhasa taponityash cha bharata
dehanyase kritamana vichintya bahudha bahu

2043.text: Then the great ascetic Rushangur took them all and said to them,

2044.text:
Knowing the age of Rushangu, those rich in penance
They brought him to the holy place of Saraswati, the rich in penance

2047.text:
On the northern bank of the river Saraswati, whoever leaves his body
Pruthudake japyaparo nainam shavo maranam tapet

2049.text:
There the Lord Lokaal, the father of the worlds, created
where Arshtisena, the Kauravas, attained the Brahmanism, the self-controlled vow,
by great austerities, O king, the great sage

2050.text:
The Indus Islands and the Rajarshi Devapisha and the great ascetics
Attained Brahmanism where Vishvamitra, the great sage
The great ascetic Lord Ugrateja, the great ascetic

2051.text: There came the mighty Balabhadra, the mighty Paratapavan

2052.text:
[j]
How did the Lord Arshtisena perform vast austerities
How did the island of the Indus attain Brahmanism then

2053.text:
Devapisha cha katham brahmana visvamitrasha cha sattam
tan mamachakshva bhagavan param kautuhalam hi me

2055.text:
Tasya rajan guru kule vasto nityam eva ha

Sa nirvinnasa tato rajansa tapasa tepe mahatapasah

2058.text:
In this holy place, the great river today, the human being who is flooded by others

2059.text:
Today the servant of others will not be afraid of the wind
Even with a little effort he will reap abundant rewards

2061.text:
In that same holy place the island of Sindhu was restored
The gods and the gods, O great king, attained great Brahmanism

2064.text:
That king Kausikas, my father, became a great yogi
and consecrated his son Vishvamitra, the great ascetic

2065.text:
Dehanyase manasha chakre tama uchuh paranatah parajah
na gantavyam mahaprajna tarahi chasmana mahabhayat

2067.text:
Having said this, Gadhira then settled Vishvamitra and
went to heaven, O king, Vishvamitra became king
and could not protect the earth even if he tried

2068.text:
Then the king heard of the great fear of the demons
and went out of the city with a force of four horses

2072.text:
So said the cow created men of terrible appearance
They reached that force and destroyed it everywhere

2074.text:
So 'smins tirthavare rajan saraswatiah samahitah
niyamaish chopavasaish cha karshayana deham atmanah

2075.text:
The water-eater, the air-eater, and the leaf-eater became the same

Asakrata tasya devas tu varatavighnam parachakrire

2079.text:
Sa tu vavra varam rajan sayam aha brahmanas tava iti

In that best of holy places Rama gave to others various kinds of wealth

2082.text:
And clothes, ornaments, food and drink, and beauty

2084.text:
[Vai]
Brahmayonibhira akiranam jagama yadunandana

2085.text:
Tapasa ghorarupanakarshayana deham atmanah

He cut up the flesh of the dead, the best of the brahmins

Avakirne saraswatyas tirthe parajvalya pavakam

2100.text:
Yada chapi na shaknoti rashtra mochayitum nripa
Atha vaiprasnikansa tatra paprachcha Janamejaya

Therefore the poison of this nation which thou hast sacrificed is great
This is the work of his austerities by which thou hast brought another great
Apan kunje saraswatyas tam parsadaya earth

Then the king went to Saraswati and said to Bakam
He fell down with his head on the ground and offered obeisances, O best of the Bharatas

offered the sacrifice again for the salvation of his nation

2109.text:
There, in the holy place, Maharaja Brihaspati, the generous

Yayatera yajmanasya yatra rajana sarasvati

Yatra yatra hi yo vipro yan yan kamaan abhipsati

Then the palm-ketu, the bridge of great righteousness; the great soul, the self-sacrificing, the constant of great charity,
the flow of Vasishta with great terrible speed; the self-controlled and conquered soul approached

[j]
The flow of Vasishta is terribly fast, how is it?
Why did the best of rivers carry the sage back

2121.text:
[Vai]
Vishvamitra's Chaivarshera and Vasishta's Bharata
There was great enmity, O king, and the austerities of the king were greatly rivaled

The ashram of Vasishta was great in Sathanutirtha

In that Saraswati holy place, the great sage Vishvamitra
was driving Vasishta with great austerities, hear that

Vishvamitra and Vasishta performed intense austerities every day in India

2129.text:
This Saraswati will soon bring me the wealth of austerities
with speed Vasishta, the best of those who chant
I will kill the best of the Davijas who has come here without a doubt

Then Saraswati, trembling and pale, bowed her head and then
approached the great sage Vishvamitra

Hatavira yatha nari sabhavad dukhita bhrisham
Baruhi kim karavaniti parovaca munisattamam

2134.text: The sage, angry, said to her,

Sanjalim tu tatha kritva pundarikanibhekshana

Then feared Sarichchrestha was thinking India

2138.text:
Sabhigamya Vasishta tu imma artham achodayat

Tarah yourself, O best of rivers, carry me swiftly
Vishvamitra curses you, do not think of yourself

2142.text:
Hearing that word from him, that river of grace and character

2143.text:
His hope worry arose in me Vasishta very much for
he has always done me kindness and his work is good for me

2144.text:
Atha kule savake rajan japantam rishisattamam

By that robbery of the roots, Maitreya and Varuna were satisfied

You are the sky-goddess, you pour out milk in the clouds

Pushtir dayutis tatha kirti siddhir vrddhira uma tatha

Avahacha chonitonmishram toyam samvatsara tad

2157.text:
Evam Vasishtapavaho loke khayato janadhipa

2158.text:

She was cursed by that angry Vishvamitra, the wise

2159.text:
Then came the king and the demons there in India

2161.text:
Whose mind is yours, then, the sages of time, the wealth of Satapa,

Then, having reached that terrible holy place, O greatly fortunate one,

Let us all deliver this Saraswati from the curse

2172.text:
For we are hungry and destroyed by righteousness and destroyed by eternal father

2173.text:
By your carelessness and evil deeds
this wing grows equal to us because we are equal Brahma and Rakshasas

2176.text:
Then have mercy on us here, O nobles of the gods

2177.text:
Their those sages heard and praised that great river

2178.text:
And whatever is produced by poisonous insects and whatever is cut and eaten

[j]

Then Indra made friends with him and said this to the time

I will kill you neither wet nor dry nor at night nor in a vehicle

In what time and place and as the best of speakers

Himavansh and Vindhya and Merush and many horned

Parigha and Vata and Bhima and Sumahabala

Pthvka blue-necked and iron-armed

2354.text:
Shataghni and Chakra-hastash and Musal-handed
Spear-and-Sword-handed and huge-bodied and mighty

2355.text:
Gada bhushundi hastasha cha tatha tomarapanaya
Asi mudgarahastasha cha dandahastasha cha bharata

2356.text:
Ayudhaira vividhaira ghoraira mahatmano mahajavah
mahabala mahavega mahaparishadas tatha

2358.text:
These and many other great councils, O king,
attended the great and illustrious Kartikeya

2359.text:
Divyasha chapya antarikshasha cha parthivasha chanilopamaah
vayadishta daivataih shuraah sakandasya anucharabhavana

2360.text:
Thousands and billions of such people surrounded the
anointed great man

2361.text:
[Vai]
Shrunu matriganaan rajana kumaranucharana imaan
kirtyamana maya veer sapatnaganasudana

2362.text:
Hear the names of the illustrious mothers, O India
by whom the worlds are filled with welfare and all living beings

2363.text:
Parabhavati Vishalakshi Palita Gonsi and
Shrimati Bahula Chaiva Tathaiva Bahuputrika

2364.text:
Apsu jata cha gopali brihad ambalika tatha
jayavati malatika dharuvaratna bhayankari

2365.text:
Vasu Dama Sudama and Vishoka Nandini and
Ekachuda Mahachuda Chakranemish Bharata

2366.text:
Uttejani Jayasena Kamalakshya Atha Shobhana
Shatrunjaya Tatha Chaiva Karodhana Shalabhi Khari

2367.text:
Madhavi is auspicious-faced and Tirthanemish and Bharatha
Geetapriya and Kalyani Kadrula and Amitasana

2368.text:
Meghaswana Bhogavati Subhrush Cha Kanakavati
Alatakshi Viryavati Vidyujihva Cha Bharata

2369.text:
Padmavati Sunakshatra Kandara Bahuyojana
Santanika Kauravya Kamala Mahabala

2370.text:
Sudama Bahu Dama Cha Suprabha Cha Yashasvini
Nrityapriya Cha Rajendra Shatolukhala Mekhala

2371.text:
Shatghanta Shatananda Bhaga Nanda Cha Bhagini
Vapushmati Chandra Shita Bhadra Kali Cha Bharata

2372.text:
Sankarika Nishkutika Bharma Chatvarvasini
Sumangala Sabstimati Vriddhikama Jai Pariya

2373.text:
Dhanda Suprasada and Bhavada and Jaleshwari
Edi Bhedi Sumedi and Vetal Janani and
Kanduti and Kalika and Dev Mitra Bharat

2374.text:
Lambasi Ketaki Chaiva Chitrasena Taha Bala
Kukkutika Shankhanika Tatha Jarjarika Nripa

2375.text:
Kundarika kokalika kandara ca shatodari
utkrathini jarena ca mahavega ca kankana

2376.text:
Manojva Kantakini Parghasa Putana Tatha
Khashaya Churvyutir Vama Karoshnath Tadit Parbha

2377.text:
Mandodari ca tunda ca kotara meghavasini
subhaga lambini lamba vasu chuda vikatthani

2378.text:
Urdhvavani dhara chaiva pingakshi lohamekhala
broad-faced sweet honey pot and so on

2379.text:
Pakshalika Manthanika Jarayur Jarjaranana
Khayata Dahadaha Chaiva and Dhamadhama Nripa

2380.text:
Khandakhanda cha Rajendra pooshana manikundala
Amocha chaiva kauravya tatha lambapayodhara

2381.text:
Venuveena Dhara Chaiva Pingakshi Lohmekhala
Shasholuk Mukhi Krishna Kharjangha Mahajava

2382.text:
Shishumara Mukhi Shveta Lohitakshi Vibhishana
Jatalika Kamchari Long tongue Balotkata

2383.text:
Kaledika vamanika mukuta chaiva bharata
lohitakshi mahakaya hari pindi cha bhumip

2384.text:
Ekakshara sukusuma krishna karni cha bharata
kashura karni chatuskarni karnapravarana tatha

2385.text:
Chatushpath Niketa Cha Gokarni Mahishanana
Kharakarni Mahakarni Bheri Savanmahasvana

2386.text:
Shankhakumbha Savana Chaiva Bhangada Chaiva Mahabala
gana Cha Sugana Chaiva Tathabhitya Atha Kamada

2387.text:
Chatushpath rata chaiva bhuri tirtha anyagochara
pashuda vittada chaiva sukhada cha mahayashah
payoda gomahishada suvishana cha bharata

2388.text:
Paratishtha supratishtha cha rochmana surochana
Gokarni cha sukarnicha sasira satherika tatha
Ekachakra megharava meghmala virochana

2389.text:
Etasha chanyasha cha bahavo mataro bharatarshabha
karttikeyanuyayiniyo nanarupah sahasrashah

2390.text:
Long-nailed, long-toothed, long-beaked, India
Simple, sweet-smelling, youthful, adorned

2395.text:
Yamyo Raudryas and Soumyas Kauberyas and Mahabalas
Varunyas and Gaindras and Agneyas Parantapa

2396.text:
Vayavyasha chatha kaumaryo brahmyasha cha Bharatarshabah
rupana apsarasam tulya jave vayusamasa tatha

2397.text:
Parapustopama vakye tathardhya dhanadopamah
Shakra viryopamasha chaiva diptya vahni samasa tatha

2401.text:
Then Lord Pakshasana gave the weapon of power
to the cave of the royal tiger to destroy the enemies of the gods

2404.text:
Vishnu gave Vaijayanti a garland that increased strength
Uma gave Charjasi a garment that shone like the sun

2406.text:
Garuda gave his beloved son, the peacock, the picture-peared
Aruna, the copper-crowned one, the weapon of his feet

2409.text:
Sa sena nairriti bhima saghantochchritaketana
sabheri shankhamuraja sayudha sapatakini
shardi dayour ivabhati jyotirbhir upshobhita

2410.text:
Then the gods came out and they gathered the army of ghosts and
played the demons undisturbed and the drums and horns in abundance

2411.text:
Patahan jharjharansh chaiva krikchan govishanikan
adambarn gomukhansh chadidimansh cha mahaswanan

2412.text:
All the gods and inhabitants praised the young man
The gods and Gandharvas sang and the Apsaras danced

2414.text:
Paratigrihya varam devas tasmad vibudhasattamat
paritatmano mahatmano menire nihatan ripun

2415.text:
All the hosts of ghosts rose with joy
Fill the worlds with the boon given by the great soul

2416.text:
He went out with a great army surrounded by a great army
to kill the demons in battle and to protect the heavenly beings

2417.text:
Vayavasayo Jayo Dharma Siddhi Lakshmi Dhriti Smriti
The army of the great army went forward, O king

2421.text:
Abhyasyamane shaktyastra sakandenamit tejasa
Ulka javala maharaja papat vasudatale

2422.text:
Samhradayantsha cha tatha nirghatasha chapatan kasitau
yathanta kalasamaye sughora sayus tatha nripa

2423.text:
Kshipta haya eka tatha shaktih sughoranal sununa
Then crores of powers fell out, O best of the Bharatas

2425.text:
He killed the buffalo in numbers surrounded by eight lotuses
He killed the cross-foot with ten thousand hundreds surrounded by ten

2426.text:
Hardodara and Nikharvaish were surrounded by ten Ishwaras
who killed them with their followers and with various weapons in their hands

2427.text:
There they made a great noise in the slain enemies
The followers of the princes, O king, filled the ten directions

2429.text:
Patakayavadhutash cha hatah ke chit suradvishah
kecchid ghanta rava tarasta nipetur vasudhatale
ke chit paraharanaish chinna vinipetur gatasavah

2432.text:
The great army of the gods, the enemy of the gods, was generous in his campaign
he took refuge in Karauncha for fear of Kartikeya

2433.text:
Then Lord Kartikeya, in great anger, pierced Karauncha with his
power, which resounded with the sound of Karauncha

2434.text:
Sashal sakandasaralam tarastavanaravaranam
pulinatrasta vihagam vinishpatit pannagama

2435.text:
Golangurraksha sanghaish cha darvadbhira anunaditam
kuranga gatinirghosham udbhrantasrimarachitam

2439.text:
Tan nijaghnur atikramya kumaranuchara mridhe
bibheda shaktya karauncham cha pavakih paraveeraha

2442.text:
Then the Lord God killed the enemies of the gods
and was worshiped by the gods and found great joy

2444.text:
The wind blew divine fragrance and the holy ones
The Gandharvas praised him and the sacrificers and the great sages

2445.text:
Ke chid enam vayavasyanti pitamahasutam parabhum
sanatkumaram sarvesham brahmayonim tama agrajam

2446.text:
Ke chin Maheshwara sutam ke chit putram vibhavasoh
Umayah krittikanam cha gangayash cha vadantya uta

2447.text:
Ekdha cha davidha chaiva chaturdha cha mahabalam
yoginam ishwaram devam shatasho atha sahasrasah

2455.text:
I have told you all that you ask me
how Lord Sakanda was anointed by the gods assembled

2456.text:
[J]
I have heard this very wonderful Brahman in fact
The consecration of the young man in detail according to the ritual

2457.text:
Yach chrutwa pootam atmana vijanami tapodhana
parahrishtani cha romani parasanna cha mano mama

2458.text:
The coronation of the young man and the killing of the demons and
hearing of it made me very happy and curious again

2460.text:
[Vai]
Shrunu rajanna idam chitram purvakalpe yathatathama
Adau kritayuga tasmin vartamane yathavidhi
Varuna devata sarva sametyedam athabruvan

2461.text:
As Shakra, the king of the gods, always protects us from fear
so be your husband of all rivers

2463.text:
And with the moon your losses will increase
So be it, said Varuna to those gods

2464.text:
Then all gathered together and worshiped Varuna, the lord of the sea,
for by the ritualistic act

2466.text:
Then you were anointed by the gods, and Varuna, the greatly renowned
The river, the ocean, the river and the lakes
we protected by the law as the gods Shatakratu

2467.text:
Then there too, having touched and given various wealth
Agnitirtha, the great wise man went to Paralambaha
Lost is not seen where the fire is in the womb of Shami

2468.text:
Lokaloka vinashe cha paradurbhute tadanagha
upatasthura mahatmana sarvalokapitamaham

2469.text:
Agni is destroyed by the Lord and we do not know the cause
May the destruction of all the worlds not become our fire

2473.text: Then they reached Agnitirtha and saw Shami still in the womb of Javalan dwelling there according to the custom

2475.text:
Bhrigu's curse, O king, what was said by the Brahma-vadi
There he also jumped and went to the Brahma-yonim

2476.text:
The Lord created where the father of all the worlds
Then Brahma, the Lord with the gods, in the past
created food and the gods according to the ordinance

2479.text:
He saw there and there a place in the best of the forests of Kaubera
where the great soul had performed vast austerities in the past

2480.text:
Where King Kubera obtained boons and abundant
wealth and friendship with Rudra by his immeasurable splendour

2481.text:
Suratvam lokapalatvam putram cha nalakubaram
Yatra lebhe mahabaho dhanadhipatir anjasa

2484.text:
Nishevitam sarvasatvaira nama badar pachanam
nanartuka vanopetam sada pushpaphalam shubham

2485.text:
[Vai]
Tatas tirthavaram rama yayau badar pachanam
tapasvisiddhacharitam yatra kanya dhritavrata

2487.text:
Tapash chachar satyugram niyamaira bahubhira nripa
bharta me devarajah sayad iti nishchitya bhamini

2488.text:
Samasa tasya vayatikranta bahvyah kurukulodvaha
charantya niyamansa tansa tan satribhis tivran suduscharan

2490.text:
Ajagamashrama tasyasa taridashadhipatih parabhu
asthaya rupam viprarsera vasishtasya mahatmana

2491.text:
She saw him performing severe austerities, Vasishta, the best of austerities
and worshiped him with the rituals seen by the sages, O Bharatha

2492.text:
Uvaca niyamajna cha kalyani sa pariyanvada
Bhagavan Munishardul kim agyapayasi parabho

2493.text:
I will give you everything today as much as I can, Suvrata
Indra, but with devotion I will never give you my hand

2494.text:
Vrataish cha niyamaish chaiva tapasa cha tapadhana
Shakrasa toshayitavyo vai maya taribhuvanesvarah

2495.text:
After saying this, the Lord God looked at her as if she were not in time and
said to her, who knew the law, consoling her as if she were not, O Bharatha

2497.text:
And all that is as it has been and will be, O beautiful one
Everything is obtained by austerity, everything remains in austerity

2498.text:
Yani sathanani divyani vibudhanaam shubhanane
tapasa tani parapyaani tapo moolam mahat sukham

2499.text:
Here, after performing austerities and renouncing the terrible body, human beings
go to become gods, O auspicious ones, listen to this word of mine

2502.text:
To inquire of her, that Lord Pakshasana
the lord of the gods made the clouds digest

2504.text:
A great time passed while she was cooking, O man
and they were not even digested and the day came to an end

2505.text:
And her pile of wood which was burnt by the fire
She saw the fire without wood and burned her whole body

2506.text:
She threw her feet aside and looked beautiful in the fire before
burned and burned and turned her feet again, O sinless one

2507.text:
And her feet burning, she did not think of the blameless
suffering of the lotus-eyed Maharshi for her love

2511.text:
And this will be your best holy place, stable in the world
Sarvapapapaham Subhru nama Badar Pachanam
Famous in the worlds of the seas, flooded by the Brahmarshis

2512.text:
Asmin khalu mahabhage shubhe tirthavare pura
tayaktwa saptarshayo jagmur himavantam arundhatim

2517.text:
Then, having assumed the form of Brahma, the great god of great fame
approached her and said,

2520.text:
Divine delightful holy stories she heard then
Passed that your drought terrible twelve years

2521.text:
She who does not eat cooks and hears good stories
The day is equal to her but the time has passed and it is terrible

2524.text:
Then Lord Hari showed Himself His form
Then He told them that He had a great character

2525.text:
The austerities you have earned on the back of the Himalayas
and the austerities you have performed, O brahmins, are not equal to my opinion

2528.text:
Sabravit Pruthu Tamrakshi Devam Saptarshi Sansadi
Bhagavan Yadi Me Paritas Tirtham Sayad Idam Uttamam
Siddhadevarshidayitam Naamna Badar Pachanam

2529.text:
Tathasmin devadevesh tariratram ushitah shuchih
parapnuyad upavasena phalam davadasa varshikam
evam astva iti tam choktva haro yatas tada divam

2531.text:
Thus the supreme perfection has been attained by the pure Arundhati
as you, O most fortunate one, have observed a restrained vow for me

2533.text:
I will give you a special boon, O best of the boons
Arundhati, the boon given to her by the great soul

2534.text:
I will give him the gift of your auspicious splendour
I will tell you another boon here as per the custom

2535.text:
He who spends one night in a holy place with good concentration
will attain the worlds and the rare body renunciation

2538.text:
Nedur dundubhayash chapi samantata sumahasvanah
marutash cha vavau yuktya punyagandho visham pate

2541.text:
[Vai]
Bharadwajasya viprarsheh sakanna reto mahatmanah
drishtvapsarasama ayantim ghritachim prithulochanam

2546.text:
[Vai]
Indra went to the holy place and then went to Bali, the best of the Yadus
and gave the brahmins wealth and gems, having bathed them according to the ritual

2548.text:
Nirrgalan sajaruthyan sarvan vividhadakshinan
ajahar kartuns tatra yathoktan vedaparagaih

2549.text:
Tan karatun Bharatashrestha shatakrtvo mahadyutih
purayam asa vidhivat tatha khayatah shatakratuh

2551.text:
Upassprushya cha tatrapi vidhivan musalayudhah
brahmanas poojayitva cha panachhadana bhojanaih
shubham tirthavaram tasmad rama tirtham jagam ha

2552.text:
Yatra Rama mahabhaga Bhargava sumahatapah
Asakrit prithivim sarvam hatakshatriya pungavam

2553.text:
Upadhyaya rewarded Kashyapa, the greatest sage,
Ajayad Vajapeya, he performed a hundred Ashvamedhas
and gave the earth with its oceans for alms

2555.text:
After giving wealth to a holy place in an auspicious place, the auspicious-faced man
bowed to the sage and then came to the Yamuna holy place

2557.text:
There, defeating the humans and gods in battle, Varuna, the hero of the enemy, took the society to do the
blessing

2558.text:
In that circle of Karatuvara there arose a battle
between the gods and the demons, causing the poison of the Tarailokya

2559.text: When Janamejaya, the best of the performers of the Rajasuya, retired, a terrible battle arose against the Kshatriyas

2560.text:
Sirayudhas then Rama in that best of holy places then
there he bathed and gave to the gods Vasu Madhava

2561.text:
The gardener then rejoiced and was praised by the gods
Then he went to the holy place of the sun with lotus-eyes

2562.text:
Yatreshtva bhagavan jyotir bhaskara rajasattama
jyotisham adhipatyam cha parabhavam chabhyapdyat

2564.text:
Davaipayana, Shukasha, Krishna, Madhusoodana
Yakshas, Rakshasas, Pisachas, Lord of the Worlds

2565.text:
These and many others are thousands of yogic perfections
in that holy place of Saraswati, Shiva, the holy Parantapa

2566.text:
There, having killed Vishnu and the demons in the past, Madhu and Kautabha
Apluto, the best of Bharatas, the best of the holy places, Uttama

2568.text:
Asito Devalash also in that same great ascetic
The sage attained yoga by believing in the supreme yoga

2569.text:
[Vai]
Tasminna eva tu dharmatma vasati sama tapadhanah
Garhasthya dharmam asthaya asito devala pura

2570.text:
Dharmanityah shuchir danto nayastadando mahatapaah
karmana manasa vacha samah sarveshu jantusu

2571.text:
Akrodhano maharaja tulyaninda pariyapriyah
kanchane loshtake chaiva samadarshi mahatapasah

2572.text:
He worshiped the gods daily and guests with the gods
He was always engaged in celibacy and always devoted to religion

2577.text:
Aharakale matiman parivrad janamejaya
Upatishtat dharmajno bhaiks kale sa devalam

2581.text:
The compound is transcended by many who worship me
not that lazy monk said anything

2584.text:
Then the Lord of the sea was astonished and worried
How this monk had been found in the sea and eternal

2585.text:
It was thus thought of by Maharshi Asita, then
he bathed in the sea and chanted the Chuchir Japya in accordance with the rituals

2586.text:
After chanting the mantra, the noble man went to the ashram
Janamejaya, holding a pitcher full of water

2590.text:
Asito devalo rajansha chintayam asa buddhiman
drishtah parabhavam tapaso jaigishavyasya yogajam

2591.text:
We were thinking, O king, then that great sage
I saw him in the sea and in the ashram, how is this yours

2593.text:
He saw the Siddhas who were wandering in the sky, concentrated
and saw Jaigishavya worshiped by those Siddhas

2595.text:
Therefore he saw him going to the world of the fathers
The world of the fathers saw him going to the world of the south

2599.text:
Chaturmasyaira bahuvidhaira yajante ye tapodhanah
tesam sathanam tatha yantam tathagnistoma yajinam

2600.text:
Agnistutena cha tatha ye yajanti tapodhanah
tat sathanam anusampraptam anvapashyata devala

2601.text:
Vajpeya karatuvaram tatha bahusuvarnaka
Aharanti mahaprajnasa tesam lokesva apashyat

2602.text:
They who sacrifice with Pundarika and Rajasuya
and whom you see in the worlds and who are to be conquered are the gods

2603.text:
Asvamedha karatuvara naramedha tathaiva cha
aharanti narashresthas tesam lokesva apashyat

2605.text:
Davadashahaisha cha satraira ye yajante vividhaira nripa
tesam lokasva apashyacha cha jaigishavya sa devala

2606.text:
Mitra Varunayor lokaan adityanam tathaiva cha
salokatam anupraptama pashya tato 'sita

2608.text:
Ascending the cow world, Brahma saw the Satri
loka going to Jaigishavya, and then Asita

2610.text:
Then the great sage was to be conquered again, and
he did not see the yogi, the invisible Arindam

2611.text:
So 'chintayan mahabhago jaigishavya devala
parabhavam suvratatvam cha siddhi yogasya chatulam

2612.text:
Asito asked then Siddhanl lokeshu sattaman
parayatah paranjalir bhutva dhiras tan brahma satrinah

2614.text:
[Siddhaha]
Shrunu devala bhutartham shansatam no drdhavrata
Jaigishavyo gato lokam shasvatam brahmano avayam

2616.text:
Then the Siddhas said to the temple again
The temple is not going there for you to go, O rich man of penance
The house of the Brahmin, the brahmin, whom you have attained

2617.text:
Hearing their words, the Lord of the Siddhas again
descended to the worlds in order

2618.text:
Savam ashramapdam punyam ajagama patangavat
paravishanna eva chapashyaj jaigishavyam sa devalah

2619.text:
Then, with intelligence, Vayaganayad Devalo, with righteousness,
seeing the effect of others, austerities, the yoga of Jaigishvya

2622.text:
Then, seeing him with a renounced mind, the great ascetic
destroyed him by the prescribed ritual

2623.text: Then the beings with the fathers, seeing him with the renounced mind, cried out,

2626.text:
Again, the god of evil will surely cut us off
He who does not understand the safety given to all beings

2627.text:
Then again, O great sage, count with all your intelligence
What is the best tax in liberation or in household religion?

2628.text:
Iti nishchitya manasa devalo rajasattama
tayaktva garhasthya dharma sa mokshadharma arochayat

2629.text:
Thinking of these things, Devalo decided then
attained the supreme perfection and yoga, O Bharatha

2631.text:
Athabravid rishivaro devan vai naradas tad
jaigishavye tapo nasti vismapayati yo 'sitama

2632.text:
Tam evam vadinam dhiram paratyuchus te divaukasah
maivam ity eva shasanto jaigishavyam mahamunim

2634.text:
[Vai]
Yatrejivan Udupati Rajasuyena Bharata
tasmin vrtte mahan asit sangramasa tarakamayah

2636.text: Where, in the twelve-year drought, the sage Saraswati taught the Vedas

2637.text:
[J]
How did the sage Sarasvata teach the Vedas in the twelve years of drought

2638.text:
[Vai]
Asit Puram Maharaja Munir Dhiman Mahatapasah
Dadhicha Iti Vikhyato Brahma Chari Jitendriyah

2639.text:
Indra is always afraid of his extreme austerities
He cannot be lured by fruits and many kinds

2640.text:
Paralomhanartham tasyatha parahinot pakshasanah
divyam apsarasam punyam darshaniyam alambusam

2643.text:
She bowed in her womb and saw the semen of the bull
She gave birth to her son Hetor the great river

2644.text:
Sushuve chapi samaye putram sa saritam vara
jagam putram adaya tama rishim parati cha parabho

2650.text:
The gods in the world, the fathers, the Gandharvas and the Apsaras
will be satisfied, O fortunate one, who are satisfied with your water

2652.text:
You have passed away, O most fortunate lake, O Brahman, in the past
The sages of the best of rivers, who are disciplined, know you

2657.text:
Thus praised by him, having received the boon, the great river
took her son and went away joyfully, O best of the Bharatas

2658.text:
At this very time, however, in opposition to the gods and demons,
Indra, seeking to abduct others, wandered across the worlds

2659.text:
Lord Indra did not choose to abduct others then
if it were worthy of them to kill the enemies of the gods

2660.text: Then Shakra said to the gods,

2662.text:
He was asked by the gods to 'asthini yatnad rishivaras tada
paranatyagam kurushveti cakaraivavicharyana
sa lokaan akshayana parapto devapriya karas tada

2665.text:
Atikaya sa tejasvi lokasara vinirmita
Jajne shailguru paransura mahimna parathita parabhu
nityam udvijate chasya tejasa pakshasana

2666.text:
With that thunderbolt, Lord Bharatha, with the mantra,
