3335.text:
The deer in the great forest were swallowed up by the forest fire as
the Kurus turned around burnt by the left arrow

3336.text:
Leaving behind the mighty-armed Bhimasena, then in battle
the army of the Kurus was disturbed and all turned their faces

3338.text:
He met Bhima and consulted with Phalguna
and told him of Vishalya and Aruja and Yudhisthira

3339.text:
After being permitted by Bhimasena, Dhananjaya fled
with the sound of his chariot, the earth and mercy, O Bharatha

3340.text:
Then surrounded by Bhima and ten enemy leaders
Duhshasanad Avarajais your sons, Dhananjaya

3342.text:
Apasavyans tu tansha chakre rathena madhusoodana
tatasa te paradravana shurah paranmukha rathe 'arjuna

3344.text:
Then he struck them with ten spears on their heads
Their eyes were red with anger and their lips were bitten on the ground
Their faces shone like stars in the sky

3345.text:
Tans tu bhallair mahavegair dashabhir dasha kauravan
Rukmangadana rukmapunkhair vidhva parayad amitraha

3346.text:
[He]
Then the great monkey banner was going with great speed on horses
The heroes of the Kurus ran to battle
The nine chariots of the Kurus
The tigers of men surrounded Arjuna in battle

3349.text: Arjuna killed ninety heroes with sharp arrows

3350.text:
They fell slain by arrows of various forms by the crown
with airplanes as the Siddhas from heaven at the end of their merits

3351.text:
Then the chariots, serpents and horses of the Kurus, the best of the Kurus,
fearlessly approached Phalguna, the best of Bharatas

3353.text:
Shaktyarishti tomaraprasaira gada nistrinshasayakaih
parachhadayana maheshvasah kuruvah kurunandanam

3354.text: The Pandavas killed that darkness with arrows like the sun with its rays

3356.text:
Karninalikanarachaisa tomaraih parasashaktibhih
kampanaira bhindipalaish cha rathastham partham ardaya

3358.text:
Atha tan davirdan sarvan nana lingair mahasharaih
sapatakaan saharohan girin vajrair ivabhinat

3360.text:
Then the sound of the Gandhis was great, O lord of the worlds
The constant roaring of men, elephants and horses

3362.text:
Ratha heena maharaja rathibhira vajibhis tatha
gandharvanagarakara drishyante sama sahasrashah

3364.text:
At that moment the arms of the Pandavas appeared
The horses and chariots of the Pandavas were victorious in battle

3365.text:
Then, O best of the Bharatas,
seeing Bhimasena's crown surrounded by the wave with great force

3366.text:
Leaving behind the remains of the dead, some of your chariots
rushed swiftly, O king, to the chariot of Dhananjaya

3368.text:
Hatavashishtans turgana arjunena mahajavan
bhimo vayadhamad abhranto gadapanir mahahave

3369.text:
Kalaratrim ivatyugram naranagashwabhojanam
parakaratta puradwara darnim atidarunam

3370.text:
Then she created a mace in the horses of men and animals
She killed many horses and horsemen

3372.text:
Having killed that Gajanika, the mighty Bhimasena
again took up his army and followed Arjuna behind him

3373.text:
Hatam paraanmukh parayam nirtsaham param balam
vayalambata maharaja parayashah shastraveshtitam

3376.text:
Alas, the army stood merging with each other
Alatchakravat, then turned around

3377.text:
Adiptam tava tat sainyam sharaish chinnatanuch chadam
Asit savshonit kalinnam phullashoka vanam yatha

3379.text:
Avishahya tu Parthasya sharasampatam ahave
matva nayavartana kuruva jita gandivadhanvana

3381.text:
Abhyadravat tan Parthah kiraj sharashatan bahun
harshayan pandavan yodhan bhimasenapurogaman

3383.text:
Kurava hi maharaja nirvishah pannaga iva
karnam evopaliyant bhayad gandivadhanvanah

3384.text:
As all beings are afraid of death, Bharatha
dharmam evopaliyante karmavanti hi yani cha

3387.text:
Seeing the force shattered, Partha forced Tavakam
The bow was spread out and Karna stood to kill the enemy
The Panchalas ran again while the left-handed soldiers watched

3389.text:
Then thousands of arrows shot from the ears of Marisha
vayayojayan Panchala with their lives, O best of the life-bearers

3392.text:
He threw the charioteer down with ignorance; he killed the horses of Janamejaya
Shatanika, the son of Soma, with his spear; he cut off his bow and arrows

3393.text:
Then he pierced Dhrishtadyumna with six; he killed the right horse in his number
The son of Suta, the son of Satyaki, killed the horse; he killed Vishokam, the son of Kaikeyi

3394.text:
The darkness rushed at the killed young man; Kaikeyi, the commander of the army, with a fierce bow
arrows various with great speed; he killed Karna's son Sushena

3398.text:
He cut off his arrow Shikhandi; Taribhis taribhis cha paratutod karnam
Shikhandi's bow and he flag; cut off with arrows he killed Sujatam

3399.text:
Shikhandinam shadbhira avidhyad ugro; danto dharshtadyumna shirasha chakrta
Athabhinat suta somam sharena; sa sanshitenadhirathir mahatma

3400.text:
Athakrande tumule vartamane; Dharshtadyumna nihate tatra Krishna
Apanchalyam kariyate yahi Partha; Karna jahitya abravid rajasingha

3402.text:
Vispharya Gandhivam athogra ghosham; Jaya samahatya tale bhrisham cha
bandha karam suddenly; killed Nagasvarathana and Naransha

3403.text:
Bhimasena followed him in a chariot; protecting Pandavas on the back of a hero
The two princes rode in chariots; they went to Karna and were freed from their enemies

3405.text:
Tama Uttamauja and Janamejaya; Karudha and Yudhamanyu and Shikhandi
roared in the ears with their sheep; crushing them with their attendant

3410.text:
Shikhandinam davadashabhih parabhinacha; chitaih sharaih shadbhira athottamaujasam
tarihira yudhamanyum avidhyad ashugaisa; taribhis taribhih somka parshatatmajau

3412.text:
Nimajjatas tan atha karna sagare; vipannavo vanijo yatharnave
uddhadrire naubhira ivarnavad rathaih; sukalpitaira daraupadijah savamatula

3413.text:
Then the bull named Shini with sharp arrows; he cut down Karna with many arrows that benefited others
he tore Karna with sharp ayo mayis; he pierced your eldest son with eight

3415.text:
Roaring on the same seat; with a rain of arrows that were very wide
he became more invincible than Satyaki; he took refuge in the sky like the sun in the middle

3420.text:
Then the battle between the two was past human; the enemy was in the midst of the enemy's death
They were angry with each other; they rose like Shambar and Shakra

3422.text:
Your son's sword was cut off by the wolf; the bow was cut off by the sword
The forehead was pierced by the sword; the head was taken from the body by the charioteer

3423.text:
The prince brought his bow; he defeated Vrikodara with twelve men
They all controlled the horses with their arrows; and the arrows again attacked Bhima

3424.text:
[He]
there did the difficult prince; fighting in the tumult of the evil ruler
he cut Bhima's bow with a razor; he also pierced the charioteer with six arrows

3425.text: Then he roared with many spears; with his best arrows he struck Bhimasena like a snake; he struck him with a club in a tumultuous manner

3426.text:
Tayaharad ten Dhanvantari; Dushasana Bhimasena parasah
taya hata patito vepamano; Dushasana gadaya vegavatya

3435.text:
Sleeping in a paraman cottage, eating the black cottage,
teasing with tea, suffering and burning in the house of the jatu

3436.text:
The devil has taken away the kingdom and lives in the forest, and you
have arrows and clothes in battle and unhappiness in your house

3437.text:
We know these sufferings and never pleasures
We are always with Dhritarashtra's evil spirit and son

3438.text: Having said this, O king, Vrikodara, having won the victory, said again, O great king, at the same time, both Kesha and Arjuna

3442.text:
Kavachi Nishangi Pashi Dandadharo Dhanurdhara
Alolupah Shalah Sandho Vatavegasuvarchasau

3444.text:
He was being stopped by the arrows all around him by the great chariots
Bhima, his eyes red with anger, looked like an angry time

3445.text:
Tans tu bhallair mahavegair dashabhir dashabhir shitai
Rukmangada rukmapunkhai Partha ninye yamakshayam

3446.text:
After those heroes were killed, the enemy's force fled, terrified of Pandava, the son of Suta, while you
watched

3447.text:
Then Karna, O great king, entered the great battlefield
seeing Bhima's mighty destruction as if he were a parajasva of death

3449.text:
These kings are at the door, tormented by the fear of Bhimasena
Duryodhana is confused and grieved by his brother's addiction

3451.text:
Duryodhana is worshiped by his family all around
Kripa and others, and the rest of the brothers who have lost their ears

3453.text:
He is that tiger of men, standing in great manhood
Reward Dhananjaya for the righteousness of the katriyas

3454.text:
Bharao hi Dhritarashtra tavayi sarvah samarpitah
tama udvaha mahabaho yathashakti yathabalam
jaye sayad vipula kirtir dharuvah savargah parajaye

3455.text: Vrishasena and Radheya, the son of the angry Pandavas, who have finished their enchantment with you

3458.text:
Tama abhyadhavan nakulah paraviro; roshad amitram paratudan prishatkaih
karnasya putram samare parahrishtam; jishnur jighansura maghaveva jambham

3462.text:
Karna's son was Nakula, O king; all the horses were covered with excellent weapons
the forest-dwellers were white with delicate weapons; they were adorned with gold and swift

3463.text:
Then Hatasvad got off the chariot; took the leather and the beautiful eight moons
and the sky-like sword; he walked like a bird floating

3465.text:
Twenty-two thousand known warriors; various countries well-fed and truthful
made by one quickly Nakula; they are as beautiful as sandalwood by Sarepsuna

3467.text:
Tam karna putro vidhamantam eka; narashvamatangarathapravekan
karidantam ashtadashabhih prishatkaira; pivyadha veer sa chukopa vidhah

3472.text:
Nakulam atha viditva chinnabanasanasim; viratham arishararta karna putrastra bhagnam
pavandhuta pataka haradino valgitasva; varapurushaniyattas te rathas shighram eyuh

3474.text:
Atha tava rathamukhyas tan paratiyus tavaranto; hridik suta kripau cha darauniduryodhanau cha
shakunisukavrikasha cha karatha devavrdhau cha; daviradajaldaghoshaih sayandanaih karmukaish cha

3475.text:
Thy Naravaravaryas tan dashaikam cha viran; paravara sharavaragryais tadayanto 'bhayarundhana
nine cloud-coloured elephants rose upon them; mountain peaks and terrible speeds Kuninda

3477.text:
The son of Kuninda with ten great arrows; he severely attacked Kripa and his horse
Then the son of Sharadvata was killed by the arrows; he fell to the ground with the serpent

3478.text:
Kuninda putravarajas tu tomarair; divakaranshu paratimair ayo mayih
ratham cha vikshobhya nanad nardatas; tato 'saya gandharapatih shiro 'harat

3480.text:
Then the battle was very terrible; again with the Kurus, Panu Srinjaya
Sharasi Shaktirishti Gada Parasvadhaira; Narasvanagashu Haram Bhrishakulam

3490.text:
With the horn of the son and the other body; Kunindaja of the bird went to kill him with an elephant
with speed and with great cruelty; then the lord of Gandhara cut off his head

3493.text:
Then he struck Shatanikam with his quick arrows; Karna's son Arjuna with his sharp arrows
Bhima and Nakula with seven arrows; Janardana with twelve arrows

3496.text:
Tama apatantam naraveeram ugram; mahahave banasahasradharinam
Abhyapatata karnasuto maharatho; yathaiva chendram namuchih puratan

3499.text:
Then the crown fell on the head of the battle; and with the branch of the sword on his forehead
the great soul shot arrows and spears; to kill Rajan in the number of the sons of Suta

3500.text:
He pierced him with ten spears; he pierced the unattached crown of the enemy
he cut off his seat and arms; he cut off his head with four axes

3504.text:
Rathena karnasa tejasvi jagamabhimukho ripun
uddhayamarsha tamraksha samahuya dhananjaya

3507.text:
All beings were astonished to see them, O Marisha
Trailokya, as Indra and Vairochana conquered the world

3508.text:
Rathajya talanirhradaira banashankharavaira api
tau rathava abhidhavantau samalokya mahikshitam

3510.text:
Seeing the two chariots attached, the earthlings of India
roared like lions and gave abundant salutation

3513.text:
So all the Pandavas cheered Dhananjaya
All directions were filled with the sound of trumpets and conches

3514.text:
Kashveditasphotitotkrushtais tumulm sarvato 'bhavat
bahughoshash cha veeraanam karnarjuna samagame

3515.text:
Seeing the two male tigers, the best of charioteers,
armed with great bows, arrows, power and clubs

3516.text:
Varminau baddhanisrinsho shetashvau shankhashobhinau
tuniravarasampannau davava api sama sudarshanau

3517.text:
Rakchandan digdhangau samadau vrishabhavam iva
aashivishasamaprakhyau yama kalaantakakopamau

3518.text:
Indra Vritrava iva karuddhau surya chandramas parabhau
mahagrahava iva karurau yugante samupasthitau

3521.text:
Both were famous for their deeds in manhood and strength
both were similar in battle to the kings of Shambramara

3522.text:
Katavirya is equal in battle and Dasarabha is equal to
Vishnuvirya is equal in prowess and Bav is equal in battle

3523.text:
Ubhau shavethahau rajan rathapravara vahinau
sarathi paravarau chaiva tayor asta mahabalau

3525.text:
Dhritarashtra then Karnam Sabala Bharatarshabha
Parivavrura Mahatmana Kashipram Ahavashobhinam

3527.text:
Tavakanam rane karno galha asid visham pate
tathaiva pandaveyanam galha partha 'bhavad yudhi

3529.text:
They gathered the demon for victory or otherwise
and our Pandavas were on the battlefield

3531.text:
Tava ubhau paratihirsetama Indra Vritrava ivabhita
Bhimarupa dharava asta mahadhumava iva garahau

3532.text:
Then there was a brief dispute in space, O best of the Bharatas
The differences between each other and the seat of the beings between Karna and Arjuna
They took refuge in different directions and all the worlds were killed

3533.text:
The gods, demons, Gandharvas, vampires, thieves and demons
made a hostile attack on Karna and Arjuna in the meeting

3534.text:
Daur asitka karnato vayagra sanakshatra visham pate
bhumir vishala parthasya mataputrasya bharata

3535.text:
The rivers, the seas, the mountains, the best of men
The trees and the herbs, there they reside in the crown

3536.text:
Asura, Yatudhanasha, Garuhyakasha, Parantapa
karna, and the birds that move in the sky

3537.text:
All the gems and treasures of the Vedas and the Akhyanas are the fifth
Sopa Vedas and Upanishads with their collections of secrets

3541.text:
The Vasavas, the Maruts, the Sadhyas, the Rudras in the universe, the Ashvins, and
Agni, the Indras, the Somas, the Pavanas, the ten directions
Dhananjaya, the suns, the ears of the suns

3542.text:
The gods, however, with their fathers, became Arjuna
Yama, Vaishravana and Varuna, from whom Arjuna

3544.text:
Paraveyas saha mauneyir gandharvapsarasam ganah
Ihamrigavyad mrigair davipasha cha rathapattibhih

3547.text:
Tapo vidyas tathaushadhyo nanarupambar tavisah
antarikshe maharaja vinadanto 'vatasthire

3548.text:
Brahma, accompanied by the Brahmarshis and the Parajapatis,
avasthito bhavena, approached that divine chariot

3550.text:
Hearing this, Maghava bowed down and said to his grandfather
May the whole world not be destroyed by the destruction of Karnajuna

3552.text:
Brahmeshanav atho vakyam uchatus taridaseshvaram
Vijayo dharuva evastu vijayasya mahatmanah

3554.text:
Atikramecha cha mahatmyad dishtam etasya paryayat
atikrante cha lokanaam abhavo niyato bhavet

3556.text:
Nara and Narayana are these ancient sages
they are the controllers of the uncontrolled and the tormentors of the equal

3557.text:
Karna lokaan aya mukhyaan paraptnotu purusharbhah
veero vaikartana shuro vijayas tava astu krishnayoh

3558.text:
Vasunam cha salokatvam marutam va samapnuyat
sahito darona bhishmabhya nakaloke mahiyatam

3559.text:
It was said by the gods and goddesses that the thousand-eyed Abaravid spoke
inviting all beings to be disciplined by Brahma

3560.text:
Sharutam bhavadbhir yata paroktam bhagavadbhya jagad dhitam
tat tatha nanyatha tad dhi tishtadhvam gatamanyavah

3562.text:
Eat the fragrant flowers of various forms and
the gods played the trumpets of the gods

3564.text:
The heroes of the world assembled and blew their conches separately
Vasudevas and Arjuna, the heroes Karna and Shalya, Bharatha

3565.text:
Then the timid terrifying battle took place then
like the competing heroes of Shakra and Shambara

3566.text:
Their flags, without garlands, shone in chariots
separate forms, covering their anger in battle with each other

3567.text:
Karnasyashivishanibha ratnasaravati firm
Purandara dhanuprakhya elephant kakshya vayarajat

3569.text:
Yuddhabhilashuko bhutva dhavajo gandivadhanvanah
karna dhavajam upatishtat so 'vadid abhinardyan

3571.text:
Sukinkinikabharana kalapashopamayasi
Abhyadravat susankruddha nagakakshya mahakapim

3572.text:
Ubhayor uttame yuddhe davairathe dayuta ahrute
parakurvate dhavajau yuddham pratyaheshan hayan hayah

3573.text:
Pundarikaksha shot Shalya with his eye arrows
He looked at Pundarikaksha in the same way

3574.text:
There Vasudeva conquered Shalya with the arrows of his eyes
and Dhananjaya, the son of Kunti, conquered Karna with his sight

3575.text:
Then the son of Suta said to Shalya, smiling
If Partha kills me in battle today, do it here for me
What is the answer then tell me the truth, my friend

3576.text:
[Shalya]
If Karna kills you in battle today, your white horse
I will kill both Madhava and Pandava in one chariot

3578.text:
Pated divakara sathanach chiryetanekadha kitih
shaityam agnir ian na tava karo hanyad dhananjaya

3579.text:
If you thus somehow scare the world as
I kill the ear and the surgeon in battle with both arms

3580.text:
Hearing these words of Krishna, Parahasana Kapiketana
Arjuna replied,

3581.text:
Sapataka dhavajam karna sashalya rathavajinam
sachatra kavacham chaiva sashakti sharakarmukam

3582.text:
Darshta's today arrows have cut his ear in battle in many ways
Today he has a chariot with a horse and a powerful shield and weapon
For my enmity with Krishna does not subside, for he laughed at me in the past

3583.text:
Today you see Govindakarnam unmathitam maya
varaneneva mattena pushpatam jagati ruham

3584.text:
Today you will hear those sweet words, O Madhusudana
Today you will console my mother Abhimanyu without debt
You will be delighted with Kunti and her father-in-law, O Janardana

3586.text:
[He]
that god with the hosts of serpents, demons, Siddhas; the hosts of Gandharvas, Yakshas and Apsaras
judged by Brahmarshis, Rajarshis and Suparnas; shone in the sky in a wonderful form

3587.text:
Not dancing with pleasant sounds; with musical instruments, songs, praises and dances
All men saw him in the sky; and in the sky they were in wonderful forms

3589.text:
Nanashvamatangarathayutakulam; varasi shaktyarishti nipataduhsaham
abhirujushtam hatadehasankulam; ranajiram lohitraktam abbhau

3590.text:
And in the defeat of the Astrabhratas in the other turn; Dhananjaya and Adhirathisha with arrows
Dishasha and the army with sharp ajihmaga; they bit each other equally

3594.text:
Mridangabheripanavanakasvanaira; ninadite bharata shakhanisvanaih
sasingha nadau babhatura narottamau; shashankasuryava meghasamplave

3596.text:
Ubhav ajeyav ahitantakav ubhau; jighansatus tau kritinau paraspara
mahahave vira varau samayatura; yathendra jambhava iva karna pandavau

3599.text:
Then Duryodhana, Bhojasaubala; Kripasha and Sharadvata's son,
the great warriors, struck Dhananjaya and Acyuta with arrows that killed their bodies

3602.text: With the hands of the best weapons in hand; the heads of the horses and the serpents and the chariots of the horses and the chariots of the sword-bearers; Dhananjaya destroyed the enemy

3605.text:
Athabravid Daronasutas tavatmajam; karam karena paratipidya santvayana
parasid Duryodhana shamya pandavaira; alam virodhena dhig astu vigraham

3606.text:
Hato gurur brahma samo mahastravit; tathaiva bhishma paramukha nararshabhah
I am your invincible and my maternal uncle; rule the kingdom of others with the Pandavas for a long time

3607.text:
Dhananjaya will stay with me; Janardana does not want to oppose him
Yuddhisthira is always engaged in the welfare of the beings; Vrikodara is his subject and Yama

3608.text:
You and Parthaish and each other; the others wish to attain Shiva in you
May the rest of the earthly cities be blessed; and may the soldiers cease their enmity

3611.text:
My honor is always supreme in you; I will tell you therefore your supreme and friendly
I will also stop my ears; when you will be in love

3612.text:
They say that a friend is easily wise; so is the equality and the wealth charged
There are four kinds of torment and trouble; that is all in you and the Pandavas

3613.text:
They are your brave relatives who have died; and again and in peace, end up stable
If they come to your friendship with others; surely, O king, so do you

3616.text:
Not even Karna, Guruputra, praise you; you should come up and say, Acyuta
Shamena yukto mahatadya phalgunas; tama this Karna will kill the others

3617.text:
Tama evam uktvabhyanuniya chasakrita; tavatmajah savan anushasti sainikan
samaghnatabhidravatahitan imaan; sabanashabdan kim u josham asyate

3620.text:
Blahakeneva yathabalahako; yadrchchaya va girina girir yatha
tatha dhanurjyatalanemi nisvanau; samiyatus tava ishuvarshavarshinau

3625.text:
Sanagapattyasvarathe ubhe bale; vichitravarnabharanambar sarje
chakampatush chonnamatah sama vismayad; viyad gatash charjuna karna sanyuge

3627.text:
Abhyakroshan somkasa tatra partham; varasva yahya arjuna vidhya karnam
chindhya asya moordhanam alam chirena; sharaddham ca rajyad Dhritarashtra soonoh

3629.text:
Then Karna first struck Partha there; with ten great arrows he struck him
Arjuna struck him back with sharp points; he was very angry with ten in the middle of the orbit

3632.text:
With the patience with which you have defeated all beings; give me food to the fire, Khandave,
with which patience you have killed the son of Suta; I will slay him with my club

3633.text:
Then Vasudeva also said to Partha; seeing him being defeated in his chariots
Amimrdat sarvatha te 'daya karno; hay astraira astrani kim idam kiritin

3634.text:
That hero, why are you deluded and not killed; these Kurus are roaring and delighted
They all know their ears; your weapon is being thrown down by weapons

3635.text:
By which patience you have killed the weapon of darkness; in every age the demons and demons are terrible
in the chases of pride and demon; with that patience kill your son of Suta

3636.text:
Anena vasya kashur neminadya; sanchinddhi moordhanam areh parasahya
maya nisrishtena sudarsana; vajrena shakro namucher ivareh

3638.text:
Then the earth is the belt of the sea; the towns are the villages and the prosperity
Give the king the killed hordes; and you shall obtain the fame of Partha

3640.text:
Paradushkaromya esha mahastram ugram; shivaya lokasya vadhaya sauteh
tan me anujanatu bhavan surash cha; brahma bhuvo brahma vidasha cha sarve

3643.text:
He killed Bhimasena and Janardana; he killed Kiritina and the inhuman
Taribhis Taribhis Bhimabala; he roared with a terrible voice

3645.text:
Sushena struck Shalya with one arrow; he struck Karna with four swords
then he struck him with ten well-armed arrows; he struck the husband of the assembly with a golden shield

3646.text:
Sa rajaputro vishira vibahura; vivaji suto vidhanura viketu
Then he fell from the top of the chariot, broken; he was cut like a shawl by the axes

3647.text:
Punasha cha karnam taribhira ashtabhisha cha; davabhya chaturbhira dashabhisha cha vidhva
chatu shatana daviradana sayudhiyan; hatva rathana ashta shatam jaghana
sahasram asvaansha cha punsha cha saadin; ashtau sahasrani cha patti viran

3652.text:
And Partha struck Shalya with ten spears; laughing at the other, he struck him in the body
Then he struck Karna with twelve well-shooting arrows; and after piercing him he struck him again with seven

3654.text:
Tatas taribhis ca taridashadhipopam; sharaira bibhedadhirathir Dhananjaya
Sharansa tu panca javalitan ivoragana; parveerayam asa jighansura achyute

3656.text:
Tan panca bhallais tavaritaih sumuktais; taridha taridhaikaikam athoccakarta
Dhananjayas te nayapatan prithivyam; mahayasa takshaka putra pakshas

3659.text:
sachakrarakshana atha padarakshana; purahsarana prishthagopansha cha sarvan
duryodhanenanumatana arighnana; samucchitana surathana sarabhutana

3660.text:
Dvisahasran samare savyasachi; kurupraveeran rishbhah kurunam
kshanena sarvan sarathasvasutan; ninaya rajan kashayam ekaveerah

3664.text:
That Arjuna weapon swallowed the same hero; Viyat tathakasham ananta ghosham
The angry Partha immediately created; To kill Karna in the great conflict

3665.text:
By the great glory of Ramad; by the destruction of the enemy by the Atharva Veda
that Arjuna weapon burning Vayadhamad; he killed Partha with sharp arrows

3667.text:
Then Karna struck the destroyer of enemies; well-sharpened serpent-faced, burning
terrible arrows, well-washed in restraint; Partha's purpose was hidden for a very long time

3668.text:
Sadaarchita chandanachurnashayinam; suvarnanali shayanam mahavisham
paradiptam airavata vanshasambhavam; shiro jihirsura yudhi phalgunasya

3669.text:
Tam abravin Madrarajo mahatma; vaikartana parekshya hi samhiteshum
na karna garivam ishura esha parapsyate; sanlakshya sandhatsva sharam shiroghnam

3670.text:
Then said the red-eyed with anger; Karna shalyam joined arrows tolerate others
Davi does not join the arrow shalya Karno; no one like me is worthy of deceit

3673.text:
The horses knelt on the ground in the sunken chariot
Then the arrow struck the crown of his wise man

3674.text:
Atharjunasyottamagatrabhusanam; dharaviyaddyosalileshu vishrutam
balasstra sargottama yatnamanubhih; sharena murdhna sa jahara sutajah

3675.text:
Divakarendu javalanagrahatvisham; suvarnamukta manijalabhushitam
purandarartham tapasa parayatnato; savayam kritam yad bhuvanasya soonuna

3677.text:
Harambupakhandala vittagoptribhih; pinaka pashashani sayakottamaih
surottamaira apya avishahyam arditum; parasahya nagaena jahar yad vrishah

3678.text: Then the best of the best was crushed by the poisonous fire; the brightest of the others, the brightest of the stars, the best of the crowns of Partha; the sun burning like the sun

3679.text:
Then the crown was adorned with many gems; the serpent took away from Arjuna's head by force
the mountain's well-born sprout and flowering tree; the Mahendra thunderbolt was the best peak

3681.text:
Then, wrapped in a white robe; standing with his whole head afflicted, Arjuna
shines with the brightness of the whole pepper; his head is like a rising mountain

3682.text:
Balahakah karna bhujeritas tato; hutashanarka paratimadyutir mahaan
mahoragah kritavairo 'arjuna; kiritam asady samutpapata

3683.text:
Tama said to him, Know that I have committed an offence; Krishna today killed my mother's enmity
Then Krishna said to Partha in numbers; kill your enmity to the great serpent

3684.text:
He was thus addressed by Madhusoodana; Gandhivadhanva, the fierce bowman of the enemy,
said, Who is this new serpent of mine; who came to the mouth of the eagle

3685.text:
[Krishna]
Yo 'sau tavaya khandave chitrabhanu; santarpayanena dhanurdhara
viyad gato bananikritta deho; haya anekarupo nihatasya mata

3687.text: At that moment Karna pierced the hero of men with ten stones; with sharp stones and peacock horses; Dhananjaya looked across

3691.text:
Janardana was defeated by twelve; nine and ninety arrows and Arjuna
with a terrible arrow again and Pandava; splitting Karna's ears he laughed

3692.text:
Dama asya harsham mamrshe na Pandava; bibheda marmani tato 'saya marmavit
param sharaih patribhira Indra vikramas; tatha yathendra balam ojasahanat

3694.text:
Manipravekottama vajrahatakaira; alam kritam chasya varangabhusanam
paraviddhamurvyam nipapat patribhira; Dhananjayanottama kundale 'pi cha

3697.text:
Mahadhanura mandalanishritaih shataih; kariya parayatnaprahitaira balena cha
tataksha karnam bahubhis sharottamaira; bibheda marmasva api charjunas tavaran

3699.text:
Sasvam tu karnam saratham kiriti; samachinod bharata vatsadantaih
parachhadayam asa dishasha cha banaih; sarvaprayatnat tapaniyapunkhaih

3701.text:
Arrows devoted to the body in many ways; shines the ear in battle, lord of the world
the slope of the cave covered with trees; as the Mahendra has auspicious ears

3706.text:
Evam baruvan paraskhalitasvasuto; vichalyamano arjuna shastrapataih
marmabhighatacha chalita kariyasu; punah punar dharmam agarhad ajau

3708.text:
Then Arjuna created seven, ten Tigmatejans, Ajihmgana
Indrashani-like horses, like fire

3709.text:
Breaking through they fell to the ground with terrible speed
Trembling souls and ears showed movement with strength

3710.text:
Balenath he restrained himself and raised the Brahmastra
Aindrastra and Arjuna saw it and invoked it

3711.text:
After inviting Gandhi, Jaya and Banasha, Dhananjaya
created rain of arrows like rain of Purandara

3712.text:
Then the bright arrows shot out of Partha's chariot
Paradurasana, the mighty warrior, near Karna's chariot

3713.text:
Tan karnas tava agrato 'bhayastan moghansha chakre maharathah
tato 'barvid Vrishni viras tasminn astra vinashite

3714.text:
Visrjastram param Partha Radheyo garasate sharan
Brahmastram Arjunash chapi samantryatha parayojayat

3715.text:
Having then struck Karna with arrows, Arjuna
cut off his ear with his arrows in anger with Jaya's sons

3717.text:
His victory cut the ear and the victory in the battle
not realized it was so quick that it seemed amazing

3718.text:
Astraira astrani radheya paratyahana savyasachinah
chakre chabhyaddhikam parthat savaviryam paratidarshayana

3721.text:
Let Kama take the terrible weapon and throw it at Kiritivan
Then Agarsan threw the earth wheel in the great battle of Radheya

3723.text:
Seeing the wheel fallen in the middle, by fate, this is my
Partha Kapurushachirnam abhisandhi avoid

3725.text:
Abane Bharashtakavache Bharashta Bhagnayudhe Tatha
Na Shurah Paraharantya Ajau Na Raje Parthivasa Tatha
tavam Cha Shuro 'si Kaunteya Tasmat Kasham Muhurtakam

3726.text:
As long as I lift this wheel from the earth, O Dhananjaya
You cannot kill me unprepared on the ground in a chariot
I am not afraid of Vasudeva or you, O Pandavas

3727.text:
Tavam hi kshatriya dayado mahakulavivardhana
samritva dharmaopadesam tavam muhurtam kshama pandava

3729.text:
If Daraupadi wears a single robe in the assembly; bringing you and Suyodhana and
Dushasana, Shakuni and Saubala; there is no righteousness in your ears

3730.text:
When in the assembly Kaunteya conquered Yudhisthira, who knew no axe,
who knew Shakunir, then where did you go to righteousness?

3734.text:
Her wrath caused all the rivers to shine with light
Paradurasana Maharaja it seemed wonderful

3737.text:
Varuna then Karna shamayam asa pavakam
Jimutaish cha disha sarvasha chakre timiradurdina

3738.text:
Pandavas, your unconcerned, mighty with the weapon of the wind
Apovaha then the clouds of Radheya, watching others

3739.text:
That elephant chamber and the best of arrows; gold, pearls, gems and diamonds, polished
by the effort of time, the best of craftsmen; made beautiful by the highest of the darkness

3740.text:
Energy is the constant hand of your army; Amitravitrasanam idya rupam
famous in the world like the sun; Tavisha samam pavakabhanu chandraih

3741.text:
Then with the sword the crown of the charioteer; with the sharp golden feathers that
sharia the burning flag mad; the great charioteer of the great chariot

3742.text:
Fame and righteousness and victory, O Marisha; all the fairies and that Ketu
Then the hearts of the Kurus fell; and there was a great cry of alas

3743.text:
Atha tavaran karnavadhaya pandavo; mahendravajranal dandasannibham
adatta partho 'njalikam nishangat; sahasrarashmera iva rashmim uttamam

3744.text:
Marmacha chidam shonitamansadigdham; vaishvanararka paratimam maharaham
narasvanagasu haram taryaratnim; shad vajam ajno gatimam ugravegam

3745.text:
Thousand-eyed, as bright as a sword; as unbearable as the same flesh-eater
Pinaka, like the Narayana wheel; terrible, the destroyer of the living beings

3747.text:
Tapo 'sati taptam guruvasha cha toshita; maya yad ishtam suhridam tatha sharutam
Anena satyena nihantva aya shara; sudanshitah karnam arim mamajitah

3748.text:
It was raised and she shot an arrow; Dhananjaya struck Karna with a terrible
creation like Atharva Angiraseem; he shone unbearably even with death in battle

3749.text:
Baruvan Kiriti Tama Atiprahstho; Ayam Sharo Me Vijayavaho 'satu
Jighansura Arkendusam Parabhavah; Karnam Samaptim Nayatam Yamaya

3750.text:
Teneshu varyena kiritamali; parahrishtarupo vijayavahena
jighansura arkendura samaprabhena; chakre vishaktam ripum aataayi

3753.text:
Arrows pierced in age that disfigurement; fell Karna's body high
Saravad varanam gairikatoya visravam; Girer yatha vajrahtam shiras tatha

3754.text:
But from the body of the ear that is dropped; the brightness of the sky soon penetrates
That is wonderful for all human warriors; they see, O king, in the same ear killed

3757.text:
Arrows covered all his body and flooded with blood
The body shines like the sun with all the rays of his ears

3758.text:
Having tormented the army of Amitri with bright arrows
Balinarjuna, time has brought the false ears of the sun

3761.text:
Upper up the army his enemies that easily
head of Karna's sotsedham ishu so 'paharad darutam

3764.text:
Sahasranetra paratimanakarmanah; sahasrapatra paratimananam shubham
sahasrarashmira dinasankshaya yatha; tathapatat tasya shiro vasundharama

3765.text:
[He]
Shalyas, however, struggled with Karna and Arjuna; seeing the forces crushed by his arrows,
watching Duryodhana go; he showed him the battlefield of India

3768.text:
Others were happy, frightened, and depressed; others seemed to be in mourning,
and others were yours to each other; as they were to others, so were they

3770.text: Having struggled mightily with Arjuna; the king of Madras saw him lying on the ground like a snake killed by Kesari; the chariot fled quickly in fear

3772.text:
Vishirnanagasvarathapraveeram; balam tavadiyam yama rashtrakalpam
Anyonyam asadya hatam mahadbhira; narasvanagara girikuta kalpaih

3776.text:
Avadhyakalpa nihata narendras; tavartha kama yudhi pandaveyaih
tan ma shucho bharata dishtam etat; paryaya siddhir na sadasti siddhih

3777.text:
Hearing these words of the lord of Madras; looking at all the bows with his mind
Duryodhana fainted with a dejected mind; again and again he breathed in distress

3780.text:
Vajrapaviddhaira iva chachalendraira; various stones, deer, trees and herbs
paraviddha ghantankusha tomaradhvajaih; sahem malai rudhiraughasamplutaih

3782.text:
Tathapaviddhaira gajavajiyodhaira; mandasubhisha chaiva gatasubhisha cha
narasvanagaish cha rathaish cha marditaira; mahi mahavaitaraniva durdrisha

3785.text:
Sharasa tu karnarjuna bahumukta; vidarya nagashvamanusyadehana
paranaan nirasyashu mahim atiyur; mahoraga vasam ivabhito 'satraih

3786.text:
Hatair manushyasvagajaish cha sankhye; sharavabhinnaish cha rathaira babhuva
Dhananjayasyadhirathesha cha marge; gajair agamya vasudhatidurga

3787.text:
Rathaira vareshuna mathitaisha cha yodhaih; sansyuta sutasvarayudhadhvajaih
vishirnashastraira vinikrittabandhuraira; nikrittachakraksha yugatrivenubhih

3788.text:
Vimuktayantraira nihataira ayomaira; hatanushangaira vinishanga bandhuraih
parabhagnanidaira manihemamandataih; satrita mahi dayour iva sharadaira ghanaih

3790.text:
Sahem pattas parighas parasvadhas; kadang rayo musalas pattishas
petusha cha khadga vimala vikosha; gadasha cha jambunadapatta baddhas

3791.text:
Bows are golden ornaments; arrows and golden-colored feathers
Rishtyas are yellow and pure vikoshas; parasas are swords and shine like gold

3794.text:
Manyuttama vajrasuvarnamukta; ratnani choccavachamangalani
gatrani chatyanta sukhochitani; shiransi chendu paratimananani

3796.text: Having said this, Shalyo stopped; Duryodhana, his heart overwhelmed with sorrow, wrote,

3797.text:
That son of Darona, the kings of the other faces; all comfort him and go with him
looking again and again at Arjuna; his flag is great and burning with fame

3801.text:
Gandivamuktaisa tu suvarnapunkhaih; shitaih sharaih shonitadigdha vajaih
Sharaish chitanga bhuvi bhati karno; hato 'pi san surya ivanshumali

3802.text:
Karna's body is drenched in blood; Lord Vivasvan, merciful to his devotees,
with his hands in red and red form; Sishnasura approaches the next ocean

3803.text:
Thus thinking, the hosts of the gods and sages; they go to their abode,
Thinking of this, the people dispersed; as happily as the sky and the earth

3806.text:
O king, adorned with various ornaments, with a soft golden ring,
the dead Vaikartana lies like a tree with a sprout

3807.text:
Kanakottama sankasah paradipt iva pavakah
saputrah purushavyaghrah samsanthah partha tejasa
paratapya pandavana rajan panchalansha chastratejasa

3808.text:
He who gives and does not transcend the words of the charioteers
the good always the good man is killed by the bull in the chariot of medicine

3809.text:
He whose Brahman sat all for his own sake is not a great soul
He who had nothing to give to the Brahmins was his life

3810.text:
Always the best giver of men, the best gift has gone to heaven
Taking the victory, shame and shield of your sons

3811.text:
Hate sama karne sarita na saravanti; jagam chasta kalusho divakara
garahasha cha tiryaga javalitarkavarno; yamasya putro 'bhayudaya rajana

3813.text:
Sakananah sadri chayash chakampuh; paravivyathur bhutaganash cha marish
Brihaspati rohini samprapidya; babhuva chandrarkasamavarnah

3815.text:
When Arjuna, who was shining like the moon; struck down Karna's head with his sword
Then in the sky and in the heavens again and again; There was a cry of the people,

3818.text:
The two best of men, Pandavas, crushed Keshi; they shone like fire and sun
on the battlefield, fearless; they shone like Vishnu and Vasava in the same chariot

3821.text:
The sound of the Panchajanyas and the chorus of the Devadattas
Let us give the earth and the space and fill it with the waters

3822.text: They roared with the sound of their conches; they frightened your son's army in the forests, mountains, rivers and directions; they were equal heroes, delighting Yudhisthira

3823.text:
Then the Kurus fled swiftly; hearing the sound of the conchshell,
leaving the king of Madras and his husband; Duryodhana, the Bharata of the Bharatas

3825.text:
Samachitau karna sharaih parantapava; ubhau vayabhatam samare 'chayutaarjunau
tamo nihityabhyuditau yathamalau; shashankasuryava iva rashmimalinau

3827.text:
Sadevagandharvamanushyacharanaira; maharshibhira yakshamahoragairapi
jayabhivrdhya parayabhipujitau; nihtya karna paramahave tada

3828.text:
[He]
Thus, when Karna fell down and your army fled,
Embracing Partha, Dasarha spoke these words of joy

3829.text:
Hato balabhida Vritras tavaya karna dhananjaya
vadham vai karna vritrabhya kathayishyanti manavas

3830.text:
Vritra was killed by Vajra in the same age with great splendour
but you killed Karna with sharp arrows from your bow

3834.text:
Govinda spoke these words to Dhrishtadyumna, Yudhamanyu, Vrikodara, the son of Madri
Yuyudhana

3835.text:
Stay facing the others, good luck to you
till it is reported to the king that Karna was killed by Arjuna

3836.text:
He went to the royal residence with the permission of those heroes
Taking Partha, Govinda saw Yudhisthira

3837.text:
The royal tiger lies on a golden bed
and the feet of the earth are joyfully taken

3841.text:
Fortunately Gandhivadhanva and Pandavas and Vrikodara
You are also well, O king, and the sons of Madri are the Pandavas

3842.text:
Mukta veer kshayad asmat sangramal lomaharshanat
Kshipram uttarakalani kuru karyani parthiv

3843.text:
Hato Vaikartana, the cruel Sutaputra, the mighty
Fortunately you conquer, O King, fortunately you grow, O Pandava

3844.text:
He who defeated Krishna, conquered by Dayut, is the lowest of the righteous
today the land of the son of Suta drinks his blood

3847.text:
It is not surprising, O mighty-armed one, to you, O Devakinanda
that Partha, your charioteer, will do today's manhood

3850.text:
Asakricha chapi medhavi krishna davaipayano mama
katham etam mahabaho divyam akathayat prabhuh

3851.text:
By your Krishna's other power, Dhananjaya
conquered the enemies facing him and never turned away

3852.text:
Jayash chaiva dharuvo 'samakam na tava asmaka parajaya
Yada tavam yudhi parthasya sarathyamupajagmivan

3855.text:
Agato bahu vruttantam darshtum ayodhanam tad
abhashamanasa tau veerava ubhau madhava phalgunau

3856.text:
He saw Karna lying in battle, a bull
shackled all over with arrows released from his shoulder

3857.text:
Seeing Karna killed with his son, King Yudhisthira
praised both the tigers of men, Madhava and Pandavas

3859.text:
Seeing the dead tiger of men, Radheyam, the proud one,
Dhritarashtra will be disappointed, this evil spirit
He will lose his life and his kingdom, O great charioteer

3860.text:
By your grace we are also satisfied, O bull of men
You and Gandhivadhanva are victorious, O Yadunanda
Fortunately you are victorious, Govinda, fortunately Karna has been knocked down

3863.text:
Nakula, Sahadeva, Pandava, Vrikodara
Satyakisha, O great king, the best chariot of the Vrishnis

3866.text:
Satuvanta satvayuktabhira vagbhis krishnau parantapau
jagmuh savashibirayaiva muda yukta maharathas

3867.text:
Evam esha kshaya vrtta sumahal lomaharshanah
What do you lament, O king, whose misguided mantra has not passed away

3868.text:
[Vai]
Hearing that unpleasant king, King Dhritarashtra
fell to the ground motionless, the Kauravas, extremely distressed
and the goddess Satyavratha, Gandhari, the seer of righteousness

3869.text:
Vidura took him back to King Sanjaya and
consoled him, and so both of them were landlords

3871.text:
Satyaki was struck by the king of the Kurus and was very unhappy
Asravad rudhiram bhuri savarasam chandano yatha

3872.text:
Satvatena cha banaoghaira nirviddhasa tanayas tava
shatakumbhamayapido babhau yupa ivochchritah

3874.text:
Birbhinnasha cha sharais tena davishata kshiprakarina
namrishyata rane raja shatror vijayalakshana

3876.text:
He is overpowered by your strong son with his bow
He is angry and torments your son

3877.text:
Seeing the king in distress, your sons, the great charioteers,
we covered the Satvata with a rain of arrows, and the demons easily

3879.text:
Duryodhana cha tavarito vivyadhashtabhira ashugaih
parahasansha chasya chiched karmukam ripum ishanam

3881.text:
Etasminn antara chaiva kururajam maharatham
avakiracha chharaira hrishto bahubhira marmabhedibhih

3882.text:
He, being slain in battle by the best arrows of Shaineya,
suddenly fled, O king, your son Duryodhana,
and then the chariot of Chitrasena, the bowman, jumped

3883.text:
Hahabhutam jagac chasid darshtva rajanam ahave
garasyamanaam satyakina khe somam iva rahuna

3885.text:
Shaking the best bow and the best of the horses
Bhartsayana charioteer Chogram Yahi Yahiti sa tavara

3886.text:
Seeing the darkness fall, Vayaditasyam ivantakam
Yuyudhana, the great king, said to Yantaram

3887.text:
Kritavarma rathenaisa darutam apatate shari
paratyudyahi rathenaina paravaram sarvadhanvinam

3891.text:
Chaturasha cha hayodaransha chaturbhih parameshubhih
Avidhyat sadhu dantan vai saindhavan satvatasya ha

3892.text:
Rukmadhvajo rukmaprishtham mahad vispharya karmukam
rukmangadi rukmavarma rukmapunkhan avakirat

3893.text:
Then the grandson of Shine, with his arrows, attacked Kritavarman
with speed, desiring to see Dhananjaya

3894.text:
He was overpowered by a strong enemy, the heater of the enemy
The invincible trembled like a mountain in the earthquake

3897.text:
He entered Kritavarma with an arrow like the staff of Yama
and broke through the shield of Jambunadavichitra and Bhanumat
and fell to the ground, fierce and covered with blood

3898.text:
Sanjatarudhirasha chajau satvatesubhira arditah
parachalan dhanura utsrjya nayapatta sayandanottame

3901.text:
Khadgashakti dhanuh kirnaam jagasvarathasankulaam
paravartitogra rudhiraam shatasah kshatriyarshabhaih

3905.text:
Sa sampraharasa tumulo daron satvatyor abhut
pashyatam sarvasainyanam balivas vayor iva

3907.text:
Tair lalatarpitair banair yuyudhanas tava ajihmagaih
vayarochata maharaja tarishring iva mountain

3908.text:
Then the arrows of the other Indrashani
Bharadwaja sent him to the battlefield

3909.text:
Dasarha cut off the arrows falling from the bow of Daron
with the wings of the sword with the ultimate weapon

3910.text:
Tam asya laghutam darona samavekshya visham pate
parahasya sahasavidhyad vinshatya shinipungavam

3911.text:
Again, offer five hundred arrows and a hundred
Attributing the lightness of Yuyudhana to the lightness

3913.text:
Thus hundreds and thousands of Yuyudhana created
Avakiran Darona chariot arrows blood-eating

3914.text: We did not find any difference between the lightness of the chief of the Davijas and the Satvatas, the two bulls of men who lived together

3915.text:
Satyaki then struck Darona with nine bowed arrows
and Dhavaja with sharp arrows
and the charioteer with a hundred while Bharadwaja was watching

3918.text:
Satyaki then, in anger, dropped his bow and the great charioteer
took up a great club and threw it at Bharadwaja

3919.text:
Tam apatanti suddenly pattabaddham ayasmayim
ayavaryach chharaira darano bahubhira bahurupibhih

3922.text:
Then we took the power and sent the golden staff of iron
tarsa to the chariot of Madhava

3924.text:
Then Darona, the grandson of Shine, struck Rajan with a leaf
reaching his right arm and beating him, O Bharatarshabha

3925.text:
Daron also cut off the great bow of Rajan Madhava in battle
with the half moon and the charioteer with the power of his chariot

3926.text:
Mumoh Sarathis was struck by the power of his chariot

jarasandhim atho jaghne mishatam sarvadhanvinam

4272.text:
Yo ya sama liyate darona tam tam darona 'natakapamah
Adatta sarvabhutani parapre kale yathantakah

4274.text:
Then the arrows marked with Darona, with golden feathers, were stoned
They killed men, serpents and horses from all sides in the battle

4276.text:
Then a terrible Nishtanko arose among the Pandavas
O best of the Bharatas, among the soldiers being killed by Darona

4277.text:
Bewitched by the shower of arrows in the battle of Bharadwaja
the great chariots of the Panchalas were taken by the thigh crocodile

4278.text:
Chedayasha and Maharaja Srinjayas, Somakas and
rushed to Bharadwaja in delight, eager to fight

4282.text:
Parakroshan Bhimasena te Dhrishtadyumna ratham parati
Drishtva Daronasya karmani tatharupani marisha

4283.text:
A brahmin's austerities are surely difficult and great
Thus the mighty in battle burns the bull of the Kshatriyas

4284.text:
Dharmo yuddham kshatriyasya brahmanasya parantapa
tapasvi kritavidyasha cha parekshitenapi nirdaheta

4285.text:
The bulls of the Kshatriyas who entered the Darona weapon touched the fire
They burned many difficult and terrible places in India

4286.text:
As strength, as enthusiasm, as strength, great effulgence
Mohayan all beings, Darona kills our strengths

4288.text:
He became more enraged and Darona crushed the Kshatriyas
Taking another bow and shining faster

4290.text:
He killed the Kshatriyas and went to the bottom of the earth
He fell to the bottom of the earth with a broken heart

4292.text:
He struck back Darona with ten arrows in the middle of the seventh
and four of his charioteers with four of his four horses

4295.text:
Chekitan saw the chariot and the dead charioteer fled
The Panchalas and the Pandavas were greatly afraid

4296.text:
Tan sametan rane shuransh chedipanchalsrinjayan
samantad daravayan darano bahv ashobhat marish

4297.text:
Akarnapalitah shayamo vayasashitikat parah
rane paryachard darona vrddhah shodashavarshavat

4298.text:
Atha Darona, O great king, wandering about without fear
Vajrahasta, the enemies believed him to be the destroyer of enemies

4299.text:
Then 'Abaravin Maharaja Darupada, the wise king
This greedy Kshatriya kills like a tiger kills a small deer

4300.text:
Kruchran Duryodhana lokaan apah parapsyati durmatih
Yasya lobhad vinihatah samare kshatriya bulls

4301.text:
Hundreds lie on the ground like cows and bulls cut down
Their limbs are covered with blood and made to eat corpses and jackals

4302.text:
Having thus spoken, Maharaja Darupada, the commander of the army,
pursued the Parthas in battle and rushed towards Darona

4304.text:
In the present and terrible struggle, in the thrilling
destruction of the world, India is like the end of the age

4305.text:
Daron, defeated in battle, roaring again and again
Panchales, and white men killed in the sword

4307.text:
There, looking in all directions, with the sight of Savyasachi,
Yuddhisthira saw neither Partha nor Madhava

4310.text:
Lokopakrosha bhirutvad dharmaraja mahayashah
Achintayan mahabahuh shaineyasya ratham parati

4311.text:
I have sent the rank of Phalguna in battle
Shaineya Satyaki is true and fearless to his friends

4314.text:
I will do my best to find my brother if
people will reproach me for not finding Yuyudhan

4315.text:
After searching for his brother, Dharmaraja Yudhisthira
abandons Varshneya Satyaki and Satyavikrama

4316.text:
Because of the fear of the world's exceptions, I will send Partha to Vrikodara
the position of the great Madhava

4318.text:
And I have appointed the son of Shaineya in a very heavy burden
but he is a friendly and proud and mighty
who has entered the army of Bharati like a shark in the sea

4323.text:
Ito gate bhimasene satvatam parati pandave
sa nathau bhavitarau hi yudhi satvata phalgunau

4324.text:
Kamam tava ashochaniyau tau rane satvata phalgunau
rakshitau vasudevaena savayam chastravisharadau

4325.text:
Of course I must do my duty to dispel my own sorrow
Therefore I will engage Bhima to follow in the footsteps of the Satvata
Then I think the law has been reversed against Satyaki

4328.text:
Bhimasena anuprapya paraptakalam anusmarana
kashmala paravishad raja bahu tatra samadishan

4329.text:
He who conquered the gods, the Gandharvas, the demons, the Chakaratha
I do not see the fortune of that younger brother of Bhimasena

4330.text:
Then he said to Dharmaraja Bhimasena, the Tathagata,
I have neither seen nor heard of your trouble like this

4333.text:
Tama abravid ashrupurnah krishnasarpa iva shavasana
bhimasenam idam vakyam paramlan vadano nripah

4334.text:
As the sound of the conch of the Panchajanyas begins
inspired by the enraged illustrious Vasudeva
Surely your brother Dhananjaya lies slain today

4335.text:
Surely Janardana is fighting in that defeated
whose virtuous semen the Pandavas live on

4336.text:
Yam bhayesva abhigachanti sahasraksha ivamaraah
sa shura saindhava parepsura anvayad bharati chamum

4338.text:
Vayudhorasko mahaskandho mattadviradavikramah
chakora netras tamraksho davisatam aghavardhana

4340.text:
The fire grows like a sacrificial fire, burning again and again
I don't see its luck, so I find myself in trouble

4345.text:
[Bham]
Brahmeshanendra Varuna avahad yas pura rathah
tam aasthaya gatau krishnau na tayora vidyate bhayam

4346.text:
I'm going to carry the command on my head, don't worry
I'll meet those male tigers and give you a confession

4351.text:
So 'daya yatto rane partham pariraksha yudhisthiram
etad dhi sarvakaryaanam paramam krityam ahave

4352.text:
Tam abravin maharaja Dhrishtadyumno vrikodaram
Ipsitena mahabaho gaccha Parthavicharyana

4353.text:
How can Darona not kill Dhrishtadyumna in battle and
restrain the king of Dharma in battle

4355.text:
After Kaunteya was embraced by Dharmaraja, Bharata
asmelled him and shot him in the head with auspicious blessings

4359.text:
After Bhimasena had gone, your army was eager to fight
Panchajanya Rava was again terrible, O lord of the world

4362.text:
Surely the greatest left-handed sage in his age
fights with the Kurus, holding the wheel and club of all, Lord

4366.text:
With the roar of the lion and the victory, Vikran repeatedly
showed his terrible soul to his enemies suddenly

4367.text:
Tam oohur javana danta vikurvana hayottamah
vishokenabhisanyatta manomarutaranhasah

4368.text:
Arujana Virujana Partho Jaya Vikarshansha Cha Panina
So Avakarshana Vikarshansha Cha Senagra Samalodyat

4370.text:
Tam sa sena maharaja sodarya surrounded
duhshalash chitrasenash cha kunda bhedi vivinshati

4371.text:
Durmukho dushahasha chaiva vikarnasha cha shalas tatha
vindanuvindau sumukho dirghabahu sudarsana

4372.text:
Vrindaraka Suhastasha Susheno Dirghalochan
Abhaya Raudrakarma Suvarma Durvimochan

4375.text:
They showed great weapons divine there heroes
stopping the terrible clouds with their arrows like the rising sun

4376.text:
He passed them and rushed at the Darona army
and rained down arrows on the elephant army in front of him

4379.text:
Punash chatitya vegena daronanikam upadravat
tam avarayad acharya velevodvrttam arnavam

4381.text:
He thought your teacher would worship me as
Bhima said to Vrikodara

4382.text:
Bhimasena na te shakyam parvestum arivahinim
maam anirjitya samare shatrumadhye mahabala

4385.text:
Tavarjuna nanumate brahma bandho ranajiram
paravistha sa hi durdharsah shakrasyapi vished balam

4389.text:
Athodbhramy gadam bhimah kaladandama ivantakah
daronayavasrijad rajan sa rathad avapupluve

4390.text:
Sasvasuta dhavajam yanam daronasyapothayat tada
paramrdnacha cha bahun yodhana vayura krishna ivaujasa

4392.text:
Then the mighty Karuddor Maharaja Bhimasena
rained down arrows on the army of the charioteers in front of him

4396.text:
Athanyaira nishitaira banaih sankruddhah kunda bhedinam
sushenam dirghanetra cha taribhis tarin avadhid bali

4398.text:
Abhayam raudrakarmanaam durvimochanaam eva cha
taribhis tarin avadhid bhimah punara eva sutansa tava

4400.text:
Vindanuvindau sahitau suvarmanam cha te sutam
parahasanna iva kauneya sharair ninye yamakshayam

4402.text:
So chirenaiva kalena tadrathanika ashugaih
disha sarvah samabhyasya vayadhamat panunandana

4407.text:
And with a loud noise of the floor, Bhima, the mighty
vayati, attacked the army of Darona with his chariots

4408.text:
[He]
went out of the chariot and threw the sun of darkness as
the teacher rained down arrows

4409.text:
Pibann iva sharaughans tan daron chapvaratigan
so 'bhayavartat sodaryan maya mohayan balam

4412.text:
Sendrashanir ivendra paraviddha samhatatmana
ghoshena mahata rajan purayitveva medinim
javalanti tejasa bhima tarasayam asa te sutan

4415.text:
He drove them away, Kaunteya, who was invincible in numbers
The king of birds, with the speed of Garuda, passed over the army

4417.text:
Daron, however, stopped Bhima in battle with his arrows
and suddenly made a noise that frightened the Pandavas

4421.text:
As a cow and bull receive the rain with their playfulness
so let the terrible tiger receive the rain of arrows

4423.text:
Daronas tu sa tavaro rajan kshipto bhimena sanyughe
ratham anyam samasthaya vayuha davaram upaayau

4424.text:
At that moment his driver quickly stirred the horse
Bhimasena's Kauravas it seemed wonderful

4426.text:
Sa mrdnan kshatriyan ajau vato krishnan ivoddhata
Agachchad daryan sena sindhuvego nagaan iva

4428.text:
Strike many with the sound of the floor
conquer all armies like a tiger and a bull

4429.text:
Bhojanikam atikramya kambojanam cha vahinim
tatha malechha ganas chanyan bahun yuddhavishardan

4430.text: Then Kaunteya sped away from the chariot of the bull fighting Satyaki

4431.text:
Bhimasena Maharaja Darshtukamo Dhananjaya
Atitya Samare Yodhans Tavakan Pandunandana

4432.text:
He saw Arjuna there fighting, the best of men
for he was overpowered to kill Saindhava

4433.text:
Seeing Arjuna there, he roared with great force
but Partha heard his great roar

4435.text:
Vasudevas and Arjuna heard the roar of his sword
and again and again they looked at Vrikodara

4437.text:
The king was shocked to hear the great
Dhananjaya's battle and hoped for victory

4442.text:
He who defeated Indra in battle and satisfied the sacrificial vehicle
The killer is fortunately alive in the number of the enemies, Phalguna

4443.text: The killer of the enemy, on whose arm strength we all depend, is alive, fortunately, Phalgun

4444.text:
Nivatakavacha yena devair api sudurjayah
nirjita rathinaika luckily Partha sa jivati

4445.text:
All the people, including the Kauravas, gathered for the cow grab
Fortunately Partha, who is in the city of Ajayana Matsya, is alive

4446.text:
Kalakeya thousands fourteen in the great battle
He who killed with the might of his arms, fortunately Partha is alive

4447.text: Fortunately Partha, who defeated the mighty king of the Gandharvas by Duryodhana, is alive

4448.text:
Crowned, strong, white horse, black charioteer
My fame is always alive, fortunately, Phalguna

4449.text:
Putrashokabhisantaptasha chikirshuh karma dushkaram
Jayadrathavadhanveshi paratignam kritavana hi yas
kach chit sa saindhava sankhya hanishati Dhananjaya

4450.text:
Kach chit tirnapratijnam hi vasudevana rakshitam
anastamit aditya sameshyamya aham arjunam

4451.text:
Kach chit saindhavako raja durayodhana hite rata
nandayishyatya amitrani phalgunena nipatitah

4452.text:
Kach chid Duryodhana raka falgunena nipatitam
drishtwa saindhavakam sankhye shamam asmasu dhasyati

4453.text:
Seeing his brothers killed by Bhimasena in battle
maybe Duryodhana will run a slow calm on us

4454.text:
Seeing many other warriors fallen to the ground
maybe Duryodhana will slowly repent afterwards

4455.text:
Kach chid Bhishmena no vairam ekanaiva parashamyati
Sheshasya rakshanaartha cha sandhasyati Suyodhana

4456.text:
Thus in many ways he thought of the earthly
grace of the oppressed and a terrible battle ensued

4457.text:
[Dhru]
And so what heroes surrounded that mighty Bhimasena who roared
with the thunderous roar of the clouds

4458.text:
I do not see him in the crossing worlds Sanjaya
who stands in front of the angry Bhimasena in battle

4459.text:
As in the great battle of time, when the club is rising,
I do not see, my father, who will stand on the battlefield

4461.text:
When the angry Bhimasena killed my sons
Duryodhana, who stood up for his welfare

4462.text:
Bhimasena Davagnesa tu mama putra trinolapam
paradhakshyato ranmukhe ke virah paramukhe sathitah

4463.text:
For my sons, who were killed by Bhima, were seen in battle
All the others surrounded Bhima in time

4465.text:
[He]
And as he roared, Bhimasena, the great chariot,
was attacked by a tumultuous sound, and the ears of the mighty man

4466.text:
The bow of the young man is very strong
but the ears of the battle will show the strength of the strong

4467.text:
Paravepanna iva gatrani karna bhima samagame
rathinam sadinam chaiva tayoh sharuva talasvanam

4469.text:
Again with a terrible roar the bows of the great Pandavas
all the warriors fell in battle

4471.text:
Paradurasana nimittani ghorani ca bahuni ca
tasminsa tu tumule rajan bhimakarna samagame

4472.text:
Then Karna struck Bhima with twenty arrows
and struck his quick thread with five deer spears

4473.text:
The next day, Bhimasena, however, turned his ear back in battle
with sixty-four arrows, the mighty Kashiprakari

4476.text:
The great charioteer cut the bow in the fist of Karna
and struck him with many arrows with bowed ends

4479.text:
Taih karno 'bharajat sharair uro madhyagatais tada
mahidhar ivodagrasa tarishrngo bharatarshabha

4481.text:
Somewhat distracted, Karna was struck by a good blow
He made a bow and struck Bhima
and threw again hundreds and then thousands of arrows

4482.text:
He was suddenly covered by the ear of a strong bow
The bow cut the sky quickly, smiling Pandu Nandan

4486.text:
Yuddhisthira was overjoyed to hear his roar
and thought that Karna had been defeated by Bhimasena, O Bharatha

4488.text: The roar of Bhima's roar was heard, O Maharaja, in all the armies of India

4489.text:
Then let us fight with weapons separately against the enemy
softly formerly Radhey and strongly formerly Pandavas

4491.text:
That chariot, equipped with the speed of your son
quickly attacked the valley with the speed of the wind of the mind

4492.text: Arjuna, Bhimasena and Satyakisha, defeated by the bow, said to him,

4494.text:
If so far Partha, the great charioteer, has been defeated in battle
how can you be defeated by Satyaki and Bhima, honorable

4495.text:
It is wonderful in this world to be exploited like the sea
by your foremost brahmin Satvata and Arjuna

4498.text:
In this case, write down what you have defined
Whatever has gone, think of the rest here, honorable

4501.text:
I think that is the highest level where Krishna and Dhananjaya
that Indian army was captured in front and behind

4502.text:
There I think the duty is to protect the Saindhavas
He will protect us, my father, from the wrath of Dhananjaya, afraid of him

4503.text:
Gatau hi saindhavam virau yuyudhana vrikodarau
sampraptam tad idam dayutam yata tach chhakuni buddhijam

4504.text:
No victory in the assembly, no defeat there
Here we are, my father, victorious today

4505.text:
Yan sama tan galhate ghoran shakunih kurusansadi
akshan sammanyamanah sa paraka sharas te durasadah

4506.text:
Where they are many, my father, the Kurus are situated
Know the army to be strong, O lord of the worlds with arrows and axes

4507.text:
Galham and Saindhavam, O king, there is no certainty of gambling here
For in Saindhavam great gambling is attached to others

4509.text:
Where those supreme archers who protect the sea
go there quickly and protect the guards

4510.text:
Here I will bless you, I will send others
I will destroy the Panchalas with the Pandusrinjayas

4512.text:
The Chakrarakshas, however, the Panchali and Yudhamanyuttamaujas
approached the army from the outside and went to Savyasachina

4513.text:
They were formerly, O great king, forbidden by Kritavarman
when they entered your Arjuna, O king, desiring to fight your army

4514.text:
Duryodhana went with them to fight the best
They were fighting against the two brothers, Bharata Bali

4515.text:
Tava abhidravatam enam ubhava udyatakarmukau
maharathasamakhyatau kshatriya paravarau yudhi

4518.text:
Utamauja hatasvasa tu hatsutas cha sanyughe
Aruroha ratham bharatur yudhamanyora abhitvaran

4520.text:
As the horses fell, he cut him with the supreme arrow
Yudhamanyu's bow and quick arrows in battle

4521.text:
O son of the slain horse, the great charioteer jumped down from his chariot
took the mace and ran towards Panchalya, your son

4522.text:
Tam apatantam samprekshya karuddham parapuranjayam
avaplutau rathopasthad yudhamanyuttamaujasau

4526.text:
[Dhr]
The two mighty men Karna and Bhima fought
What kind of battle was that at the end of Arjuna's chariot

4527.text:
Formerly Karna was defeated by Bhimasena in battle
How much more is Radheya, the great charioteer who came to Bhimasena

4528.text:
How can Bhima or Suta give his son back in battle
The chariot called the greatest chariot on earth

4529.text:
Yudhisthira, the son of Dharma, overtook Bhishma and Drona
No other fear was given to him without Karna, the bow-bearer

4530.text:
Fear does not lie constantly thinking of the great chariot
How did Bhima fight the son of Suta in battle

4531.text:
Brahmanyam viryasampannam samareshu anivartinam
Katham karnam yudham shareshtaham bhima 'yudhyata sanyughe

4532.text:
The two heroes who met Arjuna's chariot
How could they fight, O son of Suta, Vrikodara

4533.text:
Remembering the words of Kunti, who had shown her brotherhood before and was hateful to her mother-in-law
How she fought with Bhima

4534.text:
Bhima or Sutaputra fought enmity in the past
How did he fight the hero in battle with Karna

4535.text:
I hope that you and always Suta's son Duryodhana will win my
arms in battle with the Pandavas

4536.text:
Jayasha where in my battle with the slow son
how did he fight Bhimasena, the son of Bhimakarma

4537.text:
Whom my sons have taken refuge in, the great chariots,
how did the horse of Bhima fight that son of Suta, my father

4538.text:
Anekan viprakaraans cha sutaputra samudbhavan
samaramanah katham bhima yuyudhe suta soonuna

4539.text:
He who conquered the whole earth with one chariot, the mighty
how did he fight the son of Suta in battle, the terrible horse

4540.text: How did Bhima fight the son of Suta in battle, who was born with earrings and armor

4541.text:
As your battle was fought and your fame was victorious,
tell me the truth, you are well, Sanjay

4543.text:
Radhey rushed at him as he passed by and showered him with heron leaves
Maharaja Megho rained on the mountain

4544.text:
Phullata pankajenava vaktrenabhyutsmayana bali
Ajuhava rane yantam bhimam adhirathis tada

4545.text:
Bhimasena then called Karna and did not hear the battle
covering half the circle and fighting the son of Suta

4546.text:
Avakragamibhira banaira abhyavarshana mahayasaih
davairathe dansitam yattam sarvashastrabhratam varam

4550.text:
Sa yatha vana maharaja vidya vai supoojitah
Acharyavan maheshvasa karna paryachard rane

4552.text:
Tan did not tolerate Kaunteya in the same battle of Karna
when the heroes were fighting and watching all around

4560.text:
Sa karna chapprabhavan ishun aashivishonpaman
bibhrad bhima maharaja na jagam vayatham rane

4561.text:
Then with thirty-two sharp spears
Bhimasena struck Karna in battle

4562.text:
Ayatnenaiva tam karna sharaira up samakirata
bhimasena mahabahum saindhavasya vadhaishina

4563.text:
Softly and before Radhey fought against Bhima
before anger and remembering Bhima's former enmity

4564.text:
That Bhimasena could not bear the insult, the unruly
He quickly rained down arrows on him, Amitrajit

4565.text:
Those arrows sent by Rajan Bhimasena in battle
fell from all sides like frightening birds chirping

4568.text:
His tone was cut off by the thunderbolt-like arrows of the warrior
with many spears, the unreachable wolf

4569.text:
Again we covered him with a rain of arrows, O Bharatha
 Karna Vaikartana, the great charioteer of Bhimasena in battle

4571.text:
The golden-winged stone messenger, the ear bow-dropped arrows
hold the hero in battle, like the sun with its rays

4573.text:
Then Bhima, O great king, could not bear the story of Karna in battle
The great archer opened his eyes in anger

4574.text:
He gave Karna twenty-five arrows
white as the earth with hidden feet and poisonous arrows

4575.text:
Bhima again struck him with six and eight
Crush the immortal mighty son of Suta in the great battle

4582.text:
Seeing the angry Adhirathi, your sons, lord of the worlds,
Amanyant Bhimasena, offered in the mouth of Vaivasvata

4583.text:
Making the sound of the bow loud and the sound of the floor frightening
Radhey turned towards Bhimasena's chariot

4586.text:
The two great chariots, with red eyes and angry breaths,
reached each other in battle and struck the enemy

4589.text:
And the saffron jewels of the nations have been plundered by your sons
and you have constantly caused trouble with your son

4590.text:
Dagdhum aichchash cha yata Kunti saputram tavam anagasam
Krishnayasha cha pariklesham sabhamadhye duratmabhih

4592.text:
In front of you, O Kauravas, what they said, do it,
your daughters, who want to enjoy Krishna with pleasure

4593.text:
Yach chapi tan paravrajato krishnajinivasinah
parushany uktavan karna sabhayam sannidhau tava

4594.text:
Trini krityacha yata parthansa tava putro vavalga ha
vishamsthana samastho hi samrambhad gatachetasah

4595.text:
Thinking of those sufferings of Charighnas, the servant of others from childhood,
the righteous Vrikodara disappeared alive

4596.text:
Then, expanding the great golden back, the difficult
bow of the tiger of Bharata, the devoted soul, attacked Karna

4599.text:
Maharatho mahabahura mahavegaira mahabalah
vivyadhadhirathira bhima with nine sharp arrows

4601.text:
The darkness attacked the fierce Pandava bull with speed
Karna fought against him like a drunken demon

4605.text:
Rishya varna hayan karkair mixed marutaranhasah
niriksha tava putranam hahakritam abhuda balam

4608.text:
Yama rashthopam ghoram asid ayodhanam tayoh
durdarsham bharatashrestha paretarajapuram yatha

4610.text:
They watched the conflict between the approaching great weapons
Your ill-advised king, lord of the world with his son

4613.text:
Suvarnavikritan banana paramunchantava arindamau
bhasvaram vayom chakrate vahnya ulkabhira iva parabho

4614.text:
They were dressed in pearl-like pearls
rows of autumn drunken cranes in the sky

4615.text:
Seeing me attached to the son of Suta, Bhima, Arindam,
Atibharam, Bhima, Krishna and Dhananjaya

4616.text:
There the charioteers were struck hard by the terrible arrows
The horsemen and elephants fell over the arrowhead

4619.text:
[Dhr]
I think Bhimasena's feat is very wonderful
That Karna fought was a small feat in battle

4620.text:
Taridashan api chodyuktan sarvashastradharan yudhi
varayed yo rane karnah sa yakshasuramanavan

4622.text:
How did the battle again take place between the two of them,
I think it was a victory or a victory

4623.text:
Karnam parapya rane suta my son Suyodhana

4624.text:
Hearing of my defeated deeds once by Bhimakarma
Bhimasena in battle, I felt deluded

4625.text:
I think the Kauravas are destroyed by the misdeeds of my son
For Karna, the great archer, will not conquer Partha, Sanjaya

4626.text:
The battles which Karna fought with the sons of Pandu
Everywhere the Pandavas defeated Karna in battle

4627.text:
The Pandavas are invincible, my father, even by the gods and by the Vasavas

4631.text:
Peaceful desire is always Partha's long-sighted Yudhisthira
rejected by my sons who thought he was incapable

4632.text:
Those sufferings and many other parts of the brahmins all over
heart, the mighty-armed Bhima fought Sutajam

4633.text:
Therefore, O Sanjaya, tell me that Karna and Bhima should not fight in battle

4634.text:
[He]
Hear, O king, the story of the battle between Karna and Bhima
They killed each other like elephants in the forest of Parepswor

4636.text:
Mahavegai parasannagrai shatakumbhapariktai
Ahanad bhratareha bhma vaikartana sharai

4637.text:
The bow of his mouth struck Bhima with sharp swords

4638.text:
He, the bull Vaikartana, desiring to kill Bhimasena,

4641.text:
Tam karna bhujanirmukta arkavaisvanara parabhama

4642.text:
Cut off the power and then Bhima released the snake

4643.text:
Parahino nav samrabdhah sharan barhinavasasah
savarnapunkhan shila dhautan yamadandopamana mridhe

4645.text:
They were cut by the sons of Pandu with nine bowed arrows
The nine kings who were freed by Vasu Shena
Bhima Maharaja roared like a lion

4647.text:
They were looking at each other
They were looking at each other like great bulls in a herd

4650.text:
They laughed at each other and rebuked each other again and again

4651.text:
His Bhima again cut the bow in his fists and killed

4656.text:
Bhimasena, too, enraged, brought Sasvayantaram to the abode of Yama with his

4657.text:
Savalankritam kshitau kshunna cheshtamana yathoragam

4660.text:
[He]
That Karna, thus deprived of his chariot, was again defeated by Bhima
He mounted another chariot and immediately struck the Pandavas

4662.text:
Then Karna struck Bhima with a barrage of arrows
The sound of the forceful sound struck the thief again

4665.text:
Then Partha struck back with sixty-three arrows

4666.text:
So 'atividdho maharaja pandavena yashasvina

4667.text:
Then the arrow, O Maharaja, covered all bodies

4669.text:
Sarvashaikyam chatushkiskum gurvim rukmangadam gadam

4670.text:
She killed the good horses of the charioteer and the good horsemen

4673.text:
There I saw the wonderful prowess of Radheya

4674.text:
Seeing him without a chariot, the best of chariots, the charioteer fought
Duryodhana then, O king, did not speak to the evil-faced

Then the darkness itself, the charioteer of the chariot, killed the evil-faced

Tasminsa tu vivare rajan narachan gardhravasasah

They pierced his shield and the mighty men with golden feathers

He was pierced in battle by terrible arrows that pierced the heart

4692.text:
Sa vihvalo maharaja karno bhimabalardita

4694.text:
[Dhru]
I think that destiny is the supreme, but manhood is meaningless

4695.text:
Karna, Partha, he dares to conquer Govinda in battle

4696.text:
Karna is a strong and brave man with a strong bow and a conqueror of fatigue
This is what Duryodhana, the slow charioteer, told me in the past

4697.text:
Vasu shena sahaaya ma nalam devapi sanyuge

4698.text:
There, seeing him defeated, like a snake, he was uneven

4699.text:
I am a bad-faced man, unskilled in warfare

4700.text:
Ashwatthama, the king of Madras, Kripa and Karnasha, together,

Why will the cruel Yama, who is angry at the end of time, be angry with the

4704.text:
He who conquered Karna in battle like Purandara
 is not the son of Pandu who can be conquered by anyone in battle

4705.text:
Daronam yas sampramathyaikah paravistho mama vahinim

4706.text:
Who dares to stand with Sanjaya Bhima

4707.text:
Even if a man returns after reaching the city of the dead,

4709.text:
When then in the assembly Bhima took refuge in the murder of my son

4710.text:
Tan Nunam Abhisanchintya Drishtva Karna Cha Nirjitam

4711.text:
Yasha and Sanjaya, the foolish, said to the committee again and again

4713.text:
Seeing his brothers killed in battle and bitten by Bhimasena

4715.text:
Even if a human being is freed in the middle of the Vadavamukha
I don't think he will be freed when he reaches the Bhima Mukha

4717.text:
[S]
What do you regret, O Kauravas, in the present destruction of the people

4719.text:
Svayam pitwa maharaja kalakutam sudurjaram

Because you are insulting the warriors fighting as strongly as possible

Durmarshano duhsahasha cha durmado durdhara jayah

Agachchatas tan sahasa kumaran devarupinah

4725.text:
Seeing you, your son approached Bhimasena
Radhey approached Bhimasena, the mighty warrior

4728.text:
Then with twenty-five arrows, Rajan Nararshabhan

4729.text:
Parapatana sayandanebhyas te sardha sutaira gatasavah

There I saw the wonderful prowess of Bhimasena

4731.text:
He was being stopped by Bhima with sharp arrows all around

4734.text:
Agah kritam ivatmana mene chadhirathis tad

Brikodara, Partha, could not tolerate the ridicule

Again he struck him with sharp arrows and five quick ones

4738.text:
Athanyad dhanura adaya karno bharata duramanah

His Bhima killed the horse and struck down the charioteer

The bull shot his bow with arrows

4741.text:
Avarohad rathata tasmad atha karno maharathah

4743.text:
Then the Pandavas, who were shooting thousands of arrows, were
Sutaputra, the mighty warrior, desiring to kill

4744.text:
Tan ishun ishubhih karno varayitva mahamridhe
kavacham bhimasenasya patayam asa sayakaih

4746.text:
Then Bhima, the great king, with nine bowed wings

4747.text:
They pierced his armor and his right arm
and struck the ground like serpents with sharp ants

4749.text: Then, O king, your daughters, hearing the harsh words of their brother, attacked the Pandavas in battle, throwing sharp arrows at them

4750.text:
Chitropachitrash Chitraksha Charu Chitra Sharasana

4751.text:
Agachchatas tan suddenly Bhima Rajan Maharathah
Sashwasuta Dhavajana Yattan Patayaam Asa Sanyuge

4755.text:
Six thirty-six then with sharp spears and sharp-edged sword

4762.text:
He threw his bow with his hands and arms
He shone terribly in battle He was like lightning in the clouds

4763.text:
Sa chapghoshastanitah sharadharambudo mahaan

Then with a thousand arrows released from his bow, Bharata
Pandavas struck Karna with rains like a cloud of 'darim

He fought the illustrious Partha and Kesava in the battle of Nandayana,

4768.text:
[He]
Bhimasena's Radhey, hearing the sound of Jayatala

Apakramya sa bhimasya muhurta sharagocharat

Bhimasena killed Vimana and he was sad

The best of the Bharatas spread out like rays of the sun

4773.text:
The ears of the bow fell, the pictures of the arrows of the peacock clothes

Arrows fell from the ear bow and then

Chapadhvajopaskarebhyash chtrad isha mukhad yugat

Kham Purayan Mahavegan Khagaman Khag Vasasah

Tama antakam ivayastama apatantam vhikodarah

Bhurishravah Kripa Daraunira Madraraja Jayadratha

The king and the princes and the brothers in particular

In the past, arrows dropped from the bow of Bhim struck Radheya

Then Kauneya pressed the bow with his left

4792.text:
Remembering your
Bhimasena Maharaja's former enmity

The arrows thrown by Bhimasena tore the Bharatha Bharatas

4799.text:
He ravas that brave righteous king of India
telling as if that battle and victory of his own great

Hearing that loud roar of Bhimasena's bow

Abhyayacha chaiva samare daronam astrabhratam varam

4806.text:
On the other side, in the presence of the sons of Pandu and of you, lord of the world

4807.text:
The destroyed Pandavas went to eternal hell in Krishna

4808.text:
Yah sama tam paurushanya ahuh sabham anayya daraupadim

4809.text:
That Bhimasena, who has been stirring the fire of anger for twelve years,

The Lord saw the sons of his sons and other great warriors

For your sake, O horse, I saw Varuthi burning

What is gone is gone, and it is in my mind

4815.text:
How is it possible for me to remove this corrupt circle of yours
Tell me the body of the heroes, I am a stable being, Sanjaya

4816.text:
[S]
Karna and Bhima, O great king, were defeated in the great battle

4817.text:
Arrows named Bhima, with golden feathers, stoned

Bhimchapachyutaira banais tava sainaam arindam

With the elephants fallen, O king, with the horses and men

They were killed in battle by arrows falling from the terrible bow

They were the greatest of the arrows, and the horses and chariots of the dead

4827.text:
Then the river returned in a terrible battle

4828.text:
The blood of the elephants, horses and humans

Sanukarsha patakaish cha davipashwarathabhusanaih

Kanakangada keyuraih kundalair manibhih shubhaih

Vastraish chatraish cha vidhvastaish chamara vayajanaira api

Tais taish cha vividhair bhavais tatra tatra vasundhara

4840.text:
Slain by the son of Suta, O great king, Pandavas

He struck Karna with a yellow earring and a sharp
piercing in battle, O King, Bhimasena with a bird's ear

Sakundalam maha takrnaat karnasyapatayad bhuvi

4844.text:
Puna asya tavaran bhima narachan dasha bharata

4846.text:
Lalatasthais tu taira banaih sutaputro vayarochat

4848.text:
Tasmai karna shatam ishunam gardhravasasam

4849.text:
Then Pandavas rained down fierce arrows

4851.text:
They rained down on each other like clouds

4852.text:
Arrows and nets of various kinds covered them in battle
They were angry with each other in battle

4855.text:
Seeing and destroying the strength of the Saindhavas with Sauvira
He shielded the earth covered with white weapons and the fallen

4858.text:
Then the angry arrow struck the son of the thread
The midday sun shone like the autumn sun

4859.text:
Marichivikachasyeva rajan bhanumato vapuh
asid adhirathera ghoram vapuh sharashatarchisah

4860.text:
They saw no difference in the battle between pulling and releasing the chashugan

4861.text:
Agnichakropam ghoram mandalikritam aayudham
karnasyaasina maharaja savyadakshinam asyato

4863.text:
Then the bridegroom saw many golden-feathered arrows with bowed tips

4865.text:
Gardhrapatraj shila dhautan kartasvaravibhushitan
