4868.text:
Chapad adhirather mukta parapatanta sama sayaka
Eko dirgha iva paranshu parabhavana drishya sharah

4869.text:
The clouds covered the mountain with streams of water
The angry ears covered the terrible with a shower of arrows

4871.text:
That sea-like rain of arrows rose up
without thinking of it, but Bhima, angry, attacked Karna

4872.text:
The golden back of the great bow of Bhima was the lord of the world
The attraction was like the bow of Indra
Therefore the arrows filled the seat of the others like the sky

4873.text:
Suvarnapunkhair bhimena sayakair nataparvabhih
gagane rachita mala kanchaniva vayarajat

4875.text:
Karna's arrows flooded Bhimasena's arms
Agnisphuling sansparshair anjo gatibhir ahave

4878.text:
Tasmai karnah shatan banana karmar parimarjita

4879.text:
Tan antarikshe vishikhair taridhaikaikam ashatayat

4880.text:
Again the Pandavas created fierce rains of arrows
The impatient, strong, angry, burning like fire

4881.text:
He took them and Karna took all his weapons
Fighting the son of Pandu, the son of Suta, with the magic of Satramaya

4884.text:
Smiling as if to eat Bhima's angry black fire
cut the flag and Radhey dropped the light of sin

4886.text:
That Adhirathir Aista cut off the power of the gold-plated
falling Maholkabha with ten arrows

4887.text:
Sapatad dashadha rajana nikritta karna sayakaih

4889.text:
Sa vicharma maharaja virathah karodhamurchitah

4890.text:
Sadhanuh sutaputrasya chitva jayam cha susanshita
patad bhuvi nistrinshasha chayutah sarpa ivambarat

4891.text:
Then the other laughing charioteer took another bow
Satrughna, angry in battle, stronger and faster

4895.text:
Then all his Kurus worshiped Charanash
If he came from his chariot to kill Karna like Tarkshya

4897.text:
Then Radheyas killed him and attacked him
enraged Pandavas who were ready to fight in battle

4898.text:
The two mighty men, competing in the great arena together,
roared in the sky like clouds at the end of the summer

4899.text:
There was a battle between the fierce and the lions
unbearable in numbers like the gods and demons

4901.text:
After reaching the best of the elephants and entering the chariot fortress,
Pandavas, desiring to survive, did not defeat Radheya

4902.text:
Vayavasthanam athakankshanam Dhananjaya sharaira hatam
Udyamya kunjaram parthasa tasthau parapuranjaya

4903.text:
Tam asya vishikhaih karno vayadhamat kunjaram punah
Hastyanganya atha karnaya parahinot pandavo nadan

4904.text:
The wheels of the horses and chariots he saw on the ground
Then the angry Pandavas took them and threw them at Karna

4905.text:
Then he cut off all his thrown thrown sharp arrows
The weapon of youth did not kill him, but Karna, Kunti's words, Samaran

4906.text:
She ran towards your ears with the tip of her bow and touched it
Radhey, as if smiling, said to Bhimasena

4907.text:
Again and again Tubarak foolish audariketi cha
Akritastraka ma yotsir bala sangramkatar

4909.text:
Munir bhutvatha va bhima phalan yad dhi sudurmate
vanaya varaja kaunteya na tavam yuddhavishardah

4910.text:
You are eating fruits and vegetables and eating guests
I don't think your weapons are worthy, Vrikodara

4912.text:
What war, what sagehood, go to the forest, Vrikodara
You are not worthy of war, my father, be fond of exile

4913.text:
Sudan servants and slaves in your house are very
worthy of being beaten by the wrath of the wolf for food

4914.text:
The unpleasant things that were near in his youth, O lord of the worlds,

4916.text:
Fighting Aviation where not fighting but people like me
There are these and other things that are fighting like me

4917.text:
Go or where the two blacks will protect you in battle
Go home, Kauney, what are you fighting for, boy

4922.text:
Sa chinnadhanva bhimena dhananjaya sharahata
karno bhimad apayasid rathena mahata darutam

4923.text: Bhima, the bull of men, also mounted the chariot of Satyakara and followed his brother Pandavas in battle with his left arm

4925.text:
He was like Garuda in the sky, praying for others, the best of serpents
The arrows fell on his ears, and he was quickly struck by Gandhi

4927.text:
Then Arjuna, in anger, struck Darauni with sixty-four spears
and said,

4929.text:
Then, with the sound of the golden-backed bows whistling in battle
the sound of the Gandhis, Kauneya became afraid of the mighty

4930.text:
Dhananjaya attacked Darauni behind him as he went
not too long as if he were flying with arrows, threatening the force

4931.text:
Vidarya dehan narachaira naravaranavajinam
kankabarhina vasobhira balam vayadhamad arjunah

4932.text:
That force, O best of Bharatas, that horse-like human
pakashasanir iron, Partha struck down

4933.text:
[Dhr]
Every day my bright fame falls Sanjay
I think it is the end of time that I have killed many warriors

4934.text:
Dhananjaya, however, was enraged and entered my force
protected by Darona and Karna, impenetrable even by the gods

4935.text:
They both energized and fed their might
with Krishna and Bhima and the bull named Shini

4936.text:
Then, O servant, do not burn with sorrow like fire

4938.text:
And I see by inference that there is no Sanjay Saindhav
The battle is that as it happened tan tell me when I ask

4940.text:
Tell that Vrishni hero the battle as it is
for Dhananjaya because you are his skilled horse, Sanjaya

4942.text:
Nadan as the thunderbolt at the end of the heat; Javalan as the water at the end of the sun
Strike the enemies with a firm bow; shake the army of your son

4943.text:
That goes on horses with silver lights; The heroic warrior in Ayodhya
cannot be stopped by yours; All the chariots of Bharata are the foremost of the Madhavas

4944.text:
Amarshapurnasa tava anivrutta yodhi; sharasani kanchanvarma dhaari
Alambusah satyakim madhavagryam; avaryad rajavaro 'bhipatya

4945.text:
There was a struggle in India; the Tathagata did not become anyone
They looked at the two beautiful ones; the warriors and all the others

4946.text:
Avidyad enam dashabhih prishatkaira; Alambuso rajavarah parasahya
anagatan eva tu tan prishatkansha; chiched banaih shinipungavo 'pi

4948.text:
Taih kayam asyagni anilprabhavaira; vidarya banaira aparaira javaladbhih
Ajaghnivansa tan rajataprakashan; asvansha chaturbhisha chaturah parasahya

4950.text:
Then he cut off the head of this thread; with a spear like the fire of time
with earrings like the full moon; he cut off his bright face from his body

4954.text:
Athatmajas te sahitabhipetura; anye cha yodhas tavaritas tavadiyah
kritwa mukham bharata yodhamukhya; dushasanam tavatsutam azamidha

4956.text:
Nivarya tans turnam amitraghati; napta shineh patribhira agnikalpaih
dushasanasyapi jaghan vahan; udyamya banasanam azamidh

4957.text:
[He]
that raised the mighty-armed chariot of Dushasana against
the chariot of Dhananjaya, the benefactor of the Tavaraniyas

4958.text:
The great archers of the swimmers, with golden distorted flags,
the army surrounded the sea, Anartha

4959.text:
Athaina rathavanshena sarvata sannivarya te
avakirana sharavrataih karudhah paramadhanvina

4960.text:
Ajayad rajaputras tan yatamanaan maharane
Ekah panchasatam shatruun satyaki satyavikramah

4961.text:
Samprapya bharatimadhyam talaghoshasamakulam
asi shaktigada puranam aplavam salilam yatha

4962.text:
There I saw the wonderful character of Shaineya in battle
I saw him in the west direction and saw him in the west lightly

4963.text:
Udichim dakshinam parachim parachim parasritas tatha
nrityanna ivacharach chhuro yatha rathashatam tatha

4966.text:
Tan nayavaryad aistan muhurtama iva satyaki
tatha kalingaira yuyudhe so 'chintyabalavikramah

4967.text:
And that army was overcome by the Kalingas
Then Partha worshiped the mighty-armed Dhananjaya

4972.text:
This is Darona and Bhoja, Kritavarman and
Kadarthi, Satyaki, who approaches Phalguna with the sword of Krityavishika

4973.text:
Dharmaraja Pariyanveshi hatva yodhana varan varan
Shurash chaiva kritastrasha cha falgunabhyeti satyaki

4974.text:
Having done a very difficult deed in the midst of the army, the mighty
Satyaki went to the Pandavas seeking your sight

4975.text:
Bahun ekathenajau yodhayitva maharathana
Acharya paramukhan Partha ayatya esha hi Satyaki

4976.text:
Satyaki, relying on all his arms and tearing apart Varuthi,
sent by the son of righteousness, Partha, said,

4977.text:
He who has never had a warrior equal to the Kauravas
he comes, O Kaunteya, Satyaki, the true hero

4980.text:
This Satyaki, having defeated Duryodhana and killed him in battle with his brothers
and Jalasandh, comes quickly

4983.text:
I do not know the story of the king of righteousness, Keshav
without Satvata, whether he is alive or not

4986.text:
That heavier burden is placed on me by the Saindhavan
I must know that my king is to be protected and that Satyaki is to be protected

4987.text:
Jayadratha is to be killed and the sun is hanging
And this is the mighty-armed and short-lived present

4988.text:
The tired horseman and his horseman, Madhava
not the heavy-hearted arrow, he is the helper, O Keshav

4989.text:
Apidani bhaved asya kshemam asmin samagame
kach chin na sagara crossing Satyaki Satyavikrama
goshpadam parapya sideta mahaujah shinipungavah

4990.text:
Even the greatest of the Kauravas, armed with weapons,
meet with great fame and become Satyakira

4991.text:
I consider this to be the transgression of the king of righteousness, Keshav
Acharya, who sends Satyakim out of fear

4994.text:
Tam abravin mahabahuh kauravyah shinipungavam
Adya parapto 'si dishtya me chakshurvishayam iti uta

4995.text:
I will fulfill my long-cherished desire today in battle
You will not save me life if you do not fight for battle

4996.text:
Today I shall kill you in battle, the ever-heroic
delight of Dasarha, the king of the Kurus, Suyodhana

5001.text:
Today I will give you a very terrible battle, Satvata
Then you will know in truth my strength and courage

5002.text:
Adya samyamani yata maya tavam nihato rane
Yatha ramanujenajau ravanira lakshmanena vai

5003.text:
Today, when Krishna and Partha and Dharmaraja and Madhava
are killed, they will undoubtedly leave the battle without enthusiasm for you

5005.text:
You will not be saved, O Madhava, if you have attained the object of your eyes
you have attained the object of a lion as a small deer

5007.text:
He who kills me in battle who makes me unarmed
Samasa tu shasvatir hanyad who kills me in battle

5008.text:
What do you do with many deeds of falsehood
The thunder of an autumn cloud is useless for you

5009.text:
Shearing this thunderous heroic laughter is born to me
The long-desired battle in the world is now over, O Kauravas

5010.text:
It is quick in my mind, my father, to fight you
I will not kill you today, you vile man

5011.text:
They then attacked each other with words
Jighansu paramakrudhava abhijaghnatura ahave

5013.text:
Frightening arrows and Satyakisha rained down on Arindam
Arrows rained terrible clouds like each other

5015.text: Sumadattir, having pierced Satyaki with ten, fired sharp arrows to kill Shinipungavam

5016.text:
Tan asya arrows sharp in space, lord of the worlds
Apraptan astramayabhira agrasat satyakih parabho

5017.text:
Let them rain down separate arrows on each other
Make them heroes of the best descendants and hand them Vrishni fame

5018.text:
They were like tigers with nails, like great islands with teeth
they cut each other with the power of blood
they cut each other with the power of chariots and with arrows

5020.text:
Evam uttamakarmanau kuru vrishniyashah karau
parasparam ayudheyatam iva varanava yuthapau

5022.text:
Satyaki and Saumadattisha showered each other with arrows
as if they were happy, the Dhritarashtra's looked on with fear

5024.text:
Let us kill each other's horses and break our bows
without chariots and fight with swords in the great battle

5025.text:
They took the other in the leather picture of the bull and made the bow and arrows of the vast and auspicious
Vikosha and they wandered in battle

5026.text:
They walked in various paths and circles in parts
muhura and killed each other in anger and crushed each other's enemies

5027.text:
Those swords and picturesque shields, those ornaments of coinage
They, O king, who were ready for battle, did not attract each other

5030.text:
Vayudhoraskau dirghabhujau niyudh kushalava ubhau
arms together like iron bars

5031.text:
Tyor asana bhujagata nigrahapragrahau tatha
shiksha balasamudbhutah sarvayodhapraharsanah

5033.text:
Maharshabhau
yuyudhate mahatmanau kuru satvata pungavau

5034.text:
While the Satvata was fighting with a thin weapon; then Vasudeva said to Arjuna
See him fighting without a chariot; Ketu of all archers in battle

5035.text:
Paravistho bharati sena tava pandava prishtha
yodhitash cha mahaviryaih sarvaira bharata bharataih

5036.text:
Parishranto yudham sharestha samprapta bhuridakshinam
yudhakankshinam ayantam naitat samam ivarjuna

5038.text:
Rathasthayora davayora yuddhe karuddhayora yodhamukhyayoh
keshavarjunayo rajana samare parekshamanayoh

5039.text:
Then the mighty-armed Krishna replied to Arjuna
Look at the Vrishnyandhaka tiger subdued by Saumadatti

5040.text:
Parishrantam gatam bhumau kartva karma sudushkaram
tavantevasinam shuram palayaarjuna satyakim

5041.text:
This Vararihan does not fall under the control of the sacrificial
For you, O tiger of men, do it quickly, O Lord

5042.text:
Then Dhananjaya said to Vasudeva with a proud mind
Look at the Kuru leader playing with the Vrishni hero
The leader of the monkeys, drunk in the forest like a great island

5043.text:
There was a great cry of the army, O Bharatarsha
when the mighty-armed one took Satyaki to the ground

5047.text:
Look at the Vrishnyandhaka tiger, who is under the control of Saumadatti
Your disciple, O mighty-armed one, is the bowman whom you have unmarried

5048.text:
Asatya Vikrama, O Partha, where Bhurisrava is in battle
Isheshayati Varshneya Satyakim Satyavikrama

5049.text:
Evam ukto mahabahura vasudevaena pandavah
manasa poojayama asa bhurishravasam ahave

5050.text:
Vikarshana satvata sharestham karidmana ivahave
sanharshayati ma bhuya kurunam kirtivardhana

5051.text:
The best of the Vrishni heroes who does not kill Satyakim
draws like a lion in the forest like a great island

5052.text:
Thus, O king, Arjuna, the mighty-armed one, worshiped the Kauravas
Vasudevas with his mind

5054.text:
Having said this, the Pandavas of Vasudeva
cut off the arm of the sacrificial man with his sword

5058.text:
You have done this cruel thing, O Kaunteya
who cut off my arm without seeing the poisoned one

5059.text:
What will you say to King Yudhisthira, the son of Dharma,
What have you done that I have killed Bhurisrava in battle?

5061.text:
Surely you, who know all religions, are more fearless in this world than others
How can you be defeated in battle when you are not fighting

5063.text:
It is a lowly deed served by an unrighteous man
How, O Partha, have you done such a difficult deed

5065.text:
In whatever man, O Partha, wherever and whenever he is
quickly let us peel him off, then this is seen in you

5066.text:
How is it that your dynasty, the Kauravas, especially
has deviated from the Kshatriya religion and is well-behaved and well-mannered?

5067.text:
But this very insignificant thing you have done for the sake of Varshneya
Vasudeva opinion surely this does not apply to you

5069.text: How, O Arjuna, have you made the Vrishnyandhakas, whose actions are condemned by the actions of others

5071.text:
Sharan astirya savyena panina punyalakshana
Yiyasura brahmalokaya parana paraneshva athajuhot

5072.text:
The sage who fixed his eyes on the sun and his mind on the water
meditated on the great Upanishad became a yogi

5073.text:
Then the people of the whole army rebuked Krishna and Dhananjaya
and praised him as the best of men

5075.text:
Tanr atha vadino rajana putransa tava dhananjaya
amrishyamano manasa tesam cha tasya bhashitam

5076.text:
Asankruddha mana vaca samarayanna iva bharata
uvaca pandutanaya sakhepam iva phalgunah

5077.text:
All my kings know this great vow
It is not possible for me to kill anyone who is in my arms

5078.text:
You should not condemn me after considering Yupaketo
For it is not proper to condemn me without knowing my religion

5080.text:
Who would not worship the killing of a child without weapons, without a chariot,
Abhimanyor, father, who is righteous

5083.text:
[Arja]
Ya paririd dharmaraje me bhime cha varadam vare
nakula sahadeve cha sa me tavayi shalagraja

5084.text:
But with the permission of Krishna and the great soul
go to the pious worlds as Shibiraushinarau

5086.text:
Nihtam Panduputrena paramattam bhuridakshinam
Iyesha Satyakira hantum shalagrajam akalmasham

5090.text: Satyaki, whose arm was cut off by Partha in battle while sitting on the other side, took away the head of the Kauravas with his sword

5091.text:
Then the soldiers did not rejoice over Satyaki's action
Arjuna killed Yaja before he killed Kurudvaha

5092.text:
The Siddhas and Charanas there were like a thousand demons
They saw Bhurisrava and killed him in battle

5093.text:
The gods worshiped him and were astonished at his deeds
and his soldiers often rebuked him for his wings

5094.text:
No Varshney should be guilty of that and so
therefore anger is not your duty, anger is painful to men

5097.text:
When the child, the son of Subhadra, was unarmed
and killed by you in battle, where did you go to righteousness?

5098.text:
I have promised you this in some way
Whoever crushes me and kills my life in battle with his foot in anger
He will be killed by me, even if he is an old sage

5101.text:
Bhaviravyam cha yad bhavi daivam cheshtayativa cha
so 'yam hato vimarde asmin kim atradharmacheshtitam

5102.text:
Even this old song is a verse sung by Valmiki on earth
painful to his enemies which is to be done

5104.text:
For in the great sacrifices of the purified by mantras; the illustrious Bhurisahasradas
who went to the forest like a sage; no one there rejoiced in killing him

5105.text:
Sunil kesham varadasya tasya; shurasya paravata lohitaksham
asvasya medhyasya shiro nikritta; nayastam havirdhanam ivottarena

5107.text:
[Dhru]
Ajito Darona Radheya Vikarna Kritavarmabhih
Tirnah Sainyaarnavam Veerah Pratishrutya Yudhisthira

5108.text:
How he was unstoppable in the battles by the Kauravas
restrained and forcibly thrown to the ground by Bhurisravasa

5109.text:
[He]
hear, O king, not here the origin of Shaineya as it was in the past
as it was Bhurisravaso where you have doubt, O king

5111.text:
Pururavas's life was the life of Nahusha
Najusha's life was the life of Yayati, the king's sage was the consent of the gods

5112.text:
Yayatera deva yanya tu yadura jayeshtho 'bhavata suta
Yadora abhuda anvavaye devamidha iti sharuti

5113.text:
Yadavas and his son Shuras were accepted by the Tarailokya
Shura's brave king Vasudeva was of great fame

5114.text:
Dhanushya anavarah shurah kartaviryasamo yudhi
tad viryash chapi tatraiva kule shinir abhun nripah

5118.text:
Tyor yuddham abhud rajan dinardham chitram adbhutam
bahuyuddham subalinoh shakra parahradayor iva

5121.text:
Then Somadatta, having been in that state, became subject to the anger of Maris
Parasadayana Mahadeva

5123.text:
I desire a son, O Lord, who will kill the son of Chhine
and kill the footsteps of thousands of kings in the midst of battle

5124.text: Hearing that word of Somadatta, the god said,

5125.text:
He received by that boon a great gift
and he fell in battle to Saumadatt, the son of Shine

5130.text:
Brahma darvye guru darvye janatidravye 'paya ahinsakah
etesam rakshitarasha cha ye sayuh kasya chid apadi

5131.text:
The rich are not enthusiastic, the truthful of the Brahmins
They do not despise the able and uplift the poor

5132.text:
Nityam deva para danta datarasha chavikatthanah
tena vrishnipraveeranam chakra na paratihanate

5133.text:
Api meru vaheta kash chit tared va makaralayaam
na tu vrishnipraveeranam samatyantam varajena nripa

5134.text:
Etat te sarvam akhyatam yatra te sanshayo vibho
Kururajanarashrestha tava hay apnayo mahaan

5135.text:
[Dhru]
In that state, killed in that Bhurisravasi Kauravas
Tell me, Sanjaya, how the battle took place again

5136.text:
[S]
Bhurisravasi sankrante paralokaya bharata
vasudevam mahabahura arjuna samachuchudat

5137.text:
Chadayasvan bhrisham krishna yato raja Jayadratha
Astama eti mahabaho tavaramano divakara

5139.text:
Nastama eti yatha suryo yathasatyam bhaved vachah
Chodayasvansa tatha krishna yatha hanyam Jayadratham

5140.text:
Then Krishna, the mighty-armed silver-like horse
horseman, rode against Jayadratha

5141.text: The chiefs of the Maharaja army, who were rushing toward him, as if rushing at him with infallible arrows

5142.text:
Duryodhana and Karna and Vrishasena and the king of Madras
Ashwathma and Kripa and Savayam and the Saindhavas

5143.text:
Approaching the terrible Saindhava, he stood in the other's face
with eyes burning with anger, as if burning with contact

5145.text:
This is that Vaikartana battle time; show your strength to the great soul
so that he may not be killed in battle by Arjuna; Jayadratha, Karna, do so

5146.text:
There is little day left, O hero of men; interrupt the enemy with streams of arrows
After the end of the day, O hero of men; surely our ears will be conquered

5149.text:
With the destroyed Pandavas and that mountain forest called
Vasundhara, we shall eat this ear, destroyed by thorns

5153.text:
Protected by the king of Madras and by the grace of the great
How could Dhananjaya kill Jayadratha on the battlefield

5154.text: How can the terrible Saindhava, who is protected by Darauni and by my misrule, be overtaken by time?

5155.text:
There are many brave men in battle and the sun is hanging
I doubt Jayadratha will not be defeated by Partha, honorable

5158.text:
Bhimasena, a brave bowman with a strong aim,
greatly excited him in numbers with a network of arrows

5159.text:
Sthatavyam iti tishtami rane samprati manada
aivangam ingti kin chin me santaptasya raneshubhih

5161.text:
For the brave Savyasachi Dhananjaya will not be able to overcome the devil
Saindhava from the arrows of my fighting mouth

5162.text:
But because the powerful work is always done for the good
I will do it, O Kauravas, Jayo is established in destiny

5164.text:
Fight today, O best of the Kurus, between my army of Partha
Let all beings see the terrible hair-raising

5165.text:
Karna Kauravas and the battle conversing
Arjuna killed your army with sharp arrows

5166.text:
He cut off the sharp-edged faces of the brave, the unrelenting
arms, like iron, like the hands of an elephant in battle

5168.text:
Shonitakshan Hayarohan grihitapras tomaran
kshuraish chiched bimatsura davidhaikaikam taridhaiva cha

5169.text:
They sent away thousands of horses, elephants and mules
white horses, umbrellas, bows, chamaras and heads

5170.text:
Kaksham agnim ivodhuta paradahansa tava vahinim
Achirena mahi parthash chakara rudhirottaram

5171.text:
Hatabhuyishta yodham tat kartva tava bala bali
asasad duradharsha saindhavam satyavikrama

5172.text:
The terrible demon was protected by Bhimasena and Satvata
He shone, O best of Bharatas, like a blazing fire

5174.text:
Duryodhana and Karna and Vrishasena and the king of Madras
Ashwathma and Kripa and Savayam and the Saindhavas

5178.text:
They armed themselves with bows and arrows
and released the sun's rays against hundreds of falcons

5179.text:
Tan astan asyamaansha cha kiriti yuddhadurmadah
davidha taridhashtadhaikaikam chitva vivyadha tan rane

5180.text:
The lion-tailed Ketu, however, showed his power
The son of Sharadvati, O king, did not prevent Arjuna from returning

5182.text:
Then all the great charioteers of the Kauravas
surrounded him on all sides with a great lineage of chariots

5183.text:
They expanded their bows and released their arrows
They protected the sea from the rule of their son

5184.text:
There the arms of the brave Partha were seen
The inexhaustibility of the sages and the bow of Gandhi

5185.text: Arm your weapons and surrender them all to Darauna and Sharadvata with nine arrows each

5186.text:
Tam Darauni with twenty-five Vrishasenas and seven
Duryodhana with twenty Karna Shalyas and Taribhis Taribhis

5187.text:
They roared at him and shot him again and again
shooting their bows and surrounding him from all sides

5188.text:
Shalishtam tu sarvatasha chakru rathamandalam ashu te
suryastamayam ichchantas taravamanas maharathas

5191.text:
Hatabhuyishta yodham tat kartva tava bala bali
asasad duradharsha saindhavam satyavikrama

5192.text:
Karna repulsed him in battle, O king, with speed
while Bhimasena and Satvata were looking, O Bharatha

5193.text:
Partha struck him back with ten arrows in the battlefield
the mighty-armed son of Suta in the presence of all his army

5194.text:
Satvatasha and Taribhira banaih vivyadha Marisha
Bhimasena Taribhisha and again Parthasha with seven

5195.text:
Then Karna struck them again with sixty sixty great chariots
Then there was a battle, O king, with many of Karna's

5196.text:
There I saw a wonderful sight of the son of Suta
who surrounded the chariots of the angry ship alone in battle

5197.text:
But the mighty-armed Phalgunas struck Karna Vaikartana in battle
with a hundred arrows to the heart

5199.text:
Then Partha cut his bow and struck him in the middle of the seventy
with nine arrows, the heroic Dhananjaya

5201.text:
As the darkness fell, Daraunish cut off his arrow with speed
He fell to the ground with a sharp half-moon

5202.text:
Athanyad dhanura adaya sutaputra paratapavan
karno 'pi davishatam hanta chadayaam asa phalgunam
sayakaira bahusahasraih kritapatikritepsya

5205.text:
Let the two heroes fight in battle, picturesque, small and well
worthy of observation in all battles

5206.text:
Praised by each other in battle, the Siddhas and Charanavatikas
fought, O great king, seeking to kill each other

5209.text:
Take the charioteer from the chariot nest with his spear
and cover him with arrows while your son watches

5211.text:
Seeing him thus without a chariot, he mounted the chariot and then
Ashwatthama Maharaja again led Arjuna

5212.text:
The king of Madras shot Kaunteya with thirty arrows
The king of Sharadvata gave Vasudeva twenty
He killed Dhananjaya with twelve arrows

5213.text:
Chaturbhis Sindhurajasha Cha Vrishasenasha Cha Saptabhi
Pruthaka Prithana Maharaja Krishna Parthava Avidhitama

5215.text:
Partha struck Saindhava with ten spears, Vrishasena with crosses
and Sharadvata with twenty

5217.text:
Atharjunah sarvato dharam astram; paraduschakre tarasyana Dhritarashtra
tam paratyudiyuh kuruvah pandusunum; rathaira maharahai sharavarshanya avarshan

5219.text:
Rajyaprepsuh savyasachi kurunam; samaran kaleshan davada varshavruttan
Gandivamuktaira ishubhira mahatma; sarva disho vayavrinoda aprameyaih

5220.text:
Paradiptolkam avacha chantariksham; deheshu bhurinya apatana vayansi
ayat pingala jayaena kiritamali; karuddho ripun ajagavena hanti

5223.text:
He lifted them up with chariots and horses; he with the infantry and the great bowman
with all his weapons in battle; he made the hero Yama enhance the nation

5224.text:
[He]
He wandered in battle, Partha, the watchable Dhananjaya
simultaneously showing picturesque weapons in all directions

5225.text: All beings could not look back at Pandavas as if the sun had set at midday and was returning to the sky

5226.text: I saw the great man in battle like a row of swans in the sky

5228.text:
Arjuna passed by those charioteers, O king,
bewitching them with his arrows, desiring to kill Jayadratha

5231.text:
Then we do not see Kaunteya, who is giving away the great bow and arming the Pandavas
and dismissing them

5232.text:
Thus in all directions, O king, and all the charioteers in the battle
anxious Krityakaunteya attacked Jayadratha
and struck him with sixty-four arrows bowed down

5233.text:
Saindhavas tu tatha viddhah sharair gandivadhanvana
na chakshame susankruddhasa tottrardita iva davipah

5234.text:
Sa varahadhvajas turnam gardhrapatran ajihmagan
ashivishasamaprakhyan karmar parimarjitan
mumoch nishitan sankhye sayakan savyasachini

5235.text:
Taribhis tu vidhva Gandhivam narachaih shadbhira arjunam
ashtabhira vajino 'vidhyad dhavajam chaikena patrina

5236.text:
He threw away Arjuna's sharp arrows sent by the Saindhavas
simultaneously cutting him with the arrows of the Saindhavas
the head of the charioteer and the body adorned with the flag

5239.text:
Dhananjaya, cut off the head of the evil-minded Saindhava
The sun is setting, the best of the mountains,
Hear my words after the killing of Jayadratha

5244.text:
Etacha chrutva sindhurajo dhayatva chiram arindamam
janatin sarvan uvachedam putrasnehabhipiditah

5247.text:
So 'yam tapyati tejasvi tapa ghoram durasadam
samantapanchakad asmad bahir vanaraketan

5249.text:
Sakundalam sindhupateh parabhanjana asutanuja
utsange patayasvashu vrddhakshatrasya bharata

5250.text:
Then you will drop his head on the ground
Your head will no doubt bear fruit in a hundred pieces

5252.text:
There is nothing impossible or impossible for you
in all the worlds, O Vasavananda

5253.text:
Etacha chrutva tu vacana srikkini parisanlihana
Indrashanisamasparsham divyamantrabhimantritam

5254.text:

Seeing Pandusena killed by your son Bharata
Bhimasena Purogasa, the Panchalas attacked him

5554.text:
He defeated Bhimasena with ten Madri sons, Taribhis Taribhis
Virata and Drupada with six hundred and Shikhandinam

5555.text:
Dhrishtadyumna with seven arrows and Dharmaputra with seven
Kekyansha and Chedinsha with many sharp arrows

5556.text:
Satvatam pancabhira vidhva Daraupadeyans taribhis taribhis
Ghatotkacham cha samare vidhva lion roared

5557.text:
Shatashasha chaparan yodhana sa davipasvarathana rane
sharair avachakartograih karuddho 'nataka iva parajah

5559.text:
He struck him with ten perfectly sharp arrows
piercing the marrows, they all broke and entered the field

5560.text:
Then the warriors, overjoyed, surrounded Yudhisthira
to kill Vritra as the gods surrounded Purandara

5561.text:
Then King Yudhisthira shot your son Marisha
arrow very hard in battle
He was greatly struck by it and sat down on the best of the chariots

5564.text: Duryodhana, delighted, took his bow firmly and attacked the Pandavas, saying,

5568.text: How did the Pandavas surround Darona, the great archer, who was standing in the battlefield while he was wandering around

5569.text:
Who protected the southern wheel of the great teacher
who protected the northern one, killing the enemy in battle

5570.text:
How did he, the best of all armed men, dance in the chariot paths
Angry like a smokestack, approach death

5572.text:
And so Yudhisthira and Bhimasena and the Pandavas
attached to Darona in separate armies

5573.text:
So did Nakula, the wise Sahadeva, and the invincible
Dhrishtadyumna, Shatanika, Virata, and that Kekaya
Matsya, the army of Shalveya, and Darona went to battle

5574.text:
Darupadasa and the king were protected by the Panchalas
Dhrishtadyumna's father, Rajan, was followed by Darona

5575.text:
Daraupadeya maheshvasa rakshasha cha ghatotkacha
sa senasa te 'bhayavartanta daronama eva mahadyutim

5576.text:
Parabhadrakasha and the six thousand Panchalas who had defeated the others
Daronam evabhyvartanta pursued Shikhandinam

5578.text:
Among those brave men who went to battle, O best of the Bharatas
the night became terrible and frightening to the timid

5579.text:
Yodhanam ashiva raudra rajanna antakagamini
kunjarasvamanushyaanam paranaanta karani tada

5581.text:
The owls and the sky appeared, telling of the vast fear
especially of the Kauravas, who were very terrible

5584.text:
Then there was a very fierce battle in the evening
 between Darona and the Maharaja Srinjayas on all sides

5587.text:
At night, on a mountain burning like a forest of dynasties,
there was a loud crackling sound of weapons falling

5588.text:
Neither all nor others, O king, understood the darkness
Then everything became like a madman in the face of the night

5589.text:
The earthly dust, then, O king, was subdued by blood
and the darkness was covered with gold and shields and ornaments

5590.text:
Then that Indian army adorned with jewels and gold
was like Dayur, that star in the night, O best of the Bharatas

5591.text:
gomayubad sanghushta shaktidhvajasamakula
darunabhiruta ghora kashveditotkrushta nadita

5592.text:
Then there arose a great noise, tumultuous and hair-raising
covering all directions, the sound of the thunder of the Mahendra

5594.text:
There were serpents and chariots adorned with golden rivers
They appeared again in the night like clouds that lightning

5595.text:
Rishtishaktigada banamusala parasapatishah
sampatanto vayadrishyanta bharajamana ivagnayah

5596.text:
Duryodhana Purovatam Rathnagabalahakam
Vaditraghoshastanitam Chapavidyudha Dhavajaira Vritam

5597.text:
Daron Pandava parjanyam khadgashakti gadashanim
sharadharastra pavanam bhrisham shitoshnasankulam

5599.text:
In that night-face, when the terrible great sound roared,
the fearful were terrified, the brave were joyful

5601.text:
Ye ye paramukhato rajana nayavartant mahatmanah
tan sarvan vimukhansha chakre kansha chin ninye yamakshayam

5602.text:
[Dhru]
Tasmin paravishte durdharshe srinjaya amitaujasi
amrishyamane sarambdhe ka vo 'bhuda vai matis tad

5603.text: Duryodhana and his son, saying that he had transgressed the scriptures, entered into me, O immeasurable soul, what did Partha return to

5604.text:
Nihate saindhave vire bhurisravasi chaiva hi
yad abhyagan mahatejah panchala aparajitha

5605.text:
What did Duryodhana think the invincible was doing in the heat of the enemy
and what did Duryodhana think it was time to do

5606.text:
Who followed that boon-giving hero, the best of the heroes
Who followed him, the heroes fighting the mighty
Who fought in front of him, killing the enemy in battle

5607.text:
I think Padvan all the Bharadwajas are wounded by the arrows
They are like lean cows trembling in winter

5608.text:
The great archer who destroyed the enemies of the Panchalas
How did the male tiger attain fiveness

5609.text:
All the armies and assemblies; The great chariots assembled at night
The various kinds of chariots; Who dwelt then, the wise seats

5610.text:
He praises the dead and the poisoned and the defeated
The charioteers and the chariotless have been killed in battles by me

5611.text:
How did these then there the Parthians flee
The light came at night How did they do it, Sanjaya

5613.text:
Then Darona and Kekayansha and Dhrishtadyumna's sons
sent them all to the world of death with quick arrows

5614.text:
Tasya paramukhto rajan ye avartant maharathah
tan sarvan pareshyam asa paralokaya bharata

5617.text:
The camp struck him back with thirty sharp arrows
and the charioteer fell down in time with his spear

5618.text:
His Darona killed the horse and the charioteer of the great man
Then he removed the head of the savior from his body

5619.text:
And with the army of the Kalingas, the son of Kalinga, angry at the battle
before killing his father, attacked Bhimasena

5621.text:
But the angry Vrikodara of the Kalingas
ran after the chariot and struck him with his fist

5624.text:
There, leaving the enemy's chariot, Bhima went to the chariot of Dharuva
He struck Dharuva with his fist
He was thus killed by Bali, the son of Pandu

5625.text:
Having killed him, Maharaja Bhimasena, the mighty
Jai Raat, roared like a lion again and again after capturing the chariot

5626.text:
Jai Ratam Athakshipya Nadan Savyena Pani
talena Nashayam Asa Karnasyaivagratha Sathitam

5628.text:
The wolf threw the invincible sword at Karna
and cut her in the sky with the oil-drinking bird

5629.text:
Then your daughter Rajan attacked Bhima's chariot
with a great shower of arrows covering Vrikodaram

5631.text:
Tava ekaratham arodhau bharatarau paratapanau
sangramshiraso madhye bhima davava abhyadhavatam
yathambupatimitrau hi tarakam daitya sattamam

5633.text:
Then the Pandavas of Karna, Mishato, Daraunera, Duryodhana,
Kripa, Somadatta and Bahlika

5634.text:
The chariot of the mad and the brave and the evil-eared
The enemy threw it to the ground with a kick

5635.text:
Then he struck your two sons, strong and brave, Dushkarna and Durmada
with his fist, and in anger he crushed them with his feet

5638.text:
Then, at the dawn of the night, when the force was very stirred; the king Vrishabhaira Vrikodara, who was well worshipped,
the mighty lotus-eyed; the strong worshiped King Yudhisthira

5641.text:
Then it was covered with dark clouds; the great fear was very terrible
The great wolf and vulture were killed at nightfall; the battle of the great men, O king, was wonderful

5643.text:
The dharma of the Kshatriyas was seen in the past by the gods and great men
How can you, O Satvata, abandon it and engage in the dharma of the thief

5644.text:
He begs the poor man who has turned away from the enemy and the weapon he has taken away
How can a wise man, devoted to the dharma of the field, defeat another in battle

5645.text:
Davav eva kil Vrishninam tatra khayatau maharathau
Paradyumnasha cha mahabahusa tavam chaiva yudhi satvata

5646.text: How did you do such a cruel and falling thing to the arm cut off by Partha who was sitting on the other side

5647.text:
I swear to you, O Satvata, by your sons, by your dear and good deeds,
we will not pass this night if I am your heroic man

5648.text:
I will not kill that younger brother of Jishnu, whom Partha protected,
I will fall into hell, O Vrishnipansan

5650.text:
Then the lotus-eyed, lion-toothed, mighty
Satvata, very angry, said to Somadatta

5653.text:
In whom is self-control, purity, non-violence, harir, patience, forgiveness,
all things are inexhaustible, O queen Yudhisthira

5654.text:
Mridangketos, killed by his thy splendor long ago
that Karna Saubala, you will meet destruction in battle

5657.text: Then Duryodhana surrounded Somadatta with a thousand elephants and ten thousand chariots

5658.text:
Shakunish and well-armed, the best of all weapons
Surrounded by his sons and grandsons, his brothers and Indra's prowess
Sayalasa, your mighty-armed, thunderbolt-bearing young man

5659.text:
A whole hundred thousand horses protected his wise
Somadatta, the great archer, from all sides

5661.text:
There was a sea like the ocean of the fierce winds
There was a flood of forces, O king, that struck each other

5662.text:
Somadatta struck Satva with nine arrows
Satyakira killed him with ten arrows

5664.text:
Seeing him confused, the charioteer hurried
Apovaha the heroic Somadatta, the great charioteer of the battle

5665.text:
Seeing him unconscious, Yuyudhana, wounded by the arrows
Darauni, angrily rushed at the Satvata on the battlefield

5666.text:
Seeing the darkness approaching, the chariot of Shaineya returned
Bhaimaseni, in a fit of rage, stopped his enemy

5668.text:
The distracted eight-wheeled, open-eyed roaring
white-beaked king of vultures reigns

5669.text:
Lohitardra patakam tama antra mala vibhushitam
ashtachakrasamayuktam asthaya vipulam ratham

5670.text:
Surrounded by a rock-tree hand holding a spear and hammer
by an army of terrible demons

5671.text:
The kings were dismayed to see the great bow raised
At the end of the age, like the hand of the rod

5672.text:
Your army of your son Pachukshobha, tormented by fear,
waves upwards like the Ganges, shaken by the wind

5673.text:
Gatotkach, frightened by the roar of the lion used by the other
The elephants snorted and the men urine and the men were very angry

5675.text:
The iron wheels, the bhushundyas, the parasatomaras
falling, the incessant spears, the hundred-shooters, the pattishas and

5677.text:
Tatraiko 'satrabalashlaghi daraunir mani na vivyathe
vayadhamacha cha sharair maya ghatotkacha vinirmitam

5681.text:
Ghatotkacho 'atividdhasa tu Daronaputrena marmasu
chakram shatasahasraram agrhnad vayathito bhrisham

5683.text:
Go with great speed, distracted by the arrows of Darauni
As unfortunate as your resolve, you will fall to the ground in vain

5684.text:
Ghatotkachas then at once saw the wheel fallen
Darauni covered him with arrows like the sun with all his arrows

5685.text:
Ghatotkacha suta shariman bhinnan janachayopamah
rurodha daraunim ayantam parabhanjanam ivadrirat

5686.text: Bhimasena's grandson's arrows struck him like a cloud surrounded by streams

5687.text:
Ashwatthama, your unconcerned Rudra, Indra and Vikrama
Dhavajam with one arrow cut off the Anjanaparvana

5688.text:
Davabhya tu rathayantaram taribhis chasya tarivenukam
dhanur ekena chiched chaturbhis chaturo hayan

5689.text:
Virathasyodytam hastad dhemabindubhira achitam
vishikhena sutikshnena khadgama asya davidhakarota

5690.text:
The mace of Hemangada Rajans was quickly thrown by the son of Haidimba
Bharamyo with arrows and she too fell struck by Darauni

5694.text:
Tama ayasmaya varmanam daraunira bhimatmajatmajam
jaghananjana parvanam maheshwara ivandhakam

5695.text:
Then, seeing his son killed by Ashvatthama, the mighty
Daraua, Angada, digested with anger, approached him

5696.text:
Paraha vakyam asambhranto viram sharadvati sutam
dahantam pandavanikam vanam agnim ivoddhatam

5699.text:
I don't want to be angry with you, Hadimbe
but an angry animal kills itself or even

5700.text:
[He]
Hearing this, the angry Tamraksha, filled with grief for his son,
said to Ashvatthama, the Ayasto Bhaimasenir

5701.text:
Kim aha kataro daraune prithagjana ivahave
Bhimat khalva aha utpannah kurunam vipule kule

5702.text:
I am the son of the Pandavas, the unrelenting in battle
the king of the demons, equal in strength to the ten-necked

5703.text:
Stand, stand, not my life, son of Darona, you will go
Battle faith, I will destroy your mercy on the battlefield

5705.text:
Ghatotkacha rained down arrows on the axes of his chariot
The storm rained down the bull of the chariot on Darauni with streams

5706.text:
The arrows rained down on the arrows that Daraunir had not reached
Then the battle of arrows in the sky became like another

5707.text:
Athastra sangharshakritaira visphulingaih samabbhau
vibhavari mukhe vayom khadyotaira iva chitritam

5708.text:
Seeing the magic killed by the Darauni, the warrior
Ghatotkachas then created the magic and disappeared again

5709.text:
So 'bhavad girir itya uchchah shikharais tarusankataih
shulprasasi musaljalprasravano mahan

5710.text:
Tam Anjana Chayaprakhyam Daraunira Drishta Mahidharam
Parapatadbhisha Cha Bahubhih Shastrasanghaira Na Chukshubhe

5712.text:
Then he became a cloud and blue with Indra's weapon in the sky
covered Darauni with a very fierce hailstones in battle

5713.text:
Atha sandhaya vayavyam astram astravidam varah
vayadhamada darona tanayo nilamegham samutthitam

5716.text:
Like lions and tigers, with the prowess of drunken elephants
on elephants and chariots, even on horseback

5717.text:
Vivritasya shirogrivaira haidimbanucharaih saha
paulastyaira yatudhanaish cha tamasaisha chogravikramaih

5718.text:
Heroes with various weapons and various shields and ornaments
Mahabalas and Bhimaravas with angry eyes

5719.text:
Upasthitais tatho yuddhe rakshasaira yuddhadurmadaih
vishannam abhisamprekshya putram te daraunira abravit

5724.text:
Sixty thousand elephants and parayahi your Dhananjaya
Karna and Vrishasena and Kripa and Nilas and so on

5725.text:
Udichya kritavarma ca purumitra sharutarpana
duasana nikumbhaa ca kunda bhedi uru karamah

5726.text:
Puranjayo Dridharatha Pataki Hemapankaja
Shalyarunindra Senasha Cha Sanjaya Vijaya Jaya

5727.text:
Kamalaksha Puru Karathi Jai Varma Sudarshan
These six thousand leaves will follow you

5728.text:
Kill Bhima, Yama, Chobha and Dharmaraja, your maternal uncle
Asura, like Devendra, my hope of victory is in you

5729.text:
Daritan Darauni banair bhrisham vikshat vigrahaan
Azhi matulakaunteyaan asuran iva pavakih

5731.text:
Atha paravavrute yuddham daraunirakshasayor mridhe
vibhavarya sutumulam shakra parahradayor iva

5732.text:
Then Ghatotkacha struck Gautami's son
with ten arrows, angry with poisonous fire images, firmly

5733.text:
He was struck by them hard with arrows fired by Bhima's sons
He shook like a tree blown by the wind in the middle of the chariot

5738.text:
Striking down the demons with arrows and chariots with horses, the Lord
burned the Lord like fire at the end of the age

5739.text:
He burnt the army with his arrows and struck the south with great
burning the city of Taripura in the heavens, the god Maheshwarah

5741.text:
Among those thousands of kings of the Pandavas, Bharata
no one can observe him in the Darauni battle
except Ghatotkachad, the heroic Rakshasendra, the mighty one

5743.text:
He went in a terrible form with that victory banner
Davairatha in the form of Darona again and again Arisudana

5744.text:
Then the angry demon threw at the son of Darona
the eight-wheeled, terrible thunderbolt made by Rudra

5745.text:
She jumped down and grabbed the bow on the chariot of Daraunir Naya
threw it away and jumped from his own chariot

5746.text:
Sashwasuta dhavajam vaham bhasmakratva mahaprabha
vivesh vasudham bhitva sashanir bhrishadaruna

5747.text:
Daraunes then saw the deed and worshiped all beings
who jumped down and grabbed the terrible thing created by Lord Shiva

5748.text:
Dhrishtadyumna went to the chariot and then the king
shooted sharp arrows again at Daraunera Mahorasi

5749.text:
Dhrishtadyumna, too, unconcerned, shot a sword-like
golden-winged arrow into the chest of the son of Darona

5753.text: Then the righteous Darauni, accompanied by the demon Dhrishtadyumna, the son of Bhima, fought without difficulty

5754.text:
There the most wonderful Daraunir showed us his prowess
impossible to be done by any other in all beings, O Bharatha

5755.text:
In a matter of minutes, the horse-drawn carriage of the two chariots
destroyed the army of demons with sharp arrows

5756.text:
Mishato Bhimasena Haidimbe's associate and
Yamayor Dharmaputra Vijaya and Acyuta

5757.text:
Paragadham anjo gatibhira narachair abhitaditah
nipetura davirada bhuma davishrnga iva mountains

5758.text:
Nikrittaira hastihastaish cha vichaldbhira itas tatha
raraja vasudha kirna visarpadbhira ivoragaih

5759.text:
The fields shone with golden staffs and royal umbrellas thrown
The moon and sun shone like the sun at the end of the age

5760.text:
Paravrddhadhvajamandukam bheri vistirnakacchapam
chatrahansavali jushtam phenchamaramalinim

5761.text:
kankagridhramahagraham naikayudha jhashakulam
rathakshipta mahavapram pataka ruchiradrumam

5762.text:
Sharaminaam maharaudram parasashaktiyugradundubham
majja masamahapankam kabandhavarjitodupam

5763.text:
Keshashaivalakalmasham bhirunam kashmalavaham
Nagendra hayodhanaam shariravyaya sambhavam

5764.text:
Shonitaughamahavegam daraunih paravartayan nadim
yodhartava nirghosham kshatajormi samakulam

5765.text:
Parayad atimahaghoram yamakshayamahodhim
nihatya rakshasan banair daraunir haidimbam ardayat

5767.text:
The mighty Lord killed Suratha, the son of Darupada,
again in battle, Sharutanjaya, the younger brother of Suratha

5768.text:
Balanika Jayanika Jayasva chabhijaghnivan
Sharutahvayam cha Rajendra Daraunira ninye yamakshayam

5769.text:
Taribhis chanyai sharais tikai supunkhai rukmamalinam
atrunjayam ca baliam akra lokam ninaya ha

5770.text:
He killed Prishadhra and the moon god Maninam
He killed ten of Kuntibhoja's sons and ten of his chariots

5771.text:
Ashwaththama susankruddha sandhayogram ajihmagama
mumochakarna purnena dhanusha sharam uttamam
yamadandopamam goram uddishyashu ghatotkacham

5772.text:
He pierced the heart of that demon with a great arrow
and quickly entered the earth that man, O lord of the earth

5774.text:
Thus the chariot army of King Yudhisthira
defeated in battle, the heroic son of Darona roared
worshipped by all beings and by your sons, O Bharatha

5776.text:
The hosts of Siddhas, Gandharvas and devils; the serpents, the Suparnas, the ancestors, the birds
the demons, the hosts of ghosts and the Darauni; did not worship the Apsaras and the Surasha

5779.text:
Somadatta, seeing Satyakim again angry,
was covered with a great rain of arrows from all sides

5781.text:
Bhima struck the Kauravas with ten for the sake of the Satvata
Somadatta struck back that hero with a hundred

5782.text:
Satvatas tava abhisankruddhah putradhibhira abhiplutama
vrddham richdham gunaih sarvaira yayatima iva nahusham

5783.text:
He struck him with ten sharp arrows that fell like thunder
He then struck him with his power and struck him again with seven

5785.text:
Satyakisha chagnisankasham mumoch sharam uttamam
Somadattorasi karuddhah supatram nishitam yudhi

5786.text:
They fell simultaneously and the two terrible spears
The great chariot fell on the body of Somadatta

5788.text:
Bhima then pierced Bahlika with nine arrows for the sake of the Satvata
and struck the great man on the battlefield

5789.text:
Paratipiyas, however, was enraged and dug his power into Bhima's chest
the mighty-armed Purandara like thunder

5791.text:
She was beheaded by the Pandavas, the benefactor of Bahlika
He fell dead to the ground like a mountain king struck by a thunderbolt

5793.text:
Bhima killed them with ten arrows and scattered your son
karna's beloved son Vrishasena

5794.text:
Then Vrisharatha, the brother of Karna, famous
struck Bhima with his arrows, and Bali also killed him

5796.text:
Amarshayanto nihatam shatachandram maharatham
Shakunera bharataro veera gajaksha sharabho vibhu
abhidrutya sharais takshnair bhimasena atadyana

5797.text:
He was beaten by arrows like a bull in the speed of rain
He struck with five arrows five very strong chariots
The nobles of the kings trembled at the sight of the dead heroes

5798.text:
Then Yudhisthira, angry, destroyed your army
with the sight of Kumbhayonesh and your sons, O sinless one

5799.text:
Ambasthanan malavan shurans tarigartan sa shibin api
parahinon mrityulokaya ganana yuddhe yudhisthirah

5800.text:
Abhishahan shursena bahlika sa vasatika
nikritya prithivim raja chakre shonitakardamam

5801.text:
Yudheyaratta Rajanya Madrakanaam Ganaan Yudhi
Parahino Mrityulokaaya Shuraan Banair Yudhisthirah

5803.text:
Darona, seeing Yudhisthira tearing the armies,
choditas, threw arrows at your son

5806.text:
Throwing those weapons thrown, Dharmaja
killed with weapons the mighty-armed Kumbhayoner fearlessly

5809.text:
As the weapons were being thrown, Darona, enraged,
Yuddhisthira, who was determined to kill him, raised the Brahma weapon

5812.text:
Then the chiefs of the army praised the two great men
Daron and Partha, the great archers and experts in all warfare

5813.text:
Then, having released Kaunteya, Darona and Darupada's army
vayadhamad roshatamraksha with the weapon of the wind, O Bharata

5815.text:
Then Kiriti and Bhimasha suddenly turned away
taking your strength with their great chariots

5816.text:
The terrible demon Vrikodara on the right side and the wolf on the north
rained down great streams of arrows on Bharadwaja

5817.text:
Then the mighty Srinjayasha and Panchalasha
followed, O great king, Matsyasha with the Satvatas

5818.text:
Then that Indian army was killed by Kiriti
Darona and they were stopped by your son
They could not stop the Maharaja warriors then

5820.text:
This is the time for friends, friendly
Save in battle, Karna, all warriors, mighty warriors

5821.text:
Panchalaira Matsyakaikeyaih Pandavaisha cha maharathaih
vritana samantata sankruddhaaira nishvasadbhira ivoragaih

5822.text:
These are the Pandavas roaring with joy, having conquered
Shakrapamasha and many of the chariots of the Panchalas

5824.text:
I promise you the truth, rest assured, India
I am the killer of the Pandu son and the fifty-five who have come together

5825.text:
Jayam te paratijanami vasavasyeva pavakih
pariyam tava maya karyam iti jivami parthiva

5826.text:
Phalguna is the strongest of all the Parthians
I will release his infallible power created by Indra

5827.text:
When that great archer is killed, Bharatarasa, his honorable
will be subject to you or will they go to the forest again

5828.text:
Do not be depressed, O Kauravas, as long as I am alive
I will win the battle with all the Pandavas

5829.text:
I will shake the Panchalas, the Kekayas and the Vrishnis,
with floods of arrows, and give you the land

5831.text:
Shombham Shombham Karna Sa Nathah Kurupungavah
If it is accomplished by your Lord Radhey's words

5832.text:
You often talk about Karna near the Kauravas
but you don't see any prowess or strength

5833.text:
You have seen the meeting with the sons of Pandu in many battles
You have been defeated everywhere by the Pandavas, O Sutananda

5835.text:
All the Kauravas gathered in Viratanagara
defeated by Partha in battle and your brother Karna

5836.text:
You are incapable of even one in the battle of Phalguna
How dare you defeat Sukrishna and all the Pandavas

5837.text:
Abruvan Karna yudhyasva bahu katthasi sutaja
anuktva vikramed yas tu tad vai satpurushavratam

5838.text:
Roaring, O son of the thread, you are like water in the autumn cloud
You appear fruitless, O ear, and the king does not understand

5839.text:
You roar so long, Radhey, until you see Partha
For in the past, seeing Partha, you would rarely have roared

5840.text:
You roar with those arrows of the falcon without reaching you
Partha, the arrow-struck will rarely roar

5841.text:
Kshatriyas are brave with their arms, brave with their words, brave with their words
Davijatis with their bows, Phalguna, brave with their ears, brave with their desires

5843.text:
The brave roar constantly like the clouds of the next rain
and the fruit quickly gives the others like the seeds of the ripe season

5844.text:
I see no fault here in the heroes on the battlefield
Then they boast of it and carry the burden in battle

5845.text:
The burden that a man is willing to bear with his mind
God is there to help him

5846.text:
I am second in profession, carrying the burden with my mind
I roar if I am a brahmin, what is lost there for you

5848.text:
So I am today in battle with Krishna and Pandavas
I am eager to win with thirst, so I roar, Gautama

5850.text:
[Please]
Do not accept my wishful thinking, O Sutaja
When you throw Krishna and Dharmaraja and Pandavas

5851.text:
Dharuvas tatra jayah karna yatra yuddhavishardau
devagandharvayakshanaam manushyoragarakshasam
danshitanaam api rane ajeyau krishna pandavau

5855.text:
Chandra Sena Bhadra Sena Kirtidharma Dharuvo Dhara
Vasu Chandra Dama Chandra Singhachandra Suvedhana

5857.text:
Shatanika, Sudasana, Sharutanika, Sharutadhvaja,
Balanika, Jayanika, Jayasva, Rathavahana

5859.text:
Kamam khalu jagat sarvam sa devasuramanavam
sa yaksharakshasa ganam sa bhutabhujaga davipam
nishesham astraviryena kuryataam bhima phalgunau

5860.text:
Yuddhisthirash cha prithivim nirdhaheda ghorachakshusha
prameyabalah shaurir yeshaam arthe cha danshita
katham tan sanyuge karna jetum utsahase paraan

5861.text:
This is your great adoption, for it is always your son
who dares to fight in battle with the hero

5862.text:
[He]
Thus spoken, Radhey, the best of the Bharatas, laughed
And then Karna said to Guru Sharadvata,

5863.text:
Truly you have spoken, O Brahman, what you have said to the Pandavas
These and many other virtues are in the sons of Pandu

5864.text:
Partha is invincible in battle even by the gods and by Vasava
He is defeated by the demons, yakshas, gandharvas, devils, thieves and rakshasas
yet I shall conquer Partha by the power given to me by Vasava

5865.text:
I have also been given this infallible power by Shakra, the Davija
with this I shall kill Savyasachin in battle

5866.text:
When Pandavas are killed, Krishna and his brothers and sisters
Arjuna will never be able to enjoy the earth

5867.text:
After all of them are destroyed, the earth and its oceans
will be under the control of the Kauravas without effort, Gautama

5868.text:
Sunitaira iha sarvarthaah sidhyante natra sanshayah
Etam artham aha janatva tato roar Gautama

5869.text:
You, however, are old and brave and incapable of fighting
and affectionate to the Parthians, Mohan, you despise me

5871.text:
Yach chapi pandavan vipra satotum ichchasi sanyuge
bhishayana sarvasainyani kauraveyani durmate
atrapi shrunu me vakyam yathavad gadato davija

5872.text:
Duryodhana and Darona, Shakunir, Durmukho Jaya,
Duhshasana, Vrishasena, Madraraja, Tavama, 
Somadatta, Bhurish, and Darauni, twenty

5873.text:
They shall stand bitten where all the warriors
Who is the enemy as strong as Indra who will conquer these in battle

5874.text:
Shurash cha hi kritastrasha cha balinah savargalipsavah
dharmajna yuddhakushala hanyur yuddhe suran api

5877.text:
Vikarna, Chitrasena, Bahlika, Jayadratha,
Bhurisrava, Jayasha, Jalasandha and Sudakshina

5879.text:
The brave men killed in battle are stronger than the Pandavas
What else do you think is a coincidence of fate, you vile man

5880.text:
Yansh cha tan sataushi sattam Duryodhana ripun davij
They also killed hundreds of brave men and therefore thousands

5881.text:
All the armies of the Kurus are destroyed with the Pandavas
I see no other influence here in the Pandavas at all

5884.text:
[Ashwa]
Look at your ears, you wicked one, stand now, you vile man
This is your head, I will lift it from your body, you wicked one

5889.text:
Tavayi karne kripe darone madraraje 'tha saubale
mahata karyam samayatta parsid, davijasattama

5890.text:
These horse-facing all eager to fight with Radhey
The Pandavas come calling Brahman from all sides

5893.text:
Then the Pandavas, O king, and the illustrious Panchalash,
seeing Karna, the mighty-armed one, made a loud noise, O Athanandana

5896.text:
All the tigers of the earth have no purpose in life
The most enemy of the Parthians is always a sinful man

5899.text:
They, however, saw all the great chariots running in that manner
The son of Sura was not afraid, nor did he go to Tarasam

5900.text:
Seeing the city-like darkness raised by the sea of troops
Piprisus, undefeated in the battles of your sons

5901.text:
Saikaughena balavan kashiprakari mahabalah
varayam asa tat sainyam samantad, O best of the Bharatas

5902.text:
Then they covered the earth with a rain of arrows
They shot their bows in hundreds and then in thousands
They fought against Radheya Indra like hosts of demons

5903.text:
Then the ears of the earth uttered a rain of arrows
A great rain of arrows struck the Lord from all sides

5905.text:
There I saw the wonderful lightness of the son of Suta
that he was not found in battle by the others in battle

5906.text:
Stop the arrows and the great charioteer of the earth
In the ages, in these umbrellas, in the sword and in the horses
Radhey shot the arrows marked with his own name

5909.text:
They fell on their heads, O king, and with their arms all around
The earth was covered with all the heroes who did not turn away

5910.text:
Hataish cha hanyamanaish cha nishtanadbhisha cha sarvashah
babhuvayodhanam raudram vaivasvatapuraopamam

5912.text:
He fights in battle, Karna bitten by all the earth
Look at this army of Darvati, struck by Karna's arrows
Destroyed by Kartikeya like a demonic army

5913.text:
Seeing this defeated army in battle, Karna wisely
rushed to kill this terrible son of Suta

5916.text:
Seeing Kaunteya coming, Vritra, like a god's army,
fought against him, then Karna, as Indra, the wind of the enemy

5917.text:
[Dhru]
Seeing the enraged Phalguna, he was like a destroyer of time
The ears of Vaikartana, the thread, returned, what was the answer

5918.text:
That horse did not compete with Partha, always a great charioteer
and hoped to win the terrible battle in the fierce

5919.text:
He, however, suddenly found him, the ever-extremely hostile
Karna, the thread of Vaikartana, what answer did he give

5920.text:
[He]
Seeing the Pandavas coming, the elephant returned to the elephant as
the more unconfused Karna returned to Dhananjaya

5921.text:
Tama apatantam vegena vaikartana ajihmagai
varayam asa tejasvi pandava shatrutapana

5922.text:
Tam Karna covered him with a net of arrows, and Maris
pierced him, well angry, with arrows from the ships of Ajihmagai

5924.text:
Parahinot Sutaputraya tarinshatam shatrutapana
vivyadha chainam samrabdho banenaikaena viryavan

5925.text:
As if laughing with a strong arrow at the tip of his left arm
the bow of Karach fell with the speed of his wound

5927.text:
The rain of arrows, however, was released by the son of Suta, Bharatha
vayadhamacha with the rain of arrows, as if Dhananjaya did not

5930.text:
Then Partha, the great archer, seeing Karna's prowess
cut his bow in the fist with a quick spear

5931.text:
Asvansha cha chaturo bhallair anayad yamasadanam
sarathesh cha shirah kayad aharacha chhatrutapana

5934.text:
Seeing Radheya defeated, the Tavakas, O best of the Bharatas
Dhananjaya, were pierced by their arrows and fled in ten directions

5936.text:
Alam darutena va shuras tihva katriyarabha
Esha Partha vadhyham savayam gacchami sanyughe
Aham parthaa haishyami sapanchla sa somakan

5941.text:
For the falcon will not bear the others when he reaches my strength
as the sea will bear the sharks when it reaches the shore

5943.text:
Seeing the mighty-armed man passing by, Sharadvata then
approached Ashvatthama and spoke these words

5944.text:
This king is mighty-armed, impatient and angry,
he wants to fight Phalguna, believing in the behavior of a moth

5945.text:
Stop the Kauravas as long as we are watching the old Partha
not leave the tiger of men

5946.text:
Until Phalguna reaches the range of arrows
Kauravas, earthly heroes, stop him from the worst

5947.text: As long as the king is not burnt to ashes by the horrible arrows of Partha, like the serpent, let us stop the war

5949.text:
I think it is rare to live with the crown of the Kauravas
fighting with Partha and the elephant with the tiger

5951.text:
You should not go to battle in Gandhara while I am alive
Ignoring me, O Kauravas, your ever-well-wisher

5952.text:
You should not be confused about the victory of Partha
I will stop Partha, stay, Suyodhana

5953.text:
[Dur]
The teacher protects the sons of Pandu as his sons
You also neglect them always, O best of the gods

5954.text:
My or slow fortune, slow your prowess in battle
Dharmaraja, for the sake of Pariya or Daraupadya, we do not know then

5955.text:
Woe to my greedy one for whom all my relatives
deserving happiness are defeated in the utmost suffering

5957.text:
Ashwaththama, please destroy these my enemies
Even the gods are able to stand in your weapons, O sinless one

5958.text:
Kill Panchala and Somakansha, Darone Sahanugana
We will kill the rest, protected by you

5961.text:
In the beginning or if or later your actions are destroyed
tavam utpanto mahabaho panchalanam vadham parati

5962.text:
You will do the whole world Apanchalam Kilachyuta
Thus the Siddhas said and the words will be and then and so

5963.text:
They are not able to stand in the 'satragochara, O gods, he is Vasava
What u Partha and Sapanchala are true this is my word

5964.text:
[He]
Thus addressed by Duryodhana, Daraunir said to Ahavadurmada
He replied, O mighty-armed one, as you say, O Kauravas

5965.text:
Pariya hi pandava nitya mama chapi pitusha cha me
tathaivavan pariyau tesam na tu yuddhe kurudvaha
shaktitas tata yudhyamasa tayktva paranaan abhitavat

5966.text:
I, Karna, Shalya, Kripa and Hardikya, will
destroy the Pandava army in a moment, O King

5967.text:
Te chapi kauravi sena nimeshaardhata kurudvaha
kasapayeyur mahabaho na sayam yadi sanyuge

5968.text:
Let us fight the Pandavas with their strength and let them fight us
The tejas of the tejas reach the parasham, O Bharatha

5970.text:
Fighting for their own sake, those capable sons of Pandu
Why won't your armies kill them, O Bharatha

5971.text:
You are the most greedy king, the deceitful and the Kauravas
the most suspicious and the most proud, and therefore you are the most suspicious of the same

5973.text:
I will fight with my enemies and conquer the best of the best
I will fight with the Panchalas, the Somas, the Kekayas and
the Pandavas in battle for your pleasure, O Arindam

5975.text:
Today the king, the son of Dharma, will see my prowess
Ashvatthama and this world will think of him with the Somas

5976.text:
Yuddhisthira, the son of Dharma, will come in despair
seeing the Panchalas killed in numbers with the Somas

5982.text:
They were killed in battle by the Panchalas and
leaving Darauni in battle they fled in ten directions

5983.text: Dhrishtadyumna, the great king of Darauni, rushed to battle with the brave Panchalas at Darvata

5984.text:
Then that water-cloud of golden figures
surrounded by a hundred mighty chariots of unstoppable chariots

5985.text:
Dhrishtadyumna, the son of the king of Panchal, the great charioteer
Daraunim, saw the words of the warriors and dropped them

5989.text:
So 'very angry, like a trampled serpent,
the proud Darauni spoke, unconfused, archer

5991.text:
Darounir thus addressed the parshatam paraveeraha
chhadayam asa banaughaih samantal laghuhastavat

5992.text:
He was covered in battle by Darauni, mad about war
Then the son of Panchala threatened Darauni with words

5993.text:
You don't know my promise to be a brahmin and so
If you kill Darona, I will kill you, you wicked one
Then I will not kill you today, Darona is alive in battle

5996.text:
He who leaves the Brahmanical religion and becomes a devotee of the Kshatriya religion
is to be killed by all the worlds as you, O vile man

6000.text:
The mighty-armed man did not tremble, relying on patience
He released arrows and various arrows on the horse

6002.text: The Siddhas and Charanavatikas worshiped the terrible and terrible battle between the Darauni and his followers

6003.text:
They filled the sky with streams of arrows and
they fought unnoticed, making the darkness dark with their arrows

6004.text:
As if dancing in battle, bows in circles
killing each other, trying to conquer each other

6010.text:
Panchalsha chaiva tan sarvan banaih sannataparvabhih
vayadravayad ameyatma shatasho 'tha sahasrasah

6012.text:
The great charioteer of the Panchalas killed hundreds of hundreds
The great charioteers of the Panchalas killed with sharp arrows

6016.text:
He killed many brave men and became Ashvatthama
At the end of the age the fire burned all beings

6017.text:
Worshiped in battle by the Kauravas; conquering thousands of enemies in numbers
The son of Darona became very powerful; as Surendra killed the enemies

6018.text:
[Then]
Then Yudhisthira and Bhimasena and the Pandavas
surrounded the son of Darona, O great king

6021.text:
Abhishahan Shursena Kshatriya Yuddhadurmadana
nikritya prithivim chakre Bhima shonitakardamam

6022.text:
Yodheyaratta Rajanyana Madrakansha Cha Gana Yudhi
Parahino Mrityulokaaya Kiriti Nishitaih Sharaih

6023.text:
Paragadham anjo gatibhira narachair abhipiditah
nipetura davirada bhuma davishrnga iva mountains

6026.text: There was a tumultuous sound on the chariot of the horse, frightened by the slain, strike and cut off the sword

6029.text:
Then Kiriti and Bhima suddenly turned away
taking your strength with a great chariot family

6030.text:
The terrible demon Vrikodara on the right side and the wolf on the north
rained down great streams of arrows on Bharadwaja

6032.text:
So did the charioteers of your son, the destroyers of the enemy
They went with a great army against the chariot of Daron

6035.text:
That great army, pierced by the arrows of the son of Pandu,
rushed everywhere in a world covered with darkness

6038.text:
I will not kill the enemy in battle, the Bahlika, the Kauravas,
I will turn away from the battle, O Suta, this is my word

6039.text:
Then he communicated to the Sandhavans that the mighty
horses of the color of the conchshell exceeded all words in battle

6042.text:
Vimunchan sharavarshani parjanya iva vrishtiman
chhadayam asa shaineyam jalado bhaskaram yatha

6043.text: Unconcerned in battle, Satyaki covered the Kuru leader with floods of arrows all around, O best of the Bharatas

6045.text:
Tav anyonyam sharih krittau vayarajetam nararshabhau
supushpau pushpasamaye pushpitava iva kimsukau

6046.text:
Make all your limbs covered with blood and hands of Vrishni fame
Let them look at each other as if they were burning eyes

6047.text:
Rathamandala margeshu charantava arimardanau
ghorarupau hi tava astan vrishkimantava ivambudau

6049.text:
Suvarnapunkhaira ishubhira achitau tau vayarochatam
khadyotaira avritau rajan paravrishiva vanaspati

6051.text:
Then in battle, Maharaja Somadatta, the great charioteer
cut the great bow of Madhava with the crescent moon

6054.text:
Then with another spear he cut the golden flag
In the battle of Bahlika, O king, Satyaki seemed to laugh at others

6055.text:
Somadatta saw your unconcerned Ketu and dropped it
The army gathered twenty-five arrows

6056.text:
Even Satvata, angry in battle, cut off the bow of Somadatta's bow
with a sharp sword in battle

6057.text:
Athainam rukmapunkhanam shatena nataparvanam
Achinod bahudha rajan bhagnadanshtram iva davipam

6060.text:
Bhima killed Bahlika's son with ten for the sake of Satvata
Somadatta, too, unconcerned, killed Shaineya with arrows

6063.text:
He fell in two pieces, a spear of iron, great
like a mountain, with a great peak thunderbolt

6065.text:
Chaturbhis tu sharais turnam chaturas turagattaman
samipam pareshayam asa paretarajasya bharata

6066.text:
The charioteer's head was bowed with a spear from his body
Jahara rathashardula parahasan shinipungava

6067.text:
Then he shot an arrow, very terrible, burning like fire
The Satvata Rajan shot a golden-winged stone

6068.text:
Sa vimukto balavata shaineyena sharottamah
ghoras tasyorasi vibho nippatashu bharata

6070.text:
Seeing Somadatta killed there, the great charioteers
attacked Yuyudhana with a great shower of arrows

6076.text:
Then the earth struck Darona with a thousand arrows
The chariot of the horse-drawn carriage seemed wonderful

6078.text:
Then, regaining consciousness in a moment, the great demon
overwhelmed with anger, discharged the weapon of the wind

6079.text:
Unconcerned then Partha drew his bow and became valiant
Then he struck the weapon with the weapon in battle, O Bharatha

6081.text:
Uparamasva yuddhaaya Daronaad Bharatasattam
Gridhyate hi sada Darano garahane tava sanyuge

6082.text:
I don't think it's right to fight him with you
He who created him for destruction will kill this corpse

6083.text:
Avoid the Guru and go where King Suyodhana
Bhima and the chariot tiger are fighting with the Kauravas

6084.text:
Hearing the words of Vasudeva, Dharmaraja Yudhisthira
thought for a moment and then struck a terrible blow

6085.text:
Parayad darutam amitraghno yatra bhima vayavasthitah
vinighnans tavakan yodhan vayaditasya ivantakah

6086.text:
Rathaghoshena mahata nadayan vasudhatalam
parjanya iva gharmanthe nadayan vai disho dasha

6088.text:
[He]
in the present and terrible form of battle
in a world covered with darkness and dust, the king
did not see the warriors standing in battle with each other

6089.text:
The battle of the noun by inference is the greatest
the slaughter of men, elephants and horses, the most hairy

6091.text:
The armies being killed by those great chariots
the brahmins fled from all sides in darkness and dust

6093.text:
Maharata sahasrani jaghnur anyonyam ahave
Ande tamasi moodhani putrasya tava mantrite

6094.text:
Then all the armies of the army and the cowboys of India
were confused in the battle there covered with darkness

6096.text:
How did you shine upon them or my armies again
The world was covered with darkness and Sanjaya

6097.text:
[Dhru]
Then all the troops that were left defeated by the Vai
sena ordered the guards and re-arranged the army

6099.text:
Spoke to all the infantry; Duryodhana, before the earthly consolation,
left all his supreme weapons; took in his hands the burning lamps of the enemy

6103.text:
In the light of the others, however, and in the white woman; Darona, like fire, reigned all around the city
Rajendra Suvarnavarma; the sun went into the middle like a garland of rays

6105.text:
Gadash and Shaikya and Parighash are white; They are twisted in chariots by Shaktish
Azamidh with the rays of the other light; They generate again and again the lights

6108.text:
The yellow weapons were sprinkled with blood; the thin trees washed by the heroes
defeated the bright light there; like lightning in the sky at the end of the heat

6119.text:
The chariots and horses of the crowd were bright; the enraged warrior struck the fleeing horse
The great force of the army of the chariots and horses; the army of the gods and demons became equal

6120.text:
Tacha chhakti sanghakula chandavatam; maharathabhram rathavaji ghosham
shastraughavarsham rudhirambudharam; nishi paravrttam naradeva yuddham

6121.text:
In that great fire-like great soul; the Pandavas, the chief of the brahmins, who tormented him
gabhastibhira madhyagato yatharka; varshatyaye tadvad abhun narendra

6124.text:
And with thousands of other lamps burning all around
then the earth shone like a dayur garhair in India

6125.text:
Ulka shataih parajvalitai ranbhunir vayarajat
dahyamaneva lokanaam abhave vai vasundhara

6126.text:
All directions were illuminated by others' lamps all around
the rain seemed like trees covered with lightning in others' fault

6129.text: Then Arjuna, the greatest of the Kauravas, with the speed of his army, destroyed all the earth

6130.text:
[Dhr]
In that otherwise enraged army of my son
What was in your mind then that you could not bear the invincibility

6131.text:
What did the armies think of the enemy's heat when they entered
and what did Duryodhana think of the time to do it?

6132.text:
Ke chainam samare viram paratyudyayu arindamam
ke 'rakshanam dakshinam chakram ke cha daronasya savyata

6133.text:
Who behind the horse became the hero of the hero fighting
Who went forward to kill the enemy in battle

6134.text:
Yata paravishan maheshvasah panchalan aparajitah
nrityanna iva naravyaghro rathamareshu viryavan

6135.text:
Dadaha ca sharaira darona panchalanam rathavrajana
Dhumaketura iva karuddhah sa katham mrityum eeyivan

6136.text:
Avyagrana eva hi paraan akthayasya aparajitan
hatansha chaiva vishannaansha cha viprakirnaansha cha shansasi
rathino virathansha chaiva kritan yuddhshu mamakan

6137.text:
[Dhru]
Duryodhana, the great king, spoke to his submissive brothers that night, knowing the opinion of Darona and wanting to fight

6138.text:
Vikarna, Chitrasena, the mighty-armed Kauravas,
the invincible and the long-armed, and those who followed them

6141.text:
Acharya hi susanyatta bhrisham yattasha cha pandavah
tam rakshata susanyatta nighnantam shatravan rane

6142.text:
Darono hi balavan yuddhe kasiprahastah parakrami
nirjayet taridashan yuddhe kim u parthan sa somkan

6143.text:
They are all great charioteers with you
Protect Daron from Panchalya and Dhrishtadyumna from the great chariots

6145.text:
I think with all his soul that he will protect Bharadwaja
He will kill the Gupta Somakas and the Srinjayans and the Sarajakas

6151.text:
Arjuna and the army of the Kauravas and Arjuna and the Kauravas
oppressed each other with various weapons

6153.text:
Pandupanchal senanam kauravanam cha marisha
Asin nishtanako ghoro nighnatam itaretaram

6156.text:
He said to the Pandavas and the Panchalans,
Abhyadravat gacchadhva Daronama eva jighansya

6159.text:
Kritavarma ca hardikyo yudhisthiram upadhravat
daronam parati jighansantam matto mattama iva davipam

6160.text:
The army was scattering arrows all around
The Kauravas attacked, O king, at the head of the battle

6161.text:
Sahadevam athayantam darona parepsum maharatham
karno vaikartano rajana varyam asa pandavam

6162.text:
Bhimasena athayantam vayaditasyam ivantakam
Svayam Duryodhana yuddhe paratipam mrityu avrajat

6164.text:
Shikhandinam athayantam rathena rathinam varam
kripo sharadvato rajan varayam asa sanyuge

6165.text:
Parativindyam athayantam mayurasadharma hayaih
Duhshasana maharaja yatto yattama avarayat

6166.text:
Bhaimasenim athayantam maya shatavishardam
Ashwatthama, honoring his father, refused

6167.text:
Darupadam vrishasena tu sa sainyam sapadanugama
varayam asa samare darona parepsum maharatham

6168.text: After the death of Darona, who was coming from the greatest distance, the king of Madras was very angry, Bharatha

6169.text:
Shatanikam athayantam nakulin ramsam rane
Chitrasena rurodhashu sharair darona vadhepsya

6170.text:
Arjuna and the best of the warriors, the great charioteer who was running away,
Alambuso, the great king of the demons, sent him away

6171.text: Thus in the enemy battle, Dhritadyumna, who was shooting the great archer Darona, stopped him in a happy form

6172.text:
Tathanyan Panduputranam samayatan maharathana

6173.text:
The elephant riders quickly approached the elephants and appeared to be fighting in the great battle

6174.text:
At night the horses, O king, did not run at each other

6177.text:
Kritavarma tu hardikyo dharmaputram yudhisthiram

6178.text:
Yuddhisthira, however, pierced the heart with five quick spears

Madhava, however, was struck in battle by the son of Dharma, Marisha

6182.text:
His Partha cut off his bow and cut off the water from his hands and

6184.text:
Akshnor in a moment he took his bow

6185.text:
His power, the immeasurable Pandavas, like a serpent

6186.text:
That golden-coloured great woman, surrounded by the Pandavas,

6188.text:
Then in battle the brave Vrishni, the best charioteer

Then the eldest of the Pandavas gave him a sword and leather
Then he struck Madhava with his sharp arrows in battle

6192.text:
Then he shot down the son of Dharma with a hundred arrows

6193.text:
Heartfelt arrow-cut shield of that great soul

6196.text:
[S]
Bhuris tu samare rajan shaineyam rathinam varam
Apatantam apasedhat parapanad iva kunjaram

6197.text:
Then Satyaki, angry, struck him with five sharp arrows
and his blood quickly flowed into his heart

6198.text: That is how the Kauravas struck Shaineya in battle with ten sharp arrows in his arms

6199.text:
Tav anyonyam maharaja tatakshate sharair bhrisham

6200.text:
Tayor asin maharaja shastravarshtih sudaruna

6202.text: Then the angry Maharaja Shaineya, as if laughing at others, cut the bow of the great Kauravas in battle

6203.text: Then he struck him with nine sharp arrows in the heart of the broken bowman, and said to him,

6204.text:
He was overwhelmed by the strong enemy, the enemy's heater
He took the bow from another place and struck Satvata back

6205.text: He pierced the Satvata with his arrows and cut the bow with a sharp spear as if laughing

6206.text:
Maharaja Satyaki, with his bow broken, was overcome with anger
and defeated the mighty power of the other in his great chest

6207.text:
He, however, fell down with various limbs by his power, O best of chariots

6211.text:
Having said this, the angry red-eyed demon rushed at the enemy hero
Darauni, angry like a lion at an elephant

6212.text:
Ghatotkacha rained down arrows on the axes of his chariot

6214.text:
Then with hundreds of arrows, sharp and piercing,

6215.text:
Sa sharair achitas tena rakshasa ranmurdhani

Kashurapraira ardhachandraish cha narachaih sa shilimukhaih

6219.text:
Suduhsaha sharaira ghoraira divyastrapratimantryaih

6220.text:
Then the battle of arrows in the sky became like another

6221.text:
Then the sparks of the struggle of the satra appeared all around

6223.text:
Then the battle ensued between the Darauni and the demons

6225.text:
He was struck by the swimming demon, mighty
He moved in battle like a tree blown by the wind

6229.text:
Mumochakarna purnena dhanusha sharam uttamam

6230.text:
He pierced the heart of that demon with the best of arrows

So 'atividdho maharaja rathopastha upavishta

6234.text:
Worshipped by your sons and by all the warriors, O Bharatha
