6238.text: Then King Duryodhana struck Bhima with five letters and said,

Bhima cut his bow and flag with nine arrows
and struck the best of the Kauravas with nine bowed mountains

6241.text:
Bhima killed them with his arrows, Duryodhana dropped his bow

6244.text:
Even then his bow cut the sword like a small hand
the second and third and fourth and fifth and so on

6245.text:
Attam attam maharaja bhimasya dhanura achchinata
tava putro maharaja jitkashi madotkata

6247.text:
The Kauravas cut that power to pieces without receiving it

6248.text:
Then Bhima, the great king, threw his heavy club, Mahaprabha,
and with great speed, Duryodhana turned on his chariot

6249.text:
Then he suddenly struck the horse in the battle of your son

6251.text:
Then Bhima, thinking that your son Maharatham was dead,

6252.text:
The Tawakas and the soldiers thought the king was dead
Then they all cried out,

6253.text:
And when they heard the roar of all the warriors,
hearing the roar of Bhimasena, O king, the great soul

6255.text:
The Panchalas, Kekaya, Matsya, Srinjaya and Visham Pate
Arvodyagenabhijagmura Daronama eva Yuyutsaya

6256.text:
There was a great battle between Darona and the enemy
They killed each other in the darkness

6257.text:
[S]
Sahadevam Athayantam Darona Parepsum Visham Pate

6258.text:
Sahadevas, however, pierced Radheya with nine arrows

6259.text:
His ear struck him again with a hundred bowed arrows
and he quickly cut his bow strung with a small hand

6261.text:
His ears killed the horse with arrows bent at the ends

6263.text:
Then he sent a heavy, terrible golden mace

6267.text:
Tam apatantam suddenly the cycle of time is raised

6268.text:
In that great wheel, however, Sahadeva abandoned the battle, being
warned by the arrows

6269.text:
Tama abhidrutya radheyo muhurtad bharatarshabha

6274.text:
Sahadevas then, O king, was pierced by the arrows of Vimana

6275.text:
Aruroha ratham chapi pancalyasya mahatmana

6276.text:
Virata saha sena tu darutam agatama daronaarthe

6277.text:
They fought in battle with strong bows

6278.text:
Madrarajo maharaja virata vahinipatim

6279.text:
The king struck him again with nine sharp arrows

6280.text:
The king of Madras killed him and the four charioteers

6282.text:
Shatanika then saw his brother's dead chariot

6283.text:
Shatanikam athayantam madrarajo mahamridhe

6284.text:
Tasminsa tu nihate veere virata rathasattamah

6287.text:
So 'atividdho maharaja rathopastha upavishat
Kashmalam chavishat tivram virato bharatarshabha

6288.text:
Then that great army fled at night, India
slain by hundreds of arrows, and by the battle of Shobhi

6291.text:
A horse with faces and vampires with terrible appearances
The red-wet flag is adorned with red garlands
The black iron time is a terrible bearskin covered with great

6294.text:
There was a very intense battle between the humans and the demons
The spectators were delighted by all, O best of the Bharatas

6295.text:
Arjuna struck him with a hundred birds
and with ninety sharp arrows he cut off the highest flag

6296.text:
Charathim cha taribhira banais taribhira eva tarivenukam

6301.text:
[S]
Shatanika sharais turnam nirdahantam chamun tava

6302.text: Nakulish struck Chitrasena with a spear and struck him with ten sharp arrows

6303.text:
Chitrasena Maharaja killed Shatanika again in battle

6304.text:
Naculus was gathering his arrows from his armor with bent edges

6305.text:
So 'petavarma putras te viraraja bhrisham nripa

Then Nakuli cut the flag with sharp arrows

While he was doing his deed, Nakula's son cut off his bow adorned with gems in battle

Darupadam tu sahanikam darona parepsum maharatham

6316.text:
Tava ubhau sharanunnangau sharakantakinau rane

6317.text:
Rukmapunkhaira ajihmagraih sharaish chinnatanuchchadau

Vrishasena then, O king, pierced Darupada with nine arrows

6320.text:
Then he shot thousands of arrows and then
Karna's son, O great king, shone like a cloud raining down

6321.text:

6323.text:
Tathangadair nipatitaira vayarajata vasundhara

Parativindhyam atha karuddham paradahantam rane ripun

Parativindhya tu samare kurvaanam karma dushkaram

6332.text:
He was overpowered by your mighty son with his bow

The charioteer and his spear were cut down

The flag and the sky he quivered and the rays and the yokes

He then floated the chariot, son of the moon, the bright

6345.text:

6346.text:
Tava ubhau samare shurau sharakantakinau tada

They looked at Sujihm and, O king, with their eyes wide open

6349.text:
Nakula, however, was severely wounded by your bow

6350.text:
Seeing the enemy proud of the most hostile Tathagata
The bird roared like a cloud at the end of the heat of the kings

6352.text:
The angry bird struck the bird with sixty, O best of the Bharatas

6353.text:
Then he cut the arrow and the bow in his fist
and he cut the sword quickly and threw it from the chariot to the ground

Shikhandinam tu samare darona parepsum visham pate

Gautama darutam ayantam daronantikam arindamam

Ratrish cha Bharatashrestha yodhanam yuddhashalinam

His angry king Kripa threw his power at the terrible

6365.text:
Shikhandi cut her off as she fell with many arrows

6366.text:
Athanyad dhanura adaya gautamo rathinaam varah

6368.text:
Sidantam chainam alokya kripah sharadvato yudhi

That is how your sons also surrounded Davijottama

And the chariots, O king, did not run towards each other in battle

6372.text:
Darvatam saadinam chaiva gajanam cha visham pate

6374.text:
Ratha rathan samasadya paradruta vegavattaram

That night, O best of Bharatas, illuminated by other lamps

6382.text:
In that tumultuous battle, present at nightfall,

6383.text:
A son and a father, a friend and a friend, and
a relative and a relative and a maternal uncle

6384.text:
Save savan pare paransh chapi nijaghnur itaretaram

6385.text:
[S]
Tasmin sutumule yuddhe vartamane bhayavahe
Dhrishtadyumna maharaja Daronama evabhyavartata

6386.text:
Wiping the bow, he pulled the best of the victory again and again

6388.text:
Thatha parivrittam drishtha daronam acharya sattamam

Then Maharaja Panchalya pierced Darona with five arrows

6391.text:
That Darona with twenty-five struck him in the battle of India
He cut off his bow with another spear, his great splendour

6397.text:
Tam tu sayakam aprapta acharya's chariot turned
Karna cut the kingdom into twelve pieces with his hands

6399.text:
But cutting off the arrow in battle with arrows bent at the ends

6400.text:
The five sons of Darona, but all Darona and seven

6401.text:
Duryodhana and Shakuni with twenty and five
Panchalya Tavaritavidhyan all the great charioteers

6402.text:
He was wounded by seven heroes in the battle to save Darona
All of them, without hesitation, O king, struck back with their swords
He struck Darona, Darauni, Karna and your son

6404.text:
Darumasena, however, was enraged and struck the king with a leaf

6406.text:
Bhallenanyena tu punah suvarnojjvala kundalam

6407.text:
That head fell to the ground with its bitten lips in battle

6410.text:
So 'nayad dhanuh samadaya karodharaktekshana shavasana
abhyavarshacha chharaughais tam Dhrishtadyumna mahabalam

6412.text:
We celebrate Dhrishtadyumna, who has been rewarded by the six warrior soldiers

6415.text:
Satyakira Maharaja struck him with ten arrows
and told him to stand behind all the heroes as they watched

6416.text:
That Satyakesa, however, was strong and the great Karna
had a meeting as terrible as that of Balivasavayora

6417.text: The bull of the Kshatriyas, the bull of the Kshatriyas, struck back the ear of the lotus-eyed Satyaki with the thunder of the sword

6418.text:
Shaking with a cry like a bow, the earth was strong
The son of Suta fought back against Maharaja Satyaki

6419.text:
Vipatha karninarachaira vatsa dantaih kashuraira api

6421.text:
Tavakasha and Maharaja Karna and his sons were bitten
They quickly struck Satyaki with sharp arrows all around

6422.text:
Astraira astrani sanvarya tesam karnasya chabhibho
Avidyata satyaki karuddho vrishasena satantara

6429.text:
Hearing the roar of the chariot and the sound of Gandhi

6430.text:
This is the great Gandhivaninda who killed all the Shibins and the chiefs and the kings

6431.text:
The sound of the chariot begins and the roar of Vasava

6433.text:
The clouds blown by the wind are torn apart

6434.text:
The arrows sent by Gandhi of the warrior chiefs of the Darvas
The hundreds of kings who were wounded began to roar greatly
In the night the royal tiger satnayitnor in the sky

6435.text:
The roar of the roar and the roar of the lion are abundant
Hear the words of many kinds on Arjuna's chariot

6438.text:
If we kill Satyaki and Dhrush Dayumna and his associates
Undoubtedly, Maharaja, we will have victory

6439.text:
Saubhadravada, surround these heroes and great charioteers

6440.text:
Savyasachi puro 'bhayeti daronanikaya bharata
sansaktam satyaki janatva bahubhih kurupungavaih

6441.text:
Let many of the best charioteers go there
until Partha knows that Satyaki is surrounded by many

6442.text:
They hurry like brave men in the release of arrows
As quickly as this otherworldly Madhava is fighting

6444.text: Surrounded by thousands of elephants and ten thousand chariots, go to Dhananjaya

6446.text:
Kill Krishna, O mighty warrior, Dharmaraja, his maternal uncle
akula, Sahadeva and Bhimasena, O Bharatha

6447.text:
O lord of the gods, my hope of victory is in you
Kill your maternal uncle Kaunteya and the demons like Pavaki

6448.text:
Thus said Partha, thy son Saubala,
with a great army, and thy sons, O lord

6451.text:
Abhyaat tavaritam yuddhe kirana sharashatan bahun

6455.text:
Athainam koshtaki krityasarvatas te maharathah
singhanadansa tad chakrus tarjayantah sama satyakim

6458.text:
There the heroic great archer Satyakira, mad for battle,
cut off his head with fierce arrows bent at the ends

6460.text:
Patitaish Chamaraish Chaiva Shavetach Chhatraish Cha Bharata
Bhuva Dharani Purna Nakshatrair Dayaur Iva Parabho

6462.text:
The earth was filled with that great sound
night became intense and frightening

6463.text:
Seeing the tearing force, Yuyudhana shot the arrows
and heard the loud noise that shocked the hair in the night

6464.text:
Sutas tavabravid rajan sarathim rathinaam varah
Yatraisa shabdasa tatrashvansha chodayeti punah punah

6465.text:
Tena sanchodyamanasa tu tat tans turagottaman

6466.text:
Then Duryodhana, angry and strong-armed, conquering the fatigue

6468.text:
Duryodhana was thus wounded by the same arrows as before
She struck him back with ten arrows in anger

6469.text:
Then there arose a tumultuous battle, O best of the Bharatas

6470.text:
Shaineyas tu rane karuddhas tava putram maharatham

6471.text:
Then he drove his chariot in battle with arrows and took Yamakshayam

6472.text:
Hatashve tu rathe tishtana putras tava visham pate

6473.text:
Five hundred arrows, but Shaineya, with his hands,

6475.text:
Viratho vidhanushkasha cha sarvalokesvara parabhu
Aruroha ratham turnam bhasvaram kritavarmanah

6476.text:
Duryodhane paravrtte Shaineyas tava vahinim

6480.text:
Then in battle the brave bird Saubala then
struck Arjuna with sharp arrows as if laughing at him

6481.text:
Punash chaiva shatenasya sanrurodha maharatham
tam arjuna tu vinshatya vivyadha yudhi bharata

6482.text:
Athetaran maheshvasans taribhis taribhir avidhyat
sanvarya tan banaganair yudhi rajan dhananjayah
avadhit tavakan yodhan vajrapanir ivasuran

6483.text:
Bhujaish chinnaira maharaja sharisha cha sahasrasah
samastirna dhara tatra babhau pushpaira ivachitah

6485.text:
The dark owl thus struck Vasudeva
The roar filled the earth with a great roar

6486.text:
Arjuna, however, went quickly and cut off the bow of Shakuni
and took four horses to the house of Yama

6488.text:
Tava ekaratham arodhau pita putrau maharathau
Partham sishichatura banaira girim meghava ivotthitau

6489.text:
They were pierced by the great Pandavas with sharp arrows
and they drove away your army with hundreds of arrows

6490.text:
As the clouds are torn apart by the wind
they are torn apart by the wind, so, O king, are the forces of the seat of the world

6493.text:
Vijitya samare yodhans tavakan bharatarshabha
dadhmatura muditau shankhau vasudevadhananjayau

6495.text:
Tan nidhaaya dhanura nide daronah kshatriya mardanah
Aade 'nayad dhanuh shuro vegavat saravattaram

6496.text:
Dhrishtadyumna then struck Darona with seven arrows
and struck the charioteer with five arrows, O king, in battle

6499.text:
Ubhayoh senor madhye narashvadvipavahini
yatha vaitarani rajan yama rashtrapuram parati

6501.text:
Then Dhrishtadyumna and Shikhandi
Yama and Yuyudhana and Vrikodara blew their great conches

6502.text:
Having conquered thousands of chariots, the great chariots of the Tavakas
roared like lions and the Pandavas conquered Kashi

6503.text:
You see the madness of your son and Karna
and of the brave Darona and Darunaesh, O lord of the world

6505.text:
Approaching suddenly Karna and Darona, the best of the conquerors
The eloquent man, who was overcome with anger, spoke the words

6506.text:
You and Karudha have started the battle here
Seeing Saindhava killed in battle by Savyasachi

6509.text:

direction and it seemed wonderful

Pinakaih karavalairsha cha tomaraprasakampanaih
narachair nishitaira bhallaih sharaish chakraih parasvadhaih

6837.text:
Ayo gudair bhindipalair goshirsholukhalair api
autpatya cha mahashakhair vividhair jagati ruhaih

6838.text:
Shami Peelu Curry and Shamyakaish and Bharat
Ingudair and Badri and Kovidara and Pushpita

6839.text:
Palashair Arimedaish cha palakshnyagrodhapippalaih
mayadbhih samare tasminn anyonyam abhijaghnatuh

6841.text:
Yuddham tad abhavad ghoram bhimya alayudhayor nripa
harindrayor yatha rajan valisugrivayoh pura

6845.text:
Then he attacked and spun around with speed and struck the demon with
force and struck the head of Hadimbash Chakarta

6847.text:
Seeing the huge-bodied goat-relative Arindamam killed,
the Panchalas and the Pandavas roared with the roar of a lion

6848.text: Then the Pandavas played thousands of drums and thousands of conches and fell on that demon

6849.text:
Very that night they became victorious
The lights shone all around

6850.text:
Alayudha's head was thrown unconscious by the mighty Bhaimasenir
Duryodhana's other face

6851.text:
Then King Duryodhana, seeing the slain Alayudham
was greatly disturbed with his army, O Bharatha

6853.text:
The earthlings thought he should be killed by him
and his brothers thought he would live for a long time

6857.text: Seeing the mighty Bhaimasena poisoned by the weapon, the mighty-armed Karna attacked the Panchalas

6858.text:
Dhrishtadyumna divided the two Shikhandi with ten arrows
firmly thrown full-length and with bowed wings

6859.text:
Then with the supreme arrows, Yudhamanyuttamaujasa
satyaki and the charioteer were shaken by the arrows

6860.text:
They practiced there all left and right
circles other bows we saw, O lord of the people

6862.text:
Jayanemighoshastanayitnumana vai; dhanus tadin mandalaketushringah
sharaughavarshakula vrishtimaansha cha; sangramameghah sa babhuva rajana

6864.text:
Then with incomparable thunderbolt-falling kalpas; with sharp arrows and golden-picture feathers
the great soul defeated the enemies in battle; Vaikartana, my son, is engaged in your welfare

6866.text:
Avindamanas tava atha sharma sankhye; Yudhisthira te balam anvapadyan
tan pareksha bhagnan vimukhikritans cha; ghatotkacho rosham ati chakre

6867.text:
Asthaya tam kanchanratnachitram; rathottamam lion ivonada
vaikartananam upetya chapi; pivyadha vajrapratimai patkai

6870.text:
Samam hi tava apratim parabhavav; anyonyam ajaghnatur uttamastraih
tayor hi virottamayor na kash chid; dadarsha tasmin samare vishesham

6871.text:
Very tach chitram ati rupam; babhuva yuddham ravibhim sunvoh
samakulam shastranipata ghoram; diviva rahvanshumatoh parataptam

6875.text:
[He]
Knowing the demon in hiding; all the Kurus shouted
How could the demon not be a deceitful warrior; kill Karna in battle invisible

6883.text:
That powerful stone axes; the
rain of swords, thunderbolts and hammers falling hugely and burning; Karna could not kill it with the streams of arrows

6884.text:
The horses were struck by arrows; the elephants were struck by thunderbolts
and the great chariots were struck by stones; there was a great roar as they fell

6885.text:
Subhim nanavidha shastrapataira; ghatotkachenabhihatam samantata
dauryodhana tad balam artrupam; avartamana dadrishe bharamantam

6887.text:
Seeing that monster, most terrible and terrible; raining down great weapons
and dropping a flood of force; great fear entered your sons

6891.text:
Huda bhushundyo 'shamaguda shatadhnya; sathunaa ca karayasa pattanaddha
Avakiransa tava putrasya sai; tatha raudram kamalam paradurasit

6894.text:
In that terrible massacre of the Kuru heroes; in the absence of the Kshatriyas, who were destroyed by time,
they were broken and suddenly fled; all the Kauravas were crying out

6895.text:
Flee, Kurus, this is not it; the gods with Indra are densely pounding us for the sake of the Pandavas
and they are drowning in the Bharatas; there is nothing like the islands there

6898.text:
Then he covered the sky with arrows; fighting the demon with divine magic
Hariman doing the difficult noble deed; the son of Suta was not deluded in battle

6901.text:
Then the dead horse descended and rode; within his mind the Kurus fled
the divine weapon was killed by illusion; he did not think of the right time

6903.text:
What will you do to us, Bhima Partha; kill this demon who is falling in the night
He who will free us from the terrible form of the battle; he will fight us in battle with the Partha

6907.text:
Yasau rajan nihita varshapoogan; vadhayajau satkrita phalgunasya
yam vai paradata sutaputraya shakra; shaktim sharestham kundalabhya nimaya

6908.text: That power of the Lelihas, which burned like a volcano in the night of death, with ropes; Vaikartana defeated the demon

6909.text:
Tam uttama parakayapahantri; seeing her stepmother's arms burning
frightened the demon brahmin ran away, O king; making himself the size of the feet of Vindhya

6912.text:
Yudhva chitraira vividhaih shastrapoogaira; divyaira viro manushai rakshasaish cha
nadan nadan vividhan bhairavansha cha; paranaan ishtans tayajitah shakra shaktya

6914.text:
Then they fell from space; that demon king with a broken body on the ground
with his head down, his body stunned and his tongue; Ghatotkacha was the form of great faith

6917.text:
Then Karna, worshiped by the Kurus; as Indra was worshiped by the Maruts when he killed Vritra,
you mounted your son's chariot; and with joy he entered all that army

6921.text:
Then he turned around and again blew up Partha and chased
the chariot and went to Bhima and again Achyutha

6923.text:
Atiharsho 'yam asthane tavadya madhusoodana
shokasthane pare parapte haidimbasya vadhena vai

6924.text:
And the armies turned away and saw Ghatotkacha killed
and we were greatly disturbed by the fall of Haidimba

6927.text:
The confusion of the sea is like the dispersion of Meror
I think your work is so light, O Lord

6929.text:
Shaktim ghatotkachenema vyansayitva mahadyute
karnam nihatama evajau viddhi sadyo Dhananjaya

6930.text:
Shaktihasta punah karnam ko loke 'sati pumana iha
ya enam abhitas tishtet karthikeyam ivahave

6931.text:
Fortunately removed the shield, fortunately taken away the earrings
Fortunately, the power of the infallible Ghatotkache

6932.text:
If it is true that shield and also earrings
Samaran api lokans tarin eka karno jayad bali

6933.text:
Vasava or Kubera or Varuna or Jalesvara
Yamo or not dare to return Karna to battle

6934.text:
Gandhivam ayam bhavansha chakram vaham sudarshanam
na shaktau savo rane jetum tathayuktam nararshabham

6936.text:
Utkritya kavacham yasmat kundale vimale cha te
paradacha chakraya karna vai tena vaikartana samritah

6937.text:
Ashivisha iva karuddhah satambhito mantratejasa
tathadya bhati karno me shaantjval ivanalah

6938.text:
Yada parabhriti karnaya shaktira datta mahatmana
vasavena mahabaho parapta yasau ghatotkache

6939.text:
You covered her with earrings and divine shield
The bull thought you were always killed in battle

6941.text:
He is a brahmin, a truthful man, an ascetic, a man of fixed vows
and a part of mercy even to his enemies, therefore Karna is a bull rich

6942.text:
Yuddhashaundo mahabahura nityodyat sharasanah
kesariva vane mardana mattamatangayuthapana
vimadana rathashardulan kurute ranmurdhani

6944.text:
Tapante toyado yadvacha chardharah kasharatya asau
divyastrajaladah karna parjanya iva vrishtimana
so 'daya manushatam parapto vimuktah shakradatta

6947.text:
Athapare nihata rakshasendra; Hidimbakirmirabakapradhanah
Alayudhah parasainyavamardi; Ghatotkachash chograkarma tarasvi

6948.text:
[Arja]
How is it that for our sake they have killed the earthly gods of Kaish and Yogair Janardana
Jarasandha and others

6949.text:
[Vasu]
Jara Sanghasha Chedirajo Naishadisha Cha Mahabalah
If Sayur were not killed before now Sayur are terrible

6950.text:
Suyodhanas tan apashyam krishuyad rathasattaman
te 'samabhira nityasandushtah sanshrayeyusha cha kauravana

6952.text:
Sutaputro Jarasandhash Chedirajo Nishadajah
Suyodhana samashritya pateran prithivim imam

6953.text:
Yogair api hata yais te tan me shrunu Dhananjaya
Ajaya hi vina yogair mridhe te daivatair api

6954.text:
Ekaiko hi pruthaka tesam samastam suravahinim
yodhayet samare partha lokapalabhirakshitam

6955.text:
Jarasandha hi rushito rauhineya paradharshita
asmaddhartham chikhepa gadam vai lohita mukhim

6957.text:
Seeing her falling, Rohini's son
created the weapon Sathunakarna to counterattack

6958.text:
The club, repulsed by the speed of the weapon, fell to the ground
tearing the earth, shaking the goddess, as if shaking the mountains

6960.text:
For he who was born of medicine and half of his mother's body was joined together separately
by whom he was remembered by Jarasandha

6962.text:
Without the ghost Sagadaya, you see Jarasandha
killed by Bhimasena in the great battle, O Dhananjaya

6963.text:
Yadi hi sayad gadapanira jarasandhah paratapavan
sendra deva na tam hantum rane shakta narottam

6964.text:
For your sake, Naishadir was separated by his thumb
Daron made him his teacher and Satyavikrama in disguise

6966.text:
Ekalabyam hi sangushtam ashakta devadanavah
sa rakshasoragah partha vijetum yudhi karhi chit

6967.text:
Kim u manushmatrena shakyah sayat parativikshitum
Dridhamushtih kriti nityam asyamano divanisham

6970.text:
Tavatsahayo naravyaghra lokanam hitakamya
Hidimbabakakirmira bhimasena patitah
Ravana samaprana brahma yajnavinashanah

6972.text:
If the horse does not kill him in the great battle with Karna's strength
I will kill that Bhaimasenir Ghatotkacha

6973.text:
I have not killed this Yushpat before for the sake of
This is a demon who hates Brahmins and hates sacrifices

6975.text:
Ye hi dharmasya loptaro vadhyas te mama pandava
dharmasansthapanaartha hi paratijnaisa mamavyaya

6976.text:
Brahma, truth, restraint, purity, righteousness, Hari, body, patience, forgiveness
Wherever I enjoy, I swear to you by truth

6978.text:
Vrikodara will also kill Suyodhana in battle
I will tell you the means of killing him too, O Pandava

6979.text:
This sound of your tumultuousness increases against the army
and your troops flee in ten directions

6981.text:
[Dhr]
When the power of killing a hero was in vain in the son of Suta
Why did he not release her, O Partha, leaving all behind

6982.text:
All the Pandavas and Srinjayas were killed in that killing
Why didn't they win the battle by killing a hero

6983.text:
Ahuto na nivarteyam iti tasya mahavrata
savayam aahvayitavya sasutaputrena phalgunah

6984.text:
Then, bringing Davairatham, Shakradatta
did not kill the bull, tell me why, Sanjaya

6986.text:
Ya haya asya parama shaktir jayasya cha parayanam
sa shaktir vasudeva vyansitasya ghatotkache

6987.text:
Kuner yatha hastgatam haried bilvam baliysa
tatha shaktir amogha sa moghi bhuta ghatotkache

6989.text:
If Ghatotkacha kills Dhi Karna; the next gain will be that of the Pandavas
Vaikartana or if he kills him; yet the deed may be done without power

6990.text:
Iti parajna parajnayaitad vicharya; Ghatotkacham sutaputrena yuddhe
Ayodhayad vasudeva nrishimha; pariyam kurvana pandavaanam hitam cha

6992.text:
Ghatotkacham mahaviryam mahabuddhira janardana
Amoghaaya vighatartham rajan durmantrite tava

6993.text:
Then we shall be done, O Kurudvaha
If Krishna does not protect that Partha from the ears of the great chariot

6994.text:
Dhritarashtra fell to the ground with his horse-drawn carriage in battle
without Janardana, Partha, the Lord of the Yogas, the Supreme Lord

6995.text:
Taisa tair upayair bahubhi rakshyamanah sa parthiv
jayatya abhimukhah shatruun partha krishna palitah

6996.text:
That specially your infallible Krishna protected the Pandavas
He will kill the Kaunteya power thrown like thunderbolt to a tree

6997.text:
[Dhru]
The opponent and the evil minister and the wise man is my son
who has overcome this means of killing and triumphs

6998.text:
How is this Gavalgana that has passed you by
This meaning, O great Buddha, that you have not understood

6999.text:
[He]
This is the constant support of Duryodhana and Shakuni and my misrule
night after night

7000.text:
Leave all the corpses and kill Karna Dhananjaya
Then we will devour the Pandu Panchalas

7005.text:
Hanyad yadi hi dasarham karno yadavanandanam
kritsna vasumati rajan vashe te sayana na sanshayah

7009.text:
Anyansh chasmai rathodaran upasthapayad acyuta
Amogha tam katham shaktim infallible iti parabho

7011.text:
And this is the belief in the ear by the power and the immeasurable prowess
Why was she not freed by the son of the charioteer in the month of Phalguna

7012.text:
[Vasu]
Dushasanasha and Karnasha and Shakunisha are the Saindhavas
They are constantly consulting with the same Duryodhana leaders

7013.text:
Karna, Karna, great archer, immeasurable in battle
There is no other power, this is what you should be freed from, O best of the victorious

7017.text:
Aham eva tu Radheyam mohayami yudham vara
yato navasrijacha chaktim pandave shavetavahane

7019.text:
Ghatotkache, however, seeing her young, Shinipungava
I see Dhananjaya today freed from the gap of death

7020.text:
Neither my father nor my mother nor you brothers nor
nor Paranas should be protected as the terrible demon in battle

7021.text:
Tarailokyarajyad yata ki chid bhaved anyata sudurlabham
nechcheyam satvataham tad vina partham dhananjaya

7023.text:
And so in battle I have the demon for the welfare of others
No other horse can disturb Karna in battle at night

7026.text:
Yad ajanit tam shaktim ekaghnim satat rane
anivaryam asahayam cha devaira api sa vasavaih

7027.text:
Why was she not freed by Karna in the battle of the others in the past
not by Devak, her daughter, or by Phalguna, Sanjaya

7033.text:
Krishne va Devakiputre mohito deva maya
Parthe va Shakra kalpe vai vadhartham vasavi parabho

7034.text:
[Dhr]
You have been killed by fate with all your intelligence and by Keshav
For Vasavi has gone and killed the grassy Ghatotkacham

7035.text:
Karnasha and my sons and all the other earthlings
have gone to the destruction of Vaivasvata by this misguided

7037.text:
And those who were the destroyers of the enemy
Srinjayas with the Panchalas did not fight how they fought

7038.text:
Soumadattera vadhad daronaam aistam saidhavasya cha
Amarshaja jivitam tayaktva gahamana varuthinim

7039.text: How did the white creatures rise up again, as if they were yawning like a tiger, like a young tiger, like a deadly wild animal?

7040.text:
Acharya and those who protected Duryodhana and the leaders
Darauni and Karna, my father, did they also do what they did

7041.text:
Bharadwajam jighansantau savyasachi vrikodara
samarchana mamaka yuddhe katham sanjaya shansa me

7042.text:
By the killing of the king of the Indus, by the killing of these Ghatotkachas, they
were angry and well-enraged, and how did they fight at night

7043.text:
[He]
hate Ghatotkache Rajan Karnena nishi rakshase
paranadatsu cha harishteshu tavakashu yuyutsushu

7045.text:
Abravicha cha mahabahura bhimasena parantapah
Avaraya mahabaho Dhritarashtrasya vahinim
Haidimbasyabhighatena moho mama avishan mahaan

7046.text:
After thus instructing Bhima, he sat down on his chariot
The king, his face full of tears, sighed again and again
He entered into distress at the terrible prowess of Karna

7048.text:
Arise, O king, fight that heavy axis, Lord
Your confusion will be your doubt of victory

7049.text:
Hearing the words of Krishna, Dharmaraja Yudhisthira
wiped his eyes with his hands and spoke these words to Krishna

7050.text:
You know, O mighty-armed one, the supreme destination of religion
The fruit of killing a brahmin is that which he has committed and does not understand

7053.text:
On the journey to Gandhamadana, they were equally saved from the fortresses
and Panchali, tired, was carried on her back by the great soul

7054.text:
And the beginning of the wars, which this Lord has done
The difficult deeds done for me by that great soul

7055.text:
Savabhavad ya ca me paritih sahadeve janardana
saiva me daviguna pariti rakshasendra ghatotkache

7056.text:
Bhaktasha cha me mahabahuh pariyo 'syaham pariyasha cha me
yena vindami varshney kashmala shokatapita

7057.text:
Look at the armies, O Varshneya, being torn apart by the Kauravas
and Darona and Karna, armed, look at the great chariots in battle

7058.text:
In the night, see the army of the Pandavas crushed by us
They were as drunk as elephants, as great as the forest of Nada

7059.text:
Ignoring the strength of Bhimasena's arms, Madhava
and the chitrastrata of Partha, the Kauravas are equally victorious

7060.text:
This is Daronasha and Karnasha and King Suyodhana
killing the demon in battle and roaring for joy in battle

7061.text:
How is it that while we are alive and in you, Janardana
Haidimba has attained death, accompanied by the son of Suta

7063.text:
Yadabhimanyura nihto Dhritarashtraira duratmabhih
nasit tatra rane krishna savyasachi maharathah

7064.text:
And we all were detained by the evil spirit of Saindhava
for the sake of Darona and his son there in action

7065.text:
The method of killing taught by Karna's teacher made him sword himself
with his sword

7066.text:
Kritavarma, who was in his old age, killed the horses cruelly
and suddenly the two heel charioteers
and the other great archers fought and dropped Saubhadra

7067.text:
And for a little reason Krishna was killed by Gandhivadhana
Saindhava Yadava is the best and that is not very dear to me

7069.text:
These are the root of our sufferings, O mighty man
Suyodhana was relieved to meet these in battle

7070.text:
Where Darona and Sutaputras and their followers are to be killed
there is the mighty-armed Saindhava who lives far away

7078.text:
Fortunately, Phalguna is alive in the battle after reaching Karnam
For he has protected the power of the left-handed Sachi who wanted to kill him

7079.text:
Na chagad vairatham jishnu dishtya tam bharatarshabha
srijetam sapardhinava etau divyanya astrani sarvasha

7083.text:
Do not be angry, O best of Bharatas, and do not set your mind on sorrow
This is the fidelity of all here, O Yudhisthira

7084.text:
Along with your brothers and all the great men of the earth
Do not fight in the battle of the Kauravas, O king, India
And on the fifth day the earth will be yours

7085.text:
And always, O tiger of men, think of righteousness
unkindness, austerity, charity, forgiveness and truth, O Pandava

7086.text:
Sevetha paramaprito yato dharmasa tato jaya
It was said that Pandavas were old and disappeared there

7088.text:
Seeing the great army being restrained by Bhima, your
Dhrishtadyumna said, Stop this Kumbhayoni

7090.text:
Janamejaya, Shikhandi, Durmukhi, fame and wealth
Let them rush to the Kumbhayoni with joy

7091.text:
Nakula and Sahadeva were the sons of Darupada and Parabhadra
Darupada and Virata were accompanied by their sons and brothers

7092.text:
Let Satyaki, Kekayasha and Dhananjaya under the Pandavas
rush with speed to kill Bharadwaja

7094.text:
So commanded by the great Pandavas,
they all rushed forward with speed to fight Kumbhayoni

7096.text:
Then King Duryodhana, with all his might, rushed to the Pandavas
with a furious desire to save Darona's life

7097.text:
Then the battle ensued, and the army of Sharantavahana
pandavas and Kurus roared at each other

7098.text:
They, O great king, were asleep and tired in battle
The great chariots did not make any move in battle

7099.text:
Tariyama rajani chaisa ghorarupa bhayanka
sahasrayama paratima babhuva paranaharini
vadhyata cha tatha tesam kshatanam cha especially

7102.text:
People lie down asleep, some laying down their weapons
Others on elephants, others on chariots, others on horses, India

7103.text:
The sleepless ones did not understand any action of the kings
They sent the warriors in battle to the destruction of Yama

7104.text:
Savapnayamanas tava apare parana iti vichetasah
atmanam samare jaghnu savana eva cha parana api

7105.text:
Nana vacho vimunchanto nidrandhasa te maharane
yoddhavyam iti tishtanto nidra sansaktalochanah

7106.text:
Samardyanye rane ke chin nidrandhash cha paraspara
jaghnuh shura rane rajans tasmins tamasi darune

7107.text:
Many people
did not recognize themselves as being killed
They were very much deluded by sleep in battle

7110.text:
They you if you think stop the soldiers
close and close the battlefield here for a moment

7113.text:
Chukrushuh karna karneti rajana duryodhaneti cha
Uparamat pandunam virata hi varuthini

7115.text:
Tama asya vacham devasha cha rishyasha cha mahatmanah
sarvasainyani chakshudra parahrishtah patyapoojana

7116.text:
Then, worshiping the words of Akrura, all the armies of India
muhutam asvapana rajan sharantani, O Bharatarshabha

7118.text:
Tavayi vedas tathastrani tavayi buddhiparakramau
dharmasa tavayi mahabaho daya bhuteshu chaanagh

7119.text:
Yach chashvastas tavechchamah sharma Partha tad astu te
manasash cha pariyan arthaan vira kshipram avapnuhi

7120.text:
Iti te tam naravyaghram prasansanto maharathah
nidraya samavakshiptasa tushnim asana visam pate

7121.text:
Some lie on horseback, others in chariot nests
Others on elephant shoulders, others lying in the fields

7123.text:
Gajas te pannagabhogaira hastair bhurenu rushitaih
nidrandha vasudham chakrur gharananishvasashitalam

7124.text:
The elephants roared there breathing on the ground
The mountains were shattered by the great serpents breathing in the forest

7128.text:
Then the lord of the lily adorned the Gaindri direction with the lover's white cheeks
and the moon with the joy of his eyes

7132.text:
Then in a moment the world became as bright as the ghost
The invisible and the unlit quickly went into darkness and

7133.text:
Paratiprakashite loke diva bhute nishakare
vicherur na vicherusha cha rajan naktancharas tatha

7135.text:
As the moonrise becomes a stirred ocean
so the moonrise became a strong ocean

7136.text:
Then the next battle was fought again, Lord of the Worlds
Let us desire the next world for the destruction of the worlds

7137.text:
[S]
Then Duryodhana approached Darona and said
Amarshavasham apanno janaya harshatejasi

7140.text:
Completely devoid of equal splendor and strength
they grow again and again when you nurture them

7142.text:
Neither the Pandavas nor we nor any other archers in this world
They are equal to the one fighting I tell you this truth

7144.text:
That you forgive Enans who are afraid of you, especially
rewarding discipleship or my slow fortune

7145.text: Thus lifted up Darona, angry with his son, he said to the king,

7146.text:
Sathavirah sana param shaktya ghate Duryodhanahave
Ata param maya karyam kashudram vijayagrdhina
Anastravida aya sarvo hantavyo 'satravida janah

7147.text:
Whatever you think is good or bad
I will do it, O Kauravas, according to your words and nothing else

7148.text:
Having killed all the Panchalas in battle, I shall
release my might, O king, I shall obtain the weapon by truth

7149.text:
Manyase yach cha kaunteyam arjunam sharantam ahave
tasya viryam mahabaho shrunu satyena kaurava

7150.text:
Neither the gods nor the Gandharvas nor the Yakshas nor the Rakshasas
dare to withstand him in battle, the angry Savyasachi

7151.text:
Khandave yena bhagavan paratyudyato suresvarah
sayakaira varitasha chapi varshamano mahatmana

7152.text:
Yakshas, Nagas and Daityas and others who were proud of their strength
were killed by the lord of men and you know that too

7153.text:
The Gandharvas conquered Chitrasena and others in the Ghosha Yatra
You were defeated by them and saved by the strong bow

7154.text:
Nivatakavachasha chapi devaanam shatravasa tatha
surairaavadhyah battle defeated by that hero

7155.text: How can a male tiger be conquered by thousands of demons and inhabitants of Hiranyapura

7156.text:
Partiyaksham chaiva te sarvam yathabalam idam tava
kashapitam panduputrena cheshtatam no visam pate

7158.text:
I, the evil ruler, Karna, the bird, and my maternal uncle
will kill Arjuna in battle, and today I will kill Bharati in the battle of Davaidhi

7162.text:
Moodhas tava etani bhashante yanimanya attha bharata
yudhe hay arjunam asadya savastiman ko varajed gharaan

7165.text:
Iman ki parthivan sarvan ghatayishyasya anagasah
tavam asya mulm vairasya tasmad asadayaarjunam

7167.text:
Esho 'kasakushalo jihmo dayutakrita kitavah shathah
devita nikritiprajno yudhi jeshyati pandavan

7168.text:
Your words are very joyful with the ear
often touched by the Mohad Ghritarashtra's hearing

7170.text:
Iti te katthamanasya sharutam sansadi sansadi
Anutishtha paratignam tam satyavaga bhava taih saha

7174.text:
[He]
The battle continued for the rest of the night
The Kurus and the Pandavas were delighted, O lord of the worlds

7175.text:
Atha chandraprabha mushnanna adiyasya purahsara
Aruno 'bhayudaya chakre tamri kurvanna ivambaram

7177.text:
Dvaidhi Bhutan Kurun Drishtva Madhava 'Arjunam Abravit
Sapatnan Savyata Kurmi Savyasachinna Iman Kurun

7178.text:
He gave Madhava permission to do it, and Dhananjaya
turned to the left with the great archers Darona and Karna

7179.text:
Knowing Krishna's intention, the conqueror of the other cities
saw Ajishirsa gone and approached Bhimasena

7181.text:
If you don't fall back on Sharey at this time
you'll be cruel with an unlikely appearance

7182.text:
Satyashri Dharmayashasam viryenaanrnyam apnuhi
Bhindhya anikam yudham sharestha savyasachinn imaan kuru

7183.text:
[S]
sa savyasachi bhima choditah keshava cha
karna daronav atikramya samantat paryavarayat

7184.text:
The darkness of the Ajishirsham coming burning the Kshatriya bulls
The Kshatriya bulls trying to overcome him
They could not stop him from growing like a fire

7185.text:
Then Duryodhana, Karna, Shakunisha and Saubala
rained down arrows on Dhananjaya, the son of Kunti

7188.text:
Uddhuta rajaso vrishti sharavrishtis tathaiva cha
tamash cha ghoram shabdash cha tad samabhavan mahaan

7189.text:
Neither the mercy nor the earth nor the directions were known to the Tathagata
Everything became as if blinded by the army of Rajas

7191.text:
The charioteers without chariots, O king, approached each other
keshes and dressed themselves in shields and arms

7194.text:
Then you turned to the north of the battlefield
Standing in battle like a smokeless fire

7197.text:
Ahvayantam paranikam parabhinnam iva varanam
Nainam shashansire jetum danava vasavam yatha

7198.text:
Ke chid asana nirtsaha ke chit karuddha manasvinah
vistmitasha chabhavan ke chit ke chid asana amarshitah

7199.text:
Hastair hastagram apare paratyapinshan naradhipaah
Apare dashanair oshthan adashan karodhamurchitaah

7202.text:
Then Virata and Drupada returned to Darona in battle
and he was very invincible in battle

7203.text:
Then the grandsons of Darupada, Taraya, the lord of the world,
Chedayas and the great archers, Darona, went to battle

7205.text:
Then Darona defeated Chedikekayasrinjaya in battle
Matsyansha and all Bharadwaja, the great charioteer

7206.text:
Tatas tu darupadah karodhach chharavarsham avakirat
daronam parati maharaja viratash chaiva sanyughe

7212.text:
Duryodhana and Karna and Shakuni and Saubala
Sodarya and Yathamukhyas are fighting for your protection

7214.text:
There Bhimasena became angry and killed Dhrishtadyumna
He struck him with fierce words, O best of men

7215.text:
Born in the family of Darupada, the best of all weapons,
who is a Kshatriya, thinking himself to be a spectator

7216.text:
Who can forsake a man who has killed his father and son
especially after swearing an oath in the royal assembly

7217.text:
This is like a fire burning with all the fire
Arrows and bow fuel, Darona burning the field with fire

7218.text:
Pura karoti nishsheshaam pandavaanam anikinim
sathitah pashyat me karma daronaam eva varajamya aham

7220.text:
Dhrishtadyumna, also Panchalya, entered the great army
and reached the battlefield, where there was great tumult

7221.text:
Never before have we seen or heard of such a battle
as the sun rose, O king, and became great

7223.text:
Some are going elsewhere and are harassed by others on the way
turned away and others are beaten behind the earth by others

7224.text:
And the battle that followed was very fierce
so that the evening sun came in a moment

7227.text:
Davandvani yani tatrasana sansaktani purodayat
tanya evabhyudite surye samasajjanta bharata

7228.text:
Chariots, horses, horses, serpents, foot soldiers and elephants
Horses and horses came together with foot soldiers
The warriors, who were attached and separated, fell in battle

7230.text:
Let the trumpets and the drums and the elephants roar
and let the expanded and twisted bows roar

7232.text:
The horses laughed and the chariots stopped
roaring and roaring, and there was a great tumult

7234.text:
There was a great sound on the ground, and there was a pitiful great
falling horse, chariot and elephant name

7239.text: Gajash body, the lord of the human race, is the best in the world

7244.text:
Then the sea was confused and the fear of Bharataturm
balam was there then everything except Darona and Arjuna both

7245.text:
Tava evastan nilayanam tava artayanam eva cha
tava evanye samasadya jagmur vaivastavakshayam

7246.text:
Avighnam abhavat sarvam kauravam mahad balam
panchalanam cha sansaktam na parajnayat kin chan

7247.text:
In the fear of the timid like the game of death
In the great decay of the dynasties of the earth

7248.text:
There is no Karna, no Darona, no Arjuna, no Yudhisthira
no Bhimasena, no Yama, no Panchalya, no Satyakim

7249.text:
Neither Dushasana nor Darauni nor Duryodhana nor Saubala
nor Kripa nor the king of Madras nor Kritavarmana

7250.text:
Neither others nor yourself nor the earth do not show and
I see, O king, attached to the army covered with dust

7251.text:
Sambhrante tumule ghore rajo medhe samutthite
davitiyaam iva sampraptamam anyanta nisham tada

7253.text:
Hastasansparsham apannan paraan vapya athava savakan
ayapatayansa tada yuddhe narah sama vijayasihinah

7254.text:
But because of the lifting of the dust, the dust of the parseca and the chonit
parashasham rajo bhum and the speed of the wind

7256.text:
Then Duryodhana, Karna, Darona, Dushasana and
the Pandavas armed themselves with four chariots

7257.text:
Duryodhana with his brother Yama armed
Radhey with Vrikodara and Arjuna with Bharadwaja

7258.text:
That was a terrible and great wonder all around
the inhuman confrontation of the fierce charioteers

7259.text:
Rathamargaira vichitraish cha vichitrarathasankulam
Apasyan rathino yuddham vichitra chitrayodhinam

7264.text:
Arms, feet, chipped heads, beautiful earrings
arms, spears, swords, axes, and spears

7265.text:
Nalikakshura narachaira nakharaih shaktitomaraih
nyaish cha vividhakaraira dhautaih paraharanottamaih

7266.text:
Chitraish and various shapes of body coverings,
strange chariots and broken elephants and horses

7267.text:
Empty city-shaped chariots with slaughtered battle flags
human horses dragged by the sword

7269.text:
umbrellas, ornaments, clothes, garlands, fragrant
necklaces, crowns, crowns, warm earrings

7270.text:
Urasyair manibhira nishkaish chudamanibhira eva cha
asid ayodhanam tatra nabhas taraganair iva

7271.text:
Then Duryodhana met the seated Nakula
who was angry and angry and angry

7272.text:
Apasavyam cakaratha madriputras tavatmajam
kirana sharashataira hrishtas tatra nada mahaan abhuta

7276.text:
Stay, stay, said Nakula, your son
remembering all the sufferings and your evil advice

7277.text:
[He]
Then the evil ruler, in anger, attacked Sahadeva
with the speed of his chariot, as if shaking the earth

7279.text:
Neither the evil ruler nor the charioteer nor any soldier
has taken the fire and quickly understood it with his service

7280.text:
When the horses passed by as happily as you could,
then the evil ruler understood the thread and lost consciousness

7282.text:
Tad asyapujaya karma save pare chaiva sanyuge
hatsuta rathenajau vayachard yad abhitavat

7286.text:
Vrikodaro 'ta karna taribhira bhallaih samahitaih
akarnapurnaira abhyaghnana bahvor chest chandat

7289.text:
Abhisanshlishtayos tatra tayor ahavashoundayoh
Abhinn sharapattva gaya yuddham avartat

7291.text:
Then Bhima's Radhey took the club and the mighty
created the chariot so he broke the club

7293.text:
Bhima's huge bow fell
by her counterattack and his charioteer was killed by his mace

7294.text:
He created eight arrows in the ear, faint with anger
Dhavaje, Sharasane, and Sharavape, O Bharatha

7296.text:
That distressed chariot, Bhima, floated the chariot of Nakula
Hari as the destroyer of enemies climbed the peak of a mountain

7297.text:
That is how Darona and Arjuna fought in pictures, great charioteers
Acharya and his disciples, Rajendra, were armed in battle

7299.text:
All those warriors stood beyond us and
unprecedentedly watching that battle between the teacher and his disciples

7303.text:
When Darona could not attribute the Pandavas
then Paraduschakarastram, an expert in the way of weapons

7304.text:
Aindram pashupata tavastram vayavyam atha varunam
muktam muktam darona chapata taj jaghana Dhananjaya

7305.text:
Astranya astraira yada tasya vidhivad dhanti pandavah
tato 'satraih paramaira divyaira paramaira divyaira darona avakirata

7308.text:
Mene chaatmanam adhikaam prithivyam api bharata
tena shishyaena sarvebhya shastravidhya samantata

7310.text:
Then in the sky thousands of devas and gandharvas
rishis and siddhas gathered together to see

7311.text:
Then the nymphs crowded the yakshas and demons
The beautiful sky became again like a cloud

7312.text:
There the concealed words spoke again and again
The seven of Darona and the great soul Partha
The ten directions were flaming with the weapons being released

7313.text:
This is not a human battle, nor a demon, nor a demon
nor fate, nor a Gandharva, nor a Brahman, nor a Dharuva, this is the supreme
strange, this wonderful, neither we have seen nor heard

7314.text:
Ati Pandavam Acharya Darona Chapya Ati Pandavah
Nanayor Antarm Darshtum Shakyam Astra Ken Chit

7316.text:
Jnanam ekastham acharye jnanam yogash cha pandave
shauryam ekastham acharye balam shauryam cha pandave

7317.text:
These two great archers cannot be thrown into battle by others
who wish to kill these again in the Samara world

7319.text:
Then Darona, the great intellectual, defeated the Brahma weapon
tormenting Partha in battle and the ghosts disappeared

7321.text:
Then there was a great sword between the armies of the Kurus and the Pandavas
And all the beings rose up in the sacrifice of the great soul

7323.text:
When the crossing is not reached by either of them or the other
then the battle is called Vayakuli by the package battle

7324.text:
It was not known what happened again, O lord of the world
in the tumultuous battle between Darona and the Pandavas

7326.text:
[He]
in that and present destruction of men, horses and elephants
the evil ruler Maharaja Dhrishtadyumna fought

7328.text:
In a moment the chariot of his that flag with the charioteer
did not appear, O great king, the arrows of the attendant

7330.text:
He, however, turned away the evil ruler with his arrows and his companion
kiran shot thousands of arrows at Darona in battle

7331.text:
The heartfelt Kritavarma returned and in the meantime
the sisters surrounded him

7335.text:
Shuklabhijana karmaano matimanta janadhipasah
dharmayuddham ayudhanta parekshanto gatimam uttamam

7337.text:
No list kapisho natra na gavasthira gajasthika
ishura asin na sanshlisto na putira na cha jihmaga

7338.text:
Rijunya eva vishuddhani sarve shastranya adharayana
suyudhaena paraanl lokaan ipsanta kirtima eva cha

7340.text:
Dhrishtadyumna, however, left them and, seeing that your king's charioteers
were being stopped by the Yamas, attacked Darona with a quick weapon

7341.text:
They were stopped by the heroic two male lions
The four winds were arranged like mountains

7343.text:
Seeing Panchalya choosing Darona, the battle-mad
Yama and Tansha, who were attached to him, rushed after him

7344.text:
Duryodhana, the great king, fed on the blood of Kiran
and Satyaki quickly returned to him

7345.text:
They reached each other and approached each other, Madhava
Laughing and fearful, let them meet

7348.text:
Dhik karodham dhik sakhe lobham dhin moham dhig amarshitam
dhig astu kshatram acharam dhig astu balam aursam

7350.text:
I fight all those things that happened in my childhood
All those things that are old are now in the battlefield
What else can I fight with anger and greed for you today, Satvata

7351.text:
To him who spoke thus, O king, Satyaki replied
Parahasana, raising his sharp arrows and wielding the supreme weapon

7353.text:
[Dur]
Kav sa karida gatasmaka balye vai shinipungav
Kav cha yuddham idam bhuyah kalo hi duratikramah

7354.text:
What do we have to do with money and greed for money
where we fight all gathered for the greed of money

7355.text:
[Samjaya]
Tam tatha vadinam tatra rajanam madhava 'barvit
evamvrittham sada kshatram yad dhantiha gurun api

7356.text:
If I am your enemy, O king, kill me and do not delay me
For your sake I shall go to the worlds of good deeds, O best of the Bharatas

7357.text:
Show me your power and strength so quickly
I don't want to see this, the age of friends is great

7359.text:
Your son, looking at him coming, took him back
Sharaish Chavakirad Rajan Shaineyam your son

7362.text:
Satyaki struck him back with ten arrows in the same way
five hundred and thirty and ten arrows

7363.text: Satyakis cut off his bow and arrows and quickly attacked him with arrows

7364.text:
He was deeply wounded and wounded and returned to the other chariot
Duryodhana, Maharaja Dasarha, was pierced by the arrows

7365.text:
Samasvasya tu putras te Satyaki punar abhyayat
visarjanna ishujalani yuyudhana ratham parathi

7366.text: Thus Satyakira shot Duryodhana's chariot with his arrows and the king was in a state of confusion

7370.text:
His ear struck back with sharp arrows, as if laughing
he cut the bow and arrows and struck the thread with arrows

7372.text:
Unbearable, Karna fought Bhimasena
with various arrows and various weapons in battle

7374.text:
Ye nah paranah shiro ye no ye no yodha mahabalah
ta ete dhritarashtrashu visaktah purusharbhah

7375.text:
Why stand as fools all unconscious
Go where these chariots of mine are fighting

7376.text:
All of you who have recovered from the fever by rewarding the Kshatriya Dharma
whether you are victorious or killed, you will go to your desired destination

7377.text:
Jitva cha bahubhir yajnaira yaksyadhvam bhuridakshinaih
hata va devasad bhutva lokana parapsyatha pushkala

7379.text:
Panchalas attacked Darona on one side with many arrows
Bhimasena and Purogash surrounded him on one side

7380.text:
There were great chariots of the sons of Pandu
Yama and Bhimasena attacked Dhananjaya

7381.text:
Abhidravarjuna kshipram kurun daronad ananud
tat enam hanishyanti panchala hatarakshinam

7382.text:
Then Partha suddenly attacked the Kauravas
Panchalas were the only ones led by Darona and Dhrishtadyumna

7383.text:
Panchala's then Darona also did a great deed
As angry Shakra in battle killed the demons in the past

7385.text:
Slain, Maharaja, the Panchalas created and
Daronam evabhyayur in battle, deceiving the great charioteer

7388.text:
Seeing the vast number of horses and men in battle
the Pandavas, O great king, destroyed the victory of the demons then

7389.text:
Kach chid darano na nah sarvan kashapayet paramastravit
samiddhah shishirapaye dahan kaksham ivanalah

7390.text:
No one is able to look back on him in battle
No one can ever fight him back, O righteous Arjuna

7391.text: Seeing the sons of Kunti tormented by the arrows of Darona, Kesava, equipped with a wise sword, said to Arjuna

7395.text:
Etan narochayad rajan kuntiputro dhananjaya
Anye tava arochayad sarve kruchrena tu yudhisthirah

7399.text:
Hearing the words of Bhimasena, Darona became as stunned with his dearest
mind as in the sea of water

7402.text:
He ran after his companion and killed his death
and threw down a thousand sharp heron petals

7405.text:
Then he struck the sword with all his strength
Shiransya apatayac chapi panchalanam mahamrudhe
tathaiva parighakaran arm with golden ornaments

7407.text:
Elephants and falling horses, India
The earth is inaccessible, mud of flesh and blood

7408.text:
Having killed twenty thousand Panchalas' chariots
Atisthad ahave Darona vidhumo 'ganir iva javalan

7409.text:
And so again the angry Bharadwaja struck off the head of Paratapavan
Vasu Dan with his spear

7411.text:
Seeing the absence of the Kshatriyas, Darona was situated
The sages immediately fled, leading the Havyavaha

7412.text:
Vishvamitra, Jamadagni, Bharadwaja, Gautama,
Vasishta, Kashyapa and Atarisha wanted to bring him to the Brahmaloka

7413.text:
Sikata, Prishna, Garga, Balakhilya, Marichipa,
Bhrigava, Angirasa, Sukshmasha and other great sages

7414.text:
Ta enm abruvan sarve daronam ahavashobhinam
Adharmata krita yuddha samayo nidhanasya te

7417.text:
Nayasyayudham amoghesho tishta vartmani shasvate
paripurnasha cha kalas te vastum loke 'daya manushe

7418.text: Hearing these words of Bhimasena and then looking at Dhrishtadyumna, he became dismayed in the battle

7420.text:
Sthira buddhir hi daronasya na partho vaksyate 'anritam
tarayanam api lokanam aishwaryaarthe katham chan

7423.text:
If Darona fights for half a day in anger
I tell you the truth your army will be destroyed

7424.text:
Sa bhavansa taratuno daronat satyaja jayayo 'anritam bhavet
lies for the sake of the living word is not touched by lies

7425.text:
Tayoh samvadator evam bhimasena 'barvid idam
shrutvaiva tam maharaja vadhopaya mahatmanah

7426.text:
Gahmanasya te senam malavasyandra varmana
Ashvatthameti vikhyato gajah shakra gajapamah

7433.text:
But Yudhisthira, hearing that word, Darona, the great charioteer,
tormented by the addiction of his son, became desperate for life

7434.text:
Agah kritam ivatmanaam pandavaanam mahatmanaam
rishivakyam cha manvanah sharutva cha nihatam sutam

7435.text:
Vichetas paramodvigno Dhrishtadyumna avekshya cha
yoddhum nashaknuvada rajan yathapurma arindam

7437.text:
Ya ishtva manujendrana darupadena mahamakhe
labdhva darona vinashaya samiddhad dhavyavahanat

7438.text:
Sadhanur jaitram adaya ghoram jaldanisvanam
drdhjyam ajaram divyam sharansha chashivishaopmana

7439.text:
Sanddhe karmuke tasmin sharam aashivishopamam
Daron jighansuh panchalyo mahajvalam ivanalam

7442.text:
Bharadwaja, who was struck by the dark arrow,
saw it again and thought that the time of the body had come

7445.text:
He reached Sharakshaya and was tormented by the grief of his son
and the displeasure of various divine weapons

7447.text:
Then he took the divine Angirasa bow
and the arrows and scattered them with a great shower of arrows

7448.text:
Then he showered him with a great rain of arrows
and the young man became angry with Dhrishtadyumna

7449.text:
He cut that arrow into a hundred pieces and his tears with arrows
He dropped the sword and bow and the charioteer with sharp ones

7452.text:
And his arrows are distorted, and his bows, O lord of the worlds,
all cut off by the invincible club, sword, and yet

7453.text:
Then the scorcher of the enemy struck Dhrishtadyumna with nine sharp arrows
with life-threatening arrows

7454.text:
Dhrishtadyumna rathasyasvan savarthasvaira maharathah
amishrayad ameyatma brahmam astram udirayana

7455.text:
They are mixed with many young winds
Paravat, Savarnash and Shonash, O Bharatarsha

7456.text:
As that lightning cloud roars in the water
so Rejur Maharaja is mixed on the battlefield

7463.text:
Dhrishtadyumna, the great charioteer, wished to do a difficult deed
Iyesha vaksho bhettun cha Bharadwajasya sanyughe

7464.text:
He stood in the middle of the age and in the armor of the age
Then the soldiers worshiped him in the hips of the Shona

7465.text:
Standing in the contemporaries, even when Shona was standing
I didn't see the difference between Donas and it seemed amazing

7466.text:
Kshipram shayenasya charato yathaivamisha griddhinah
tadvad asid abhisaro darona pararthayato rane

7468.text:
They killed the horses of Dhrishtadyumna on the ground of Nayapatan
and Shonash were freed from the bonds of the chariot, O lord of the worlds

7470.text:
Without a chariot, he took the sword, the best of the sword-bearers
Daronam attacked Rajan Vainateya Ivoragam

7471.text:
His form shone when Rajan killed Bharadwaja
like the form of Vishnu after killing Hiranyakasipu

7472.text:
So 'chirad vividhan margan parakaran ekavinshati
bharantam udbhraantam aviddham aplutam parasritam saritam

7474.text:
Then with a thousand arrows he shot down Shatachandra
The sword and leather of Dhrishtadyumna in conjunction with that davija

7476.text:
Sharadvatasya Parthasya Daraunera Vaikartanasya cha
Paradyumna yuyudhanabhyaam abhimanyosh cha te sharah

7477.text:
Athasyeshu samadhatta drdham paramasanshitam
Antevasinam acharya jighansuh putra sammitam

7479.text:
Satyaki and Satyavikrama walking on the chariot paths
Darana and Kripa went between the ears of Bharata
The two great men Vishvaksena and Dhananjaya saw them

7480.text:
Let them worship Varshneya and Baruvana, good and good,
The divine weapons of all, the infallible one who kills them in battle,
After attacking the army with Vishvakse, Dhananjaya

7482.text:
I am delighted again by Satyaki and Satyavikrama
and by the sons of Madri and Bhima and King Yudhisthira

7483.text:
Yach chhikshayanuddhata sana rane charati satyaki
maharathana upkridana vrishninam kirtivardhana

7485.text:
[He]
born the cruel Ayodhya in that royal assembly
like Rudra, who kills the angry but like an animal

7488.text:
Banpata nikrittas tu yodhas te kurusattama
cheshtanto vividhash cheshta vayadrishyanta mahahave

7489.text:
In the present and in the terrible battle of the gods and demons
said the Kshatriyas there, Yudhisthira, the king of righteousness,
rushed to Kumbhayoni with his great chariots armed

7490.text:
This is the heroic attendant who accompanied Bharadwaja
and does his best to destroy Bharadwaja

7491.text:
Such forms as we see in the great battle
Today Darona will be thrown down in battle by the angry companion
They you together seek the Kumbhayoni

7495.text: A great cholka fell as if the sun had risen, as if it were lighting with heat, as if it were proclaiming great fear

7496.text:

And in other battles the army did not run then

7754.text:

Arjuna, however, looked at Jihm with a glance and sighed

He is your mean news, lowly, sinful,

Then you will tell me, foolishly, again, such a harsh

Such words were bitter and harsh

What can I do when this is ready

The Kauravas, enraged and stable by the son of Darona,
