7839.text:
The four directions are strange and the hundred-killers are the fire-burners
The wheels are shining like circles with sharp ends

7840.text:
Ati Bharatarshabha
Drishtvaantariksham aavignah pandupanchala srinjayas

7841.text:
As the horses fought the great chariots of the Pandavas
so that weapon grew in age, O lord of the people

7843.text:
As a fire burns a chamber at the end of winter
so that weapon of the Pandavas burned the sword of the Lord

7846.text:
Dhrishtadyumna, flee with the Panchala army
Satyake and go to your house surrounded by Vrishnya and Andhaka

7849.text:
Bhishmadronaarnavam tirtva sangramam bhiru dustaram
Avasatsyamya aslile sagana daraunigoshpade

7850.text:
Let this terrible sword quickly return to me
The well-behaved teacher I have defeated in battle

7851.text:
The child whom Saubhadra, unskilled in warfare,
has killed and not raised by many cruel men capable of fighting

7853.text:
Jighansura Dhritarashtrasha cha sharantesva asveshu falgunam
kavachena tathayukto rakshaartham saindhavasya cha

7858.text:
Quickly take your weapons and get off the horses
This is the yoga 'tar prescribed by the great soul

7859.text:
Davipasvasyandanebhyas cha kshitim sarve avarohat
Evam etan na vo hanyad astram bhumau nirayudhan

7860.text:
As the warriors fight against the strength of the horse and weapons
so do these Kauravas become stronger

7861.text:
And they will throw down their weapons from their vehicles which
not this weapon will kill humans in battle

7862.text:
Ye tava etat pratiyotsyanti manasapiha ke chan
nihanishyati tan sarvan rasatalagatan api

7863.text:
They heard his words and all of Vasudeva's Bharatha
desired to leave the satra with their minds and deeds

7865.text:
No weapons should be released here by anyone
I will stop the weapon of Daron's son with speed

7866.text:
Atha vapya anaya guruvya hemavigrahaya rane
kalavad vicharishyami daraunera astram vishatayan

7867.text:
For there is no man here equal to me in prowess
Just as there is no other light equal to the sun

7869.text:
Nagayuta samaprano haya aham eko nareshva iha
shakra yatha paratidvandvo divi devashu vishruto

7870.text:
Today see my strength in the battle of Bahvoh Pinasyor
Against the burning bright Darauner weapon

7871.text:
If there is no counterattack to the Narayana weapon
I will counterattack him today in the presence of the Kuru Pandus

7872.text:
After saying this, Bhima, the son of Darona, Arindam,
Abhyayana Meghaghoshana Rathenadityavarchasa

7875.text:
The fire in the battle was scattered like serpents with flaming mouths
and Partha was scattered like golden flames

7876.text:
His form was in the battle of Rajan Bhimasena
at the end of the day as if it were a mountain covered with mines

7877.text:
That weapon of the son of Darona will return to him
Avardhata maharaja yathagnir aniloddhata

7882.text:
[He]
Seeing Bhimasena scattered, Dhananjaya with his weapon
covered Tejas with Varuna to counterattack him

7883.text:
He did not notice that Kash Chid was covered with Varuna's weapon
Arjuna's lightness and covered by his splendour

7884.text:
Sasvasuta ratho bhima daronaputrastra samvrita
Agnava agnira iva nayasto javalamali sudurdrishah

7886.text:
He is Bhima, his chariot and his horses and his charioteer,
covered by the son of Darona, who has gone into the fire

7888.text:
Suryam agni paravishtah sayad yatha chagni divakara
tatha paravishtam tat tejo na parajnayat kin chan

7890.text:
Udiryamaanam daraunim cha nishprati davandvam ahave
Yudhisthirapurogaansha cha vimukhansa tan maharathana

7894.text:
Then they pulled Bhima and all his weapons
Narayana weapon peace means Nara and Narayana forced

7895.text:
The great chariot of Kaunteya, who was being pulled away, roared
and that terrible weapon of Daraunera grew invincible

7899.text:
Having said this, Krishna then dropped him from his chariot to the ground
breathing like a snake with eyes red with anger

7901.text:
In that other peaceful manner then in the unbearable brightness
all directions and the other directions became pure

7902.text:
Paravavusha cha shiva vatas parashanta mrigapakshinah
vahanaani cha harishtani yodhasha cha manujesvara

7903.text:
Vayapodhe cha tato ghore tasmins tejasi bharata
babhau bhima nishapaye dhiman surya ivodita

7904.text:
The remaining force of the Pandavas remained there defeated
Astravyuparamad Dhrishta with the desire to kill your son

7905.text:
When the force was present, he was attacked by that weapon and
Duryodhana, the great king, said to the son of Darona

7906.text:
Ashwatthama again quickly use this weapon
for the Panchalas are again conquering

7907.text:
Ashwatthama, when he was thus spoken to by your son, Maris
sighed sorrowfully and said to the king

7909.text:
This is the weapon Vasudeva used to counterattack
Otherwise the prescribed number of killings is the enemy, O lord of the people

7910.text:
Defeat or death or death is the sword, death is not invincible
These four horses of the defeated are like dead men who throw weapons

7911.text:
[Dur]
Acharya son if this davir weapon is not used
let us kill the Guru-killers with other weapons, O best of the archers

7913.text:
[Dhru]
When Darone was killed by Chopadhina in that weapon
and what did Duryodhana say to Darauni again

7914.text:
Seeing Partha and his army ready for battle
Narayana's weapon released, he walked in the face of the army

7915.text:
[He]
Knowing the death of his father, the lion-tailed Ketan
sent his fear in anger and ran towards his companion

7916.text:
And the bull of men rushed upon him with twenty slings
and struck the bull with five of them with great speed

7918.text:
And he struck his charioteer with twenty golden-pointed stones
and the horseman with four sharp arrows

7919.text:
Viddhva viddhanadad daraunih kampayanna iva medinim
adadt sarvalokasya paranaan iva maharane

7922.text:
Darauni, angry in battle, covered him with leaves
and struck him with ten, remembering the killing of his father

7924.text:
Vayashva Suta ratham chainam daraunish chakre mahahave
tasya chanucharan sarvan karuddhah parachhadayacha chharaih

7926.text:
Seeing the warriors turned away and Dhrishtadyumna in distress
Shaineyo quickly stirred up the battle against the chariot of Darauni

7927.text:
Ashtabhira nishitaish chaiva so 'shavatthamanam ardayat
vinshatya punara ahatya nanarupaira amarsanam
vivyadha cha tatha sutam chaturbhis chaturo hayan

7928.text:
So 'tividdha maheshvaso nana lingair amarshanah
Yuyudhanena vai daraunih parahasan vakyam abravit

7933.text:
Sidan rudhirasiktash cha rathopastha upavishta
sutenapahritas turnam daronaputrad rathantaram

7934.text:
Then with another well-winged arrow bowed
the enemy struck Dhrishtadyumna in the middle of Bharuvora

7935.text:
He was over-wounded before and severely tormented afterwards
He reached the battle Panchalya and took refuge in the sword

7937.text:
Kiriti Bhimasena and the old Kshatriyas and the Pauravas
The young king and the Chedis and the Malavas and Sudarsana
They struck him with five arrows equally on all sides

7938.text:
Aashivishabhaira vishadbhih pancabhisha chapi tan sharaih
chiched yugapada daraunih pancavinshatisaika

7939.text:
Saptabhis cha shataira banaih pauravam daraunira ardayat
malavam taribhira ekana partham shadbhira vrikodaram

7944.text:
Asin's chariot with his fierce splendour; Sudarshan's Indra Ketuprakash
arms and head Indra of equal strength; Taribhis arrows simultaneously sanchakarta

7946.text:
Yuvanam indivaradam varnam; chedipriyam yuvarajam parahasya
banais tavaravan javalitagnikalpai; viddha paradana mrityave sashwasutam

7949.text:
They destroyed the others and Darauni scattered arrows from behind
Abhyavartat vegena kalavat panduvahinim

7952.text:
Then those soldiers, O king, did not stay there
established with the effort of Govinda and Arjuna

7954.text:
Then, crossing the river, the lion-tailed Ketan
savyasachi said to the great archer Ashvatthama

7955.text:
Ya shaktira yacha cha te veeryam yaja jnanam yacha paurusham
Dhritarashtrashu ya paritih paradvesho 'samasu yasha cha te
yacha cha bhuyo 'sati tejas tatparama mama darshaya

7957.text:
[Dhru]
Acharya putro manarho balavansh chapi sanjaya
paritir dhananjaye chasya pariyasha chapi sa vasaveh

7958.text:
Never before has a terrible word been spoken so harshly
Then why did that Kaunteya speak harshly to his friend

7959.text:
[He]
was killed by the young prince and by the old Kshatriya in the east
and by the Malava who was equipped with the ritual of the arrows and the Sudarsana

7960.text:
Dhrishtadyumna, Satyaka and Bhima were defeated
Yuddhisthira was pierced and struck by those words

7961.text:
Antar bhede cha sanjate dukkham sansmritya cha parabho
abhutapurvo bimatsora dukkhan manyur ajayat

7963.text:
Thus spoken by Shavasana Karodhana, the greatest of the king
Partha, the harsh words fell on all the hearts
Daraunish was angry with Partha and Krishna in particular

7964.text:
Sa tu yatto rathe sathitva varya upasprusya viryavan
devairapi sudurdharsham astram agneyam adade

7965.text:
Acharyanandan addressed the enemies from sight to sight
He invoked the arrow, which burned like smoke
Sarvata karodham and threw it, the destroyer of enemies

7967.text:
Chukrushur danavash chapi dikshu sarvasu bhairavam
rudhiram chapi varshanto vinedus toyadambare

7969.text:
Bharantasarvamahabhutam avarjitadivakaram
tarailokyam abhisantaptam javaravistam ivaturam

7974.text:
The burning great serpents fell from all sides of the earth
roaring terribly with a roar like the sound of water

7978.text:
Seeing the Pandava army burning in the great battle
they were overjoyed, O King, and roared with the roar of a lion

7980.text:
The whole horse army, Rajan, and Savyasachi, the Pandavas,
did not appear in the great battle in a world covered with darkness

7981.text:
Never before, O king, have you seen or heard
such a weapon as the son of Darona created by the immortal

7982.text:
Arjuna, however, O Maharaja, raised the Brahma weapon
prescribed by the lotus-woman for the repulsion of all weapons

7988.text:
Hatav iti tyor asid enor ubhayor matih
Tarsabhyagatau darshva vimuktau keshavarjunau

7989.text:
Tava akshatau paramuditau dadhamatura varijottamau
Drishtva paramuditan parthansa tavadiya vayathitabhavana

7990.text:
And seeing the two great men freed, Darauni was very sad
For a moment he thought,

7994.text:
Seeing him standing in front of Darauni, the Kurukuladvaha
Sannakantha 'barved the words and greeted him with a smile

7995.text:
Bho Bho Maya or chance we don't know what this might be
How false is this weapon of yours and how is it a transgression of mine

7996.text:
Adharottaram etad va lokanam va parabhavah
Id imau jivatau krishnau kalo hi duratikramah

7997.text:
No demons, immortals, Gandharvas, no vampires, no rakshasas
No snakes, no yakshas, no birds, no humans in any way

7998.text:
They dare to do otherwise this weapon I have sent
Then it is only to kill and burn the right army

8000.text:
[v]
The greatest of all, wonder at me whom you ask for this
Then I will tell you the next thing, and listen to your mind with all your heart

8005.text:
He became Brahman by that austerity, my father
Then he became the Lord of the universe, the womb of the universe, the lord of the world

8006.text:
He saw the very invisible Lord of all the gods
The least of the least of them and the greatest of the great

8007.text:
Rudram Ishanam Rishabham Chekitanam Ajam Param
gacchatas Tishtato Vapi Sarvabhutahridi Sathitam

8008.text:
Durvaranam durdrishm tigmamanyum; mahatmana sarvaharam parachetasama
divyam chapam ishudhi chadadanam; hiranyavarmanam anantaviryam

8009.text:
Pinakin, thunderbolt, burning spear; axe, sword, sword, sword,
bhru, matted hair, moon, crown; Vayaghrajina, spear, rod in hand

8010.text:
Shubhangadam nagayajnopavitim; visvaira ganaih shobhitam bhutasanghaih
ekibhutam tapasam sannidhanam; vayo 'atigaih sushtutam ishtavagbhih

8013.text:
The supreme treasure of the lights thrown around the axis
Then Narayana saw it and worshiped the universal possibility

8014.text:
Varadam Pruthucharva Angya Parvatya Sahitam Parabhu
Ajam Ishaanam Avyagram Karanatmanam Achyutam

8015.text:
Abhivadyatha Rudraya sadyo 'nadhakanipatine
Padmakshasa tam virupakshama abhitustava bhaktimaan

8016.text:
Tvat sambhuta bhutakrito varenya; goptaro 'daya bhuvanam purvadevah
Avishema dharanim ye 'bhayarakshan; pura puranam tava deva srishtim

8017.text:
Surasuran nagarakshahpisachan; naran suparna atha gandharvayakshana
pruthagvidhana bhutasanghaansha cha visvansa; tavat sambhutan vidma sarvansa tathaiva
aindram yamyam varunam vaittapalyam; maitram tavastram karma soumyam cha tuvyam

8019.text:
They go to the waters as separation; they go to the destruction of unity again
Thus the learned goes to the defeat of others and this one; leaving behind the beings there comes union

8021.text:
And worship the devotee who worships me; do not revile me without harm
Your self is your self; the learned thus goes to Brahma Shukra

8022.text:
Astousham tava tava sammanam ichchan; vichinvan vai savrisham devavarya
sudurlabhan dehi varan mameshtan; abhistuto pratikarshish cha ma mama

8023.text:
Tasmai varan achintyaatma nilakantha pinaka dhrika
arhat deva mukhya parayachchad rishisanstuta

8026.text:
Neither Suparna nor the serpents nor the Viyonijas in the world
No one and your god will conquer in battle

8027.text:
Not by weapon, nor by thunder, nor by fire, nor by wind,
nor by wet, nor by dry, nor by thirst, nor by sthavara

8028.text:
Kash chit tava rujam karta matprasadat kash chan
api cheta samaram gant bhavishya madamdhika

8029.text:
[v]
Evam ete vara labdhah purastad viddhi shaurina
sa esha devash charati maya mohayan jagat

8030.text:
Tasyaiva tapasa jatam nara nama mahamunim
tulyam etena devana tam janihya Arjuna sada

8031.text:
Tava etau purvadevaanam paramopacitav rishi
lokayatra vidhanartham sanjayete yuge yuge

8033.text:
That you, knowing the Supreme Being as a god, become the world
Attract yourself by the law of loving it

8034.text:
Shubham aurvam navam kritva mahapurushavigraham
Eijivans tavam japair homair upaharaish cha manad

8036.text:
Janma karma tapoyogas tayos tava cha pushkalah
tabhya linga 'rachito devas tavayarcayam yuge yuge

8037.text:
He who knows all forms of being and creates the Supreme Lord in the form
Atmayogasha and in him the scriptural yogasha are eternal

8038.text:
Evam deva yajanto hi siddhasha cha paramarshiyah
pararthayanti param loke sathanam eva cha shasvatam

8039.text:
He is this Rudra devotee and Keshav Rudra Sambhavah
Krishna is the one to be sacrificed and this is the eternal Lord of sacrifices

8042.text:
Hrishtaloma and Vashyatma offered obeisances to the great sage
Varuthini and offered obeisances

8047.text:
Seeing the great wonder of his own victory
he asked the old man who had come by chance, O best of the Bharatas

8049.text:
In the direction in which I raise my burning spear
my enemies are scattered, O great sage

8051.text:
People think that all the enemies that have been broken by him are broken by the madness
I will burn the armies that have been burnt by him from behind

8052.text:
Lord, tell me who is that Purushottama
Spear-wielding, great Krishna, bright as the sun

8053.text:
[v]
Parajapatinam parathamam tejasam purusham vibhum
bhuvanam bhur bhuvam devam sarvalokesvaram parabhum

8055.text:
Mahadevam mahatmanaam ishanam jatilam shivam
taryaksham mahabhujam rudram shikhinam chiravasasama
dataram chaiva bhaktanam parasadavihitan varan

8056.text:
They are his associates, divine in form and various forms, Lord
Vamana, Jatila, Munda, Harsvagriva, Mahodara

8057.text:
Mahakaya mahotsaha mahakarnasa tathapare
aanaira vikritaih padaih partha veshaish cha vaikritaih

8058.text:
Idrishaih sa mahadevah poojyamano maheshwarah
sa shivas tata tejasvi parasadad yati te 'garata
tasmin ghore tada partha sangrame lomaharshane

8059.text:
Daronakarnakarpaira guptam maheshvasaih paraharibhih
kasa tam senaam tada Partha manasapi paradharshayet
rite devan maheshvasaad bahurupaan maheshvaraat

8060.text:
Sthatum utsahate kash chin na tasmin agratha sathite
na hi bhutam samam tena tarishu lokeshu vidyate

8062.text:
Tasmai namas tu kurvanto devas tishtanti vai divi
ye chanye manava loke ye cha savargajito narah

8063.text:
Ye bhakta varadam devam shivam rudram upa patim
ih loke sukham parapya te yanti paramam gatim

8064.text:
Obeisance, O Kaunteya, to that peaceful one who is always
Rudra, whose neck is cold, who is the youngest and who shines brightly

8065.text:
Kapardine karalaya haryaksne varadaya cha
yamyayavyakta keshaya sadvrute Shankaraya cha

8066.text:
Kamyaya Hari netraya sathanave purushaya cha
Hari keshaya mundaya krishayattarana cha

8067.text:
Bhaskaraaya Sutirthaaya Devadevaaya Ramhase
Bahurupaaya Sharvaaya Pariyaya Pariyavasase

8068.text:
O warm, well-faced, thousand-eyed, sweet
girisha, peaceful, husband, dressed in rags

8069.text:
Om Hiranyabahve Chaiva Ugraya Patiya Disham
Parjanyapatya Chaiva Bhutanaam Patiya Namah

8071.text:
Saruva hastaya devaya dhanvine bhargavaya cha
bahurupaaya visvasya patiya chiravasaya

8072.text:
A thousand heads and a thousand eyes
A thousand arms and a thousand feet

8073.text:
Sharanam parapya kaunteya varadam bhuvanesvaram
Umapatim virupaksham dakshayajnanibarhanam
parajanam patim avyagram bhutanaam patim avyayam

8074.text:
Kapardina Vrishavartam Vrishanabha Vrishadhvajam
Vrishadarpa Vrishapati Vrishashringam Vrisharshabham

8075.text:
Vrishakam vabhodaram vabham vabheka
vyudham vaara vabhtam mahesvaram

8076.text:
Mahodaram mahakayam davipicharm nivasinam
lokesham varadam mundam brahmanyam brahman pariyam

8077.text:
Tarishulpanim varadam khadgacharma dharam parabhum
pinakin khanda parashum lokanam patim ishwaram
parapadye sharanam devam sharanyam chiravasasam

8078.text:
Obeisance to him who is the lord of the gods, whose friend is Vaishvarana
Obeisance to him who is always well-dressed and well-armed

8079.text:
Saruva hastaya devaya sukhadhanvaya dhanvine
Dhanvantaraya dhanuse dhanvacharya dhanvine

8080.text:
Om Ugrayudhaaya Devaaya Suravaraaya Cha
Namo 'satu Bahurupaaya Namasha Cha Bahudhanvine

8081.text:
Om Sathanave Nitya Suvrata Sudhanvine
Om Taripuraghnaya Bhaga Ghana Cha Vai Namah

8082.text:
O lord of plants, lord of men,
lord of water, lord of daily sacrifices

8083.text:
Pooshno dantavinashaya taryakshaya varadaya cha
nilakanthaya pingaya savarnakeshaya vai nama

8084.text:
And the divine deeds of the wise Mahadeva
I shall recite them to you as the wise of others as the best of the wise

8087.text:
They were not ashamed, where did they find peace, even when the gods
suddenly fled from the sacrifice and were angry with the Lord

8088.text:
All the worlds were agitated by that victory cry
They became subdued, O Partha, and the gods and demons fell down

8093.text:
Then the gods came out trembling and bowed down to the same darkness
Again he set up the bright sharp arrow of the gods

8094.text:
They nine imagined Rudra's sacrificial portion and distinct
They feared the crossing and took refuge in the king

8095.text:
Tena chaivatikapena sa yajna sandhitas tada
yattasha chapi sura asana yattasha chadyapi tam parati

8096.text:
The demons were old and the mighty were in heaven
Iron, silver and gold were the other greatest

8097.text:
The iron star-eyed lotus-eyed silver
gold was the supreme horse and the garland of lightning

8098.text:
You could not break them, O Indra, even with all your weapons
Then all the immortals went to Rudra for refuge in distress

8102.text:
Purani na cha tam shekura danavas parativikshitum
sharam kalagnisamyuktam vishnusomasamayutam

8103.text:
The child was placed on his lap and he put the five heads together again
Uma asked Suran who Yama was

8104.text:
Stand the arm of Indra, the angry Lord, with his thunderbolt
He is this Lord God, Lord of all the worlds, Lord

8113.text:
Sarvaira devaih satuto deva saikada bahudha cha sa
shatadha sahasradha chaiva tatha shatasahasradha

8114.text:
Such is that great god and the great and glorious Lord Aja
I cannot tell you all the virtues of the Lord

8115.text:
Sarvaira garhair grihitan vai sarvapapasamnvitan
sa mochayati supritah sharanyah sharanagatan

8116.text:
He gives longevity, health, wealth, wealth, desires and abundance
He gives to men and He throws back

8117.text:
And his power is said to be among the gods like Indra
and he is also said to be the good and evil of men in the world taken by you

8118.text:
He is again called the God of wealth and desires
He is the God of the greatest of beings

8119.text:
Bahubhira bahudha rupaira visvam vayapnoti vai jagat
Asya devasya yad vaktra samudra tad ashtat

8120.text:
This is also the god who dwells in the graves daily
The people who worship him there heroic place is God

8121.text:
His bright forms are terrible and many
the things that men do and speak of in the world

8122.text:
There are many names in the worlds here truly
defined by their greatness and power and by their actions

8123.text:
And in the Vedas he is mentioned as the best of the hundred Rudriyas
and the name of the great soul is called Ananta Rudra

8125.text:
The Brahmanas and sages called him the eldest being and
the first horse became his fire from the mouth of the gods

8126.text:
In all respects he who feeds the cattle and who enjoys them again
is their lord and who is therefore called the lord of the cattle

8127.text:
When the Lingam of this is established by constant celibacy
Mahayanti and the worlds are remembered as Maheshwa

8131.text:
Ekaksho jajvalanna aste sarvato 'kshimayo 'pi va
karodhadyas chavishala lokans tasmacha chharva iti samritah

8132.text:
Smoke and form which is his Dhurjatis is called
Vishve Devasha and that in which Visvaroopasa is then remembered

8133.text:
Tisro devir yada chaiva bhajate bhuvanesvarah
dayamam apah prithivim chaiva taryambakasha cha tatha smritah

8134.text:
He who always satisfies all purposes in all actions
Shivam is the desire of mankind, therefore this is called Shiva

8135.text:
Sahasraksho 'yutaksho va sarvato 'akshimayo 'pi va
ayacha cha visvam mahat pati mahadevas tatha smritah

8136.text:
Dahtya urdhvam sathito yacha cha paranotpattih sathitisha cha yata
sathitalingasha cha yana nitya tasmat sathanura iti samritah

8137.text:
Unequal in bodies and equal to the other name here
sa vayu in uneven bodies of breathing and breathing

8138.text:
Whoever worships the Vigraha or the Linga
The one who worships the Linga always enjoys the greatest Shariam

8140.text:
Taijasi mahati dipta devabhyas cha shiva tanuh
bhasvati manushesva asya tanur ghoragnira ucyate

8141.text:
Brahmacharyam chartya esha shiva yasya tanus taya
yasya ghorataram murtih sarvan atti tayeshwarah

8142.text: He who burns, who is sharp, who is fierce, who is fierce, who is full of flesh and blood, who is called Rudra

8143.text:
This is the god Mahadeva who is before you, O Partha
in battle, killing the enemy, whom you have seen, bearer of Pinaka

8144.text:
This is the Lord God who fights you in battle
who gave you the weapons and who killed the demons with you

8145.text:
Blessed is your fame, your longevity, your merit, and the Vedas, which are called
Devadevasya te Partha vayakhyatma shatarudriyam

8146.text:
Sarvarthasadhakam punyam sarvakilbish nasanam
sarvapapaprashamanam sarvadukkhabhayapaham

8147.text:
He who hears this fourfold Satotra always
conquers all enemies and is glorified in the Rudra world

8148.text:
Charitam mahatmano divyam sangramikaam idam shubham
pathana vai shatarudriyam shrunvansha cha satatotthitah

8149.text:
Bhakto visvesvaram devam manusheshu tu yas sada
varan sa kamal labhate parasanne taryambake narah

8150.text:
Go and fight, O Kaunteya, you will not be defeated
You have Janardana as your minister and protector

8151.text:
[He]
having thus spoken to Arjuna, the son of Parashar in numbers, then
departed, O best of the Bharatas, as he had come, O Arindam

8153.text:
Release these mighty sons of Dhritarashtra
and release them from the rule of Dharmaraja

8154.text:
Thus spoken by the illustrious Pandavas, the Gandharvas
smiled and then said these words to Partha

8155.text:
One alone, Father, shall we obey on earth
Whose rule we obey and walk free from fever

8156.text:
Let us act as directed by that one, O Bharata
There is no ruler like us other than the Lord of the gods

8161.text:
Then there was a tumultuous battle between the Gandharvas named Tarsvi
and the Pandavas of Bhimavega, O Bharatha

8164.text:
As the chariot of Karna and the horses of Dhritarashtra
were cut off by hundreds of Gandharvas, so they were cut off

8166.text:
The birds scattered by the rain of arrows all around
could not turn to the sons of Pandu

8167.text:
Abhikruddhana abhiprekshaya gandharvana arjuna tad
lakshayitvatha divyani mahastranya upachakrame

8168.text:
Thousands of thousands he defeated the Yamasadana
Arjuna with the fire was the strongest of the Gandharvas in numbers

8172.text:
Dhananjaya, the son of Kunti, seeing them rising,
surrounded him with a great network of arrows

8173.text:
They were bound by a net of arrows like birds in a cage
They rained down on Arjuna in anger clubs, powerful sights and showers

8174.text:
Gada shaktyasi vrishtis ta nihtya sa mahastravit
gatrani chahanad bhallaira gandharvaanam Dhananjaya

8175.text:
He fell on others with his head and his feet and arms and
it seemed like a rain of hail and others were afraid

8176.text:
The Gandharvas, being killed by the great Pandavas,
rained down arrows from the earth and space

8179.text:
They burning Ganharvas with the arrows of Kunti's son
like the demons, they were devastated by Indra's arrival supreme

8181.text:
Seeing the Gandharvas crossed by the wise son of Kunti
Chitrasena took his club and attacked Savyasachi

8182.text:
As he attacked him quickly in the battle with his club in his hand
Partha cut his all-iron club into seven pieces with his arrows

8183.text:
Sagadam bahudha drishta kritam banais tarasvina
covered by the self of knowledge he fought against the Pandavas
we fought with his divine weapons he was sitting in the sky

8186.text:
Sa vadyamanasa taira astraira arjuna mahatmana
Athasya darshayama asa tadatmana pariyam sakha

8187.text:
Chitrasena then noticed his friend who was weak in battle
sanjaharastram then then the bull of the Pandavas created by another

8188.text:
Seeing Dhananjaya with his weapons withdrawn, all the Pandavas
took away the enemy's horses, arrows and bows

8189.text:
Chitrasena and Bhima and Savyasachi Yama also
asked Kaushala and got on their chariots

8191.text:
What is your determination, O hero, to defeat the Kauravas?
And why is this Suyodhana detained by his wife?

8192.text:
[Picture]
This intention was known by the great soul there
Duryodhana's sin and Karna's, O Arjuna

8193.text:
Vanasthana bhavato janatva kalishyamanan anrhavat
ime 'vahasitum parapta daraupadi cha yashasvinim

8195.text:
Dhananjaya is also your protector with his brothers in battle
he is your dear friend and your disciple Pantava

8196.text:
At the word of the king of the gods, I have come here soon
This evil spirit is bound and I will go to the temple of the gods

8198.text:
[Picture]
This sinful man is eternally corrupt and does not deserve to be saved
The others have found the king of righteousness and the darkness of Krishna, O Dhananjaya

8199.text:
Nedam chikirshitam tasya Kuntiputro mahavrata
janati dharmaraja hi sharutva kuru yathechhasisi

8200.text:
[They]
all approached the king Yudhisthira
and approached him and praised him for all his evil deeds

8201.text:
Ajatashatrus tach charutva gandharvasya vachas tada
mokshayam asa tan sarvan gandharvan parasshans cha

8203.text:
Upakaro mahans tata krito 'yam mama khecharah
kulam na paribhutam me mokshena asya duratmanah

8204.text:
Ajnapayadhvama ishtani pariyamo darshanena vah
parapya sarvan abhiprayans tato varajat machiram

8206.text: Even the king of the gods revived the dead Gandharvas who were killed in the battle of the Kauravas by a divine shower of nectar

8207.text:
Janatis tan avamuchyatha rajadaransha cha sarvashah
kritwa cha dushkaram karma paritiyuktasha cha pandavas

8208.text:
The great chariots worshiped by the Kurus with their wives and young men
The great men shone like fires in the midst of the Kurus

8210.text:
Don't be equal, father, again, do such a courageous thing
For those who do courage do not grow happiness, India

8212.text:
King Duryodhana, having been permitted by the Pandavas, then
tormented by the sword, went to the garrison

8217.text: It seems difficult to me to enter Hastinapura, the sinful and eternal arrogant of Duryodhana

8219.text:
[Vai]
Dhartarashtra nisrishtasa tu Dhritarashtra Suyodhana
lajjayadhomukha sidanna upasarpata sudukhita

8220.text:
The king, followed by the four-armed force, went to Savapura
thinking of defeat with his intellect overcome with grief

8222.text:
Athopavishtam rajanam paryanke javalanaprabhe
upaplutam yatha somam rahuna ratrisankshaya
upagamayabravit karno duryodhanam idam tada

8224.text:
Fortunately I see all my brothers, O Kurunanda
conquering the battle, freed from the defeated great chariots

8226.text:
And the arrow-shaped limbs are very old and oppressed
I think it is very strange that you are here in India

8227.text:
Arishtan akshatansha chapi sadar dhanavahana
vimuktan samprapashyami tasmad yuddhad amanushat

8228.text:
There is no man in this world who can do this, India
Yatkritam te maharaja saha bharatribhira ahave

8229.text:
Evam uktas tu karnena raja Duryodhana tad
uvacavaka shira rajana bashpagadgadaya gira

8231.text:
Ayodhitas tu gandharvas suchiram sodarair mama
maya saha mahabaho kritash chobhayata kshaya

8232.text:
Mayadhikas tava ayudhanta yada shura viyad gatah
tada no nasam yuddham avata saha khecharaih

8242.text:
Shaving the directions covered by the Pandavas with sharp arrows
Dhananjaya was showing himself to his friend then

8244.text:
They met and thus armed each other and freed the brahmins
Then the heroic Gandharvas with the Pandavas
worshiped each other Chitrasena and Dhananjaya

8246.text:
Bharatrun arhasi no veer moktum gandharvasattam
Anarha dharshanam hime jivamaneshu pandushu

8247.text:
After thus speaking, the Gandharva, the great Pandava,
said,

8251.text:
They who have rejected me are always my enemies
They have saved me and given me life

8252.text:
If I had been killed by a hero in that great battle
Share, it would have happened to me that I would not have lived like this

8253.text:
Bhaved yasho prithivyam me khayatam gandharvato vadhata
paraptasha cha lokah punyah sayur mahendra sadane 'kshayah

8255.text:
Karna and others, fame and friends and relatives who
have pursued the evil rule and have passed away, are now returning to the city

8258.text:
Bhishma, Darona, Kripa, Darauni, Vidura, Sanjaya, and
Bahlika, Somadatta and others who were accepted by the elders

8259.text:
The Brahmins are the arrows and the chiefs and the indifferent attitudes
What will they say to me and what will I say back to them

8260.text:
Standing on the head of the enemy and thus conquering the thief
How can I tell them, deviating from self-blame

8262.text:
Oh, how this trouble has been done to me by a bad character
all the evil-minded Mohad who has caused me to doubt

8263.text:
Therefore I will worship the Supreme Being, for I cannot live
For who can live without consciousness, lifted up by the umbrellas of trouble

8264.text:
Shatrubhisha chavahasito mani paurushavarjita
pandavaira vikramaadhyaish cha savmanam avekshitah

8265.text:
[Vai]
Evam chintaparigato dushasanam athabravit
dushasana nibodhedam vacanam mama bharata

8266.text:
Return the anointing I have given you, become king
Parashadhi prithivim safitam karna saubal palitam

8267.text:
Bharatrun palaya visrabdham maruto vritraha yatha
bandhavasa tavopajivantu deva iva shatakratum

8268.text:
Always be attached to the Brahmins and be careful of your hope
You will always be your destination for your relatives and friends

8269.text:
Janatinsha chapya anupasyetha vishnu devagana iva
guruvah palaniyas te gachcha palaya medinim

8272.text:
Parsidetya fell to the ground with a sorrowful heart
Sad feet shed tears from his eyes

8273.text:
And the above-mentioned man-tiger will not be like this
The earth will disappear and the earth will become shaky
The sun will give up its own brightness and the moon will give up its cold rays

8274.text:
The wind will blow quickly and the snow will move
The water will dry up and the fire will leave the heat in the seas

8281.text:
You don't deserve to be angry with someone like this
Your brother is depressed and your enemy is with you
Get up, Varaja, good luck and comfort your brother

8282.text:
O king, I do not yet understand your lightness here
What is the wonder here that you are a hero who has been freed from the enemy of the Pandavas
Immediately subdued by the enemies, Shatrukarshan

8283.text:
The army of Jivaish and the Kauravas and the inhabitants of the country
unknown or known should do the king's pariyam

8285.text:
The army and the living beings who are human beings who are about kings
must join together and strive for the king's cause as much as possible

8286.text:
If thus, O King, the Pandavas, the inhabitants of your subject,
have accidentally saved him, what is there to regret?

8288.text:
The brave and the strong did not flee in battle
They came before you to be sent to the assembly

8289.text:
You still enjoy the gems of the Pandavas
Satvasthana Pandavas, see that you are not sitting on the other side
Get up, O king, good for you, you should not worry

8290.text:
Of course, O king, the inhabitants of the king's subjects should observe the
pariyanyas, what is there to regret?

8291.text:
This is my word, O king, if you do not do so
I will stand here serving your feet, O crusher of enemies

8294.text:
[Vai]
Raja Duryodhana, who was sitting on the other side,
said to console the king, Shakuni, Saubalas then

8295.text:
Samyag uktam hi karna tach chrutam kaurava tavaya
mayahritam shariyam safitam mohat samapahaya kim
tavam abuddhya nripa varapranaan utsrashtum ichchasi

8296.text:
Even today I understand that you have not served the elders
He who does not control the joy or sorrow that arises
He perishes after receiving the Sharia like a vessel of mango in water

8297.text:
Atibhirum atiklibam dirghasutram paramadinam
vayasanad vishayakrantam na bhajanti nripam shariyah

8298.text:
How can your sorrow be in the opposite of the honored
Do not destroy the good done by the Parthians by relying on sorrow

8299.text:
Where you rejoice in your work and desire to do good, O Pandavas
there you lament, O king, this is the opposite of you

8300.text:
Parsid ma tayajatmana tushtash cha sukritam samara
parayachcha rajyam parthanam yashodharmam avapnuhi

8301.text:
Let us understand this and you will not be ungrateful
Make your brothers with the Pandavas and establish them
Give them the ancestral kingdom and then enjoy happiness

8303.text:
Bahubhya sadhujatabhya dushasanam arindamam
utthapya samparishvajya parityajighrat murdhani

8304.text:
Karna and Saubalayosh also remembered the words of the king Duryodhana, who went to the supreme nirvedam, and then
varidyabhiparitatma, the supremely disappointed, reached the supreme

8307.text:
They thus addressed the king, the destroyer of enemies,
Where are you going, O king, with us, O India?
How shall we enter the city without you?

8309.text:
Dhritarashtaja spread out the darbhaprastaram and certainly
sprushed the water and became clean and took refuge on the ground

8313.text:
Brihaspatiyushanoktaish cha mantras mantravisharadah
Atharvaveda paraktaish cha yash chopanisadi kariyah
mantrajapya samayuktas tas tada samavartayan

8315.text: At the time of the accomplishment of the action, she yawned there and said,

8316.text:
Ahur daityas chatam tatra supritena antaratmana
parayopavishtam rajanam dhritarashtram ihanaya

8320.text:
[Danavaha]
Bhoh Suyodhana Rajendra Bharatanam Kulodvaha
Surrounded by brave men and also by great men

8321.text:
Akarshih sahasam idam kasmat parayopavesanam
Atmatyagi hay avag yati vachyatam chayashaskarim

8322.text:
For wise men like you are not prepared for many dangerous actions
root killings against work

8323.text:
Control this mind, O king, destroyer of righteousness, wealth and happiness
fame, suffering, patience, and increase the joy of enemies

8325.text:
Pura tavam tapasasmabhira labdho devan maheshwarat
purvakayasha cha sarvasa te nirmito vajrasanchayaih

8326.text:
Astaira abhedya shastaish chapya adha kayasha cha te 'nagh
krita pushpamayo devya rupata satrimanohara

8328.text:
The Kshatriyas and the mighty Bhagadatta Purogamas
The brave men who know the divine weapons will cut off those enemies

8332.text:
Yudhi sampraharishyanto moksyanti kurusattama
ihsneha danavavishtah samakrantaantara atmani

8333.text:
They will betray others, leaving affection for their relatives from afar
Happy male tigers with polluted minds
Ignorance and delusion and destiny are the law-makers

8337.text:
Yach cha te 'antargatam veer bhayam arjuna sambhavam
tatrapi vihito 'samabhira vadhopaya 'arjunasya vai

8338.text:
The soul of the slain hell has taken refuge in the idol of Karna
Remembering that enmity, the hero will fight Keshav and Arjuna

8342.text:
Asapatna tavaya hiyam bhoktavya vasuddha nripa
ma visadam nayasmana naitat tavya uppadyate
vinashte tavaya chasamakam paksha heyeta kaurava

8350.text:
Thus the hope of the evil-minded Dhritarashtra was firm
in the defeat of the Pandavas, O best of the Bharatas

8351.text:
Karna 'paya avistha chittatma narakasyantar atmana
Arjuna's killing Karurama did he then

8354.text:
Duryodhana and at night Karna Vaikartana 'barvit
samayanna ivanjali kritva parthivam hetumad vachah

8355.text:
The dead do not conquer the enemy, life sees the good
Where are the good things of the dead, O Kauravas, where is the victory
There is no time for depression, fear or death

8357.text:
Or maybe you are afraid of Arjuna's prowess
I tell you the truth and I will kill you in battle, Arjuna

8358.text:
In the eleventh year of the past I have taken up my weapons with truth
I shall bring Partha under your control, O lord of the people

8360.text:
Tato manujashardulo yojyam asa vahinim
rathnagasvakalilam padatijanasankulam

8362.text:
Chariots, serpents and foot soldiers shone like a very crowded
vayapeta cloud in a dense time like an unmanifest autumn dayour

8363.text:
Jayashirbhir davijendrais tu satuymano 'dhirajavat
grihnanna anjalimalasha cha Dhritarashtra janadhipah

8364.text:
Suyodhana yayav agre sharia paramaya javalan
karna sardham rajendra saubalena cha devina

8365.text:
Duhshasana and his brothers were all the
bhurisravas, Somadatta and Maharaja Bahlika

8367.text:
[Birth]
What did the great archers of Dhritarashtra do in that forest of the Parthians who lived there, O best of men?

8368.text:
Karna Vaikartanasha and Shakunish are very strong
Bhishma and Drona's grace you deserve to praise me

8369.text:
[Vai]
Evangateshu Parthashu visrishte cha Suyodhana
Agate Hastinapuram mokshite Pandunandanaih
Bhishma 'baravin maharaja Dhritarashtrama idam vacah

8370.text:
I told you, father, before you went to the forest of penance
I did not like going to your body and you did not do it

8372.text:
Seeing you in Gandhara with your army, lord of the worlds
The son of Suta fled, afraid of the Gandharvas, then from the battle
You, O king, with your army, O prince

8381.text:
[Kana]
Duryodhana, I will tell you this, O Kauravas,
After hearing it, you should do everything so, O Arindam

8384.text:
He is helpful and loving and ready for me
I mean something, but listen to him as he really is

8387.text:
Let the best of the Davijas and the equipment be prepared according to the ritual
Let the sacrificial utensils be prepared, O best of the Kurus

8388.text:
And the priests, who are well versed in the Vedas, are invited as prescribed
Let them do the work, O king, according to the scriptures, Arindam

8391.text:
Rajasuyam karatushrestham samaptavaradakshinam
Ahara tavam mama krite yathanyayam yathakramam

8393.text:
Dirghayura jivati cha vai Dhritarashtra pita tava
Atasha chapi viruddhasa te karatura esha nripottama

8395.text:
Let these rulers of the earth, who are taxpayers, pay your earthly
taxes and gold and silver

8396.text:
Let us do the langa today with it, O noble king
Let us till the land of the sacrificial field with it, O Bharatha

8399.text:
This great sacrifice is the best to do the Rajasuya
We like it and it is your share, India
It will be without hindrance and this will be your desire

8400.text: And thus spoken by the brahmins, the king Dhritarashtra said to Karna, Saubala, and his brothers

8401.text:
I like the words of the whole Brahmanas, no doubt
If you like your body, don't tell me anything

8405.text:
Sajjam karatuvaram rajan kalapraptam cha bharata
sauvarnam cha kritam divyam langal sumahadhanam

8406.text:
Hearing this, Dhritarashtra, the best of kings, lord of the world,
ordered the king to do the king's initiation

8408.text:
Dhritarashtra was overjoyed and Vidura was of great fame
Bhishma, Darona, Kripa, Karna and the illustrious Gandhari

8412.text:
Savaviryarjitam arthaugham avapya kurunandana
tatra gacchanti rajano brahmanasha cha tatas tatha

8414.text: Then King Yudhisthira, hearing the messenger's words, said,

8415.text:
We'll also worship you now how can
time be kept until the year is thirteen

8417.text:
When he will throw him into the fire of weapons and arms
The king of men will be in battle above the waves of the rain

8420.text:
Athajagmura narashrestha nanajanapadeshvarah
brahmanasha cha mahabhaga Dhritarashtra puram parati

8424.text:
Vidura, you have thus commanded all the varnas, O Arindam,
as the most learned worshiped the righteous

8428.text:
[Vai]
Paravishantam maharaja sutas tustuvura achyutam
Janasha chapi maheshvasam tustuvu rajasattamam

8429.text:
Lajaish sandalwood powder and bow scattered people then
They said, fortunately, the king's obstacle is over, this is your deed

8430.text:
Apare tava abruvansa tatra vatikas tam mahipatim
Yuddhisthirasya yajnena na samo haya esha tu karatuh
nai tasya karator esha kalam arhati shodashim

8431.text:
Evam tatrabruvan ke chid vatikas tam naresvaram
suhridas tava abruvansa tatra ati sarvan aya karatuh

8434.text:
Abhivadya tatha padau matapitror visham pate
bhishmadranapripana cha vidura cha dhimata

8438.text:
Tama abravin maharaja Dhritarashtra mahayashah
Satyam etat tavaya veer pandaveshu duratmasu

8439.text:
After I have been killed, O best of men, and after I have attained the great sacrifice,
you will again raise me up in your heroic Rajasuya

8441.text:
So 'barvit suhridas chapi parsvasthana nripastamah
Kada tu tam karatuvara rajasuyam mahadhanam
killing the Pandavas and taking them all back, O Kauravas

8443.text:
Athotkrushtam maheshvasaira Dhritarashtraira maharathaih
paratijnate phalgunasya vadhe karna sanyuge
vijitansha chapya amanyanta pandavana dhritarashtrajah

8444.text:
Duryodhana, too, leaving Rajendra, the mighty man,
entered the house of another, as shy as the lord Chaitraratha
They all went to their homes with great archers, O Bharatha

8446.text:
Bhuyo cha charai rajendra paravrttir upapadita
paratijna sutaputrasya vijayasya vadham parati

8450.text:
Sangmya Sutaputrena Karnenahava Shobhina
Duryodhana parie nitya vartamano mahipati
poojayama asa viprendran karatubhira bhuridakshinaih

8451.text:
Bharatrunam cha pariyam rajan sa cakara parantapah
nishchitya manasa viro dattabhukta phalam dhanam

8456.text:
We are deer killed in the forest of the gods, equal India
We will not be destroyed, O great king, let us live together

8457.text:
You brothers are brave and all are weapons experts
You have left little of the tribes of the forest dwellers

8460.text: The king, who is devoted to the welfare of all beings, said to them,

8462.text:
I am told by the deer at night that the remains of the slain at the end of the dream
thin beings are equally good and that you have mercy on us

8463.text:
They say the truth and we should show mercy to the forest dwellers
For eight months is our year if we use them

8466.text:
They went and followed the paths of the forests with pure water
and saw the holy hermitage of Kamyaka, full of ascetics

8468.text:
[Vai]
The great souls of the Pandavas, who lived in the forest, lived for eleven years with difficulty, O best of the Bharatas

8470.text: Yudhisthira, however, the royal sage, thinking of the sins of his own actions, the mighty-armed one, the best of the sufferings of his brothers

8472.text:
Samsmarana parusha vachah sutaputrasya pandavah
nishvasaparamo dino bibhrat kopavisham mahat

8473.text:
Arjuna, Yama, Chobha and Daraupadi, the illustrious
He and Bhima, the most brilliant, the best of all, the strongest
They looked at Yudhisthira and suffered the greatest of sorrows

8475.text:
Whose mind is yours, then, the age of time, son of Satyavati
The great yogi Pandava observer came today

8477.text:
Tama seated, worshipped, served, controlled senses
satisfying the old age by the fall of the Pandavas

8479.text:
Yudhisthira, mighty-armed one, hear, O best of the righteous
sons of unburnt austerities attain great happiness

8480.text:
For in pleasure and pain a man serves in turn
No one attains the utmost unhappiness, O best of men

8481.text:
Parajnavansa tava eva purusha sanyukta paraya dhia
udayastamayajno hi na shochati na hrishyati

8482.text:
He who serves happiness when he is in trouble bears what is in trouble
He who worships what is in time is like a farmer in the name of crops

8484.text:
Truth, uprightness, anger, division, restraint, calmness
Anasuya, non-violence, purity, restraint of the senses
The means, O Maharaja, of men's pious deeds

8486.text:
The action done here is enjoyed in the next
Therefore one should engage the body by austerity and regulation

8488.text:
Satyavadi labhetayur anayasam atharjavi
akrodhano 'ansuyash cha nirvritim labhe param

8489.text:
The self-controlled peace does not find eternal trouble
nor does the self-controlled soul suffer when he sees the Shariam gone to the other

8490.text:

with a garland of beads and webs of swans and cranes

The mighty-armed Paraharada will cry at the head of the

May your intelligence grow in righteousness and do not set your mind on iniquity

The sacrifice was accepted by the sea-eyed man who was wandering

You will prevent them from being invincible and invincible in battle

I believe that time and strong fate are the laws that
