9562.text:
Athoposhya shirahsnata daivatanya abhigamya sa
hutvagnim vidhivad viprana vachayam asa parvani

9567.text:
The man who asked for others and the fame that you offer me
Consider me and I will give it to others Choose what you want

9569.text:
A father who does not give is to be spoken of and a husband to be spoken of and a husband who is to be married
A dead husband and a son are to be spoken of and a mother who is not protected

9572.text:
Sabhivadya pituh padau variditeva manasvini
pitu vacanam ajnaya nirjagama vicharitam

9574.text:
After bowing at the feet of the honorable elders there,
the forests of Karamashas, my father, went to all of them

9576.text:
[Mark]
Then King Narada, the king of Madras, met him
and sat in the assembly, telling the story of Yoga, Bharatha

9577.text:
Then he visited all the holy places and hermitages and
he came to his father's house with Savitri and her ministers

9581.text:
[Mark]
She, urged by her father to write in detail,
received the words of the gods and said these things

9586.text:
[Narada]
Oh, what a great sin Savitri has committed, O king,
not knowing that she has surrounded the virtuous and truthful

9588.text:
Balasyavah pariyash chasya karotya ashwaansh cha mrn mayan
chitre 'pi cha likhtya ashwaansh chitrasva iti chochyate

9590.text:
[Narada]
He is as brilliant as Vivasvan and as equal to Brihaspati in his opinion
He is as brave as Mahendra and as forgiving as the earth

9592.text:
[Narada]
In Sanskrit, he is equal to Rantideva in power and charity
As Brahmin and truthful as Shibir Aushinara

9593.text:
Yayatir iva chodarah somavat pariyadarshanah
rupanayantam 'shavibhya dayumatsenasuto bali

9595.text:
Everyday straightforwardness is said to be in that state and to the strong
completeness of the austere and the virtuous

9596.text:
[Ashwapati]
Gunair upetam sarvais tam bhagavan parabravishi me
doshan apya asya me baruhi yadi santih ke chan

9598.text:
[King]
Ehi Savitri gaccha tavam anyam varaya shobhane
His fault is great one stands attacking the virtues

9599.text:
As the Lord told me, Narada, honored by the gods,
He will lay down his body in a short life

9601.text:
Long life or short life, whether he is virtuous or not
I have chosen my husband once, I will not choose a second

9603.text:
[Narada]
Sthira buddhir narashrestha savitrya duhitus tava
naisha chalayitum shakya dharmad asmata kathachanan

9604.text:
No other man has the qualities of truthfulness
It is giving to others so I like your daughter

9606.text:
[Narada]
Avighnam astu savitriah paradane duhitus tava
sadhayishayamahe tavat sarvasam bhadrama astu vah

9607.text:
[Mark]
Having said this, Kham got up and went to the sea
The king also performed all the marriage ceremonies for his daughter

9612.text:
The king, having worshiped that royal sage as he deserved,
being well-intentioned in his words, made his submission

9613.text: After offering him the offering, the seat and the cow, the righteous man said to the king,

9616.text:
Chayutas sama rajyad vanavasam ashritasha; charama dharma niyatas tapasvinah
Katham tava anarha vanavasam ashram; sahishyate kalesham imam suta tava

9618.text:
You can't kill my hope with friendship and war
You can't reject me with love that has come to me

9619.text:
Anurupa hi sanyoge tavam mamaham tavapi cha
sanusham paratichcha me kanyam bharyam satyavatah sutam

9620.text:
[Dayumatsena]
I have always desired a relationship with you
I am yours in the kingdom of Bharashta and then I thought of this

9621.text:
This is your intention which I have already wished for
May it be fulfilled I have always wished for you horse you are my guest

9624.text:
Even the truthful man rejoiced to find a wife who was endowed with all virtues
and she found him to be the husband she desired

9626.text: By service, by virtue, by reliance on others, by self-control, and by all desires and actions, bring satisfaction to all

9627.text:
Shavashrum sharirasatkaraih sarvaira achadanadibhi
shavashuram devakaryaish cha vacha samyamanena cha

9629.text:
Thus there in the ashram they then dwelt, and
the time of their penance, Kash chid atichakram Abharat

9630.text:
Savitryas tu shayanayas tishtantyasha cha divanisham
The words spoken by Narada are in my mind

9632.text:
Savitri counts her hopes day by day
That word spoken by Narada is always in my heart

9637.text:
[Dayumatsena]
I am not able to tell you to break the vow, how can anyone like us say that it is appropriate to say that you should
cross it

9642.text:
Avaidhvyashira asa te tu savitrya artham hitah shubhah
Uchus ascetics all the inhabitants of the ascetic forest

9646.text:
[Six years]
pass this as instructed and you
reach the meal time if later

9647.text:
[Savitri]
After sunset I should eat in the sun with my desire
This is the resolution in my heart and I have done it in time

9648.text:
[Mark]
As she was thus conversing, Savitri returned the meal
Satyavan stood beside him with an ax on his shoulder

9649.text:
Savitri told your husband Naikas you should go
I will come with you because I don't want to lose you

9650.text:
[Truthful]
Before you have gone to the forest, you are suffering and the path is broken, beautiful
and you are able to fast and fast, how can you go on foot

9651.text:
[Savitri]
I have no sorrow in fasting and no fatigue
You should not refuse me to go and encourage me

9653.text:
[Mark]
Satbhigmyabrvich chhavashrum shavashuram cha mahavrata
Ayam gacchati me bharta phalaharo mahavanam

9654.text:
I wish to be allowed to go out with my noble father-in-law
for I cannot bear to be separated from him

9655.text:
Gurva agnihotraartha krite parasthitash cha sutas tava
 nivaryo nivaryo sayad anyatha parasthito vanam

9658.text:
Then let this bride get her desire as she desires
and be careful not to do it, daughter, on the path of truthfulness

9659.text:
[Mark]
Without permission from both, she went illustrious
with her husband, laughing as if heartbroken

9660.text:
She saw the forests strange and beautiful everywhere
wide-eyed, echoing with the sound of peacocks

9661.text:
The river is the holy flow and the flowering part of the mountain
The truthful said,

9662.text:
Looking at her husband in all his states, she is blameless
Mritama eva hi tam mene kale munivacho samaran

9665.text:
He felt a sweat as he felled the wood
and he had a headache from the exercise

9666.text:
He approached his wife and said, tormented by shame,
The pain in my head caused by my old age

9667.text:
Angani chaiva savitri hridaya vayati cha
Asvasthama cha chaatmana chai mita bhashini

9668.text:
I noticed this with my head pierced like a spear
I want to sleep then, well, I have no power to stand

9669.text: Then Savitri embraced her husband and sat down on the ground with her head on his lap

9674.text:
I know your body as a god, this meditating human being
Tell me with desire, Devakasa, what do you want?

9675.text:
[Yama]
You are chaste, Savitri, and also austere
Therefore I address you, know me as your auspicious Yama

9685.text:
The seven steps of the parahu are the seven steps of a friend, the wise seer of the truth
and hear what I shall say in honor of friendship

9687.text:
By the righteousness of one, according to the opinion of the saints; all have followed that path equally
I do not desire the second or the third; therefore the saints call the righteousness of the other

9688.text:
[Yama]
Nivarta tushto 'sami tavana gira; savarakshara vayanjana hetuyuktaya
varam vrinishveha vinasya jivitam; dadani te sarvam anindite varam

9692.text:
The most desired of the virtuous is the one who is associated with them; after that they call others friends
and no fruit is associated with the righteous; then the virtuous dwell in the assembly

9693.text:
[Ya]
Mano 'nukulam budha buddhivardhanam; tavayaham ukto vachanam hitasrayama
vina punah satyavato 'saya jivitam; varam davityam varayasva bhamini

9694.text:
[Savitri]
Hritam pura me shavasurasya dhimata; savam eva rajyam sa labheta parthivah
jahyat savadharma na cha me gurur; yatha davitiyam etam varayami te varam

9696.text:
[Savitri]
Parajas tavayema niyamena sanyata; niyamya chaita nayase na kamaya
Ato yamatvam tava deva vishrutam; nibodha cheman giram iritam maya

9697.text:
Adrohah sarvabhuteshu karma manasa gira
Anugrahasha cha danam cha satam dharma sanatana

9700.text:
[Savitri]
My son, the lord of the earth, is my father; may he have a hundred sons of his father, equal to my Maura
and whatever may be the children of the family; I choose this third for you as your best

9701.text:
[Yama]
The brightest of the children of the family; may the father of a hundred sons be your auspicious
by the desire you have done, O daughter of the king; turn away from the path which has come to you

9705.text:
Friendship gives birth to the name of trust in all beings
Therefore people trust in the good especially

9708.text:
[Yama]
A hundred sons of strong strength; it will be a pleasure for your strength
You will not struggle, O prince; turn away from the path which has come to you

9709.text:
[Savitri]
The righteous always have eternal righteousness; the saints do not suffer nor are they distressed
There is no fruitless association of the righteous with the righteous; the righteous do not follow the fear of the righteous

9713.text:
[Yama]
As you speak the Dharma Samhita; the mind is favorable to the good words of great meaning
so is my devotion to you excellent; ask for a boon that is unparalleled, O Yatavrata

9715.text:
I do not desire happiness without my husband; I do not desire heaven without my husband
I do not desire Sharia without my husband; I do not desire to live without my husband

9718.text:
This, my dear, is the husband I have freed, O delight of your family
Arogas will be your fame and perfection

9723.text:
Savitrya also found her husband when he went to Yama and
went there where her husband's body was found

9726.text:
[Truthful]
I've been asleep for a long time, why didn't you wake up
Where is that man lying who pulled me together

9728.text:
You are resting, O most fortunate one, and sleep, prince
If you can, get up and see the night deep

9731.text:
Shiro 'bhitapa santaptah sathatum chiram ashaknuvan
tavatsange parasupto 'ham iti sarvam samare shubhe

9736.text:
These cheerful, bitter-speaking animals graze at night
They hear the sound of leaves and the deer grazing in the forest

9740.text:
Then I will bring fire and light it here everywhere
These are the woods here kill your sorrow

9743.text:
[Truthful]
The headache is gone and I notice my limbs in all places
I wish to meet my mother and father by your grace

9747.text:
What is your condition today for me I think
Your invisible and I will be in great sorrow

9748.text:
They told me in the past that they were
very sad and old and often asleep at night

9749.text:
We cannot live without you for a moment, my son
As long as you hold us, my son, we will hold you alive

9750.text:
Vrdhayor andhayor yashtis tavayi vanshah pratishthitah
tavayi pindash cha kirtish cha santana chavayor iti

9752.text:
I am jealous of the sleeplessness for which my father and
mother have become suspicious and are not helpful to me

9754.text: My father, with an anxious mind and a stranger's eyes, asked each of the inhabitants of the ashram at this time

9756.text:
For my deeds will cause you great sorrow today
I will follow them while they are alive and I will marry them
I will kill them and I will do my duty

9761.text:
[Truthful]
I desire to see my father, go to Savitri Machiram
If I see the displeasure of my mother or father in the past
I shall not live, O bridegroom, I shall attain myself by truth

9762.text:
If in righteousness and in your wisdom you want me to be alive,
go to my ashram near me or do my duty

9763.text:
[Mark]
Savitri then got up and combed her hair, beautiful
She was holding her husband in her arms

9764.text:
Satyavansh also got up and wiped his limbs with his hands
looking in all directions and took a hard look

9768.text:
[Satyawan]
Abhyasagamanaad bhiru panthano vidita mama
vrikshantaralokitaya jayotsnaya chapi lakshaye

9769.text:
Agatau savah patha yena phalanya avachitani cha
Yathagatam shubhe gaccha panthanam ma vicharaya

9771.text:
[Mark]
Baruvann evam tavarayuktah sa parayad ashram parati

9773.text:
He went to all the ashrams and went to the supreme suffering with his wife Shaibya
for the sake of his son, O best of men

9775.text:
Hearing the sound, however, they turned toward something, son, suspicious
Savitri and Satyavan ran together

9780.text:
And again, speaking the words of pity, they cried out in sorrow
Alas, son, alas, saintly bride, where are you, where are you

9781.text:
[Suvarchas]
As his wife Savitri is united with austerity and restraint
and conduct, so lives Satyavan

9783.text:
All the things I have chosen with concentration
are the best things I have ever eaten and fasted in the air

9785.text:
[Shisya]
As the words of my teacher
have never been false by being, so lives the truthful

9786.text:
[Rasyah]
As his wife Savitri is endowed with all the same virtues
without widowhood, so lives Satyavan

9787.text:
[Bharadwaja]
As his wife Savitri is united with austerity and restraint
and conduct, so lives Satyavan

9789.text:
[Mandavya]
As the deer and birds say in a quiet direction
And the earth is the source of others, so lives Satyavan

9790.text:
[Dhaumya]
You are endowed with all virtues, as your son is popular
You are endowed with long life and characteristics, and so lives Satyavan

9791.text:
[Mark]
Thus reassured by the truthful words of the ascetics,
they ignored them and seemed to be present in the meaning

9792.text:
Then at that moment Savitri with her husband Satyavata
came to the ashram and entered the ashram at night very happy

9795.text:
All we have said is that there is no doubt about it
you will grow more and more

9797.text:
Shaibya and Satyavansh and Savitri stood together
All of them, permitted by them, sat down without hesitation

9798.text:
Then all those forest dwellers who were seated with the king
being curious, O Partha, asked the king's son

9799.text:
Why didn't the pollen come with your wife, Lord
Why did you come in the night, and what contract did you have

9801.text:
[Truthful]
I went with Savitri with my father's permission
Then I felt the pain of cutting wood in the forest

9802.text:
I noticed that I was in pain for a long time as I slept
and I had never slept for so long before

9803.text:
So that you may not be in trouble for all
Therefore there is no other reason for Viratra's arrival

9804.text:
[Gautama]
Aksmacha chakshura ah paraptir dayumatsenasya te pitu
Nasya tava karanam vettha savitri vaktum arhati

9805.text:
Sharotum ichchami savitri tavam hi vettha paravaram
tavan hi janami savitri savitrim iva tejasa

9807.text:
[Savitri]
So this is the resolution as you know it, nothing else for you
And nothing is a secret to me, tell me the facts here because

9808.text:
The death of my husband was told by the great Narada
He arrived today and I will not leave him

9809.text:
Yama himself approached him as he slept
He brought him bound to the direction of the father's service

9810.text:
I have praised the darkness of the god, the Lord of truth and words
The five boons he has given me, listen to them of mine

9811.text:
Chakshur e cha savarajyam cha davau varau shavasurasya me
labdham pitah putrashatam putranam atmanah shatam

9812.text:
Four years and a hundred years of life my husband has found and is truthful
For the sake of my husband's life, I have cut off the stable boon

9813.text:
This is the truth I have told you in detail for the reason
As it happened, Sukhodarkam, this is a great sorrow to me

9816.text:
[Mark]
That night, in the late afternoon, in the rising sun

9823.text:
Parayahi rajan bhadram te ghushtas te nagare jayah
adhyassva chiraratraya pitrupatamaham padam

9826.text:
And with Shaibya and Savitri, he set out in a well-spread
manned chariot surrounded by an army

9827.text: Then the priests consecrated Dayumatsena and his great son as prince

9829.text:
Bharatrunaam sodaraanam cha tathaivasyabhavacha chhatama
Madradhipasyasvapateraam malavyam sumahabalam

9830.text:
Thus the soul, father, mother, mother-in-law, father-in-law and
husband's family were all rescued by Savitri from trouble

9831.text:
That is how this auspicious Daraupadi, endowed with virtue,
will save you all, like Savitri, a noble lady

9832.text:
[Vai]
Evam sa Pandavas tena anunito mahatmana
vishoko vijvaro rajan kamyaka nayavasat tada

9833.text:
[Birth]
Then the great Brahman Lomasha spoke the words
At the words of Indra, he came to Yudhisthira, the son of Pandu

9834.text:
Yach chapi te bhayam tivram na cha kirtayase kav chit
tacha chapya apaharishyami savyasachav ihagate

9835.text:
What is that, O best of the learned, that great fear
sat upon the ears, and that righteous man did not tell anyone's mind

9836.text:
[Vai]
I tell you this story, O tiger of the king
He asks, O best of Bharatas, listen to my words

9838.text:
Abhiprayam atho janatva mahendrasya vibhavasu
kundalarthe maharaja surya karnam upagama

9840.text:
At the end of the night, O King, we showed him that he was radiant
with grace and affection for his son, O Bharatha

9842.text:
Hear my words, father, best of the truthful
Baruvato, O mighty-armed one, friendship is the greatest good

9843.text:
Upayasyati shakrasa tavam pandavanam hitepsya
brahmana chhadmana karna kundalapajihirshaya

9844.text:
He knows your character of the whole world and
as you are begged by the righteous, you will give and not ask

9845.text:
Tavam hi tata dadasya eva brahmanebhya parayachitah
vittam yacha chanyad apya ahura na paratyakhyasi karhi chit

9849.text:
Ratnaih satribhis tatha bhogair dhanair bahuvidhair api
nidarsanaish cha bahubhih kundalepsuh purandara

9850.text:
If you give your ears to your easy earrings, auspicious
You will go to the end of your life and come under the control of death

9851.text:
Combined with shield and earrings, honorable
you will not be killed in battle, know that I am the enemy of my words

9852.text:
A horse that has risen from nectar is both a gemstone
Therefore protect your ears and keep your ears alive

9853.text:
[Karna]
Ko maam evam bhavan parah darshayan sauhridam param
kamaya bhagavan baruhi ho bhavan davij veshadharak

9854.text:
[Bara]
I, my father, show you the thousand rays of friendship
Do this word to me, and this is the best thing for you

9855.text:
[Karna]
Shareya eva mamatyantam yasya me gopatih parabhuh
paravaktadya hitanveshi shrunu chedam vacho mama

9857.text:
Varatam vai mama loko 'yam vetti kritsno vibhavaso
yathaham davijamukhyabhyo dadyam paranaan api dharuvam

9860.text:
It is not fitting for a man like me to protect his life
For it is fitting to die with fame, which is acceptable to the world

9861.text:
So I will give it to Indra with earrings and armor
if Balavritraghna will come to me for alms

9862.text:
Hitartham Panduputranam kundale me parayachitum
tan me kirtikaram loke tasyakirtir bhavishati

9863.text:
I seek fame in the world, for even by life, Bhanuman
The fameful attains heaven, but the poor perishes

9864.text:
For fame revives a man in the world like a mother
Disfame kills the living even though the body is alive

9865.text:
Ayam Purana Shloka Hi Savayam Geeto Vibhavaso
Dhatra Lokesvara Yatha Kirti Ayu Narasya Vai

9866.text:
Purushasya pare loke kirtir eva parayanam
ih loke vishuddha cha kirtir ayur vivardhani

9867.text:
So I will give to the body-born and attain eternal fame
and give the righteous gifts to the Brahmins according to the right

9868.text:
Having sacrificed my body in battle, doing karma is very difficult
winning or conquering others, I will only gain fame today

9869.text:
Give safety to the frightened, save the survivors of battle
and save the old, the children, and the demons from the great fear

9870.text:
I shall attain the supreme fame in this world, O destroyer of all things
Even with my life, my fame should be protected, know that it is my best

9871.text:
So 'ham datva Maghavate bhiksham etam anuttamam
Brahman chhadmine devaloke ganta param gatim

9872.text:
[Sun]
Mahitam karna karshis tavam atmanah suhridam tatha
putranam atha bharyanam atho matura atho pitu

9874.text:
The eternal fame you desire against your life
will no doubt take your life away

9875.text:
The living do the work of father, mother, daughters and
ye chanye bandhavah ke chil loke 'asmin purusharsha
rajanash cha naravyaghra paurushena nibodha tat

9876.text:
And fame is the great light of a saintly man while he is alive
What is the use of the fame of the dead for a body that is burnt to ashes
The dead do not know fame, life enjoys fame

9878.text:
Bhaktimanto hi me rakshya iti etenapi hetuna
Bhako 'yam paraya bhaktya mama iti eva mahabhuja
mamapi bhaktira utpanna sa tavam kuru vacho mama

9879.text:
There is something else here that is spiritual and created by God
so I tell you to do this without hesitation

9882.text:
Shombhase kundalabhya hi ruchirabhya mahadyute
vishakhayor madhyagatah shashiva vimalo divi

9885.text:
Upapattiyupapannaarthaira madhuryakritabhusanaih
Purandarasya karna tavam buddhima etam apanud

9886.text:
For you, O tiger of men, are always competing with the left-handed
The left-handed and with you the hero will meet in battle

9888.text:
Therefore I shall not give these earrings of yours to Indra, O auspicious
If you desire to defeat Karna in battle, O Arjuna

9889.text:
[Karna]
I am a devotee of the Lord as you know me, O cowherd man
and there is no other god in any way

9890.text:
I have no wife, no sons, no soul, no friend, no
so I always desire with devotion as you protect me

9891.text:
The great souls of the desired and the devotees no doubt
do devotion to the desired and you know you and the sun

9892.text:
Ishto bhaktish cha me karno na chanyad devatam divi
janit iti vai kritva bhagavan aha mada dhitam

9893.text:
Again and again I beg with my head and offer it again and again
I write to you, Tigmansho, but you must forgive me

9895.text:
Yach cha mama attha deva tavam pandavam phalgunam parati
vayetu santapajam dukkham tava bhaskaramanasam
arjuna parati maam chaiva vijeshyami rane 'arjunam

9896.text:
Tvapi viditam deva mamapya astrabala mahata
jamadagnyad upattam yata tatha darona mahatmana

9898.text:
[Sun]
If, father, you give me these auspicious thunderbolt earrings
you will also choose him for victory, O mighty one

9899.text:
Niyamena paradadyas tavam kundale vai shatakratoh
Avadhyo haya asi bhutanaam kundalabhya samanvita

9900.text:
Arjuna destroyed your demon Soodana
The chariot of others wants to win you in battle, O calf, in your earrings

9901.text:
Sa tavam apya enam aradhya sunritabhih punah punah
abhyarthayetha devesham amoghartham purandaram

9902.text:
Give me infallible power to destroy my enemies
I will give you the best shield in the thousand-eyed earrings

9903.text:
It is thus by this rule that you shall give your earrings to Indra
by which you shall kill your ears in battle, O enemy in battle

9907.text:
Then the Lord Bhanu, the sun-god, the destroyer of all suns,
said to him,

9909.text:
[Birth]
What is that secret not told to the ears by the hot rays
What kind of earrings are they and what kind of shield are they

9910.text:
Kutash cha kavacham tasya kundale chaiva sattam
Etad ichchamya aha sharotum tan me baruhi tapodhan

9911.text:
[Vasampayana]
This, O king, I shall tell you, this is the secret of the fire
in whatever earrings and shield you wear

9912.text:
Kuntibhojam pura rajan brahmana samupasthitah
tigmateja mahapranshu shamashrudandajata dharah

9913.text:
Darshaniyo 'navadyangas tejasa parajvalanna iva
madhu pingo madhuravaka tapa savyadhya bhushan

9914.text:
He said to King Kuntibhoja, the great ascetic
I wish to beg, and I will eat in your house without envy

9915.text:
I don't have to be bullied by you or your followers
I'll live in your house like this if you like it, sinless one

9917.text:
Tama abravit Kuntibhoja paritiyuktam idam vacah
Evam astu param cheti punas chainam athabravit

9918.text:
My daughter, O great Brahmin, is named Pritha, a renowned
virtuous woman, devoted and not arrogant

9921.text:
This calf, the most fortunate Brahmin, wants something
I have heard him say so in my house

9922.text:
Tavayi vatse parasvasya brahmanasya abhiradhanam
tan me vakyam na mithya tavam kartum arhasi karhi chit

9924.text:
Brahmana hi param tejo Brahmana hi parantapah
Brahmanaam nama karaira suryo divi virajate

9925.text:
Amanayana hi manarhana vatapisha cha mahasurah
nihato brahmadandena talajanghasa tathaiva cha

9926.text:
So 'yam vatse mahabhara ahitas tavayi sampratam
tavam sada niyata kurya brahmanasya abhiradhanam

9930.text: I think I should tell you that you are a child of the earth and that you are my daughter

9931.text:
The beloved daughter of the hero born in your family of the Vrishnis
was given to me by my father as a child in the past

9932.text:
Vasudevasya bhagini sutanaam paravara mama
Agryam agre paratijnaya tenaasi duhita mama

9933.text:
Tadrishe hi kule jata kule chaiva vivardhita
sukhat sukham anuprapta hardad dharadam ivagata

9935.text:
Birth in a royal family on earth, form and wonderful sight
Therefore you are endowed with it and endowed with it, beautiful

9937.text:
Evam parapsyasi kalyani kalyanaam anaghe dharuvam
kopite tu davijashresthe kritsnam dahyet me kulam

9941.text:
Labho mamaisha rajendra yad vai poojayati davijan
adesh tava tishtanti hitam kuryam narottam

9944.text:
For the Brahmanas are worshiped by the greatly fortunate, O lord of the earth
They are able to save and to kill the Sayur on the contrary

9951.text:
The demigods are very fortunate in the old and young ascetics
They are always angry with others even in the opposite

9952.text:
Even in the case of a great crime, forgiveness is to be shown by the Davijatis
Acceptable worship with as much enthusiasm as possible, O best of the Davijas

9956.text:
There she went to the Brahmin and Pritha, being a chaste woman,
satisfied him as a god worthy of ritual attendance

9957.text:
[Vai]
Sa tu kanya maharaja brahmana sanshitavrata
toshayam asa shuddena manasa sanshitavrata

9960.text:
Annadi samudachara shayasanakritas tatha
day by day his increases not decreases

9961.text:
Nirbhartsanapavadaish cha tathaivapriyaya gira
Brahmanasya pritha rajan na chakarapriyam tada

9962.text:
Vayaste kale puno chaiti na chaiti bahusho davijah
durlabhyam api chaivanna diyatam iti so 'barvit

9964.text:
Yathopajosham rajendra davijatipravarasya sa
paritim pradudayam asa kanya yatnair anindita

9965.text:
The great saint was pleased with her virtue
and again with attention he made the next effort

9966.text:
She was asked by her father in the morning and in the evening, Bharata
Are you also pleased with your daughter's attendance at the Brahmin

9970.text:
Ask for boons, auspicious ones, which are difficult to drink by humans here
That you may overcome all your cemeteries with fame

9971.text:
[Unti]
I have done all things for her who has given me the knowledge of the Vedas
Your father, who is very pleased with me, has done all things for me, O brahmin, by my boons

9972.text:
[Bara]
If you don't want your boon from me, gentle lady, pure smile
take this mantra to call you to the heavens

9978.text:
Well arranged in your house and always well respected
We will accomplish it until then and disappeared

9980.text:
[Vai]
gate tasmin davijashresthe kasminsh chit kalaparyaye
chintayam asa sa kanya mantragram balabalam

9981.text:
This is what kind of person he gave me
mantragram strength I will know it soon

9984.text:
Her sight became divine and she saw a divine vision
Amuktakavacham devam adorned with earrings

9987.text:
Honey-pink, mighty-armed, conch-necked, smiling
Angadi, tied crown, flaming in all directions

9988.text:
Yogat kritva davithatmanam ajagama tatapa cha
abbhashe tatha kunti samna paramavalguna

9989.text:
I have come under your control, gentle lady, by the force of your mantra
What can I do, O queen, tell me, I am the doer of that

9992.text:
Your alliance is to have a son from the fortunate sun
viryenapratimo loke kavachi kundaliti cha

9995.text:
I will burn them all for you, no doubt
and your father is a fool who does not know this is yours

9999.text:
[Vai]
Then the princess of the sea saw; all in all the positions of the sky
the sun shining brightly and great; as the sun shines

10002.text:
I have called you to know the power of the mantra, your fire
from childhood to childhood, and then you should forgive me, Lord

10005.text:
She will come to you with me and you will have a son like me
and you will be distinguished in all the worlds, beautiful

10006.text:
[Vai]
Sa tu kanya bahuvidha baruvanti madhuram vachah
sahasranshu na shashak na shashaka manasvini

10007.text:
When the child could not reject the darkness
frightened by the curse, Rajan meditated for a long time

10008.text:
The curse of the innocent father of the Brahmin and so
for me, how can you not be angry with us from the fire

10009.text:
Even as a child, Mohad is very destructive and others
not to be overcome by the tejas and austerities

10010.text:
I am very scared today and caught in the hand very much
How can I do your wrong thing to give to others horse myself

10011.text:
She was so cursed and thinking a lot then
mohenabhiparitanga samayamana punah punah

10012.text:
Tam devam abravid bhita bandhunam rajasattam
varida vihvalaya vaca shapatrasta visham pate

10013.text:
[Kunti]
My father is being held, O God, my mother and other relatives
This will not be a violation of the law in those who are being held

10014.text:
Tavaya me sangamam devayadi sayad vidhivarjita
mannimittam kulasyasya loke kirti nashet tatha

10018.text:
Sarvan kamayate yasmat kaner dhatosh cha bhamini
tasmat kanyeha sushroni savatantra varavarnini

10019.text:
Nadharmasha charita kash chit tavaya bhavati bhamini
Adharmam kuta evaham chareyam lokakamyaya

10021.text:
She will meet me and you will become a virgin again
and you will have a son who will be very armed and very famous

10022.text:
[Kunti]
If I have a son, take away everything from you
Earrings, shield, brave, mighty-armed, mighty-strong

10026.text:
[Sun]
Aditya kundale rajani datte me mattakashini
te 'saya dasyami vai bhiru varma chaivedam uttamam

10028.text:
[Vai]
Tathetya uktva tu tam Kuntim avishesha vihangamah
savarbhanu shatrur yogatma nabhya pasparsha chaiva tam

10029.text:
Then the maiden was overwhelmed by the brightness of the sun
and the goddess fell on her bed in a foolish consciousness

10032.text:
Iti samokta Kunti rajatmaja sa; Vivasvantam yachamana salajja
tasmin punye shayaniye papata; mohavistha bhajyamaana lateva

10033.text:
He bewitched her with the effulgence of Tigmanshus; he established himself by yoga
The sun did not spoil her; she regained consciousness again and again

10036.text:
Na hi tam ved narya anya ka chid hatreyikam rite
kanya puragatam balaam nipunam parirakshane

10037.text:
Then in due course she gave birth to a child of beautiful colour
the daughter of that god who gave birth to immortal radiance

10038.text:
As his father wore a shield bound with golden earrings
haryaksha and a bull's shoulder

10039.text:
And as soon as the pregnancy was born, the midwife invited him and placed him in a beautiful
box spread all over

10040.text:
When she was lying on the honeycomb, she cried in happiness and
created a well-dressed horse river

10041.text:
Knowing that she should not conceive a daughter
, O king, she lamented with pity for her son's affection

10042.text:
Samutsrjanti manjusham ashwandyas tada jale
Uvacha rudati Kunti yani vakyani tacha chrunu

10043.text:
Savasti te 'satva antarikshebhya parthivebhyasha cha putraka
divyebhyasha chaiva bhutebhyas tatha toyacharasha cha ye

10044.text:
Shivas te santu panthano ma cha te paripanthinah
Agamasha cha tatha putra bhavantva adroha chetasah

10046.text:
May the Father protect you everywhere, the best of the heaters
who gave you my son by the divine law, Kil

10047.text:
Aditya Vasava Rudra Sadhya Visve Cha Devata
Marutasha Sahandra Dishasha Cha Sadisha Ishwara

10048.text:
May all the gods protect you in equal and unequal times
I will know that you are informed by your shield even abroad

10049.text:
Blessed are you, my son, Janaka, the god of the sun and the fire
who will see you with divine eyes, the army that has gone

10050.text:
Blessed is the Supreme Being who will make you a son
Whose son you thirst for, you will drink the Satan, O God

10051.text:
Who is the dream she has seen that you are as bright as the sun
with divine shield and adorned with divine earrings

10055.text:
Thus, O king, lamenting in so many ways, Pritha
avasrijat manjusham ashwandyas tada jale

10056.text:
Rudati putrashokarta nishithe kamalekshana
dhatrya saha pritha rajan putradarshanalasa

10058.text:
The box of your horse river went to the river Charmanvati
Charmanvatyasha and Yamuna then went to the Ganges

10060.text:
The divine one who rose from the nectar and then the shield with the earrings
wearing the pregnancy and the fate created by the law

10061.text:
[Vai]
At this time, however, Dhritarashtra's friend
Suto 'Adhiratha, went to the Jahnavi with his wife

10063.text:
She saw the coffin carried by chance
the gifts brought by the waves of the Jahnavi

10064.text:
She was curious enough to grab her, beautiful
Then she offered herself to the charioteer of the thread

10066.text:
She was like the young sun, wearing a golden shield and
adorned with a face with polished earrings

10070.text:
Partijagraha tam radha vidhivad divyarupinam
putram kamalagarbhabham devagarbham shariya vratam

10075.text:
Sutas your chief chariot son grew up in time then
seeing that we relocated him to the city of Varanasi

10076.text:
There he went to the temple in the weapons of Darona
He went to Duryodhana in friendship and he was mighty

10078.text:
Sandhaya Dhritarashtra, in the displeasure of the Parthas,
he wishes to fight always with the great Phalguna

10082.text:
There the Brahmanas attend him for the sake of wealth
There is nothing to be given to him at that time in the Davijatis

10084.text:
[Vai]
The bull in disguise of the Brahmin who had not attained the king of the gods
saw that he had come and said that he was not in the mind of Bubodha

10085.text:
Hiranyakanthih paramada garaman va bahu gokulan
kin dadaniti tam viprama uvacadhirathis tatha

10086.text:
[Bara]
Hiranyakanthyah paramada yach cha anyat paritivardhanam
Naham dattam ihechchami tadarthibhyah paradiyatam

10089.text:
[Karna]
Avanim paramada gasha cha nirvapam bahu varshikam
tat te vipra paradasyami na tu varma na kundale

10093.text:
Sahajam varma me vipra kundale chamritodbhave
tenavadhyo 'sami lokeshu tato naitad dadamya aham

10094.text:
The vast earthly kingdom, the peaceful, the killed thorn
Receive from me yours, O saintly Brahmin chief

10095.text:
I shall be freed from the earrings and armor and easily
movable by the enemies, O best of the brahmins

10096.text:
[Vai]
When Lord Pakshasana asked for no other boon
Then the next day Karnas said to him again

10097.text:
I know, O Lord of the gods, that you are the pollen of my Lord
It is not right for me to give you your boon, Indra, in vain

10101.text:
[Sakra]
I know that I came before the sun and that I was your last
so I told you everything and so this is no doubt

10104.text:
[Karna]
Give me power with shield and earrings, O Vasava
Amogha, destroyer of hosts of enemies, at the mouth of the army

10106.text:
Give me earrings and armor and body-born
Take your ear power at this time for me

10107.text:
Amogha kills hundreds of enemies by falling from my hands
Again she reaches out to my hands to defeat my demons

10108.text:
She will take your hand and kill one enemy, energetic
roaring and returning to me, Sutaja

10109.text:
[Karna]
The only thing I want to do is kill the enemy in the great battle
Roaring and falling back because I'm afraid

10111.text:
Yama ahur ved vidvanso varaham ajitam harim
Narayanam achintyam cha tena krishna rakshate

10112.text:
[Karna]
Evam apya astu bhagavan ekveer vadhe mama
Amogha paravara shaktir yena hanyan paratapinam

10114.text:
[Indra]
You will not have ears for your terribleness, how can you
Varanash and not in your limbs, for you do not want to lie to you

10117.text:
[Karna]
Sanshayam paramam parapya vimoksye vasavim imam
yatha maam attha shakra tavam satyam etad baravimi te

10122.text:
Then Indra, having deceived Parahasana; having added Karna to fame in the world
thought the work done by the Pandavas; then afterwards he ascended to heaven

10123.text:
Hearing the ears of Dhritarashtra; all the poor were as if their pride had been broken
and the son of Suta had gone to that state; the forest dwellers rejoiced when they heard the path

10125.text:
[They]
obtained the Krishna Saindhava and cracked it; together with the brahmins from the ashram of Kamyakad they
recited the Purana to Markandeya; the character of the sages of the gods in detail

10126.text:
The chariots and their journeys returned; with all the Sudapaurogavaisha
Then the holy forest of the gods, the heroic men; crossed the whole forest dwelling

10127.text:
[Birth]
Thus taken away by Krishna, having suffered the greatest trouble
What did the Pandavas do after recovering Krishna?

10128.text:
[Vai]
Thus taken away by Krishna, having suffered the greatest trouble,
leaving behind the lustful king with his brothers, Acyuta

10129.text:
Again Yudhisthira went to the beautiful forest of the gods
He returned to the beautiful Markandeya ashram with tasty roots and fruits

10130.text:
Anugupta phalharas sarva eva mitasana
Nayavasana Pandavas tatra krishnaya saha bharata

10131.text:
In the Vasana forest, King Kunti's son Yudhisthira
Bhimasena and Arjuna and the Pandavas, the sons of Madri

10133.text:
Ajatashatru, who was sitting in the forest with his husbands,
came to the Brahmin and said this in a hurry

10134.text:
Attached to me in the forest with the forest
attached to the horn of the deer rubbing

10138.text:
Armed archers, all the mighty men of the enemy
They, who are trying for the sake of the Brahmins, follow the deer quickly

10143.text:
Never in this family did I sink into religion; no movement would become a loss of meaning
They were not answered again in all beings; they reached the same doubt by whom, O king

10147.text:
[Sahadeva]
Shakunis tavan yajaishid akshadyutena bharata
sa maya na hatas tatra tena paraptah sama sanshayam

10148.text:
[Vai]
Then King Yudhisthira said to Nakula
Climb the tree, Madreya, and look in ten directions

10151.text:
I see many Rajan trees sheltering the water
and the crows are noisy and there is no doubt about the water

10154.text:
He saw the clear water surrounded by cranes
Protect the crow Then he heard a voice from the sky

10156.text:
Ignoring that statement, Nakula became very thirsty
Apibach Chhitala Toyam and drank and fell down

10157.text:
When Nakula was long, Yudhisthira, the son of Kunti,
said to his brother, the heroic Sahadeva, the enemy

10158.text:
Brother is waiting for you, father Sahadeva, your elder brother
Bring him and bring you beauty and water

10159.text:
Sahadevas said so and returned in that direction
and saw his brother Nakula then slain on the ground

10160.text:
He was grieving for his brother and tormented by thirst
He ran for water and then a voice spoke to him

10162.text:
Ignoring that statement, Sahadeva became thirsty
Apibach Chhitala Toyam and drank and fell down

10164.text:
Thus said Gudakesha, taking the bow with his arrows
Then the intelligent man with his sword opened returned to the lake

10165.text:
Where the male tigers went to fetch water
he saw them killed there by the white horseman

10166.text:
Seeing them as if they were asleep, Narasimha was very sad
Raising his bow, Kaunteya looked around the forest

10167.text:
He did not see anything there he was in that great forest
Savyasachi then ran to the water in the fall

10168.text:
Abhidhavansa tato vacham antarikshat sa shushruve
kim aasid asi paniyam naitach chkyam balat tavaya

10169.text:
Kaunteya, if you will answer the questions I have asked you
then you will drink water and take away, O Bharatha

10172.text:
Karninalikanarachan utsrujana bharatarshabha
anekair ishusanghatair antariksham vavarsha ha

10174.text:
[Vai]
He released your infallible arrows and was overcome with thirst
He fell down drinking those questions without knowing it

10176.text:
Chiram gatas toyhetor na chagacchanti bharata
tansha chaivana bhadra te paniya cha tavam ana

10178.text:
Seeing them, Bhima was grieved and tormented by thirst
The mighty-armed man thought it was the work of the yakshas and rakshasas
He was thinking then I must fight today

10181.text:
[Vai]
Thus spoken, then Bhima fell down with the Yaksha's immeasurable splendour,
without knowing it, he drank those questions

10183.text:
Apetajananirghosham paravivesh mahavanam
rurubhisha cha varahaisha cha pakshibhisha cha nishevitam

10184.text:
It is adorned with blue and bright trees
and sung by butterflies and birds of great fame

10186.text:
The lotus flower is covered with nets of sindhuvara and cane
ketaka, karavira and fig tree
Sharamartas approached it and was astonished to see the lake

10187.text:
[Vai]
sa dashar hatan bharatrunl lokapalan iva chayutan
yugante samanuprapte shakra paratimagaurvan

10188.text:
Seeing Arjuna killed by scattered bow and arrows
Bhimasena and Yama went motionless

10191.text:
Sayat tu Duryodhananedam upanshu vihitam kritam
gandhara rarachitam sattam jihmabuddhinam

10192.text:
Whose action or inaction is equal, or
who can trust him, the hero of the wicked, the unkind of the soul

10194.text:
Don't think that this water is not polluted by poison as
the colors of my brothers' faces are pleasant

10195.text:
Each and every one of these four-powered men
who else can return except the destroyer of time

10196.text:
With this determination he sank into the water
and as he went down he heard the water from the sky

10198.text:
Do not dare, my father, to take my former wife
After asking the questions, O Kaunteya, then drink and take away

10199.text:
[Y]
The chief of the Rudras or Vasus or Maruts
I ask who you are, O God, and this is not done by Chhakuni

10200.text:
The snow-covered mountains, the Pariyatras, the Vindhya and the Malaya
Who has dropped the four mountains to the earth with his splendour

10201.text:
You have done a very great deed, O best of the strong
no gods, no Gandharvas, no demons, no rakshasas
You have done a great wonderful thing in the great battle of Vishahera

10203.text:
Which is why my heart is troubled and my head is raised
I ask you, Lord, therefore who are you standing here

10205.text:
[Vai]
Tatas tama ashivam sharutva vacham sa parushaksharama
yakshasya baruvato rajanna upakramya tada sathitah

10206.text:
Virupaksham mahakayam yaksham talasamuchchrayam
javalanarkapratikasham adhrishyam parvatopamam

10207.text:
The best of the Bharatas saw the mighty warrior standing on the bridge
threatening him with a cloud-like voice

10208.text:
[Yaks]
These are your brothers, Rajan, whom I have forbidden
Forcibly taking you away, then I have killed you

10211.text:
A man who praises himself with all his soul is the Lord
As the other knows, I will answer your questions, ask me

10212.text:
[Yaks]
What savid raises the sun and some move around it
Which chain takes it to the setting and in which it stands

10213.text:
[Y]
Brahmad iti amun nayati devas tasya abhitasha charah
dharmasha cha asta nayati cha satyaye cha pratitishtati

10214.text:
[Yaks]
Ken savic chrotrio bhavati kena savid vindate mahat
ken davitiyaavan bhavati rajan kena cha buddhimaan

10215.text:
[Y]
Sharutena sharotriya bhavati tapasa vindate mahat
Dhritya davitiyavan bhavati buddhiman vrddhasevaya

10216.text:
[Yaksha]
What is the divinity of the Brahmins and what is their religion like that of the righteous
What is their human nature like that of the unrighteous

10217.text:
[Y]
Svadhya is their divinity, their austerities are like the righteous
Their death is like the human being, their dispute is like the righteous

10218.text:
[Yaksha]
What is the divinity of the Kshatriyas and what is their religion like that of the virtuous
What is their human nature like that of the wicked

10219.text:
[Y]
Ishvastram esam devatvam yajna esam satam iva
bhayam vai manusho bhavam parityaga 'satam iva

10221.text:
[Y]
Parano vai yajniyam sama mano vai yajniyam yajuh
Vaga eka vrishchate yajnam tam yajnam nativartate

10224.text:
[Yaks]
Experiencing sense objects, intelligent, worshiped by the world
Agreed, exhalation of all beings, who does not live

10226.text:
[Yaks]
What is heavier than the earth What is higher than the earth
What is faster than the wind What is more human

10229.text:
[The]
fish that sleeps does not blink and hatches the egg that has been born
The stone has no heart and grows at the speed of the river

10234.text:
[Yaks]
What is Savid one-step righteousness What is Savid one-step fame
What is Savid one-step heaven What Savid one-step happiness

10237.text:
[The]
son is the soul of man, the wife of man, the friend of fate,
the subsistence of the rain, the gift of the sun, and his devotee

10240.text:
[Yaks]
Kasha cha dharma paro loke kasha cha dharma sada phalah
Kim niyamya na shochanti kasha cha sandhir na jiryate

10241.text:
[Y]
Anrishansya parao dharmasa tarayidharma sada phalah
Ano yamya na shochanti sadbhis sandhir na jiryate

10242.text:
[Yaks]
What does one give up to become a pariah? What does one give up to become meaningful? What does one give up to become meaningful? What does one give up to become happy?

10243.text:
[He who]
gives up pride becomes a friend, gives up anger and does not grieve
gives up desire and becomes meaningful, gives up greed and becomes happy

10245.text:
[Y]
The dead poor man, the dead nation, the anarchy
The dead Ashrotriya, the autumn, the dead sacrifice, your unrighteousness

10246.text:
[Yaks]
What is the direction, what is the water, what is the food, Partha, what is the odd
Tell me the time of Sharaddha, then drink and take away

10247.text:
[Y]
Santo dig jalam akasham gaur anna pararthana vishama
Sharaddhasya brahmana kala katham va yaksha manase

10249.text:
[He]
who touches heaven and earth with the sound of a pious deed
as long as that sound is called a man

10250.text: He who is equal in happiness and sorrow, in the past and in the future, is the richest man in all

10251.text:
[Yaks]
The man you have described, O king, is the richest man in fame
Therefore, let the one of your brothers whom you wish live

10252.text:
[Y]
Shayamo ya esha raktaaksho brihach chal ivodgatah
vayudhorasko mahabahur ankula yaksha jivatu

10253.text:
[Yaksha]
Pariyas te Bhimasena 'yam Arjuna vah parayanam
Sa kasmana nakulam rajan sapatnam jivam ichchasi

10255.text:
Tathaina manujah parahura Bhimasena pariyam tava
Atha kena anubhavena sapatnam jivam ichchasi

10256.text:
On whose arm strength all the Pandavas rely
Arjuna, you want Nakula to live by removing darkness

10257.text:
[Y]
I think that non-violence is the supreme religion and the supreme goal
I wish to practice non-violence, may Nakula, the Yaksha, live

Avyaktabodhanacha chaiva budhyamanam vadantya up

10555.text:
The twenty-five great souls are not even understood
The twenty-five pure Buddhas are immeasurable and eternal

10556.text:
Constantly understands twenty-five and twenty-four
The horse followed in the sight of the sight is both the greatest light

10557.text:
The unmanifest is not that Brahman who understands, my father, only
only twenty-five and twenty-four does not see

10559.text:
When one understands the supreme intelligence, pure and immaculate,
the twenty-two royal tigers, then one attains Buddhism

10560.text:
Then he abandons the unmanifest creation and destruction of the righteous
The devoid of virtue knows the nature of others with virtues and the unconscious

10565.text:
Sadvinshena parabuddhena buddhimano 'paya abuddhimana
Etan nanatvam ity uktam sankhyashrutinidarsanata

10567.text:
Budhimano 'parabuddhena samata yati maithila
sangadharma bhavatya esha nissangaatma naradhipa

10568.text:
Asadya nissangatmanam sadvinshakam ajam viduh
vibhus tayajati chavyaktam yada tava etad vibudhyate
chaturvinsham agadham cha sadvinshasya parabodhanat

10570.text:
The difference between these two
fish is as different as the fish in the ocean

10572.text:
The twenty-fifth of this one who is in the bodies
This is to be saved, Parahur Avyaktagocharat

10573.text:
So 'yam evam vimuchyata nanyatheti vinishchaya
parana paradharma cha bhavati esha samatya vai

10574.text:
The pure Dharma is wise with the pure Buddha
The liberated Dharma is united with the liberated, O Purusharsha

10575.text:
Even if you are a niyoga dharma and a niyogatma,
the liberator and the liberator will be together here and so on

10576.text:
Shuchi karma shuchish chaiva bhavati immeasurably bright
vimalaatma cha bhavati together with the pure soul

10580.text:
It is not to be given to this and that false soul; to the deceitful Kaliba, not to the deceitful intellect
not to the wise man who is tormented by knowledge; this is to be given to you as you have written

10581.text:
Sharaddhanvitayatha gunanvitaya; parapavadad virataya nitya
vishuddhayogaya budhyaya chaiva; kariyavate 'tha kshamine hitaya

10583.text:
These qualities should not be given to the inferior; they call this the Supreme Brahman pure
not done by the Shareya to be added to such; do not give the preacher of religion to the unworthy

10586.text:
Agadha birth and death, O king; healing and fearless and Shiva
reviewing delusion and abandon everything today; knowing this is the true meaning of knowledge

10587.text:
Avaptam etad dhi pura sanatanad; dhiranyagarbhad gadato naradhipa
parasadya yatnaena tamugratejasam; sanatana brahma yatha daya vai tavaya

10589.text:
[also]
This is the supreme Brahman who does not return again
from the twenty-fifth Maharaja Paramarshinidarsana

10590.text:
He who attains recurrence again and attains the next knowledge
now understands the essence of the immortal

10592.text:
Narada obtained this from the sage Vasishta, the great sage of Hiranyagarbha
from Vasishta, the tiger of the sages

10593.text:
Naradad viditam mahyam etad brahma sanatana
Ma shuchah kauravendra tavam sharutvaitat paramam padam

10594.text:
He who has no fear of wealth in the alphabet
but there is fear of him who does not know this, O earthling

10595.text:
And by ignorance the foolish soul repeatedly suffers
affects and suffers thousands of races and ends in death

10596.text:
He attains the heavenly world and the animal world and even humanity
If he is purified by time, he is saved from the ocean of ignorance

10597.text:
The ocean of ignorance is called the terrible horse, the unmanifest and the deep
Every day the beings sink, O India

10598.text:
Because you have crossed the depths and the unmanifest from the eternal
therefore you are free from the darkness and the darkness of the earth

10600.text:
The worshiper of the darkness bowed his head to the sage
after allowing him to do so, he asked Vasuman this

10601.text:
Lord, is this better in the hereafter or in this life
for a man in an impermanent body subject to lust

10602.text:
Asked by the great ascetic, the great ascetic
said to himself,

10605.text:
Why don't you go to the disgust of tasty lustful desires
You see honey, you fool, you don't see the fall of others

10607.text:
It is difficult to do pure deeds without desire for righteousness
It is difficult to do good deeds with desires for righteousness

10608.text:
He is as comfortable as you are in the forest
He is as comfortable in the forest as you are in the forest

10609.text:
Mano vaka karmake dharme kuru sharaddham samahitah
nivruttau va paravrttitau va sampradharya gunagunaan

10611.text:
Return to the worthy what you have received by a good method
Let go of anger and give and not recite without regret

10613.text:
Satkrita chaikapatni cha jatya yonir iheshyate
Rid Yaju Samago vidvan sah karma patram ucyate

10618.text:
Worship everything and everything that is done everywhere
In all religions wherever you are passionate, may your desire be prescribed as religion

10620.text:
Tejasa shakyate paraptum upayasah charina
Iha cha paretya cha shareyas tasya mulam dhriti para

10621.text:
Rajarshi adhritih savargata patito hi mahabhisah
Yayati kshinapunyash cha dhritya lokaan avaptavan

10622.text:
By serving the ascetics, the righteous, the learned,
you will attain abundant wisdom and you will attain the Shareyo

10624.text:
[Y]
Dharmadharmavimuktam yad vimuktam sarvasansrayat
janmamrityuvimuktam cha vimuktam punyapapayoh

10625.text:
Yach chivam nityam abhayam nityam chaksharam avyayam
shuchi nityam anayasam tad bhavan vaktum arhati

10626.text:
[also]
Here I will tell you the history of the ancient
The dialogue between Yajnavalkya and Janaka, Bharatha

10631.text:
[Ya]
Start me, Avani Pal, if you ask me this
The supreme knowledge of yoga and Sankhya in particular

10632.text:
Nothing you don't know but you are asking me
Even if you ask me, I should tell you this is the eternal religion

10634.text:
The unmanifest and the great part and the ego and
the earth, the air, the sky, the water and the light are the fifth

10636.text:
Sound and touch and form and taste and smell and so on
speech and hands and feet and feet and genitals and so on

10637.text:
These are the special features, O King, of the five
intelligences and senses in the great beings, and these are the special features, O Maithila

10638.text:
Mana sodasakam parahura adhytmagatichintaka
tavam chaivanye ca vidvansas tattvabuddhivisharda

10640.text:
The great bow also produces ego, O lord of men
They say that this is the second verse, this is the intellectual memory

10647.text:
The Tiryaka Saratas produces a river below you, O King
The wise say that this is the ninth verse

10648.text: These nine creations and the twenty-four elements, O lord of men, are mentioned as described in the scriptures

10650.text:
[Yajnavalkya]
O best of men, describe to me the number of times of the unmanifest
Five thousand kalpas are called two times the day

10651.text:
Ratir etavati chasya paratibuddho naradhipa
srijatya oshadhim evagre jivanam sarvadehinam

10652.text:
Then he created Brahman, the origin of Dhairanya
We have heard that she is the idol of all beings

10654.text:
This king is taught in the Vedas as the earth of mercy
The Lord made the middle sky of the two branches

10657.text:
The gods and the daughters of the ancestors covered the worlds with the gods
We have heard thus that the moving and non-moving are the best of men

10658.text:
God, your ego created the beings in five parts
earth, air, sky, water and light are the fifth

10659.text:
Etasyapi nisham ahusa third here doing
five thousand kalpas is called evahara

10662.text:
They are killed by each other's virtues and defeated by the infinite
Here they change into the animal world

10664.text:
The mind moves, O King, the character of all the senses
The senses do not see, but the mind itself sees here

10666.text:
O king, when the mind is above the senses,
not when the senses are above the mind,
so the mind should meditate on the other senses

10669.text:
As He withdraws the living beings and creates them again and again
The eternally immortal Brahma is eternal and infallible

10670.text:
Ahah kashayam atho buddhva nishi savapnamanas tatha
chodayam asa bhavagana avyakto 'ham kritam naram

10671.text:
Then a hundred thousand rays, stirred by the unmanifest
making twelve souls, the sun burning like fire

10672.text:
The four kinds of parajas burn the net with their quick brightness
Jarayva and Savedajatam and Udbhijjam, O lord of men

10674.text:
The world burned the immeasurable force only the world then
filled the water with the mighty Kshipram all around

10676.text:
Darkness is immeasurable, very strong, burning like fire,
heat is the seven flames of all beings, and easily

10677.text:
Bhakshayam asa balvan vayura astatmakam bali
vicharann amitpranas tiryag urdhvam adhas tatha

10678.text:
Tam apratibalam bhimam akasham garasate 'atmana
akasham apya atinadan mano garasate charikam

10679.text:
The mind is the whole soul, that ego is the creator
The ego is the great soul, the past, the future and the future

10680.text:
Tama apya anupamaatmanam visvam shambhah parajapatih
anima laghima paraptir ishaano jayotir avyayah

10681.text:
Everywhere is the water, the feet, everywhere the eyes, the head and the face
everywhere the sharutimal covers everything in the world

10682.text:
The heart of all beings is the festival of the thumb
The infinite truth is the great soul, the universe is God

10685.text:
[Ya]
padava adhyatmam ityahura brahmanas tattvadarsinah
gantavyam adhibhutam cha vishnusa tatradhidaivatam

10689.text:
Vaga adhyatmam iti parahura yatha sharutinidarsanam
vaktvyam adhibhutam tu vahnis tatradhidaivatam

10690.text:
They say that the eye is spiritual, as the scriptures indicate
the form is the supernatural here, but the sun is the supernatural there

10694.text:
Tavaga adhyatmama iti parahusa tattvabuddhivisharadah
saparsha evadhibhutam tu pavansha chadhidaivatam

10695.text:
Mano 'adhayatmam iti parahura yatha sharutinidarsanam
mantavyam adhibhutam tu chandramasha chadhidaivatam

10696.text:
Ahankarikam adhyatmam ahusa tattvanidarsanam
Abhimano 'dhibutam tu bhavas tatradhidaivatam

10698.text:
Esha te vyaktato rajan vibhutir anuvarnita
adau madhye tatha chante yathatattvena tattvavit

10699.text:
Parakritir gunan vikurute savachchandena atma kamyaya
karidartham tu maharaja shatasho 'tha sahasrasah

10700.text:
As thousands of lamps distort the lights for the sake of others
so they distort many of the virtues of a man

10701.text:
Sattvam Ananda Udrekah Paritih Parakashyam Eva Cha
Sukham Shuddhitvam Arogyam Santoshah Sharaddhadhanta

10702.text:
Akarpanyam asamrambhah kshama dhritir ahimsa
samata satyam anrnyam mardavam harir achapalam

10703.text:
Shucham Arjavam Acharam Alaulyam Hridya Sambhramah
Ishtanishta Viyoganam Kritanaam Avikatthanam

10705.text:
The confluence of the modes of passion is the form of the conflict of wealth
Atyashitvam akarunyam sukhadhukhopasevanam

10706.text:
Parapavadeshu ratir vivadanam cha sevanam
Ahankaras tava satkarash chainta vairopasevanam

10710.text:
Insufficiency in food and drink
perfume in beds and seats

10712.text:
[Y]
These are the waves of the virtues of the Supreme Personality of Godhead
They remain untouched by the whole world forever

10713.text:
Shatadha sahasradha chaiva tatha shatasahasradha
kotishsha cha karotya esha paratyagatmanaam atmana

10714.text:
Spiritual thinkers say that the best place for the Sattvic is the middle place for the Rajasic
the lowest place for the Tamasic

10715.text:
Kelvenah punyaena gatimam urdhvaam avapnuyat
punyapapena amanushyam adharmenapya adhogatim

10716.text:
Hear from me the duality of these waves and the conjunction of these waves in fact
The Rajas and Tamas of Sattva

10717.text:
But Rajas of Sattva is seen as Rajas and Tamas and
tamas and Sattva is seen as the unmanifest of Sattva

10718.text:
He who is united with the unmanifest Sattva attains the heavenly world
Raja, combined with the Sattva, appears in human beings

10719.text:
Rajas tama bhayam sanyuktas tiryagyonishu jayate
Rajas tamasasattvaish cha yukto manushyam apnuyat

10721.text:
The best place possible for the wise, the unwounded, the infallible
the transcendental, the unconscious, and the birth and death, the nudam

10724.text:
[Janak]
Anadinidhanava etava ubhava eva mahamune
amurtimantava achalava aprakampyau cha nirvranau

10725.text:
How, O tiger of the sages, is the unconscious
conscious horse and the one who appears to be a field expert

10727.text:
Existence and mereness without being and so
the same place of transcendence are separated from the embodied

10728.text:
Tell me, O Davija, whatever place is attained by time,
Sankhyajnana and Tattva, Prith Yoga and so on

10729.text:
Arishtani cha tatvena vaktum arhasi sattam
viditam sarvam etat te panava amalakam yatha

10730.text:
[Ya]
Na shakyo nirgunas tata guni kartum visham pate
gunavansha chapya agunavan yathatatvam nibodha me

10731.text:
Gunaira hi gunavan eva nirgunasha chagunas tatha
parahura evam mahatmano muniyas tattvadarshinah

10733.text:
But the unmanifest does not know the man who is born by nature
and always thinks that there is nothing beyond me

10735.text:
When one ignorantly creates the modes again and again
what does not know the Self is called the unmanifest here

10736.text:
The doer is also called the doer of the elements
The doer is also called the vaginal dharma of the vagina

10739.text:
Because of being a beel, being of other nature, and being of paralysis, and also of being
neglectful, being other, and being proud, and only

10740.text:
They think that the ascetics are pure and free from spiritual fever
we have heard this infinite, eternal, unmanifest

10741.text:
They say that the unmanifest oneness is the diversity of the Purusha and
they are compassionate to all beings and are only situated in knowledge

10743.text:
Know another mosquito and another chodumbar and
no chodumbar combinations mosquitoes are covered there

10744.text:
Anya eva tatha matsyas tathanyad udakam samritam
not by the touch of water the fish is covered all over

10745.text:
Anyo haya agnir ukhapya anya nityam evam avaihi bhoh
na chopalipyate so 'agnir ukha samsparshanena vai

10746.text:
The lake is your other day and the other water is remembered
There is no lake covered by the touch of water

10748.text:
Those who see you otherwise and do not see you properly
 enter the obvious hell of the terrible others again and again

10749.text:
This is the best of all the Sankhya philosophies
Thus the Sankhyas have become merely for the purpose of enumerating

10751.text:
[Ya]
The knowledge of Sankhya which I have spoken to you, the knowledge of Yoga, describe to me
as I have heard and as I have seen in essence, O King

10754.text:
What the Yogas see is also seen by the Sankhyas
He who sees the one Sankhya and Yoga is a Tattvavit

10755.text:
Rudra paradhanan aparan viddhi yogan parantapa
tenaiva chath dehena vicharanti disho dasha

10756.text:
Yavad dhi paralayas tata sukshmenasta guna vai
yogena lokaan vicharan sukham sannyasya chaanagh

10758.text:
Davigunam yogakrityam tu yoganam parahura uttama
sagunam nirgunam chaiva yathashastranidarsanam

10759.text:
Dharana chaiva manasah paranayamasha cha parthiv
paranayama hi saguna nirguna dharanam manah

10760.text:
Yatra drishyet munchan vai paranan maithila sattama
vatadhikyam bhavatya eva tasmad dhi na samacharet

10761.text:
Twelve chodanas are remembered in the first night of the night
Sleeping in the middle and twelve chodanas in the next night

10764.text:
Paratibhamam cha apavargam cha paratisamhritya maithil
indriyagramam akhilam manasya abhinivesya ha

10766.text:
Evam hi parisankhyaya tato dhayayet kevalam
virajaska malam nityam anantam shuddham avranam

10767.text: The stable Purusha, the Sattva, the impenetrable, the immortal, the eternal, the inexhaustible, the northern, the Brahman, the inexhaustible

10770.text:
A characteristic of a man who is struck by clouds like a stone
and can be moved by dots

10775.text:
He who is righteous sees the Brahman, who is the Supreme Infinite
like flame, situated in the midst of great darkness

10778.text:
[Ya]
Tathaivavotkramamana tu shrunushvavahito nripa
padbhyam uttkramanasya vaishnavam sathanam ucyate

10779.text:
Janghabhya tu vasuna devan apnuyad iti nah sharutam
janubhya cha mahabhagan devan sadhyana avapnuyat

10780.text:
Payunotkramamanas tu maitram sathanam avapnuyat
prithivim jaghanenatha urubhya tu parajapatim

10781.text:
The Maruts are the gods on the sides, and Indum on the nose
They call Indra on the arms, and Rudra on the chest

10782.text:
Garivayas tam rishishrestham naram apnotya anuttamam
visve devan mukhenath disah sharotrena chapnuyat

10783.text:
Gharanena gandhavahanam netrabhya suryama eva cha
bharubhya chaivashvinau devau lalatena pitruna atha

10784.text:
Brahmanam apnoti vibhum murdhna devagrajam tatha
etanya utkramana sathananya uktani mithilesvara

10785.text:
I will tell you the evils prescribed by the wise
The bodies of the separation of the year

10788.text:
Atidyutir atiprajna aprajna chadyutis tatha
parakritera vikriyapattih so masaan mrityulaksanam

10789.text:
He despises the gods and is opposed by the Brahmins
Krishna shayav chhavi shaya so masaan mrityulakaam

10790.text:
As a broken navel sees the moon through a hole in the wheel
so a thousand rays are the vessel of death in seven nights

10791.text:
A man who smells the fragrance of a corpse and finds fragrance
but he who is in the temple of the gods is the victim of death at night

10792.text:
Karnanasavanamana dantadrishtiviragita
sanjna lopo nirusmatvam sadyo mrityu nidarsanam

10793.text:
And suddenly the king of the left eye of the servant
head, smoke immediately appeared, a sign of death

10794.text:
Knowing so many of your misfortunes, a man who is self-conscious
night and in the morning should engage himself in the Supreme Self

10795.text:
The time that you wait for will be the time that passes
Then let's do this if he wants to die unwanted

10796.text:
He should hold all fragrances and tastes in concentration
so he conquers death by the other self

10797.text:
Sasankhya dharanam chaiva viditva manujarshabha
jayecha cha mrityum yoga tatparenatara atmana

10800.text:
Yatharsheneha vidhina charatavamatena ha
mayadityad avaptani yajunsi mithiladhipa

10801.text:
Mahata tapasa devas tapishtah sevito maya
paritena chaham vibhuna suryenanoktasa tadanagha

10807.text:
Then Lord Sun said to me as I was burning
Bear with the burning for a moment and then it will be cold

10809.text:
You will marry the whole hundred paths, O bull of the gods
and at the end of it you will have wisdom in your reappearance

10812.text:
Then the next circle, very auspicious and adorned with all kinds of dishes,
having made Omkaram from the beginning, my goddess Saraswati

10814.text:
Then Shatapatha gathered the whole city together
and the rest with great joy

10817.text:
I took half of the temple while I was looking
Saveved alms for the maternal uncle

10818.text:
Sumantu Nath Pailena tatha Jaimini cha vai
pitra te munibhisha chaiva tato 'ham anumanitah

10819.text:
Ten and five have been obtained by me from the Yajur Veda, O sinful one,
and I have understood the Purana by Lomaharsha

10821.text:
To do the hundred paths I have done and I have done unprecedentedly
as I wished for my purpose and so I have done it

10824.text:
What is the Brahmanical truth here and what is the Vedic and the unexcellent
I think of it and there the Gandharva came and asked me

10826.text:
Vishva Visvam Tathasvasvam Mitra Varunam Eva Cha
Jananam Janyeyam Tathajna 'Janah Kas Tapa Apata Tatha
Suryadah Surya Iti Cha Vidyavidye Tathaiva Cha

10827.text:
Vedyavedyam tatha rajanna achalam chalam eva cha
apurvam akshayam kshayyam etat parashnam anuttamam

10830.text:
Then I thought of Goddess Saraswati again
with my mind and she lifted my question like milk and butter

10831.text:
There I kill the Upanishads and the rest of the earth
with my mind, my father, seeing the Anviksiki parama

10833.text:
Athotas tu maya rajan raja visvavasus tad
shruyatam yad bhavana us parashna samprashtavana iha

10834.text:
Vishva visveti yad idam gandharvendranuprachhasi
visvavyaktam param vidyad bhutabhavya bhayankaram

10835.text:
Tarigunam gunakartritvad ashisvo nishkalas tatha
asvasa tathaiva mithunam evam evanudrishayate

10837.text:
Jnana tu parakritim parahur janeyam nishkalam eva cha
jnasha cha janasha cha purushas tasman nishkala ucyate

10838.text:
Kas tapa atapa parokta ko 'sau purua ucyte
Tapa parakti iti ahura atapa nikala samta

10839.text:
That is how the knowable, the unmanifest, the piercing man is called
Chalachalam, hear me that too

10840.text:
They call the moving other nature the cause of the throwing creation
The doer of the throwing creation is remembered as the motionless man

10841.text:
Ajava ubhava aprajanuchakshayau chapya ubhava api
Ajaunityava ubhava parahura adhyatmagatinishchayah

10842.text:
Akshayatvat parajanane ajam atrahur avyayam
akshaya purusham parahuh kshayo haya asya na vidyate

10845.text:
They are born and die in whom these Yatasha Chayutas
They who do not know the meaning of the Vedas, O best of the Gandharvas

10847.text:
He who seeks ghee, O best of the Gandharvas, who churns the milk of a donkey,
will not find there any slowness or ghee

10848.text:
Thus he who knows the knowable and the unknowable does not find knowledge
He is only considered to bear the burden of knowledge in a foolish mind

10849.text:
They should be seen eternally by the self beyond that
so that his birth and death may not happen again and again

10850.text:
Thinking of infinite birth and death, let us cross this
leaving the perishable here and establishing the inexhaustible Dharma

10851.text:
But when he sees the 'Atyantam Ahanya Ahana Kashyapa
then he becomes a Kevali and does not see the Sadvinsam

10852.text:
Anyash cha shasvad avyaktas tathanyah panchavinshakah
tasya davav anupashyet tama ekam iti sadhus

10855.text:
Jaigisavyasyasitasya devalasya cha me sharutam
parasarasya viprarsya varshaganyasya dhimata

10856.text:
The monk Panchashikha, Kapila, Shuka,
Gautama, Arshtisena and the great Garga

10861.text:
Nothing unknown to you is remembered as the treasure of Sharuti
It is said that in the world of the gods and in the world of the ancestors, O Brahmin

10862.text:
Brahmalokagatash chaiva kathayanti maharshiyah
patish cha tapatam shasvad adityasa tava bhasate

10866.text:
The twenty-fifth understands the other nature of the unconscious
but the twenty-fifth does not understand the other nature of the Gandharva

10867.text:
Anenapratibodhena paradhanam paravadanti tama
sankhyayogasha cha tattvajna yatha sharutinidarsanata

10869.text:
The twenty-fifth is not to be considered as the supreme of me
The twenty-four is not to be accepted by men who see the knowledge

10871.text:
He sinks when he does not understand the unity of time
He sinks because he is enveloped in the egoism of time

10873.text:
Anyash cha rajanna avaras tathanyah panchavinshakah
tatsthatvada anupasyanti eka eveti sadhus

10875.text:
When that Kevali Bhuta does not see the Sadvinsham
then that omniscient learned man is not reborn

10877.text:
See, I see, he who does not see the safety and the essence, O Kasyapa
only and only, the first and the twenty-fifth and beyond that

10879.text:
[Ya]
Thus saying, he went to heaven; Vibhrajana vai sharimat darshanena
tushtasha cha tushtya parayabhinanda; paradakshina mama kritva mahatma

10883.text:
