11204.text:
[Y]
How the righteous Shuka of Vayas was born, the great ascetic
and you attained the supreme perfection, tell me, O grandfather

11206.text:
And how is the mind of the child gone to the subtle knowledge of the truth
as no one else in this world is second to anyone here

11207.text:
I wish to write this in detail, O great light
For I am not satisfied to hear the best of nectar

11208.text:
Mahatmyam atmayogam cha vijnanam cha shukasya ha
yathavad anupurvyena tan me baruhi pitamaha

11209.text:
[Bhi]
Not by the poor, nor by the rich, nor by the wealth, nor by the relatives
The sages have made the righteousness which is called, he is great for us

11210.text:
Austerity is the root of all that you ask me, O Pandava
that is austerity by restraining the senses and nothing else

11214.text:
Merushrunge kil pura karnikaravanayute
vijahara mahadevo bhimair bhutaganair vrata

11216.text:
Yogenaatmanam aavisya yogadharmaparayanah
dharayana sa tapasa tepe putrartham kurusattama

11217.text:
Agneer bhumer apam vayor antariksasya chabhibho
viryena sammita putro mama bhuyad iti sama ha

11218.text:
Sankalpenatha so 'nena dushprapenakritatmabhih
varayam asa devesham asthitas tapa uttama

11219.text:
Atisthana marutaharah shatam kil sabhah parabhuh
aradhayana mahadevam bahurupam umapatim

11220.text:
There are the Brahmarshis and all the Devarshis and
Lokapalasha and Lokesha and Sadhyasha with Vasus

11221.text:
Adityas and Rudras and the sun and the moon
Marutas and Marutas and the seas and rivers

11226.text:
Jatash cha tejasa tasya vaisvanara shikhopamah
parajvalantya sama drishyante yuktasyamita tejasa

11227.text:
Markandeyo hi bhagavan etad aakhyatvan mama
sa dev charitanih kathayam aas me sada

11229.text:
By such austerities and devotion to him, Bharata
Maheshwara, the Supreme Soul, made his mind wise

11230.text:
The Lord Taryambaka said to him, as if laughing at others
Such will be your son Davaipayana

11231.text:
As the horse, as the fire, as the wind, as the earth, as the water
As the sky, so shall the pure future son be great

11232.text:
Tadbhavabhavi tad buddhis tad atma tad apasrayah
tejasavritya lokans tarin yashah parapsyati kevalm

11235.text:
The sage, seeing the nymph, was suddenly fascinated by lust
There appeared Lord Vayas in that forest, Yudhisthira

11236.text:
And she, having then done her age, became like a lustful
shuki, and approached the Maharaja of Ghritachi

11239.text: The sage who was trying to control the fire suddenly fell into the forest with his sperm

11240.text:
So 'vishkena manasa tathaiva davijasattama
Arani mamantha brahmarshis tasya jajne shuko nripa

11241.text:
When Venus was being crushed, Shuka was born, the great ascetic
The great sage Arani, the great yogi, was born from the womb

11242.text:
As the fire burning in the sacrificial fire burned the sacrifice,
so the form of the parrot was born with the brightness of a flaming fire

11243.text:
Bibhrat pitush cha kauravya rupavarnam anuttam
bbhau tad bhavitaatma vidhumo 'ganir iva javalan

11246.text:
Jehiyante sama gandharva danrutush chapsaroganah
devadundubhayash chaiva paravadyant mahasvanah

11247.text:
Vishvavasusha and the Gandharvas and Tumburu and Narada
Haha hoohoo and the Gandharvas praised the birth of Shuka

11249.text:
Divine all flowers in the next rain, the wind
moving and immovable, and the world became happy

11252.text:
Swans and centipedes and cranes in their thousands
turned to the other south, and the pigs and the squirrels in India

11253.text:
Arneyas and the divine parapya birth Mahadyutih
There lived the intelligent bridegroom concentrated

11255.text:
Brihaspatim tu vavre sa vedavedangabhashyavit
upadhyayam maharaja dharmama evanuchintana

11256.text:
So 'dhitya vedan akhilan sarahasyaan sasamgrahaan
itihasam cha kartsnyena rajashastrani chabhibho

11258.text:
Even in his childhood he was a great ascetic among the gods and sages
to be invited and respected by knowledge and austerities

11260.text:
[Bhi]
Sa moksham anuchintyaiva shuka pitaram abhyagata
parahabhivadya cha gurum shareyo 'rathi vinayanvita

11261.text:
May the Lord, who is skilled in the dharmas of salvation, tell me
so that I may have the ultimate peace of mind, O Lord

11262.text:
Hearing the words of his son, the great sage said to him,
Study, my son, the liberation and the various parts of religion

11263.text:
Shuka, the best of the Brahma-scientists, took his father's employment
Yoga and the whole of Papila, India

11264.text:
Sa tam brahmya sharia yuktam brahma tulyaparakramam
mene putram yada vayas mokshavidya vishardama

11265.text:
He said then go to Janaka, the lord of Mithila,
he will tell you for the sake of salvation, especially in all

11266.text:
Pitura niyogad agaman maithilam janakam nripam
parastum dharmasya nishtam vai mokshasya cha parayanam

11269.text:
Egoism should not be done in the sacrifice in that king
and should be under his control he will cut you off from doubt

11271.text:
Thus addressed, the righteous sage went to Mithila
with his feet to make the land with the sea

11272.text:
He crossed the mountains and crossed the rivers and lakes
with many wild animals and twenty-four of various kinds

11273.text:
Meror and Haresh were the year of the Himalayas and
Karma was the year of India

11274.text:
Sa deshan vividhan pasyansh china hun nishevitan
Aryavartam iman desam aajgam vichintayan

11275.text:
Obeying his father's words, thinking of the darkness itself,
he crossed the road as if he were flying in the sky

11276.text:
The towns and the beautiful white cities and
the gems and the strange things the parrot doesn't see

11277.text:
The gardens and the beautiful temples and the
holy shrines he crossed and the road

11279.text:
There are many people living there, many foods
palli ghoshans, prosperity and many village complexes

11280.text:
They are adorned with sapphires and rice, served with swans and cranes
and lotuses and hundreds of beautiful women

11283.text:
The mind carrying the burden of darkness, thinking of the darkness itself,
Atmarama, the self-satisfied soul of others, reached Mithila

11286.text:
There also the gatekeepers darkness fierce words judgment
And so Shukas stood there without anger

11287.text:
Not chatapadhva tormented, thirsty, shy,
turned, melted or not removed and so heat

11290.text:
There sat Shukas, my father, thinking of Moksham
The equally bright one in the shade and in the heat

11292.text:
There is a great Chaitanya temple connected to the inner court
with well-divided waters, a beautiful flowering tree

11295.text:
They are skilled in conversation and dance and song
They are equal to the apsaras in appearance

11297.text:
Padyadini paratigrahya poojaya parayaarchya cha
deshakalopapannena sadhva annenapya atarpayana

11298.text:
Tasya bhuktavatas tata tad antapura kananam
suramyam darshayam asura aikakshyena bharata

11300.text:
Araneyas tu shuddhaatma tarisandhehas tarikarmakrita
vashyandrayo jitkrodha na hrishyati na kupyati

11305.text:
Anena vidhina karshnis tad ahah shesham acyuta
ta cha ratri nripa kule vartayam asa bharata

11306.text:
[Bhi]
Then King Janaka, with his ministers, made the city of India
priest and all the inner cities

11307.text:
Asana and rewarded with gems and various
heads and arghya, Puru approached his son

11308.text:
He took that seat and adorned it with many gems
spreading a blanket of competition and covering it with all kinds of beauty

11317.text:
So I have come here to present you at the command of my father
Tan me, best of the righteous, tell me as you should

11318.text:
What is the duty of a Brahmin here for the sake of salvation and what is the self
And how should salvation be attained by knowledge or austerity

11321.text:
After studying the Vedas and avoiding the righteousness,
Abhyanujnam atha parapya samavarteta vai davijah

11322.text:
Samavrttas tu garhasthye sadaro niyato vaset
anasuyur yathanyayam ahitagnis tathaiva ca

11325.text:
[Shuk]
In the arisen knowledge and knowledge, in the direct perception of the heart, in the eternal
What must one dwell in the ashrams and forests

11326.text:
This is what I ask you, and you must tell me
As the meaning of the Vedas is true, tell me yours, O lord of the people

11329.text:
Anuchchedaya lokanam anuchchedaya karmanaam
purvaira acharito dharmasha chaturashramya sankatha

11330.text: By this karma yoga, by doing good and evil deeds in many species, one attains here the name of moksha

11331.text:
For the reasons that are to come, this tea in many worldly births
attains the pure soul's salvation in the first ashram

11332.text:
But reaching the darkness, the wise of the liberated vision
cross the ashrams, what new meaning may be the supreme desire

11333.text:
One should always avoid the Rajasic and Tamasic evils
Attachment to the Sattvic path one should see oneself by oneself

11334.text:
Sarvabhuteshu cha atmana sarvahutani cha atmani
sampashyana nopalipyeta jale wari charo yatha

11339.text:
When one does not feel sinful in all beings
he attains Brahman by action, mind and speech

11340.text:
He who combines the self of austerity, abandons envy, abandons the delusion
 and abandons desire and greed, then attains Brahmanhood

11342.text:
When he sees praise and condemnation equally
gold and tea in happiness and sorrow

11343.text:
Cold and hot, and so forth, and evil, and evil, and unpleasant,
life and death, when Brahman is attained

11345.text:
As a house surrounded by darkness can be seen by a lamp
so it is possible to observe the soul by the lamp of intelligence

11347.text:
Brahmarshe viditash chasi vishyaantam upagatah
gurus tava parsadena tava chaivopashikshaya

11348.text:
Tasyaiva cha parsadena paradurbhutam mahamune
jnanam divyam mamapidam tenasi vidito mama

11350.text:
They do not attain that path in childhood or doubt or fear or even in the knowledge born of non-redemption
arisen

11351.text:
By pure profession, like me, the doubt cut off
releases the knots of the heart and reaches that path

11352.text:
Bhavansha chotpanna vijnana sathirabuddhira alolupa
vayavasayad rite brahmanna asadayati tatparam

11353.text:
There is no specialty in your pleasures and pains, no greed
no curiosity, no passion for dance and song

11355.text:
And I see you and all the other sages who
have established the supreme path, the inexhaustible darkness and the eternal

11357.text:
[Bhi]
Hearing this, however, the self-controlled man was determined
Atmanatmanam asthaya darshana chaatmanam atmana

11358.text:
Kritakarya sukhi shantas tusnim parayad udang mukhah
shaishiram girim uddisya sadharma matarishvanah

11361.text:
Madgubhih khanjaritaish cha vichitrair jiva jivakaih
chitravarnair peacock cha keka shatavirajitaih
rajahansa groups cha harishtai parabhratais tatha

11362.text:
The king of birds and the flesh of the eagle whom he always acquires
The four guardians of the world and the gods and the hosts of sages
where they always meet for the welfare of the world

11364.text:
Shaktir naista kshitile tarailokyam avamanya vai
yatrovaca jagat sakandah kasipan vakyam idam tada

11365.text:
Yo 'nayo 'sati matto 'bhayadhiko vipra yasyadhikam pariyah
yo brahmanyam davitiyo 'sati tarishu lokashu viryavan

11366.text:
So 'abhyuddharatva iman shaktim atha va kampayatva iti
tacha chrutwa vayathita lokah ka imam uddhared iti

11368.text:
He could not bear the throwing and looked at the fire
He laughed at the pure soul power of the other burning then
The best man was shaking with his left water

11369.text:
When the mighty Vishnu trembled in his power, then
the earth shook, all with its mountains, forests and forests

11372.text:
He was determined to quote that word as he endured
he took hold of her power and did not shake her name

11376.text:
It is not possible to go there by yakshas, rakshasas and demons
covered by a flame of fire ten yojanas wide

11377.text:
Lord Pavakas there stands himself, the mighty
remover of all obstacles, the wise Mahadeva

11378.text:
For a thousand divine years, standing on one foot
the gods were tormented, and there the great god Dhritavrata

11379.text:
Andrim tu disham asthaya shailarajasya dhimata
vivikte parvata tate parasharyo mahatapa
vedan adhyapayam asa vayasah shishyaan mahatapa

11380.text:
Sumantu and the greatly fortunate Vaishampayana and
Jaimini and the great wise Paila and the ascetic

11383.text:
Unprepared in the trees, mountains and unevenness
the great soul with yoga is like an arrow devoid of virtue

11385.text:
Then we reported everything to our father in detail
Shuka was overwhelmed by the conversation with the king of Janaka

11386.text:
Thus teaching his disciples, Vayas and his son, the mighty
Uvasa, the great sage Parashar, on the back of the Himalayas

11389.text:
Endowed with great honor and equally raised in fame
One of your wishes now is to be graced by the Guru

11391.text:
Hearing these words of the Guru, the disciples were delighted
Again they bowed their heads to the Guru with folded hands

11392.text:
Uchusa te sahita rajanna idam vacanam uttama
Idi parit upadhyayo dhanyah samo munisattama

11396.text:
Brahmanaya sada deyam brahma shushrusave bhavet
brahmaloke nivasam yo dharuvam samabhikankshati

11398.text:
These discipleship qualities should all be known in reality
no way should knowledge be given to an untested character

11401.text:
Let everyone cross the fortresses and let everyone see the good
Sharavayecha chaturo varnaan kritva brahmanam agrata

11403.text:
Yo nirvadet sammohad brahmana vedaparagama
so 'padhyanad brahmanasya parabhuyad asamshayam

11404.text:
Yash chadharmena vibruyad yash chadharmena prchhati
tayor anyatara paraiti vidvesham vadhigacchati

11406.text:
[Bhi]
Hearing this, the Guru's words were heard by the old disciples of the mighty
Then they embraced each other with joyful minds

11407.text:
Uktah samo yad bhagavata tadatvayati samhitam
tan no manasi sanrudham karisyamas tatha cha tat

11408.text:
And honoring each other and thus with a well-pleased mind again
announce the same teacher again the eloquent ones

11409.text:
Shailad, we desire to go to the earth, O great sages
If you are interested in doing the Vedas in many ways, O Lord

11411.text:
Go to the field or the heavenly world if you like
Apramadash cha vah karyom brahma hi parchurachlam

11413.text:
Avatirya mahi te 'tha chaturhotram akalpayana
sanyajayanto vipransha cha rajanyasha cha vishas tatha

11416.text:
Narada, the great ascetic, saw him at the hermitage
And he spoke to him in a sweet voice at the right time

11417.text:
Bho Bho Maharshi Vasishta Brahmaghosho Na Vartate
Eko Dhyanparas Tusnin Kim Asse Chintaannan Iva

11418.text:
This mountain without the Brahmaghoshas is not beautiful
as the moon is flooded with dust and darkness

11420.text:
The sages and the gods and the Gandharvas and the mighty
free are not filled with the sound of the Brahma as before

11421.text:
Hearing the words of Narada, Krishna Dvaipayana said,
O great sage, what you have said is wise in the Vedic argument

11422.text:
You deserve to appear to me so favorable to my mind
Omniscient and omniscient and curious everywhere

11425.text:
[Narada]
Anamnaya mala veda brahmanasyavrata malam
mala prithivya vahikah satrinam kautuhala malam

11426.text:
Let you study the Vedas with your wise son
shaking the darkness created by the demons with the sound of Brahma

11428.text:
Shukena saha putrena vedabhyasaam athakarato
savarenocchaih sa shaikshena lokaan apuryanna iva

11429.text:
Tyor abhyasator evam nanadharmapravadinoh
vato 'timatram paravavau samudranila vejitah

11430.text:
Then the old man stopped his son from studying
The pig stopped only but was filled with curiosity

11431.text:
Ask the father Brahman where this wind came from
You can tell me all the movements of the wind

11434.text:
Seeing the shadow in the mirror like Savam, think of yourself with your own self
contemplate yourself with your Vedic intelligence

11435.text:
The gods, the travelers of Vishnu, the travelers of the ancestors and the travelers of Tamas,
These two paths pass through and go to heaven and below

11439.text:
Anapatyo 'bhavat parano durdharsha shatrutapana
I shall tell you the separate actions of those but the others as they are

11442.text:
Ambare saneham abhrebhyas tadid bhayash chottamadyutih
Avaho nama samvati davitiyah shavasano nadan

11444.text:
The wind holds the water from the four seas of fame
The wind in the sky lifts the bow from the clouds

11445.text:
He who combines the clouds with water and gives them to the rain
Udvaha is the third of the rainy seasons, he is the eternal destination

11446.text:
Gathered in many ways by which the blue separate clouds
the beginnings of the rain liberation become the clouds

11447.text:
They are gathered together and by whom the roaring rivers
are created for protection and become clouds

11449.text:
The clouds that are blown by the swift, sick, rough, sick, juicy
wind do not become clouds

11451.text:
Yasmin pariplave divya vahantya aapo vihayas
punyam chakakashagangayas toyam vishtabhya tishtati

11452.text:
Durat paratihato yasminn ekarashmir divakaram
yonir anshusahasrasya yena bhati vasundhara

11453.text:
Yasmad apyayate somam nidhir divyo 'mritasya cha
sasthah parivaho nama sa vayura javatam varah

11454.text:
He who drives away the souls of all living beings in eternity
Whose path is followed by both death and Vaivasvata

11457.text:
The one who created and defeated the other does not return when he goes
The other wind called the other wind is difficult to transgress

11462.text:
After saying this, the son of Parashar, the Lord,
said,

11465.text:
Narada 'thabravita parito baruhi brahmavidam varan
ken tavam shareyasa tata yojayamiti hrishtavat

11466.text:
Hearing the words of Narada, Shuka said to Bharata
You should engage me in whatever is good for this world

11467.text:
[Narada]
Before the sages inquired about the truth, the Lord Sanatkumara spoke these words

11468.text:
There is no knowledge equal to the eye There is no knowledge equal to austerity
There is no suffering equal to passion There is no happiness equal to sacrifice

11469.text:
Renunciation of action, sin, constant virtue
Good conduct, community, Shareya, this is my best

11470.text:
He who is attached to the unhappiness of man is deluded
The rope is not for the liberation of suffering, for association is the characteristic of suffering

11471.text:
Saktasya buddhish chalti mohajalavivardhini
Mohajalavrito dukkham iha chamutra chashnute

11472.text:
The restraint of lust and anger by all means
is the work of the arrows of the enemy, for both are ready to kill the arrows

11473.text:
Nityam karodhat tapo rakshecha chhariyam raksheta matsarat
Vidyaam manavamanaabhyam atmanaam tu paramadato

11474.text:
Cruelty is the supreme religion and forgiveness is the supreme strength
There is no supreme knowledge beyond self-knowledge

11476.text:
He who renounces all the fruits of his beginnings is hopeless and selfless
He who has renounced everything is a learned man and he is a wise man

11478.text:
He who is not present with and without the Self-beings
He who is liberated soon attains the Supreme Shareyo

11479.text:
Adarshanam asansparshas tathasambhasanam sada
Yasya bhutaih saha mune sa shareyo vindate parama

11480.text:
Do not harm all beings, Maitreya, walk in the past
Do not enmity with anyone after reaching this birth

11481.text:
Akinchanyam susantosho nirashistvam achapalam
Etad ahuh param shareya atmajnasya jitaatmanah

11482.text:
Abandon marriage and become self-controlled, my son
Attain the place of Ashoka, fearless here and hereafter

11483.text:
The meatless do not mourn, leave meat here for yourself
Leave meat, gentleman, and you will be freed from the feet of suffering

11484.text:
Taponityena dantena munina sanyatatmana
ajitam jetukamena bhavyam sangeshu asangi

11485.text:
Anasakta ekacharya rata sada
brahmane nachirad eva sukham aayatya anuttamam

11486.text:
The sage who alone enjoys the beings of the Davandvara
know that he is satisfied with the knowledge of others and does not grieve for the satisfaction of knowledge

11487.text:
Shubhaira labhatidevatvam vayamishraira janma manusam
Ashubhaish chapya adho janma karmabhira labhata avashah

11488.text:
There death, old age and suffering are constantly haunting
the world, the being is digested, and how do you not understand that

11489.text:
Ahite hitasamjnyasa tavam adhruve dharuvasamjnyasa
Anarthe chaarthasamjnasa tavam kimtam navabudhyase

11490.text:
Wrapped around by many delusional fibers of your sons
you don't realize you're wrapping yourself up like a treasurer

11491.text:
Alam parigraheneha doshavan hi parigrahah
Krimir hi koshakarasa tu badhyate savaparigrahat

11492.text:
Animals suffer, attached to their sons, wives and families
Like old wild elephants drowned in a muddy lake

11493.text:
They are like fish on the ground caught in a great net
Look at the animals suffering in the trap of love

11494.text:
Family, son and wife, body, and storehouses of pottery
Parakhyam, all that is uncertain, what is all that is good and evil

11495.text:
When you have to leave everything and go to the rest of your
evil, why are you attached to others and not following your own purpose

11496.text:
How can you walk alone in the unrelenting, unreliable, apathetic, non-divine
dark desert journey

11497.text:
No one will follow you behind your back
Good deeds and evil deeds will follow you wherever you go

11500.text:
Rupkulam manah saratam saparshadvipam rasavaham
gandhapankam shabdajalam savargamargaduravaham

11501.text:
Kshamaritram satyamayi dharmasthair yavatakaram
tayagavatadhvagam shighram buddhinava nadim taret

11502.text:
Abandon righteousness and iniquity in Jubhe, truth and falsehood
Forsake both truth and falsehood, and forsake him whom you forsake

11503.text:
Abandon righteousness without resolve and iniquity with non-violence
Ubhe satyanarte buddhi buddhi paramanishyat

11504.text:
Asthi sathunam sanayu yutam masashonit lepanam
charmavandham durgandhi purnam mutra purisayoh

11505.text: Leave the old age, the sickness, the anxiety, the dust, and the eternal abode of ghosts

11511.text:
The state that whatever is perceived by the senses is manifest
the unmanifest is to be understood as transcendental to the senses

11512.text:
The body is satisfied as by the streams fixed by the senses
The self spread out in the world sees the world in itself

11513.text:
The power like the other does not see the time of knowledge
seeing all beings in all states always

11514.text:
Brahmabhutasya sanyogo nashubhenopapadyate
Jnanena vividhan kaleshan ativruttasya mohajan
loke buddhiprakashena lokamargo na rishyate

11515.text:
Anadi nidhanam jantum atmani sathitam avyayam
akartaram amurtm cha bhagavan aha tirthavit

11516.text:
A being who is constantly suffering from all his deeds
he kills animals in many ways to counteract suffering

11518.text:
Ajasram eva moharto dukheshu sukhasamjhita
badhyate mathyate chaiva karmabhira manthavat sada

11521.text:
By restraining the new bondage, by the force of austerity
we have attained many perfections, even the unhindered happiness

11522.text:
[Narada]
Ashokam shokanashaartham shastram shanti karam shivam
Hearing it, one attains intelligence and one who attains it increases happiness

11523.text:
Thousands of places of sorrow and hundreds of places of fear
Day by day the fool enters, not the wise

11525.text:
Anishta samprayogacha cha viprayogata pariyasya cha
Manushya manasaira dukhaira yujyante alpabuddhayah

11526.text:
One should not think of the virtues which have passed away in the darvy
The bond of affection of one who does not appreciate them is said to be beyond

11527.text:
He should be a fault-finder where the passion turns
he should see the victim as unwanted and quickly refrain from it

11528.text:
There is no meaning, no religion, no fame that regrets the past
even if it is used in absence, it does not cease

11530.text:
Whether dead or lost, he who regrets the past
suffers and finds suffering in medicine and falls into misfortune

11531.text:
They who do not shed tears, seeing the children in the worlds with intelligence,
who see others equally, all do not shed tears

11533.text:
This is the cure for suffering if you don't think about it
