satotram jagau sa visvaya nirgunaya mahatmana

11883.text:
The sprouts of the others were white in colour
Some were golden and resembled emerald

11885.text:
These characters are carried in many forms by the eternal
sahasranayana shariman shatashirsa sahasrapata

11886.text:
Sahasrodara Bahusha Cha Avyakta Iti Cha Kava Chit
Omkaram Udgirana Vaktraat Savitri Cha Tad Anvayam

11887.text:
Sheshebhya chaiva vaktrebhya chaturvedodgatam vasu
aranyakam jagau devo harir narayana vashi

11888.text:
Vedim kamandalum darbhan mani rupan athopalan
Ajinam dand kashtam cha javalitam cha hutashanam
dharayam asa devesho hastair yajnapatis tada

11890.text:
One and two and three great sages
reached this country and longed to see me

11892.text:
This body of mine is the best born in the house of religion, Davij
These worship you always and accomplish as you have come

11896.text:
[Bhisma]
Thus demonstrating to Narada, the Supreme Personality of Godhead
said the words, Go again, Narada Machiram

11898.text:
These greatly fortunate Siddhas were once solitary horses
They will undoubtedly observe me, freed from the darkness of dust

11903.text:
Yam paravishya bhavantiha mukta vai davijasattama
sa vasudeva vijnyeya paramatma sanatana

11904.text:
See the greatness and glory of the Lord, O Narada
who is never tainted by good and evil deeds

11907.text:
Jagat paratishtha devarshe prithivya apsu parliyate
Jayotishya apah parliyate jayotir vayu parliyate

11908.text:
The air in the sky goes to the paralysis of the mind and the sky itself
for the mind is the supreme being and it dissolves into the unmanifest

11909.text:
The unmanifest merges in the inactive Brahman in the Purusha
There is nothing beyond that Purusha, the eternal

11911.text:
Earth, air, sky, water and light are the fifth
These together are called the body of the great souls

11913.text:
The body is not without the aggregate of metals, Kav Chit
nor is the living entity moving under the control of the Brahman metals, or

11914.text:
That being is enumerated, the rest is Sankarshana, the Lord
Therefore he who attains Sanatkumara status by all his actions

11918.text:
Sankarshana and Paradyumna are the minds that are called
Paradyumnas, which is Aniruddha, is the ego of Maheshwarah

11919.text:
From Me everything is possible, the world, moving and non-moving,
letter and letter, and truth and truth, O Narada

11921.text:
Nirguno nishkalasha chaiva nirdvandvo nisparigraha
Etat tavaya na vijneya rupavan iti drishyate
Ichchana muhurtana nashyeyam Isho 'ham jagato guruh

11922.text:
Maya horse this is what I created that you see me, O Narada
You should not know me like this, endowed with all the qualities of all beings
I have told you this properly, your four idols

11925.text:
I am the omnipresent Brahman, the Self within the Bhutagram
I am not destroyed in the destroyed bodies of the Bhutagram

11926.text:
Hiranyagarbho lokadisha chaturvaktro niruktagah
Brahma sanatano devo mama bahv arthachintakah

11927.text:
Look at the eleven Rudras on my right side
The eleven Adityas on my left side

11930.text:
Tapansi niyamansha chaiva yaman api pruthagvidhana
tathasta gunam aishwaryam ekastham pashya murtimat

11931.text:
Shariyam lakshmim cha kirtim cha prithivim cha kakudminim
vedanam mataram pashya mat satham devim saraswatim

11932.text:
See the pole and the best of the stars, O Narada, the sky
The waters, the earth, the seas, the lakes and the rivers

11934.text:
O sage, the work of the fathers is more important than the work of the gods
I am the father of the gods and the fathers, the horse alone, from the beginning

11935.text:
I am the head of a horse and in the sea in the northwest
drink the sacrificial offerings and the poems with autumn

11936.text:
Maya srishtah pura brahma mada yajnam ayajat savayam
tatas tasmai varan parito dadava aham anuttam

11937.text:
Don't think that being a son and being the head of the world at the beginning of the age
and being done by ego is a synonymous name

11943.text:
Vidya sahayavantam mama adityasthaam sanatanaam
kapilam parahura acharyas sankhyanishchita nischayah

11944.text:
Hiranyagarbha Bhagavan esha chandasi sustuta
so 'ham yogagatira brahmana yogashastrashu shabdita

11946.text:
I shall enjoy myself alone with knowledge, O Davijottam
Then again I shall do the whole world here with knowledge

11947.text:
Asmana murtisha chaturthi ya sasarijacha chesham avyayam
sa hi sankarshanah paraktah paradyumnam so 'pya ajijanat

11948.text:
Paradyumnad Aniruddho 'ham sargo mama punah punah
Aniruddhat tatha brahma tatradi kamalodbhavah

11949.text:
All beings, moving and immovable, are of the Brahman
Know this creation again and again in the beginning of the Kalpa

11950.text:
As the sun rises from the sky and I am here
not again by force of time bringing immense brightness
so by force I am the earth for the benefit of all beings

11952.text:
I will kill the demon Hiranyaaksha, the proud of his strength
I will kill Hiranyakasipu again in the form of Narasimha
I will kill the destroyer of sacrifices, the delight of Diti, in the work of the gods

11953.text:
The mighty Bali, the son of Virocana, will be the great demon
who will defeat Indra and his kingdom

11956.text:
In the Tareta Yuga I shall be Rama, the leader of the Bhrigu dynasty
I shall destroy the fields and the prosperous chariot of force

11958.text:
Taritopaghatad vairupyam ekato 'tha davitas tatha
parapsyato varanatvam hi parajapatisutav rishi

11959.text:
Tayor ye tava anvaye jata bhavishanti vanaukasah
te sahaaya bhavishanti surakarye mama davij

11960.text:
Then I shall slay Ravana, the lord of the demons, the terrible Pulastya, the despiser of the family,
in numbers, and with his host, the destroyer of the worlds

11961.text:
Davaparasya kalesha chaiva sandhau paryavasanike
paradurbhavah kansa hetor mathurayayam bhavishati

11962.text:
There I will kill the demons and the devakantakas of the morning
Kushasthali and make my abode in the city of Dwarka

11963.text:
Vasanasa tatra vai puryam aditera vipriyam karam
hanishye narakam bhouma mura peetham cha danavam

11964.text:
I will take you to the beautiful city of Paragjyotish, rich in various wealth,
to the place of Kusha, killing the best of demons

11965.text:
Shankaram cha mahasena bana pariyahitaishinam
parajeshyamya athodyuktau devalokanamaskritau

11967.text:
Yah kalayavanah khayato garga tejo abhisamvrita
bhavishyati vadhasa tasya matta eva davijottama

11968.text:
Jarasandhasha cha balavan sarvarajavirodhakah
bhavishyatya asura safito bhumipala girivraje
mama buddhiparisandad vadhasa tasya bhavishyati

11970.text:
Thus the worlds will say that the sages Nara and Narayana
are the two gods who burn the field for the sake of the world

11971.text:
Having done the incarnation of the earth as desired
All the chiefs of the Sattvas and the best of the doorways
I shall do the destruction of the terrible self-knowledge

11972.text:
Karmanya aparimeyani chaturmurti dharo haya aham
kritwa lokaan gamishyami savan aham brahma satkritan

11976.text:
This is all that I have told you, O Brahman, with devotion
The Puranas and the future and the mystery of the best

11978.text:
Even Narada, the most brilliant, desired the grace of others
and ran to Badarasrama to see Nara and Narayana

11979.text:
This is the great Upanishad composed of the Chaturveda
Sankhya Yoga and followed by the Pancharatra

11980.text:
Narada recited the song from the mouth of Narayana
In the house of the Brahmin, my father, as he saw it, as he heard it

11981.text:
[Yuddhisthira]
This is the wonderful greatness of that wise man
What does not Brahma know because he heard from Narada

11982.text:
The grandfather is the Lord, and therefore he is after God.
How can he not know the power of the other, the immeasurable power?

11983.text:
[Bhisma]
Thousands of great kalpas and hundreds of great kalpas
have passed, O King, the creation and the destruction

11985.text:
Ye tava anye brahma sadane siddha sangha gathered
tebhya tacha chravayam asa puranam ved sammitam

11986.text:
Hearing from them the sun and the moon, we heard the Brahman of the self-realized
self-followers, O Bharatha

11988.text:
Suryanugamibhis tata rishibhis taira mahatmabhis
meru samagata devas sharavitash chedam uttamam

11989.text:
Then, from the presence of the gods, Sharutvasito Davija
Sharavayam was, O King, the greatest of the sages of the ancestors

11990.text:
My father, too, was telling me, father, Shantanu
Then I heard this and told you, O Bharatha

11991.text:
Surair va munibhira vapi puranam yair idam sharutam
sarve te paramatmanam poojayanti punah punah

11992.text:
This is a sagely tradition, O king
that you should never give it to a devotee of Navasudeva

11994.text:
Surasuraira yatha rajan nirmathyamritam uddhritam
evam etat pura vipraih kathamritam ihoddhritam

11997.text:
Muchyetartas tatha rogach chrutvemaam adita kathaam
Jigyasura labhte kamaan bhakto bhakta gatim varajeta

11998.text:
Even you, O king, should not always worship the Purushottama
He is the mother and father and the teacher of the whole world

11999.text:
Brahmanya Devo Bhagavan Pariyata Te Sanatana
Yudhisthira Mahabaho Mahabahu Janardana

12000.text:
[Vaishampayana]
Sharutvaitad aakhyana varam Dharmaraja Janamejaya
Bharatarasha chasya te sarve narayana parabhavana

12001.text:
Jitm bhagavata tena purushenati bharata
ityam japyapara bhutva saraswatim udirayana

12002.text:
He who is our teacher, the best of Krishna, the sage of Davaipaya,
said the supreme chanting of Narayana

12003.text:
Going to space, constantly drinking milk and nectar,
worshiping the Lord of the gods, return to the ashram

12004.text:
[Janamejaya]
How is that Lord God, the foremost in sacrifices, the Lord
the holder of sacrifices, and always the Veda-veda-angavitta

12005.text:
Nivruttam chasthito dharma kshemi bhagavat pariyah
paravrtti dharma viddhe sa eva bhagavan parabhuh

12006.text:
How have the gods been made worthy of sharing in the religions of others
How have the minds of the aged become worthy of renunciation and destruction of religion

12007.text:
This is our doubt, O Brahman, cut off this eternal secret
You have heard the story of Narayana, the Dharma Samhita

12010.text:
I am the eternal religion of salvation, which is difficult to practice
whom all the gods have abandoned and become the arm of the sacrificial poem

12011.text:
What is Brahma, Rudra, Indra, the mighty Lord?
The sun, the lord of the stars, the wind, the fire, Varuna, the sky, the earth and all the rest of the heavenly beings

12013.text:
Those who have forgotten the measure of time and have settled in the instinct of others
Let us do this great fault in the measure of time

12016.text:
And those who take part in the sacrifices of others, O best of the brahmins,
whose share do they give in the great sacrifices

12018.text:
Well, I will tell you that my back was once the teacher
Krishna Dvaipayano Vayaso Veda Vayaso Mahan Rishi

12019.text:
Sumantur Jaiminish and Pailash and Sudrudha Varata
I am the fourth disciple and the fifth Shuka is remembered

12020.text:
All the five disciples who had come together were disciplined
clean, conquered anger and conquered the senses

12021.text:
We taught the Vedas in the fifth chapter of the Mahabharata
on the beautiful mountains of Meru, served by the Siddhas and Charanas

12022.text:
They never doubted the Vedas they were practicing
This is what you asked them to tell you
Then I heard it and I also told you, O Bharatha

12026.text:
Taraikalikam idam jnanam paradurbhutam yathepsitama
tacha chrunudhvam yatha jnanam vaksye sanshayam uttama
yathavrttam hi kalpadau drishtam me jnanachakshusha

12027.text:
The one whom the Sankhya Yoga experts call the Supreme Self
attains the name of a great man by all his actions

12030.text:
Earth, air, sky, water and light are the fifth
The great beings born of ego, India

12031.text:
He created the great beings and then created their qualities again
Hear the idols that are emanating from the beings

12032.text:
Marichira Angirasha Chatri Pulastya Pulaha Karatu
Vasishtasha cha mahatma vai Manu Savayambhuvas tatha
Janyeya parakritiyo 'satau ta yasu lokah paratishthitah

12034.text:
Rudra became angry and created ten others
These eleven Rudras are considered to be transformed men

12035.text:
They Rudras and other creatures and all the sages of the gods
have arisen and have approached Brahma for the perfection of the world

12036.text:
We are created, O Lord, by You, the Supreme Lord Vishnu,
in whose authority we should not exist, O Grandfather

12037.text:
How can the rights you have specified be maintained by the chariot thinker
by the rights holder

12038.text:
Show me the strength of him who thinks for rights
Thus said the great god to the gods

12039.text:
Well I have been informed by you gods may you be well
I have this concern that has arisen which you think

12040.text:
How to take over the whole of democracy
How not to lose strength, your horse and myself

12043.text:
They undertook the austerities prescribed by the Brahman, the Vedas imagined
The great law is called the austerities of the terrible

12046.text:
Bho Bhoh Sabrahmaka Deva Rishiyash Cha Tapadhanah
Savagatenaarchya Vah Sarvan Sharavaye Vakyam Uttamam

12047.text:
I know what I have to do and it is for the welfare of the people that I should do it with great
paranoia to expand your life

12048.text:
Sutaptam vasa tapa deva mamaradhana kamyaya
bhoksyathasya mahasatvas tapasah phalam uttamam

12051.text:
Hearing this word of the gods and goddesses, the spirits rejoiced
Then all the demigods, Brahma and the great sages

12053.text:
They are the most revered parts of the Karya Yuga Dharma
Parapura Adityavarnam Tam Purusha Tamasah Parama
Brihantam Sarvagam Devam Ishanam Varadam Parabhum

12054.text:
Then the blessed God spoke these words to all the immortals
the incorporeal Lord in the sky

12055.text:
The part that I imagined has come together
I'm going to tell others today the fruit of the frequency characteristics

12057.text:
Yajnaira ye chapi yakshyanti sarvalokeshu vai surah
kalpayishyanti vo bhagans te nara ved kalpitan

12058.text:
Yo me yatha kalpitavan bhagam asmin mahakratau
sa tatha yajnabhagaarho veda sutra maya kritah

12059.text:
You hold the worlds, fruitful of the sacrificial portion
all-purposeful, created in the world according to their rights

12060.text:
They who will serve others and be honored with the fruits of others' behavior
will hold the worlds with the strength they drink

12061.text:
You are the ones who are worshiped in the world in all sacrifices by human beings
Then you will worship Me, this is your feeling of mine

12062.text:
It means the Vedas created with the sacrificial herbs
these are properly used for the gods in the fields

12063.text:
Nirmanam etad yusmakam paravrtti gunakalpitam
maya kritam surashrestha yavat kalpakshayad iti
chintayadhva lokahitam yathadhikaram ishwarah

12067.text:
Sana, Sanat Sujata, Sanaka, Sasananda,
Sanatkumara, Kapila, and the seventh Sanatana

12073.text:
Asya chaivanujo rudra lalatad yas samutthita
brahmanushisto bhavita sarvatra savara parada

12074.text:
Go and think of the Savan rights according to the law
Let all the works be done in all the worlds, Machiram

12077.text:
Then the Tareta Yuga will be the name of the Tarayi where there will be
Paroksita where the animals will be slaughtered in the sacrifice
There will be no fourth leg of Dharma

12078.text:
Then there will be a mixed time called Davapara
There will be a time without Davipada and Dharmasha in that age

12079.text:
Then, in the thirteenth age, in the age rewarded by Kali, there will be
one-footed religion wherever it is

12084.text:
Tam devo darshayam asa kritva hayshiro mahat
sangan avartayan vedan kamandalu ganitra dhrka

12090.text:
Thus this greatly fortunate Padmanabha is eternal
the leader in sacrifices and the one who is always the holder of sacrifices

12091.text:
Nivrttim chasthito dharmam gatimam akshaya dharminaam
paravrtti dharmaan viddhe kritva lokasya chitratam

12093.text:
Tasmai namadhvaya devaya nirgunaya gunatmana
Ajaya visvaroopaaya dhamne sarvadivaukasam

12095.text:
O lord of the horses and lord of the Maruts, and
lord of the Vedas and sacrifices, and lord of the Vedangas

12096.text:
Om samudravasine nitya hare munja keshina
shantiye sarvabhutanaam mokshadharmanubhasine

12098.text:
Kapardine varahaya ekashrngaya dhimate
vivasvate 'shavashirase chaturmurti dhrute sada

12099.text:
For the secret, the knowledge, the invisible, the imperishable, the imperishable
This God moves everywhere, the infinite movement

12101.text:
Do my words, disciples, serve Hari, God
Sing the Vedas with words, Lord, and worship Him according to the ordinance

12102.text:
[Vaishampayana]
It was said that we were wise by that Vedic age
all his disciples and his sons Shuka were supremely righteous

12106.text:
Your health is bright and strong
The anxious is freed from disease and the bound is freed from bondage

12107.text:
Let the lustful obtain desire and attain long life
The Brahmin shall be the omniscient, the Kshatriya shall be victorious
The prostitute shall attain abundant profit and the Chudra shall attain happiness

12108.text:
Aputro labhte putram kanya chaivepsitam patim
Lagna garbha vimuchyeta garbhini janayet sutam
Vandhya parasavam apnoti putrapoutra samridhimata

12109.text:
Kshemena gachche adhvanam idam yas pathate pathi
yo yam kamam kamayate sa tama apnoti cha dharuvam

12111.text:
[Janamejaya]
Astoushid yair iman vayasah sashishyo madhusoodana
nambhira vividhaira esam niruktam bhagavana mama

12112.text:
You should speak to the servant of the Lord of the universe, Hare,
hearing that I shall be as pure as the moon in the autumn

12113.text:
[Vaishampayana]
Shrunu rajana yathachast phalgunasya harir vibhuh
parasannaatmatmano namanam niruktam gunakarmajam

12114.text:
Namabhi kirtitais tasya keshavasya mahatmana
prishtavan keshavam rajan falgunah paraveer ha

12115.text:
[Arjuna]
Bhagavan Bhutabhavyesh Sarvabhutasruga Avyaya
Lokadham Jagan Nath Lokanaam Abhayaprada

12116.text:
The names of the gods mentioned by the great sages
in the Vedas and Puranas and the secrets of their deeds

12117.text:
I want to tell you what they have said, Keshav
There is no one else who has defined the names except you, Lord

12118.text:
[Shari Bhagavan]
In the Rigveda, in the Sayajurveda, in the Atharva Veda, in the Sama Veda, in the Puranas, in the Sopanishads, and in the Jyotishe, O Arjuna

12119.text:
In Sankhya and Yoga and Ayurveda as well
many of My names have been mentioned by the great sages

12121.text:
Om Namo 'ti Yashase Tasame Dehinam Paramatmane
Narayanaaya Visvaaya Nirgunaaya Gunaatmaaya

12122.text:
Yasya parasadajo brahma rudrash cha karodhasambhavah
yo 'sau yonir hi sarvasya sathavarasya charasya cha

12123.text:
Astadasa gunam yata tata satvam sattvavatam vara
parakriti sa para mahyam rodasi yogadharini
rita satyamarajaya lokanaam atmasamjhita

12126.text:
Ahnah kshaye lalatacha cha suto devasya vai tatha
karodhavistasya sanjajne rudra samhara karaka

12128.text:
Kapardi jatilo mundah shamashanagrhasevakah
ugravratadharo rudra yogi taripuradarunah

12129.text:
Dakshakratuharasha chaiva bhaga netraharasa tatha
Narayanaatmakam janeya pandaveya yuge yuge

12131.text:
I am the soul of the worlds and the worlds, O Pandu Nandan
therefore I worship Rudra before myself

12134.text:
Rudro Narayanasha chaiva sattvam ekam davidhakritam
loke charati kaunteya vayakti satham sarvakarmasu

12135.text:
Na hi me kena chid deyo varah pandavanandana
iti sanchintya manasa purana visvama isvaram
putrartham atmanaam aham atmana

12137.text:
The gods with Brahma and Rudra and with Indra and the sages
worship the best of the gods, Lord Narayana Hari

12139.text:
Obeisance to Vishnu, the giver of sacrifices, and to the giver of refuge
Obeisance to the bestower of blessings, O Kaunteya, Obeisance to the arm of the sacrificial poem

12141.text:
Ye cha shishtas tarayo bhaktas phalkama hi te matah
sarve chayavan dharmas paratibuddhas tu shareshta bhaka

12142.text:
Brahmana, Shiti, Kantha, Yasha and other gods are remembered
The other Buddhas serve this Parthanukitri
The devotee is special to you, this is Parthanukirti

12144.text:
Knowing the part of spiritual yoga and who I am and from whom Bharata
renunciation is characteristic of religion and also of prosperity

12146.text:
I cover the universe with my rays like the sun
And Vasudeva, the abode of all beings, then I am the horse

12147.text:
Gatish cha sarvabhutanaam parajanaam chapi bharata
vayapta me rodasi partha kantish chabhyadhika mama

12148.text:
Adhibhutani chaante 'ham tad ichchansha chasmi bharata
karamanacha chapya aha partha vishnura iti abhisamjhito

12149.text:
People desire me, seeking the perfection of Damat, for
heaven and the earth and the middle, therefore I am the horse of Damodara

12152.text:
Then the first sage, the son of Brahma, crossed the boon
Uttataraod panad vai Prishnigarbhanukirtanaat

12154.text:
Savapatnyam ahito garbha utathyena mahatmana
Utathye 'natarhite chaiva kada chid deva mayaya
Brihaspatir athavindata tam patnim tasya bharata

12158.text:
He reached the long darkness of the chief sage by the curse
He was the longest named horse by the name of the sage in the past

12159.text:
Vedan avapya chaturah sangopangan sanatanaan
parayojyam asa tada nama guhyam idam mama

12160.text:
Anupurvyena vidhina keshaveti punah punah
sa chakshushman samabhavad gautamasha chabhavat punah

12163.text:
Even in the Puranas it is said that
Ekayonya Atmakav Agnisomau
Devasha Chagnimukha Iti
Ekayonitvacha Cha Paraspara Mahayanto Lokaan Dharyat Iti

12164.text:
[Arjuna]
How did the Agni and Soma transform each other in the past
This is my doubt, cut it off, Madhusoodana

12165.text:
[Saribhagavan]
Hant te vartayishyami puranam pandunandana
Atmatejodbhavam partha shrunusvaika mana mama

12169.text:
Mantravado 'pi hi bhavati
tavam agne yajnanam hota visvesham
hito devenbhira manushe jana iti
nidarshanam chatra bhavati
visvesham agne yajnanam hoteti
hito devaira manushaira jagat iti
Agnir hi yajnanam hotrikarta
sa chagnir brahma

12170.text:
There is no Dhavanam except the horse
No austerity is possible without a man
There is worship of Havir mantras by gods and men, and by this you are appointed to offer sacrifice They carry the sacrifices
The sacrifices satisfy the gods and the gods feel the earth

12171.text:
Shatapathe hi brahmana bhavati
Agni samiddhe sa juhoti yo vidvan brahmana mukhe danahuti juhoti
Evam apya agnibhuta brahmana vidvanso 'agni bhavayanti
Agni vishnu sarvabhutanya anupravishya parana dharayati
Api chatra Sanatkumara geeta shaloka bhavanti

12172.text:
Vishvam Brahmasrijat purvam sarvadir niravaskaram
Brahmaghoshaira divam tishtantya amara brahmayonayas

12177.text:
For the sake of Ahalya's assault, Gautama, we heard that Indra had attained peace.
For the sake of Kausika, Indra had attained the separation of Musk and the testicles of sheep Bhuyasa tapasa chaatmanam sanyajya netraakrutir anya lalate rudrasyotpadita

12179.text:
Angiras, who had come to the sacrifice of producing nectar, touched Brihaspati and did not go to the offering.
Then Brihaspati became angry with the waters Bhavateti
Since then the waters have been narrowed by the Yados

12180.text:
Vishvaroopo Vaitvastra purohito devaanm asit savasriyo 'suranm
sa paratykaa devabhyo bhagam adadat parokama asurabhya

12183.text:
Hairanyagarbhacha Vasishtad Dhiranyakasipu cursed
Yasmad tavayanyo vrito hota tasmad asamapta yajnasa tavam apurvat sattvajatad vadham parapsyasiti
Tcha chapdanad Dhiranyakasipu paraptavan vadham

12184.text:
Vishvaroopa, the enhancer of the mother's wings, became very much in austerities.
To break his vow, Indra employed many beautiful apsaras so far

12186.text:
Atha ta Visvaroopo 'barvid adyaiva sendra deva na bhavishantiti
tato mantranja jajapa
taira mantraih paravardhata tarishirah
ekenasyena sarvalokeshu davijaih kariyavadbhira yajneshu suhutam somam papava ekenapaikena sendran devan
Athendrasa tam vivardhamana Somapanapyayit sarvagatram darshva chintama apede

12190.text: When he descended to the Supreme Self, the Creator collected those bones and made them into a thunderbolt Vritram Indra Jaghan

12192.text:
Atha Brahma vadhya bhayapranaste tarailokyanathe sachipatau jagad anishvaram babhuva
devan rajas tamasha chavivesh
mantra na paravartant
maharshinam rakshasi paradurbhavan
Brahma chotsadana jagam
anindrasha chabala lokah supradhrishya babhuva

12194.text:
Then Nahusha said
Everything I have eaten by Indra is present except Sachi
He said this and went to Sachi and said to her
O fortunate one, I am Indra of the gods, worship me to assault

12195.text:
Tama athovaca Nahusha
Aindram padam adhyasyate maya
Aham Indrasya rajyaratnaharo natradharma kasha chit tavam Indra bhukteti
Sa tama uvaca
Asti mama kin chid varatam aparyavasitam
tasya avabhrthe tavam upagamisyami kaish chid evahobhir iti
Sa shachyaivam abhihito Nahusho Jagam

12196.text: Then Sachi, grief-stricken and longing to see her husband, Nahusha, fearing her, approached Brihaspati will show you

12197.text:
Satha Mahaniyamam asthita devi varadama upshrutim mantras ahavaya
sopashruti sachi samipam agata
uvavacha chainaam iyam tavayopahutopasthita
kin te pariyam karvaniti
ta murdhana paranamyavaca sachi bhagavatya arhasi me bharataram darshayitam tavam satya mata Cheti
brought the army to the lake
there he showed Indra going to the bis garnthi

12199.text:
Tama Indrovaca
Go
Nahushas tavaya vachya 'purvena mam rishiyuktena yanana tavam adhirudhodvahasva
For Indra's great vehicles of mind have been carried by me
You should be carried by another
She said this and went away happily
Indra also bis Garnthim evavivesh bhuyah

12201.text: Then Maitravaruni, the son of Kumbhayoni, Agastya, saw the sages being sold by Nahusha, and he touched them with his feet Yaanaad Avapatat

12202.text:
Then Indra became Tarailokya again
Then the devas and sages took refuge in Lord Vishnu for the sake of Indra
They said to him, 'Lord Indra, you are not worthy to save Brahma from being killed 'Abhiyajatu
Then he will get all the places

12203.text: Then, when the sages of the gods did not see Indra, they said to Sachi,

12205.text:
Aakashaganga gatash cha pura Bharadvaja maharshi upasprashansa tarin karaman karamata vishnunabhyasadit
sa Bharadvaja sasalilena paninorasi tadita salakshanoraskah sanvruttah

12206.text: Agni, cursed by the great sage Bhrigu, became all-eating

12207.text:
Aditira vai devaanam annam apachada etad bhuktvasuran hanishyantiti
There Budha came to finish the charya
Aditi chavochad bhiksham nadata
Atha bhiksha paratyakhyaan rushitena budhena brahmabhutena vivasvato davitiye janamnya anda samjhitasyaanda Aditya:
Sa Martando Vivasvan became the god of Chharaddha

12209.text:
Daksha cursed King Soma and he was infected with tuberculosis
He came to Daksha who was infected with tuberculosis
Daksha told him that he was not behaving equally
The sages there said to Soma that you are destroyed by him
 Somas went there to the Hiranyasaras shrine
and performed his bath
After bathing he was freed from sin
When Somas was in the shrine of Chavabhasita, the shrine became known as Parabhasam Sathah
Standing on the full moon only, the cloud line shows his body covered
The cloud-like color came and his rainbow became pure

12212.text:
Himavato Girera duhitaram Uma Rudrash chakme
Bhrigu api ca maharshi Himavantam agamyabravit kanyam Uma me dehiti
tam abravid dhimavan abhilasito varo Rudra iti
tam abravid Bhrigu yasmata tavayaham kanya varana kritabhavah paratyakhyatas tasman na ratnanam bhavan The vessel will be
Today, this is the word of the sage who is situated in the other servant

12213.text:
That is such a greatness of the Brahmanas
Even the fields have reached and enjoyed the eternal inexhaustible earth wife
That is this Brahmagnisomiya
The world is sustained by it

12214.text:
[God]
The sun and the moon are eternal hairs called my particles
They bind the heating particles and the world rises separately

12215.text:
Bondhanat tapanacha chaiva jagato harshanam bhaveta
Agnisoma kritaira ebhih karmabhih pandunandana
Hrishikesho 'ham ishaano varado lokabhavana

12216.text:
Idopahuta yogana hare bhagam karatushva aha
varnasha cha me harishresthas tasmad dharira aha samritah

12217.text:
Dham saro hi lokanaam ritam chaiva vicharitam
Ritdhama tato vipraih satyash chaham parakirtitah

12218.text:
Nasta cha dharanim purvam avindam vai guha gatam
Govinda iti ma deva vaga bhih samabhitustuvuh

12219.text:
Shipivisteti chakhyaam heenroma cha yo bhavet
tenavistam hi yata ki chich chhipivistam hi tat samritam

12220.text:
Yasko mama rishir avyagro naikayajneshu geetvan
shipivista iti haya asmad guhya nama dharo haya aham

12221.text:
Satutva maa shipivisteti yasko rishir udaradhih
matprasadad adho nasta niruktam abhijagmivan

12223.text:
I have never spoken anything vile or obscene before
Rita is the daughter of Brahma, she is my true goddess Saraswati

12224.text:
Sacha chasa chaiva kaunteya mayaveshitam atmani
paushkare brahma sadane satya maam rishyo viduh

12227.text:
I till the earth, O Partha, becoming the great black iron
Krishna is my colour, and therefore I am Krishna, O Arjuna

12228.text:
I have synthesized the earth with water, air and air
wind and effulgence, and then I am Vaikuntha

12229.text:
Nirvana is the supreme happiness, the supreme religion is called the other
Therefore, do not choose the former, I am the infallible by that action

12230.text:
Prithivi nabhasi chobhe vishrute visvalaukike
tayoh sandharanartham hi mama adhokshajam anjasa

12231.text:
Niruktam veda viduso ye cha shabdartha chintaka
te ma gayanti paragvanshe adhokshaja iti sathitih

12232.text:
The word is unanimously uttered by the great sages
There is no other horse in this world except Narayana, the Supreme Lord

12233.text:
Ghritam mamarchisho loke jantunam parana dharanaam
Ghritaarchir aham avyagraira vedajnaih parikirtitah

12234.text:
The stars are the metals that are eaten and are called karmaja
This is called the conflict between bile, mucus and air

12236.text:
Vrisha hi bhagavan dharmah khayato lokeshu bharata
Naighantuka padakhyatam viddhi maa vrisham uttamam

12237.text:
Kapira is called the boar, the best and the righteous bull
Therefore Kashyapa, the lord of others, defeated Vrishakapi

12240.text:
The one-horned boar used to be a divine sight
I lifted this earth from the one-horned then I am the horse

12241.text:
Tathaivasam tarikakudo varaham rupam aasthitah
tarikakuta tena vikhyatah sharirasya tu measurenat

12242.text:
Virincha iti yas paraktah kapila jnanachintakaih
sa parajapatira evaham chetanat sarvalokakrita

12243.text:
Vidya sahayavantam mama adityastham sanatana
kapilam parahura acharyah sankhya nishchita nishchayah

12244.text:
Hiranyagarbha dayutimana esha yasha chandasi satuta
yogas sampujyate nitya sa evaham vibhuh samritah

12248.text:
Shakha bhedash cha ye ke chid yash cha shakhasu geetah
savaravarnasamuchcharah sarvansa tan viddhi matkritan

12249.text:
Yat tad dhayashirah partha samudeti varapradama
so 'ham evottare bhage karmakshara vibhagavit

12250.text:
By the path ordered by Rama, by my grace, the great soul
Panchal, you have attained karma, therefore, O eternal being,
the Babhravya clan became the first karma-paraga

12254.text:
Nara and Narayana previously performed austerities and rode the inexhaustible
dharmayana on the mountain Gandhamadana

12255.text: Then in due course of time Daksha became a sacrifice and did not imagine Daksha's share of Rudra's Bharata

12257.text:
Then burning the spear and performing the Daksha sacrifice in detail
Avayoh suddenly went near the ashram of Badarya
With great speed, O Partha, you fell on Narayana's chest

12258.text: Then the hair of Narayana, covered with all the effulgence, became Munja Varnas, but then I became Munja Keshavan

12259.text:
Then the spear was thrown out by the great soul with a shout
Jagama Shankara karam Narayana samahatam

12261.text:
Atha Rudra vighatartham ishikam jagrahe narah
mantraish cha sanyuyojashu so 'bhavat parasura mahan

12264.text:
[Saribhagwan]
They were involved in the battle of Rudra and Narayana
Then all the worlds were suddenly agitated

12265.text:
The fire did not accept the white sacrifice offered in the sacrifices
The Vedas do not reflect the same name of the sages as the devotees of the soul

12267.text:
Nishprabhani cha tejansi brahma chaivasanacha chayuta
Agacha chhosham samudrasha cha himavansha cha vayashiryat

12269.text:
Sanjali paragraho bhutva chaturvaktro niruktagah
uvaca vachanam rudram lokanam astu vai shivam
nayasyayudhani visvesh jagato hitakamyaya

12270.text:
Yad aksharam athavyaktam isham lokasya bhavanam
kutastham kartri nirdvandvam akarteti cha yam viduh

12272.text:
Tapasa mahata yuktau deva sharesthau mahavratau
I parsadajas tasya kasminsh chit kaarantara
tavam chaiva karodhajas tata purvasarge sanatana

12277.text:
Yas tavam vetti sa maa vetti yas tavam anu sa mam anu
navayor antaram kin chin ma te bhud buddhir anyatha

12280.text:
This is what you have told, Partha Narayana, Jayo in battle
The names and the secrets and the interpretations of India
The sages have told you here which you have chanted

12281.text:
Evam bahuvidhai rupaish charamiha vasundhara
Brahmaloka ca kaunteya goloka ca sanatana
Maya tavam rakshita yuddhe mahantam paraptavan jayam

12282.text:
Yas tu te so 'garato yati yuddhe sampratyupasthite
tam viddhi Rudram kaunteya devadevam kapardinam

12284.text:
Aprameyaprabhavam tam devadevam umapatim
namasva devam parayato visvesham haram avyayam

12286.text:
Idam shatasahasrad dhi bharatakhyana vistarat
amathya matimanthena jananodadhim anuttamam

12287.text:
As freshly brought milk and sandalwood from Malaya
And the forest as nectar from the Vedas and herbs

12288.text:
Samuddhritam idam brahmana kathamritam anuttamam
tapo nidhe tavayoktam hi narayana kathashrayam

12289.text:
Sa Hisho Bhagavan Devah Sarvabhutatmabhavanah
Aho Narayana Tejo Durdarsham Davijasattam

12291.text:
Visiting all the ashrams and immersing in all the holy places
is not as fruitful as the story of Narayana

12292.text:
Sarvatha pavitah samaha sharutvemam adita katham
Harer visvesvarasyeha sarvapapapranashanim

12293.text:
No wonder you did there that my noble Dhananjaya
with the help of Vasudeva who achieved the best victory

12296.text:
Tapasapi na drishyo hi bhagavanl lokapoojitah
Yam drishtavantam te sakshacha chariotsaka vibhusanam

12298.text:
Then the person who followed the grace of the gods saw him
If you saw him then the god was situated in the body of Aniruddha

12299.text:
Badrim ashram where Narada ran back
to see Nara and Narayana what is the reason for that, sage

12300.text:
Narada, the Supreme Personality of Godhead, retired from the White Island
After reaching the ashram of Badarim, he met the two sages

12301.text:
How long did he stay and what stories did he ask when he
returned to the white island or in that great soul

12302.text:
What did the great sages Nara and Narayana say?
Then you should tell me everything in detail

12303.text:
[Vaishampayana]
Om Namo Bhagavate Tasame Vayasayamit Tejase
Yasya Parsadad Vakshyami Narayana Katham Imam

12304.text:
After reaching the white continent, he saw the inexhaustible Harim
Retired, Narada, the king, came to Merum with thirst
Heart carried the burden which was spoken by the Supreme Soul

12306.text:
Then Mero crossed the mountain Gandhamadana
fell down and quickly followed a huge cloud

12308.text:
Tejasabhyadhikau suryat sarvalokavirocanat
sharivatsa lakshanau poojyau jata mandala dharinau

12309.text:
The two web-foot arms are characterized by the foot-shaped wheel
the long-armed Vayudharaska and the musk square

12310.text:
Sixty teeth, eight fangs, sound like clouds,
with broad foreheads, beautiful chin, beautiful eyebrows, and nose

12311.text:
The two gods with heads resembling an umbrella
were called great men endowed with such characteristics

12313.text:
They became inwardly overlooking the Purushottamas
They always went there who were worshiped by all beings

12314.text:
I saw such two great sages in the white lamp
Thinking of this, I circumambulated them with my mind
and sat down there on the ground, O auspicious Kusha

12315.text:
Then the two men, dressed in austerities, dressed in fame and splendour,
the sage Sham and Damo, performed the morning ritual

12318.text:
Then Narayana there spoke to Narada
comfortably seated, resting, having been entertained, and happily seated

12319.text:
Even now that Lord is the Supreme Being, the Eternal
Shavetadeepa, the other nature of the two you have seen

12320.text:
[Narada]
Drishto me purusha shariman visvaroopadharo avayayah
sarve hi lokas tatra sathasa tatha devas saharshibhi
adyapi chainam pashami yuvam pashana sanatanau

12321.text:
Yaira lakshanaira upetah sa harir avyaktarupadharka
taira lakshanaira upetau hi vayaktarupadharau yuvam

12322.text:
I saw you there by the side of that god
and here you came and I was released today by the Supreme Soul

12323.text: Who can be called by his splendor and fame except you two righteous sons in the worlds like him

12324.text:
He told me before the name of the field expert
and the appearance of the others, for they will be told as

12325.text:
There are all the white men who are devoid of the five senses
and the Buddha of Rati and the devotees of the Purushottama

12327.text:
Ramate so 'rachyamano hi sada bhagavat pariyah
visvabhuka sarvago devo bandhavo bhakta vatsalah
sa karta karanam chaiva karyam chatibala dayutih

12328.text:
Tapasa yojya so 'atmana shavetadvipata param hi yata
teja iti abhivikhyatam savayam bhasavabhasitam

12330.text:
The sun does not shine there, no moon shines there
The wind does not blow, O God, the austerities are difficult to perform

12331.text:
Vedim astatalotsedham bhumava asthaaya visvabhuka
ekpadasthito deva urdhvabahura udang mukhah
sangan avartayan vedansa tapas tepe suduscharam

12332.text:
Yad Brahma Rishyasha Chaiva Savayam Pashupatisha Chaiva Yata
Sheshasha Cha Vibudhashrestha Daityadanavarakshasas

12334.text:
All the deeds which are used by the lonely intelligences
God receives with his head all of them

12336.text:
Thus Lord God Hari told me
I will be devoted to you and be with you always

12337.text:
[Nara and Narayana]
Blessed are you who have been favored to see the Lord Himself
For no one, not even the lotus-born, has seen Him alone

12338.text:
Avyaktayonir Bhagavan Durdarsha Purushottama
Naradaitad dhi te satya vacana samudahritam

12340.text:
Tapo hi tapyatas tasya yata sathanam paramatmanah
na tat samprapnute kash chid rite hay aavan davijottam

12341.text:
For that which is the light of the whole of a thousand suns
places, that is the light of the whole of it, and it shines with it

12343.text:
Therefore, O God, the taste is good for all beings
Apo yena hi yujyante darvatvam parapnuvanti cha

12344.text:
Therefore the effulgence which arises from it is form-quality
which is equally combined with the sun and then shines in the worlds

12345.text:
Therefore the gods arose, and the touch of the Purushottama
who is equally united with the wind, then he blows the worlds

12347.text:
Therefore, O God, arises the mind in all beings
the moon, which is united with the possession of the quality of light

12348.text:
So bhutotpadakam nama tata sathanam ved samjhitam
vidya sahayo yatraste bhagavan havyakavya bhuk

12352.text:
Paradyumnacha chapi nirmukta jivam sankarsanam tatha
vishanti vipra paravarah sankhya bhagavataih saha

12356.text:
Ye tu tasyaiva devasya paradurbhavah surapriyah
bhavisyanti tarilokasthas tesam savastitya ato davij

12357.text:
Vidhina savena yuktabhya yathapurvam davijottama
asthitabhya sarvakruchram varatam samyak tad uttamam

12358.text:
We have also seen you on the island of Shaveta, the ascetic
meeting the Lord as you conversed with him

12359.text:
Everything is conscious of us in the world of moving and non-moving
Whatever happens or exists, good or evil

12361.text:
Jajapa vidhivan mantran Narayana gatan bahun
Divyam varshasahasram hi naranarayanashrame

12362.text:
Avasat sa mahateja narada bhagavan rishih
tama evabhyarchyana devam naranarayanau cha tau

12363.text:
[Vaishampayana]
Whose mind is yours, then, Narada, the supreme lord of time,
having made destiny, he made the patriarchal righteousness, and then the supreme

12365.text:
Tell me, O best of your wise men, as it is
what this is done and what is the fruit of its actions

12370.text:
Sharutish chapya apara devaputran hi pitaro 'yajana
Vedashrutih paranasta cha punar adhyapita sutaih
tatasa te mantradah putrah pitrutvama upapedire

12371.text:
Surely you have known this long ago,
sons and fathers do not worship each other

12372.text:
Tarin pindan nayasya vai prithvyam purvam datva kushan iti
katham tu pinda sanjnam te pitaro lebhire pura

12373.text:
[Nara and Narayana]
Iman hi dharanim purvam nastam sagaramekhalam
Govinda ujjaharashu varaham rupam ashritah

12377.text:
Atmagatroshma sambhutaih sanehagarbhais tilaira api
parokshyapavargam devesh paranmukh kritavan savayam

12378.text:
And to establish dignity, he then spoke the word
I am the fathers, ready to create the world, all of us

12380.text:
Tarayo murti vihina vai pinda murti dharas tava ime
bhavantu pitaro loke maya srishtah sanatana

12381.text:
Father and grandfather and also great-grandfather
I am the only one who is known here to be dwelling in the bodies of the seas

12382.text:
There is no one greater than me, whom I should worship myself
who is my father in this world, I am the grandfather

12383.text:
Grandfather and father and I am the cause of this
Having said this, the god Vrishakapi

12384.text:
On the mountain of the boar, the brahmin gave the body in detail
and worshiped himself and went to the darshan there

12388.text:
[Vaishampayana]
Hearing this, Narada spoke these words to Naranarayana
Atyantabhaktimana deva ekantitvam upeyivan

12390.text:
Tava api khayatatapasau naranarayanava rishi
tasminna evashrame ramye tepatus tapa uttamam

12391.text:
Tam apya amitvikranta pandavaanam kulodvahah
pavitaatmadya samvruttah sharutvemam adita katham

12392.text:
Naiva tasya paro loko nayam parthiva sattama
karmana manasa vaca yo davishyad vishnum avyayam

12393.text:
Majjanti pitarasa tasya narake shasvatih samaah
Yo davishyad vibudhasreshtam devam narayana harim

12396.text:
Krishna Dvaipayanam Vyasam Viddhi Narayana Parabhuma
Who else is the tiger of men, the creator of the Mahabharata
Who can tell the various religions and the Lord except him

12397.text:
May the great sacrifice be performed as you have resolved
conceived the horse sacrifice and your Sharutadharma in truth

12399.text:
This is the story of Narayana which I have told you
Narada told me in the past, O King, to my teacher
while the sages and the Pandavas were listening, Krishna and Bhisma

12402.text:
Tarigunatigash chaturpanchadharah; purteshtayosha cha phalbhagaharah
viddhati nityam ajito 'tibalo; gatimam atmaga sukritinam rishinam

12404.text:
He is the source of immortality in the world; the subtle, the ancient, the unchanging, the supreme
that is generously held by the Sankhya yogis; known constantly by the self-controlled by intelligence

12405.text:
[Janamejaya]
Sharutam bhagavatas tasya mahatmya paramatmanah
janma dharmagrihe chaiva nara-narayana-atmakam
mahavaraha srishta cha pindotpattih ancient

12406.text:
He who is conceived in the other's instincts and in the renunciation
sa tatha na ruto brahmana kathyamanasa tavayanagha

12407.text:
Yach cha tat kathitam purva tavaya hayashiro mahat
havyakavya bhujo vishnor udaka purve mahoddhau
tacha cha drishtam bhagavata brahmana parameshthi

12408.text:
What that produced before by the deer, the holder of the world
form, the greatest of the others, the unprecedented, the best of the wise

12409.text:
Drishtva hi vibudhashrestham apurvam amitaujasam
tad ashwashirasam punyam brahma kim akaron mune

12412.text:
Hearing the horse-headed idol of the god Hari Medhas
The king, in doubt, stirred up darkness

12413.text:
[Yuddhisthira]
Yat tad darshivan brahma devam hayashiro dharam
kimartham tat samabhavad vapura devopakalpitam

12414.text:
[Vayas]
Yat ki chid iha loke vai dehabaddham visham pate
sarvam pancabhira avistam bhutaira ishvara buddhijaih

12415.text:
God is the Creator of the universe, Lord Narayana, the Supreme Being
The Self of the Beings, the Giver of Blessings, the Saguna and the Nirguna
Hear the Unmanifest of the Destruction of the Beings, O King

12416.text:
Dharanyam atha linayam apsu chaikarnave pura
Jyotir bhute jale chapi leene jyotishi chanile

12419.text:
Tamaso brahma sambhutam tamo moolam ritatmakam
tad visvabhavasamjnantam paurushim tanum asthitam

12420.text:
So 'aniruddha iti paraktas tat paradhanam parachakshate
tad avyaktam iti janyeyam tarigunam nripasattam

12421.text:
Vidya sahayavan devo visvakseno harih parabhuh
Apsva eva shayanam chakre nidra yogam upagatah
jagatash chintayan srishtim chitra bahugunodbhavam

12423.text:
Padme 'aniruddhata sambhutas tada padmaninibhekshana
sahasrapatre dayutimana upavishta sanatana

12425.text:
Purvama eva cha padmasya patre suryansu saprabhe
Narayana kritau binduva apama asta gunottarau

12427.text:
He became sweet in the darkness and then by the command of Narayana
he told you that his other point was Kaitabha Rajasa

12429.text:
They saw the Brahman in the lotus, immeasurably bright
creating the first Vedanta, four hundred beautiful forms

12431.text:
Then the two demons, the best of the Vedas, took the eternal
rasas and entered the waters of the east ocean

12433.text:
Veda me param chakshur Veda me param balam
Veda me param dham Veda me brahma chottam

12434.text:
All my Vedas have been taken away by the demons by force from here
My worlds have become dark and destroyed by the Vedas
What can I do except the Vedas, for I am about to create the worlds

12435.text:
Aho bat mahad dukkham veda nashanjam mama
parapta dunoti hridayaam tivrashokaya radhayan

12438.text:
Namas te Brahma hridayanam te mama purvaja
Lokad ya bhuvan sharestha sankhyayognidhe vibho

12439.text:
Vyaktavyakta karachintya kshemam panthanam aasthita
visvabhuka sarvabhutanaam antaratmanna ioniz

12440.text:
Aham parasadjas tuvyam lokadhamne savayambhuve
tavatto me manasam janmam paratham davij poojitam

12441.text:
Chaksusham vai davitiyam me janam chasit puratam
Tavatprasadacha cha me janam tritiyam vachikam mahat

12442.text:
Tavatta sharavanajam chapi chaturtham janam me vibho
nasikya chapi me janam tavatta panchamam ucyate

12443.text:
Andajam chapi me janam tavatta sastham vinirmitam
Idam cha saptam janam padmajam me 'mitprabha

12447.text:
Thus satisfied, the Supreme Personality of Godhead turned His face from all sides
He gave up His sleep and then prepared for the work of the Vedas
By the combination of the Supreme Lord He assumed His second body

12449.text:
His head was covered with stars and stars
and his hair was long and radiant like the rays of the sun

12450.text:
Karnavakas patale lalatam bhutadharini
ganga saraswati punya bharuvav asta mahanadi

12452.text:
Dantasha cha pitaro rajana somapa iti vishrutah
Goloko brahmalokasha cha oshtava asta mahatmanah
Gariva chasyabhavad rajana kalaratrir gunottara

12454.text:
Rasam punah paravishtasha cha yoga paramam asthitah
shaiksam savaram samasthaya om iti parasrijata savaram

12455.text:
Sasvarah sanunaadi cha sarvaga sanigdha eva cha
babhuvantarmahi bhuta sarvabhutagunoditah

12456.text:
Then the two demons, having made the Vedas and the bonds of time,
put them in the bottom of the ocean, where the sound was then dropped

12458.text:
Placing the horse's head in the water in the east ocean
the Vedas' abode also became the horse's head then

12461.text:
Shavetam Chandra Vishuddhabham Aniruddha Tanau Sathitam
Bhuyo 'paya Amitvikranta Nidra Yogam Upagata

12462.text:
Atmapramana rachite apama upari kalpite
shayane nagabhangadye javalamalasamavrite

12464.text:
Uchatush and Samavishtau Rajasa Tamasa Tau
This is that man who lies white and falls asleep

12465.text:
Anena nun vedanam kritam aharanam rasat
kasyaisa ko nu khalva esha ki cha savapiti bhogavan

12467.text:
Looking at the two demons, they then set their minds on the battle
Then there was a battle between Tayor and Narayana

12468.text:
Rajas tamo vishta tanu tava ubhau madhu kaitabhau
Brahmanopacitim kurvan jaghana madhusoodana

12473.text:
Evam esha mahabhago babhuvasvashira hari
Puranam etad akhyatam rupam varadam aishwaram

12474.text:
Whoever hears or holds this Brahman daily
will never attain to the destruction of his study

12475.text:
Aradhya tapasogrena devam har shirodharam
Panchalena karamah parapto ramana pathi deshite

12476.text:
Etad dhayashiro rajanna aakhyana tava kirtitam
puranam ved samitam yan ma tavam paripruchchasi

12477.text:
Whatever body God wishes to make in the method of work, whatever he chooses
he will make it, transforming himself into himself by himself

12479.text:
Narayana Para Veda Yajna Narayana Atmakah
Tapa Narayana Param Narayana Para Gati

12480.text:
Narayana is the supreme truth, the truth, the Narayana-atma
Narayana is the supreme religion, and it is rare to repeat it again

12481.text:
The characteristics of others' instincts and religion are Narayana-like
Narayan-like fragrance is considered the best on earth

12482.text:
Apam chaiva guno rajan raso narayanaatmakah
jyotisham cha guno rupam samritam narayanaatmakam

12483.text:
Narayana-atmakasha chapi saparsho vayugunah samritah
Narayatmakasha chapi shabda akashasambhavah

12484.text:
Manasha chapi tato bhutam avyaktaguna laksanam
Narayana parah kalo jyotisham ayana cha yata

12485.text:
Narayana is the supreme fame, Sharish and Lakshmi are the gods
Narayana is the supreme Sankhya, Yoga is Narayana-atma

12486.text:
The cause is the man whose other is the cause and the cause of the other
The nature and the actions of whom the destiny is the cause

12488.text:
Tattvam eka maya yogi Harir Narayanah parabhuh
sabrahmakanam lokanam rishinam cha mahatmanaam

12489.text:
Kesava knows the
mind of the Sankhya Yogis and the Yatis of the Atmavedis, not of them

12490.text:
Ye ke chit sarvalokeshu daivam pitrya kurvate
danani cha parayacchanti tapyanti cha tapo mahat

12493.text:
They do not find the path of the great soul; nor does anyone approach him here
The great sages who are self-controlled in knowledge; see the eternal man as the most virtuous

12494.text:
Aho haya ekantinah sarvan parinati bhagavan hari
vidhiprayukta puja cha grihnati bhagavan savayam

12496.text:
In the fourth stage they go to the Purushottama
but the solitary men go to the supreme stage

12497.text:
Surely this is the best solitary religion, Narayana, the dearest
Agatva gatayas tisro yad gacchanti avyayam harim

12498.text:
The brahmins who are rightly established with the Upanishads and the Vedas
path the path of righteousness and those who are righteous

12499.text:
I know the path of lonely men distinct from them
Who has taught this Dharma, whether by god or sage

12500.text:
Ekantinam cha ka charya kada chotpadita vibho
Etan me sanshayam chindi param kautuhalam hi me

12501.text:
[Vaishmpayana]
Samupodhesva anikeshu kuru pandavayora mridhe
Arjune vimanaske cha gita bhagavata savayam

12503.text:
Sammitah samaveda puraivadi yuge kritah
dharyate savayam ishena rajan narayana ha

12504.text:
This is the meaning, O great king, of the back of Partha, Narada
the greatly fortunate among the sages, hearing Krishna Bhismayo

12505.text:
And this has been told to me by the Guru, O King
but as you have been told there by Narada, so hear

12506.text:
Yadaseen manasam janam Narayana mukhodgatam
Brahmanah prithivipala tad Narayana savayam
tena dharmaena kritavana daivam pitrya cha bharata

12510.text:
The third birth of the Brahman, when it was the great oral
there this religion was born of Savayam Narayana, O king

12511.text:
A sage named Suparno attained darkness, O Purushottama
by austerities, by well-burnt restraint and by regulation

12513.text:
Rigveda pathapathitam varatam etad dhi duscharam
Suparnacha chapya adhigato dharma esha sanatana

12514.text:
Vayuna davipadam sharestha parathito jagad ayusha
vayoh sakashat paraptasha cha rishibhira vighasashibhih

12515.text:
They attained the great ocean and the best of religion
Then he disappeared again, concentrated on Narayana

12517.text:
Jagat sarashtumana devo harir narayanah savayam
chintayam asa purusham jagat sarga karam parabhuh

12519.text:
Create others, my son, all from your mouth and feet, and
shareyas, I will give you strength and splendour, O Suvrata

12520.text:
And take the Dharma from me by the name of Satvata
and by it establish all the Kritayuga according to the prescribed ritual

12521.text:
Then Brahma offered obeisances to the god Hari Medhase
He took the Dharma and the foremost of the secrets with his collection
And he went to the mouth of Narayana with the Aranyaka

12524.text:
Then turned back then in the beginning of the auspicious Kritayuga
Then the Satvata pervaded the Dharma and settled in the worlds

12525.text:
By that instrumental religion, Brahma created the world
We worshiped the Lord of the gods, Hari, the Supreme Lord

12526.text:
Dharmapratishtha hetosh cha manu savarochisham tatha
adhyapayama asa tad lokanam hitakamyaya

12530.text:
Sanatkumara, the Lord, then defeated the king
From Sanatkumara and also from Veerana, the lord of the others,
At the beginning of Krita, the tiger of the Kurus learned this Dharma

12532.text:
Then he gave the other direction to a righteous man named Kukshi
Then he disappeared again and rose from the mouth of Narayana

12533.text:
Andaje janmani punar brahmane hari yonaye
Esha dharma samudbhuto narayana mukhat punah

12534.text:
Grihito brahmana rajana parayuktasha cha yathavidhi
adhyapitasha cha muniyo nama barhishado nripa

12535.text:
Barhishadbhyasha cha sankrantah samavedantagam davijam
jayeshtam namnabhivikhyatam jayeshta sama varato harih

12536.text:
Jayeshtacha chapya anusankranto rajanam avikampanam
antardhadhe tato rajana esa dharma parabhor hareh

12538.text:
He gave this Dharma to his grandfather, the pure, the holder of the world at the beginning of the age,
and to his grandfather, Daksha, in the past

12540.text:
At the beginning of the Tareta Yuga, Vivasvan again gave it to Manu
Manus became the world and gave the meaning to his son Ikshvaku

12543.text:
Narada, however, has received the mystery with its collection
This is the Dharma, O Lord of the universe, directly from Narayana, O King

12545.text:
By knowledge of religion and by this well-used action
non-violence and righteousness are attained by the Lord Hari

12546.text:
A single cluster division or sometimes called a double cluster
There are also four clusters and a number of quad clusters

12548.text:
Manash cha parathitam rajan pancandriya samiranam
Esha lokanidhir dhiman esha lokavisargat krita

12550.text:
This is the solitary religion I have told you, O King
I have given the Guru a gift that is difficult to understand by the unrighteous
For many solitary men are rare, O King

12552.text:
Evam sa bhagavan vayaso gurur mama visam pate
kathayam asa dharmajno dharmaraje davijottamah

12554.text:
Devam paramakam brahma shavetam chandrabham achyutam
Yatra chaikantino yanti narayana parayanah

12555.text:
[Janamejaya]
Thus many kinds of religion are served by the other Buddhas
How can the brahmins not do others who are present in various boons

12556.text:
[Vaishampayana]
Three other natures, O King, are created in the bonds of the body
The Sattvic, the Rajasic and the Tamasic, O Bharatha

12557.text:
The best man among the bonds of the body is the leader of the Kuru dynasty
The sattvic man is determined to attain salvation by being a tiger

12558.text:
Here too he knows the Purusha Brahma Vartinam
Narayana is the Supreme Moksha and therefore he is called Sattvik

12559.text:
Manisita cha parapnoti chintana purushottamam
Ekantabhaktih satataam narayana parayanah

12560.text:
Manisino hi ye ke chid yatiyo mokshakankshinah
tesam vai chinnatrishnanam yogakshema vaho hari

12562.text:
Sankhya Yogena Tulyo Hi Dharma Ekantasevita
Narayanaatmake Mokshe Tato Yanti Param Gatim

12563.text:
A man who is seen by Narayana becomes re-enlightened
Thus, O king, by self-will, re-enlightenment is not born

12564.text:
Rajasi and Tamasi are mixed with age and remembered by others
That is the self-born man, Lord of the universe
Hari does not look at us with the characteristics of others' instincts

12565.text:
Seeing this being born, Brahma, the father of the worlds,
overwhelmed the human being with Rajas and Tamas

12567.text:
[Janamejaya]
How can a man go to the transformational Purushottama

12568.text:
[Vaishampayana]
Susukshma sattvasamyuktam sanyuktam taribhira aksharai
purusha purusha gacchaena niskrita panchavinshakam

12570.text:
As the streams of water flowing from the sea; they re-enter the darkness, O king
These are the great streams of knowledge; they re-enter Narayana

12571.text:
This is the Dharma I have told you, O Satvata Yadubandhava
do it according to justice if you can, O Bharatha

12572.text:
Evam hi sumahabhaga Narada guruve mama
shavetanam yatinam aha ekantagatim avyayam

12573.text:
Vayasa chakathayat paritya dharmaputraya dhimate
sa evayam maya tuvyam akhyato parasrito guruh

12576.text:
[Janamejaya]
Sankhya, Yoga, Pancharatra, Vedaranyaka and
Jnananya etani brahmarshe lokeshu paracaranti ha

12579.text:
Pitamahad yam paravadanti shashtam; maharshim arsheya vibhuti yukta
Narayanasyanshajam ekaputram; davaipayanam ved mahanidhanam

12580.text:
Tam adi kaleshu mahavibhutir; Narayano Brahma mahanidhanam
sasarja putraarthaam udarateja; vayasam mahatmanaam ajah purana

12581.text:
[Janamejaya]
Tvayaiva kathitha purvam sambhavo davijasattama
vasithasya suta shakti shaktis putra parasara

12585.text:
Having done the narrative of India, we then performed the austerities of the wise of Sharanta
The service of the devoted king

12586.text:
Sumantur Jaiminish and Pailash and Sudrudha Varata
I am the fourth disciple of Vai Shuka and Vayasatmaja

12591.text:
Listen to the best of the narrations, this is the best of the sages
Adi kalaodbhavam viprasa tapasadhigatam maya

12592.text:
Parapte paraja visarge vai saptame padmasambhave
Narayano mahayogi shubhashubhavivarjitah

12593.text:
He created from the womb a son, Brahman, immeasurably bright
Then he appeared to him and spoke these words to him

12598.text:
Savarupini tato buddhir upasthe harim parabhuma
yogena chaina niryogah savayam niyuje tada

12600.text:
Brahmanam paravishasveti lokasrishtya arthasiddhaye
tatas tamas ishvaradishta buddhih kshipram vivesh sa

12601.text:
Then the Lord saw him again endowed with intelligence
Bhuyasha chained him with the words of the others,

12602.text:
Having said this, the Lord disappeared there
Parapa chaiva muhura tena savasthanam deva samjhitam

12603.text:
He became one with that other nature
Then his intelligence became another again then Kil

12605.text:
Many strong giants, demons and rakshasas on earth
will be endowed with austerities and will attain the best of boons

12607.text:
Atha nana samudbhutair vasudhaya yathakramam
nigrahena ca papanam sadhunam paragrahena ca

12608.text:
I will hold this ascetic truth on earth
I horse this is held by the enjoyer in the underworld

12612.text:
Then again the creator of the universe, resounding with the sound of Bhoh
Saraswati, became Saraswati there

12613.text:
Apantaratama nama suto vaka sambhavo vibhoh
bhutabhavya bhavishyajnah satyavadi drdha varata

12614.text:
Tama said with bowed head, the beginning of the gods, the infinite
You should do the scriptures in the Vedic narrative, O best of the wise
Therefore do this word as I have commanded you, O sage

12615.text:
Then the Vedas were separated from the mind by the Savayambhuva
Then Lord Hari was pleased with his deeds
by his austerities and by his well-burnt Yama and his laws

12616.text:
[Saribhagavan]
In the manvas, your son is thus the initiator of the worlds
The unchanging Brahman of the future and invincible forever

12619.text:
Even there you will break the Vedas in many ways with austerities
and in the dark age you will become dark in colour

12620.text:
You are the doer of dharmas and various kinds of knowledge, and
you will be endowed with austerities and will not be freed from passion

12621.text:
Veetaragasha cha putras te paramatma bhavishati
Maheshwara parsadena naitad vacanam anyatha

12622.text:
Yam manasam vai paravadanti putram; pitamahasyottam buddhiyukta
vasitham agryam tapaso nidhanam; yasha chapi suryam vayatirichya bhati

12624.text:
The past, present and future are cut off from all meaningful doubt
They who crossed the horse before the millenniums

12625.text:
Tansha cha sarvan mayoddishtan darkshyase tapasanvita
punara darkshyasi chanek sahasrayugaparyayana

12626.text:
Eternal death in the world and the hand of the wheel, O sage
Meet me, O sage, this is not my word otherwise

12628.text:
[Vayas]
Thus the sage Sarasvata, the most infinite, then
said, and said,

12629.text:
So 'ham tasya parsadena devasya Hari medhasah
Apantaratama nama tato jato 'ajnaya hari
punas cha jato vikhyato vasishta kulanandana

12630.text:
Then this is said to be the birth of myself
by the grace of Narayana and the birth of Narayana

12631.text:
I have performed great and terrible austerities
in the past, the best of the wise, by supreme meditation

12633.text:
[Vaishampayana]
This is the possibility told to you before, O king of Asmad Guru
Hear again as asked by the untroubled mind of Vayas

12636.text:
Apantaratamasha chaiva vedacharyah sa ucyate
parachin garbham tama rishim paravadantiha ke chan

12637.text:
Umapatir bhutapatih sharikantha brahmanah suta
uktavan idam avyagro jananam pashupatam shivah

12639.text:
Yathagamam yatha jananam nishtah narayanah parabhuh
na chainam evam jananti tamam bhuta visham pate

12641.text:
Hari always dwells in all without doubt
Madhava does not dwell in doubtful cause and effect

12642.text:
Pancharatravido ye tu yathakramapara nripa
ekantabhavopagatas te hari paravishanti vai

12643.text:
Sankhya and Yoga are the eternal Dave; all the Vedas are defined by Nikhilena Rajan
by all the sages; Narayana is the universe and this is the Purana

12644.text:
Because good and evil actions are summoned; whatever changes in all the worlds
therefore know that it becomes the sage; in the divine space and in the bows of the earth

12645.text:
[Janamejaya]
There are many men, not Brahmans, but only one
Who is the best man here, and who is called Yonir here?

12646.text:
[Vaishampayana]
Many men in the world who think of Sankhya Yoga
Do not desire this man, O dweller of the Kuru dynasty

12647.text:
And as one vagina is called for many men,
so I will describe that man as the universe, multiplied by many

12648.text:
Offering obeisances to the Guru, to the immeasurable splendor of age,
tapa, to the gifted, to the worshipful, to the great sage

12649.text: This Purusha Sukta is the most famous of all the Vedas, the earthly truth and the truth, and was contemplated by Rishi Singha

12650.text:
The scriptures were uttered by the sages Kapila and others
based on spiritual thought, O Bharatha

12652.text:
Here again I cite the history of the ancient
conversation with Brahma of Taryambaka, lord of the world

12653.text:
In the midst of the sea of Kashiroda, Hataka is bright
The king of the mountains known as Vaijayanta

12659.text:
Kacha chit te kusalam putra savadhyatapasoh sada
nityam ugratapasoh tavam hi tatha prachchami te punah

12661.text:
I have seen the Lord Vairaja in the house for a long time
Then I have reached the mountain served by your feet

12662.text:
I am also curious to go alone with you
This is not the reason for the little future, grandfather

12663.text:
What is that best house, devoid of hunger and thirst,
inhabited by gods and demons, and by sages of immeasurable splendour?

12665.text:
[Brahma]
Vaijayanto girivarah satata sevyate maya
Atraikagrena manasa purushasha chintyate virata

12666.text:
[Rudra]
Many men are Brahmans created by you, Savayambhuva
Others are created, O Brahman, and that one man is Virata

12669.text:
As he is called the one Yonir of many men
so that Purusha is the universe, the supreme and the greatest
They enter the others becoming transcendental and transcendental, eternal

12674.text:
Vishvamurdha Visvabhujo Visvapadakshi Nasika
Ekasha charati kshetreshu savairachari yathasukham

12675.text:
For the fields are the bodies and the seeds, good and evil
He who knows them is called the Yoga-atma and is therefore called the knower of the field

12676.text:
Nagatir na gatis tasya janeya bhutena kena chita
sankhyena vidhina chaiva yoga cha yathakramam

12677.text:
I think of his path and I do not know his path, the best
but I will tell him the knowledge of the eternal Purusha

12678.text:
The greatness of His unity is that He is remembered as one and the same person
He is one and eternal bearing the word Mahapurusha

12680.text:
Abandoning all actions of virtue, abandoning good and evil
Avoiding both truth and falsehood, one thus becomes nirguna

12681.text:
Achintyam chapi tam janatva bhavasukshmam catushtayam
vichared yo yatir yattah sa gacchet purusham parabhuma

12682.text:
Thus do some of the learned desire the Supreme Self
The One Self and the other Self-thinkers

12685.text:
Where there is the whole abode of democracy; the Vedic is the supreme bound, the subordinate is the
manta, the parashita is the parashita; the householder is the householder, the touchable is the touchable

12686.text:
Darshta darshtavyam sharavita sharavaniyam; janata janyeyam sagunam nirgunam cha
Yad vai paraktam gunasamyam paradhanam; nitya chaitacha chaasvatam chavyayam cha

12687.text:
Yad vai sute dhatura adyam nidhanam; tad vai viprah paravadante aniruddham
Yad vai loke vedikam karma sadhu; aashir yuktam tad dhi tasyopabhojyam

12689.text:
The four-divided man does as he pleases
thus he is the Lord who is enlightened by knowledge

12690.text:
This is what you have told me, my son, as you ask
as described in the knowledge of Sankhya and in Yoga

12692.text:
[Bhisma]
The righteousness prescribed everywhere is heavenly and truthful
There is no failure of the righteousness of many doors

12693.text:
In whatever matter he who goes to determine
he knows only darkness and no other, O best of Bharatas

12694.text:
Api cha tavam naravyaghra sharotum arhasi me katham
pura shakrasya kathitam narada surarshina

12695.text:
Surrishir Narada Rajan Siddhas Tarailokyasammatah
paryeti karamsho lokaan vayura avyahto yatha

12697.text:
Sitting for a moment, Chhachi's husband asked him,
Brahmarshi, what wonder have you seen, sinless one?

12698.text:
Yatha tavam api viprarse tarailokyam sacharacharam
jatakautuhalo nitya siddhasha charasi sakshivat

12699.text:
There is no horse unknown in this world, O sage of the gods, tell me what you have
heard or felt or seen

12700.text:
To that Rajan Surendra, Narada, the best of speakers,
told a vast story to the seated one

12702.text:
[Bhisma]
Asit kil Kurushrestha mahapadme purottame
Gangaaya dakshina tire kasha chid viprah samahitah

12703.text:
Soumya somanvaye veda gatadhva chinnasanshaya
dharmanitya jitakrodho nityatripto jitendriya

12706.text:
Seeing many of his sons, he was engaged in abundant action
The king, who followed the family religion, became a man of righteousness

12707.text:
Then he thought with his mind of the Dharma as stated in the Vedas and as stated in the scriptures
the disciplined and the Dharma of the Tarividha

12715.text:
Asmin hi lokasantane param parama abhipsato
utpanna me matira aya kuto dharmamayah palava

12718.text:
[Bhisma]
The guest heard the words of the righteous
The other spoke the words of the wise in a sweet voice

12721.text:
Rajadharmashrayam ke chit ke chid atmaphalasrayam
guru charyashrayam ke chit ke chid vakyam yama ashrayam

12722.text:
Some who served their mother and father went to heaven
The others went to heaven with non-violence and the others with truth and so on

12723.text:
Ahve 'bhimukhah ke chin nihatah savid divam gatah
ke chid unchvrataih siddhah savargamargasamashritah

12726.text:
Evam bahuvidhaira loke dharmadvaraira anavritaih
mamapi matir avigna meghalekheva vayuna

12728.text:
Where the Dharma Chakra was reversed by the previous incarnation
on the banks of the Gomati in Naimisha, there is the city of Nagahvayam

12729.text:
Samgrais taridashais tatra ishtam asid davijarshabha
yatrendraatikramam chakre mandhata rajasattamah

12732.text:
Equality, charity, difference, and teeth protect the four kinds of
unequal people and all eyes by meditation

12733.text:
Tama abhikramya vidhina parastum arhasi kanskitam
sa te paramaka dharmana mithya darshaishyati

12736.text:
Yajva danaruchih ksanto vrtte cha parame sathitah
satyavaga anasuyush cha shilavan abhisansritah

12737.text:
Sheshanna bhokta vacananukula; hitarjavotkrishta kritakritajna
avairakrida bhutahite niyukta; gangahradambho abhijanoppanna

12738.text:
[Brahman]
It is great to remove the burden of one who is overloaded
This is the most comforting word I have heard from you

12741.text:
The sight of the beloved as if thought of by the mind
The words you have uttered make me glad

12742.text:
I see and contemplate in the sky like a given eye
This is the advice I have received from the words of others' knowledge
I will do as you see me

12743.text:
Stay here with me, saint,
The next morning you will go, comforted and happy
This is the Lord Surya, the slow-moving ray of the low-faced

12744.text:
[Bhisma]
Then he made him a guest, O Shatrusudana
He stayed that night with that davija

12748.text:
[Bhisma]
He presented the forests, the strange holy places and the lakes
to the same sage as Kam Chin by the tax of visiting

12753.text:
[Brahman]
I am rested and worshiped by your beautiful words
I wish to see that god who is the best of serpents

12754.text:
This is the supreme work, this is the fruit I desire
For this reason I have reached the Pannagalaya today

12755.text:
[The serpent's wife]
Arya, the monthly charioteer who has gone to carry the sun's chariot
will undoubtedly show the brahmin in seven days

12757.text:
[Brahman]
With this certainty, O saintly one, I have arrived here
Not waiting for your arrival, O Goddess, I shall dwell in this great forest

12758.text:
I have come here to report to you as soon as I have arrived
I have received my visit and I have spoken your word

12759.text:
I will also live here on the beautiful bank of the cowshed
time, limited food and maintenance as stated

12760.text:
[Bhisma]
Then the brahmin settled the serpent again and again
Then the bull of the Brahmins crossed the bank of the river

12762.text:
All the relatives of the serpent gathered together
Bharatarasa's daughter and wife went to the Brahmin

12763.text: They saw him on the bank of the river in a secluded place, fasting and fasting, devoted to chanting

12765.text:
For the sixth day you have attained this world of penance
and you do not desire any food, O righteous one

12766.text:
You have visited us and we have attended your
work and hospitality and we are all family

12768.text:
While you are living in the forest on a fasting diet,
children and old people are suffering all this from the crisis of religion

12769.text:
Na hi no bharunaha kash chid rajapathyo 'nrito 'pi va
purvashi va kule hay asmin devatathithibandhushu

12770.text:
[Brahman]
This is your food I have chosen by instruction
Davir wool for ten nights after the coming of the serpent

12771.text:
If the snake doesn't come when I leave at night
I'll eat it, so this is the best

12772.text:
Don't worry and go as you came
That's why I'm sorry you don't deserve to be afraid of this here

12776.text:
Api tavam asi kalyani devatathithipujane
purvam uktena vidhina yukta yukta matsamam

12777.text:
Not by this unfulfilled purpose, a woman has been softened by her intelligence
by my separation, the beautiful hips have been separated by the bridge of righteousness

12778.text:
[Nagabharya]
The teacher of the disciples is the service of the brahmins, the Vedas are the paranam of the servants
The word of the servants is the obedience of the kings to the world

12779.text:
The salvation of all beings is here called the Kshatriya religion
The sacrificial instinct of the Vaishyas is accompanied by the host

12780.text:
Brahmin, Kshatriya, Vaishya, Shushrusa, Shudra, Karma, Tat
Grihastha Dharma, Nagendra, Sarvabhutahitaishita

12781.text:
Regular eating and daily vows are orderly
For religion is the attribute of the senses from the relationship of religion

12782.text:
Aham kasya kuto vaham ka ko me ha bhaved iti
parayojan matir nityaam evam mokshashrami bhavet

12784.text:
I know the righteousness, and when the righteousness is eternal in you,
how can I leave the right path and go on the uneven path

12787.text:
Gomatyas tava esha puline tavaddarsanasamutsukah
asino 'avartayan brahma brahmanah sanshitavrata

12788.text:
I am yours with this Nagendra Sama previously contained
The other serpent who has reached me is the best of serpents

12790.text:
[Snake]
Then whom do you see in the form of a Brahmin
A human being, only a brahmin or a god, O pure-smiling one

12791.text:
Who is the man who is able to see me, O illustrious
who will speak the beautiful words of sight before the command

12794.text:
[Nagabharya]
Arjavenabhijanami nasau devo 'nilashan
Ekam tava asya vijanami bhaktimaan atiroshanah

12795.text:
For he is a water-seeking satoka who longs for a change of task, as
year after year a bird who loves rain longs to see you

12796.text:
For nothing can protect your god without disturbance
The horse born in the same generation does not worship anyone

12797.text:
You should leave that anger easily and see him
You shouldn't burn yourself today with his hope cut

12798.text:
Without wiping away the tears of those who have fallen upon you with hope
A king or prince is fit to kill Bharuna

12799.text:
Maunaj jnanphalavaptir danena cha yasho mahat
vagmitvam satyavachkyaena paratra cha mahiyate

12801.text:
Let us make the intended uncomplicated and desirable
The religious scholars know that no one goes to hell

12802.text:
[Snake]
Abhimanena mano me jatidoshena vai mahaan
Anger born of resolution, saintly woman, has been burnt by the fire of your words

12804.text:
For under the control of evil, the ten-necked Paratapavan
and Indra, the rival, was killed in battle by Rama

12807.text:
Then this is the enemy of austerities and the fall of Shareus
I have restrained my anger as soon as I hear your words

12809.text:
This is where I'm going to stay where that devil
has said everything and will not go away without meaning

12810.text:
[Bhisma]
The lord of the serpents went there to the Brahmin,
meditating with his mind on the darkness and considering the functionality

12812.text:
Bho bho, you should not be angry with me for not being angry
What is the purpose of your approach here

12815.text:
I have heard of his absence He has gone
I wait for him with all my people Like a farmer in the rain

12816.text:
Tasya chaklesha karanam savasti karasamahitam
vartayamya ayutam brahmayogayukto niramayah

12818.text:
I am that serpent-brahmin sage as you find me
Command me as Savairam what shall I do for you

12819.text:
I heard you were here
so I came to see you myself, Davis

12823.text:
I worship the Self, the Self-dwelling, the Self-seeking, the Self-welfare
dwelling, the greatly wise and strong

12824.text:
Parakashitas tavam savgunaira yasho garbhagabhastibhi
shashankakarasamsparshaira hridyaira atmaprakashitaih

12825.text:
That's my question that arose cut off your anilashan
I'll tell you the job afterwards you deserve to shoot me

12826.text:
[Brahman]
Vivasvata goes by the way; you carry that chariot on a single wheel
If there is anything there that is wonderful; you should praise what you have seen

12827.text:
[The serpent]
in whose thousands of rays birds reside like branches
and the sages are perfect with the gods

12828.text:
What is more wonderful than the wind blowing out and the sun's rays resting on the great
spreading sky, O brahmin?

12829.text:
Venus is the name of the cross whose water-bearer is in the clouds
What wonder is there in the rains that he creates water

12830.text:
What a wonderful thing is it that the milk of the seven months is shed by the pure rays
and given again in time

12831.text:
Whose splendor is always present in the particulars of the soul
Whose seed is the earth and this holds the moving and the unmoving

12832.text:
Where the god, the mighty-armed, is eternally supreme, the infinite
the eternally immortal, the brahmin, what is the wonder that is so supreme

12834.text:
Once upon a time at noon the world was burning in the sun
and the sunlight appeared everywhere again

12835.text:
He illuminates all the worlds with his effulgence
as if he were facing the sun and falling into the sky

12836.text:
Hutahutir iva jayotir vayapya tejo marichibhih
anindeshyena rupam davitiya iva bhaskara

12838.text:
Then he broke through the sky and entered the sun's rays
united and then the light instantly became the sun

12839.text:
There we are praised when the light of the sun comes together
Who else can be the sun in the chariot who has come

12840.text:
They we ask the sun in doubt
who is this who has invaded the sky and gone like another sun

12843.text:
Richasha chanena viprena samhitantara abhistutah
savargadvara kritodyog yenasau taridivam gata

12844.text:
Asanna dhiranakankshi nityam unchshilashanah
sarvabhutahite yukta esha vipro bhujangam

12846.text:
[Snake]
This is such a wonderful sight there is my Davija
perfect human body which has attained perfection
Brahman with the sun turns the earth

12848.text:
Savasti te 'satu gamishyami sadho bhujaga sattama
samaraniyo 'sami bhavata communication plans

12852.text:
I am in you, O best of the heavenly beings, you have no doubt in me
This world is all yours, what do you care about me, you sinless one

12853.text:
[Brahman]
Evam etan mahaprajna vijnatarthabhujangam
natiriktas tavaya devas sarvathaiva yathatatham

12854.text:
Who I am is yours and this serpent
I am your part and all beings are cows everywhere always

12855.text:
Asit tu me bhogapate sanshaya punyasanchaye
so 'ham unchvrata sadho charisyamya arthadarshanam

12856.text:
This is my determination, saint, done for a better reason
I invite you to do well, I am grateful, serpent

12857.text:
[Bhisma]
Sa chamantryoraga sharestham brahmanah kritanishchaya
dikshakanski tad rajansha chayavanam bhargavam sharitah

12858.text:
He was ritualized by him and attained the Dharma
And so he told this story to the king then

12860.text:
Even Narada, O King, in the residence of Devendra,
told the best of Bharatas, by asking for an uncomplicated deed

12861.text:
And in the past the king of the gods told this auspicious
all the best of the earth, O lord of the earth

12862.text:
And when I had a terrible battle with Rama and
Vasu, then, O king, this story was told to me

12864.text:
Then this is the supreme religion that you ask me, O Bharatha
Asanna Dhiranakanski to do charitable deeds, O king
